3Cuklw0Fw-LZkzHtO06bEA.text: My Husband and I Enjoyed our Mexican food!! I had the Chicken Chimichanga . Beans & rice, He had  1 chicken  & Beef Enchilada. Beans  & rice  large portions. Great Margaritas the best place in town .we'll  be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vcyVIdRCd08j237NUXGypA.text: Amanda was wonderful and helped with the sun on the patio. Took our coupon and made sure everything was perfect

czFrLASgY90Kf2K7UnumLg.text: Absolutely love this place. I literally crave it daily. Such a fun, friendly staff. Amazingly fair prices, and the best Happy Hour in town!  I've been three times, this week, alone. Entertained friends, and they've gone twice already, this week. We are all in love!!!

Y8YWPAqtx2Y9V8iEtFvJFg.text: AWESOME happy hour! It goes until 7pm every day and they have a huge selection of food and drinks. I always fill up on the chips, salsa, veggies and beans they serve as soon as you walk in and end up taking most of what I ordered home. Their margs are pretty decent, especially considering the happy hour price. The staff is friendly and attentive.

B1fDtQCLmaKFYBASIzSQCw.text: Been here several times and love it every time. My FAVORITE Mexican restaurant in Vegas and probably all time. The food is always delicious no matter what you get but what really makes this place shine is the impeccable service EVERYONE gives. Love the unlimited fresh chips, salsa and beans they bring out when you sit down. You could probably get full on just those but save some room for the main course! Highly recommend the 1-3 item combination plate where you can have a choice of several items plus soup, rice and those yummy beans. Also top on the list is their namesake Flaming Fajitas, which True to the name, they light on fire tableside before serving! Forget the fancy, overpriced, sub-par service restaurants on the strip and come here for your fix!

BbMbGEbYopF0qoReLaggGA.text: We usually go to the Mexican place down the street out of convenience but since it has changed names, food hasn't been the same. Not that it was ever spectacular but Juan's? This place is awesome!  Chips were great and not greasy, I love the complimentary grilled veggies and they even tossed in fideo soups for both my son and I (it usually only comes with an entree at other places and I ordered the app nachos and he the kid's meal). Service was really exceptional. Omar waited on us and there was also another lady that really took care of us. Drinks were filled without being asked and dirty plates were taken away without being noticed. I had mentioned it was my first time and Omar brought us churros at the end of the meal!   Food was great and portions plenty. I ate about a third of my nachos and the kiddo didn't finish his kids meal either. I really digged the environment,  decor and murals too. Considering this used to be a no-frills BBQ place, they really amped up the Mexican theme. The flaming fajitas tableside really added to the fun of the whole place and we enjoyed being wowed when others ordered it.  Juan's is def my new neighborhood spot for Mexican.

YwXq_1XNhS8kd1i-KQta8Q.text: clean, spacious, easy parking, super friendly and accommodating service (takes reservations), food is amazing and portions are really generous! i reserved a table for 8 and when we arrived they had placed the 2 salsas plus awesome bean dips to be shared between 2 people and kept on offering refills on their freshly made chips. (grilled onions and jalapenos were also provided.) while it did take a little time for the food to arrive we had fun enjoying the atmosphere and the kids liked watching them make fresh tortillas. we of course ordered a flaming fajita plate, which was impressive and delicious but the rest of us couldn't resist ordering from the happy hour menu, which was impressively inexpensive and incredibly filling (maybe partly because you can almost eat your entire dinner with the bean and salsa dips?). they also provide complimentary soup, which is like a tomato-based soup with rice (the kids loved it), and we all left with to-go boxes! they do have tv's all around tuned into sports if that's something that you're into but a slight draw-back since we had young kids and a couple of the tv's were showing a pretty graphic boxing match.   i'd definitely come here again and if we were locals we'd probably be regulars!

Rwu6yYW7WD-NORfkSamb4Q.text: Pretty mediocre Mexican food, in my opinion. It wasn't bad, just wasn't "Oh my God, this is the best Mexican food of my life" status. But I will say their margaritas were pretty stellar. Got a great deal for happy hour and had a coupon. Staff was friendly and quick, too.

dz-aVoj90pFXQCo6Q3m2bQ.text: I have had a hard time finding a place that serves posole or menudo and the mexican places I've been to haven't impressed me. From chips and salsa when you sit down, to the sangria, to the menudo and the chile relleno, this place is the best Mexican place I've ever had. Ever. Thanks for the good service juan!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria is delicious
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno

2a8Y_rcb4Z45aF6whvYkjw.text: My favorite authentic Mexican restaurant.  The fajitas are amazing, I usually order the chicken and steak fajitas.  They are delivered to our table in flames.  While we eat we are serenaded by a live singer.  Great experience.  Great food!

snYSU9eqDVmwrQiD7cznXQ.text: We had a group of 7 that came here for NYE after hearing many other friends rave about the place. Plenty of parking, short wait for the rest of our group to arrive so I had a mango margarita at the bar. We were seated immediately when our party arrived and the parade of deliciousness started arriving starting with the chips, salsa, and received beans. I'm not sure if some in our party requested grilled onions and jalapenos with the chips and salsa or if it's a regular thing that comes with, but do yourself a favor and order it! We also got the table side guac which was great. The highlight, obviously are the fajitas! Tip: if you're getting an appetizer, soup, or multiple baskets of chips and salsa, order the fajitas for one. It comes in a Dutch oven type pot with a burner underneath and they literally light the thing on fire before placing on the table(fire out before hitting the table but burner underneath still lit, so watch little hands).  We made the mistake of ordering the fajitas for two and we had the leftovers for lunch the next day. Great place, prompt friendly service, now I know why everyone I talk to recommends the place! We'll definitely be back and will bring newbies with us too!

C6DH2LRhgCO7REwIL_wtTA.text: Okay so I took my mom to Juan's flaming fajita grill bar. She loved it. This is my second time coming here this is her first time coming here we are definitely going to be making it a ritual every time we're on this side of town to do some eating over here. This is the best restaurant so far in the valley

VRU-OBn7XTmmMIj6GUs1Ew.text: The food is Yummy. When you order to go they give you a good amount of free chips&salsa and beans. The lady that works there is nice.

LjrV8bVacHqZ366qvGjutw.text: Best Mexican restaurant I've tried in Las Vegas. Great food, excellent customer service.

0xoHwMHj8XqzAtVzkhq8nQ.text: They have the best salsa. Awesome service. Food is excellent no matter what you order. Love it here

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Quesadilla is absolutely delicious!!! Love this place!!!

KnEvZtUbMZWFZuIvHYjRCA.text: Juan's has become our go-to Mexican place. They are always cool with special requests (I was on a strict diet for a while). Fajitas are yummy and the Queso Dip, Fundido and Enchiladas. Best frozen margaritas!

O-hk64HAMk8in45mZKdRrQ.text: I finally tried out JFF! The parking lot was packed when we arrived, so I worried we might have to wait long for a table. Nope! Just a couple minute wait and we were on our way. Soon chips, salsa and bean dip were at our table. They also brought a side of grilled veggies! The salsa was alright, but could have been thicker for my preference. The bean dip was very good as were the chips. Our server mentioned they have excellent guacamole made table-side. The guac sounded good and I would be the only one trying it so, I asked for the small side priced at $3.95 on the menu. The small side of guacamole was not made table-side so I didn't get to choose any of the ingredients that went into the guac. It was just brought to the table already prepared. I didn't like it at all. it was just bland mashed avocados with way to many tomatoes in it. I would have liked some onion, jalapeno, salt and maybe even some lime, but I wasn't offered any. The kicker for me was when my food arrived and there was about the same amount of the same exact bland guacamole on my plate that I paid extra for prior. Had I known, I wouldn't have ordered the other, but the server also said it would be made table-side and to my customization.  My friend and I ordered "Combo Fajitas For Two" priced at $25.95 with beef and pork. This comes with a cup of "Fideo Soup" that is out of this world yummy. The soup really packed some delicious flavor. One thing that impressed me here is that a lot of the time when you order fajitas somewhere it usually is just meat and tortillas, but they actually gave a small side of sour cream, bland guacamole, pico de gallo and you can choose flour or corn tortillas. The meal also came with rice and beans that were very good. The fajitas were so-so for me. The meat is thicker than I am used to and was a bit tough and the bell peppers were still to raw and not cooked enough. My hubby ordered his own combo plate that had Chile Relleno and a Cheese Enchilada and thought it was good, but nothing to write home about. There were major hits and misses with the whole meal. Our server was very friendly and checked on us often. It was worth at least giving it a try! Will I come back? Not anytime soon, but I can see giving JFF another shot at some point maybe with a coupon.  When you walk in the dining area is on the right and there is a cantina towards the left. Happy Hour is 7 days a week from 3 pm - 7 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Fajitas have arrived! @ Juan&#39;s Flaming Fajitas &amp; Cantina - 12/13/13
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Small Side of Guac&#34; @ Juan&#39;s Flaming Fajitas &amp; Cantina - 12/13/13

Ci01EV5M3wzIR7_YCRhQCQ.text: Start off with chips, salsa, bean dip and fried onion/jalapenos before digging into one of the amazing dishes Juans has to offer.  An obvious go to: fajitas, which they add flair to buy adding a bit of tableside fire to them prior to serving. They have a great, attentive staff who are friendly and ensure your dining experience meets your expectations.

sjFoYzsb4pk0QyGrjy6FvQ.text: Just left after visiting during Happy Hour which is 3-7pm every day of the week. During Happy Hour we had Shrimp Cocktail and Ceviche both cost $7.95. Well drinks only $3.50 but couldn't taste any liquor in them at all and I had vodka & 7 so I should be easily able to taste the vodka. The food was OK at happy hour price but not worth more. Our main problem was the waiter was a total ass literally throwing an empty chip basket right on my place setting and my lemon that was in my water came flying out onto the table. No apology was made. I see every other review here is positive so maybe he was having a bad day but it was our first visit so we won't be back.

b7m5LjiDEGucocT0Q0b6Cw.text: I come here so often it's almost embarrassing. The food is amazing and so is the service. I've been here so many times and not once have I ever been disappointed. I've also tried an assortment of their entrees and they're all delicious. Some of my favorites are the Tex Mex Enchiladas, Carne Pollo Chimichanga, Steak Nachos, and Flautas. Literally everything is so good. Their happy hour is good, too. The only thing next for me to try is their brunch :)

Z14RAqm2G2x2h6wc0XMYsQ.text: First time here and over all I liked this place. I came in for Happy Hour. It's clean, the Bartenders we're friendly and made sure I never had to wait for a fresh refill.   The Bar has video slot machines which were Tight with a capital T and even though I sadly kept loosing money, I still was happily consuming tasty drinks and Chips and Salsa at happy hour prices.  The House Margarita tasted (Tony the Tiger) GRRRREight, so was the Modelo Dark Draft served in a large chilled glass with a lime slice that I swilled down with great lewd gusto.  The Chips and Bean dip was decent, but what really shined was the red and green Salsas. The best I think I've had in Las Vegas since being a San Diego transplant many years ago...so I ate all that was put in front of me and even asked for some to go.  I ordered a large Albondigas soup to go as well with all the trimmings which are generally sliced Limes, Spanish Rice, chopped onions and Cilantro and crushed red pepper, all Muy importante preparaciones for an anticipated hangover the next day. Si Si Senor!  What I actually got, I discovered to my dismay after Greedily opening the bag while hungover the next day and looking for my cure...was a large Fideo Soup instead and more Bean dip rather than Spanish Rice ///sigh x@#&%!! at least the chopped Onions and Cilantro and limes were there, but Sheesh! Hay Carumba! Vas Ist Das! Mein Gotte In Himmel !!! Oh thank Heaven they sell Alka Seltzer at 7/11...

n5OafdNG8p0VruKhLyJh5g.text: Ever since they sold out to a corporation the food has gone down hill. The portions are small and the service is unacceptable. They treat you like cattle pushing and yelling. I won't go back.

W9PS4lONSWNjMRMm7xE22A.text: Wonderful staff, great food, great atmosphere.  Mimi is awesome,  would recommend 100%

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sBLO4nee9URjdmO74IbnVg.text: This was my first visit but not my last. First off the service is impeccable. Our server, Yajaira, was a lot of fun and went above and beyond for us. The entire staff was exceptional. As for the food, I could eat the salsas by the spoon! The food was delicious. I liked watching the flaming fajitas. We will definitely be back.

22-s4PRii4HXKoBjwrycvQ.text: Spot! Chips and salsa, fire! Fajitas, fireronni, Beer, cold and frosty. Service, friendly and attentive

O0_Fy_JQKmgY7pYaeoGazA.text: Second time I have eaten here. The food really is great and the cheese dip us totally amazing. The thing that stands out the most though is the service. There is a large wait staff and they work great together. I highly recommended the place.

6P3rW7FXBnYg1Os2z4ZmSA.text: I was a bit hesitant on first glance, because this has more the feel of a sports bar than a restaurant, but the steak fajita is actually quite tasty, on par with better fajitas I have had in other cities. And the lunch version of it is a reasonable amount of food at a reasonable price. Service was also attentive, which is a plus.

KaGcz9BU55UASh0xHQ-qXg.text: Really great food and drinks for summerlin Area Mexican food. This place has nailed the perfect mix of food and entertainment. Live music, flaming fajitas - its dinner and a show ! Huge portion sizes on the meals too ! Make sure to check for he happy hour drinks and check in offers to get some smoking deals ! Pro tip -  Always make sure to budget time to be seated during dinner time each time I have had to wait about 20 minutes during peak times to get a table - check to see if you can make a reservation-  but the wait is worth it !

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas and all pastor tacos - not pictured is the beer gartita - make sure to get it frozen not on the rocks it tastes better

ZukYFtSjcSjwiT4WY1xHXg.text: This is a great place for margaritas, fajitas, and friends.   You must have the best waitress ever. Yajaira

urbwF65un-eGwWFhgs0cGw.text: This place is amazing ! Great service and even better food !!! Anything on the menu is amazing !!! Busy but for great reason ! Make sure if it's a few people make reservations prior! If not it's worth the wait !

MQyk-td2dENKzWhTneHcfQ.text: This place is delicious!!! My hubby and I arrived to the restaurant on a Saturday night and the intriguing smells of fajitas tantalized my senses from the parking lot. The restaurant was packed which is always a good sign so we went to the bar for drinks while we waited to be seated. To drink, I had a strawberry daiquiri that was very yummy. For my meal, I ordered the flaming chicken fajitas with corn tortillas and devoured my entire serving of fajitas.  Upon delivering fajitas to your table they light them on fire... it's dinner and a show:)  This place is fantastic. If you like Mexican food you will LOVE this restaurant!

35igiiqN3rg91fUDHqqn4w.text: Delicious food and excellent margaritas. Service is amazing. They also are on point with catering with extremely fair prices.

H7hxtYHzPzWwZvF8qWcPmA.text: Yajaira was an excellent waitress and the food was delicious! Thank you for the birthday wishes too! David was also very good at keeping our table cleared and our chips and salsa full!

vOu5wcRH86ZDb5dbMZx0eQ.text: Great service and Amazing food, reasonable prices, family atmosphere! It took about 20 minutes to sit our party of 7 but it's worth the wait.

Z3Oh1XXKWpqxwQ31IPigAA.text: This place never let's me down. The flaming fajitas were yummy and plenty. The desserts not only looked amazing, they also delivered on the taste.

TzONNNBHRm1PDxcSsdQ9LQ.text: This is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.  Not Mexican restaurants, all restaurants including fine dining.    The service was amazing, from the manager who locked up our mountain bikes to the busser who made several jokes.    The food value here is excellent and the quality is top notch.  We got the chicken fajitas and they were perfect.   I can't recommend any restaurant more than this one.

mRpAQAgcz9-Hx33ur5sQHQ.text: OMG ... do NOT pass this place up if you are in search of the best fajitas north of the border !!! My hubby and I met our family here around 8:20 pm (leary because they advertise that they close at 9 pm) only to find a line of people waiting to get in. My first thought ... there's no way they're closing at 9 !!  Happy to say the food was amazing. Flaming table side beef and shrimp fajitas were the best I've had in Vegas. Service was impeccable. Guacamole was as good as my own (and that's a very good thing!). My advice ... run to Juan's. Yes ... right now !! I'm a foodie and I wouldn't post this if it wasn't 100% True!!

0Muv39xkhaci4qWHDaZ3BA.text: The food here is very delicious! We ordered food for 6 people and our bill was only $100! We ordered chicken and shrimp fajitas... Amazing! The blended Guava margarita was delicious! Carne asada plate, carne asada burrito and combination two item was fantastic! They give you complimentary roasted peppers, chips, and assorted salsas! For dessert we had fried ice cream that was perfectly made! We'll be back again! Thank you for the amazing customer service!

ZP1JRHJUwgab6rw0HoZRBQ.text: If you live in the southwest part of the Las Vegas valley Juan's is an absolute must try! I found Juan's on yelp and was intrigued by the high reviews it had received. My first time stop at Juan's iinvolved  a Friday happy hour and I was enthralled from the start. The happy hour menu is outstanding from beer to margaritas it has something for everyone that enjoys a cocktail. With Juan's not only do you get incredible chips and salsa they also give you fried onions and jalapenos which are a prefect complement with a cocktail since the jalapenos have some heat! It goes without saying the number one menu item to try are the fajitas! Chicken, beef or shrimp it does not matter they are all superb. I have eaten at Juan's approximately fifteen times and it has been fantastic everytime. Put Juan's at the top of your must try list!

moaqB13K3CMfx1doTYhN5w.text: Love the food and portion size . Everything is price worthy , great family environment and good service.

cFDHO6QsttO_oo08pyO-kA.text: We absolutely Love Juan's Flamining Fajita Cantina (JFFC).  Food is always amazing. Fajitas set on fire at your table.  Service is always great.  Only downside is there is usually a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1ik5mVUFyBsASIbAing2jg.text: We have been here before but it was a while ago. Today i was craving Mexican food after church and I must say that place totally answered that craving. I had the New Mexico Enchiladas......soooo good. It was also a huge hit with the kids (that can be rare these days with new places). Needless to say we found a new "go-to" Mexican joint.

GfZBsV9SgNC3_V_BSJ0zDA.text: Yajaira was an amazing server and the food was fantastic as always!  You can't go wrong here.

-bCNoLomKnmKzYLG03ENKw.text: Great service, great food. Amanda, Daisy and Echo were all so nice when I was doing takeout even though they were very busy with diners in the restaurant. Even gave chips and salsa with the takeout order. Looking forward to going back and dining in next time.

GDdmIV2CcMvItCqXyY5rBg.text: Mimi helped us out a lot, was a great experience and awesome food. We're pretty picky about our Mexican food we eat and this place delivered. Can't wait to finish the rest of this monster plate at home. Thanks again guys I highly recommend this place.

AxGjcVKxRwLZ8xyoOG9YUw.text: Great food and excellent service! I was visiting from the bay area but I will definitely go back! The fajitas were delicious! Our server was Santiago (It's been a few days so I'm pretty sure that was his name). I've dined at five star and Michelin rated restaurants all over the world, and he provided some of the best service from behind the bar I have ever experienced! Great service is hard to come by these days and it was definitely noticed and appreciated!  In summary, this place is a hidden gem! Make time during your Vegas trip to go!

J5KAW3F9VjcnYsNxqa2JNA.text: Great food. Maybe the best Mexican food in town! I highly recommend this place. It gets busy pretty much every night so be prepared. Sometimes you can sit in the bar area or outside but it's worth the wait if you have to.

fWp_yAiMMtlyrMiG1mMHFA.text: GREAT FOOD, GREAT SERVICE (even when busy) !  One of my favorite places to eat as it has a great environment and the SERVICE IS SPECTACULAR!!  Thank you for always making my night out wonderful!!

4iukY-F7X743DeyqpY966A.text: Where has this place been all my life. Should have been going here all along. The fajitas, ceviche, chips and salsa so good.

kAkfr0ftLpX82ZaEaV8RVA.text: The service is great!!  Food is always fresh and sizzling hot.  We went on a Friday night and we were seated promptly and our server came and took our order quickly.  I was very surprised at how quickly they attended us because they were busy. This place is one of my favs.  You won't be disappointed!

ieZcYGYXeB4OuPUXjdq2pQ.text: Quick overview: great service (5/5) and slightly above average food (3.5/5). Added bonus: they offer lettuce in lieu of tortillas for those watching carbs!  We came here on a Saturday around lunch time. There was a wait for seating, with a few customers ahead of us. So we opted for a table at the bar where we were promptly seated.   The server quickly came to take our drink order, which consisted of a water and a small house margarita on the rocks. The margarita came out quickly. Overall, the service throughout our meal was swift & friendly.   Complimentary chips with 2 types of salsa (red and green) and beans quickly followed. I enjoyed the red salsa. They also serve complimentary grilled jalapenos and onions. Awesome!  They were a bit salty, but I like it nonetheless.   We ordered the chile Colorado and the flaming chicken fajitas. Both came with sope de fideo soup (noodle soup). The noodles were thick like spaghetti and there were small bits of tomato. It was okay - not my favorite version of the soup.   The chile Colorado was okay, nothing outstanding. The flaming chicken fajitas were set aflame table side-this is what sets this Mexican restaurant apart from its fellow competitors. When I order fajitas I like 2 things 1) flavor to the meat and 2) a selection of veggies. Most fajitas have bland meat, requiring me to lime down my fajitas. These fajitas weren't bland, which I was happy about. They came with red & green peppers and onions. Not overly zealous on the veggies, but I like when I get red bell peppers so yay! for this. The fajita menu also offers lettuce wraps in lieu of tortillas.

OqhhQjLk8c9iaGIGbqOxQw.text: This is hands down the best Mexican restaurant I've ever visited. The team-oriented atmosphere made for fantastic service from all of the staff, the chips, salsa & bean dip (for free!) as starters were delicious, the fajitas were absolutely incredible (and really flaming - they light them ablaze in front of you!) & they even brought us over churros for dessert for free! My family and I were so pleased with our service and can't wait to return before we head back to Massachusetts. Thank you, Flaming Fajitas!!

nQ8zRye81xB4eoy7uDKeqg.text: With a long time lived in LA and now living in Vegas the search for good Mexican food was on.  This place has hit a g- spot. The fajitas are excellent..steak and shrimp.  Steak tender and shrimp were good size  For starters the salsa,  bean dip and margaritas... thumbs up.... the jalapeno, onion mix is awesome, atmosphere great and service to match.  We will be back....

pSyOOT1AyKl82r6lkcPb4w.text: The service here is 5 star. From the hostess to the bus boys to the expediters to our server. Super friendly and amazingly efficient. If only all restaurants were like this.  Food: Husband ordered the Carne Asada burrito. It was excellent and he cleaned his plate. I ordered a combo with a Chile relleno and a cheese enchilada.  It was good, but nothing special. So, knocked off a star since it was just ok. Didn't like that the cheese used in the relleno didn't melt.   I'd definitely come back and try the fajitas. They looked amazing.

jjfYBaCeLqMSRl4Urp2uYw.text: Food is good, comes out hot. My husband loves this place. I only reduced one star because the wait is crazy and they don't take reservations. Also the margaritas are very weak.

DhoyI5PjD6hBrVLZprbJbQ.text: Huge disappointment. It got such good reviews and we were expecting authentic Mexican food. Nope this place is definitely food for gringos. Queso fondido was cheddar cheese mixed with mozzarella not oaxa cheese like it's supposed to be. Al pastor was sweet like BBQ sauce. Combination tamale plate came with only ONE small tamale for $10.95! I should have just ate at La Bonitas or Cardenas. That would have been way better.

KxjHVgG0en1c9JSuR7npUw.text: Dinner with the best friend. Wow, cool place decent service and great food!  My girl and I stopped in after shopping at ikea. What a great find. Few TVs in bar area, great selection in the bar for drinks, but we had margaritas. Very good standard margaritas.  My girl had the Huge burrito with French Fries in it. She said it was really good (it looked great). And I'm one for visiting new places and trying what they advertise... Fajitas of course!!! The steak fajitas are so good and the Presentation when they are brought out, wow oh wow cool!   I wanted a nice spicy sauce but all they delivered weren't very good ( for my taste). Everyone else must like them.   The guy that waited on us seemed like he was really into himself. Like everyone walked in wanting him. Kinds cocky but whatever. Good luck with that. But the food was good!

SCqfApbh1IvV_y-p1exG1A.text: We found this place on a top ten restaurants for kids site.  It was delicious.  The chips came with two salsas a sour green delicious salsa, a cilantro red salsa And a bean dip.  We gluttons got the queso as well.  My husband thought the queso was delicious.  Everyone at our table from age 2-40 ate their meal.  The carnitas and fajitas were festive and yes you guessed it delicious.  Not even the ridiculously long wait could get me to dock a star.  My waitress got me 4-5 iced teas even though it was super busy.  If we lived in Vegas we would eat here weekly.

kfjh7ew1-HfN-Uh5tA5tLg.text: Really enjoyed the Flaming Fajitas, the chips and salsas are great. And of course the Fried Ice Cream.  This place has a real Mexican flavor. The prices are reasonable.

7Ca_WOKTAoG1t3G-p_rnVA.text: Standard fare with one very important difference and that difference is taste! The food was flavorful, hot (temp) and not frozen reheated bulk food which seems to be the norm these days. Grilled jalapeno peppers were served, along with salsa to go with the chips. The service is excellent, they honored the Yelp dscount, beers were cold and the staff deerves another mention for excellence. Dirk recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Fajitas.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surprisingly excellent!

fLk9um1dCEtrcD690f8YMg.text: What a great find! First visit. The waiters were amazing! The chips are fresh and crisp and you get beans, and two types of salsa right away. We ordered and had food within 15 minutes. Their guacamole is absolutely delicious! Honey had a carne asada burrito and the steak was juicy and tender. Everything was phenomenal. Hernan, our waiter, was very attentive and checked on us every 7-10 minutes to make sure everything was perfect. This is definitely going to be added to our date night rotation! 4 stars for first visit, but will easily become 5 stars if the service is as awesome next time!

O8lhtC5PNpK56zH43wMHfw.text: My mom has had a huge hole in her heart since her beloved Viva Mercados shut down. In an act of desperation and pure genius, she phoned me and asked if I knew of a great Mexican restaurant in the area. It just so happened that I had bookmarked Juan's a few days earlier and deciding to to put my faith in my fellow Yelpers, we headed over... And once again, my Yelp compadres, you did NOT disappoint.  As soon as my mother and I opened the door we were greeted. This is a large space, with a separate bar and patio area (which pleases me because I don't have to sit near children - no offense to you parents out there). We were seated at a table and were greeted within 15 seconds. Needless to say, the serve was on point all night. My iced tea was never more than half full the entire night.  Chips and salsa and bean dip came out immediately, quickly followed by grilled peppers and onions.Then we got a cup of the sopa de fidello.  Being the avocado lover I am, I had to gets my guacamole on; Juan's make theirs table side with fresh cilantro, tomatoes, jalapenos, and onions. You really can't mess up guac, it was a total win. Fresh to death.   My mother and I wanted to see what these Flamingo Fajitas were all about. We ordered the fajitas for 2 (priced around $23), steak and chicken combo. It came with a side of rice and beans, as well as more guac (there is no such thing as too much guac), pico de gallo, and sour cream. The fajitas came out, our server set the tray done and lite that bad boy on FIY-AH! It was awesome. The fajitas were then placed on the table and we devoured them. The meat was perfectly season as were the onions and peppers. DELICIOSO!!! Some of the best fajitas I've ever had. This entree actually served three and we had left overs.  We didn't have room for dessert so we skipped that. All in all, the hole in my mom's heart has been filled. Juan's delivered. Great food, great service. I am a fan. I cannot wait to go back and try their other entrees. Ole!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor with grilled veggies.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beans and rice come as a side for the fajitas. As well as guac, sour cream, and pico.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and steak fajitas for two. (Serves three actually)

pgYtGb8EFxKMhyJVBVBJGg.text: I love all the differnt sides that come with the complimentary chips, several salsas, beans, and grilled onions & jalapenos, plus the yummy tomato noodle soup all before your entree arrives, and the fajitas are amazing and so fun when they set them on fire table side. The have good selection of beer and other drinks and lots of tvs for sports fans. All and all the atmosphere os awesome plus amazing food, this place is an A+

53DwbvkD666iJUhunV4qhg.text: I really enjoyed my experience here!  I had their combination plate lunch special: al pastor burrito, chicken tamale, and grilled vegetables for $10. I ate most of it because it was very delicious...even though I was full off of the chips and delicious bean dip + salsa they gave us!  Our waiter was young and very attentive...although he forgot my husband's tortillas...his favorite part of any Mexican meal.   We did not order a flaming fajita but it was fun watching other people receive theirs. Those flames really do rise!  For the lunch price, I felt like I got a lot for my money. Come try it out!  Oh, and there is a cantina/bar connected to the restaurant.

F3t0ZOEWmIG7fTvJA0U2LQ.text: I'm not sure where to start. I am new to Nevada and wanted really good Mexican food which I have yet to find. I took to Yelp and found this heaven! The first table we got we weren't too satisfied and though we aren't picky I asked if we could possibly get a booth instead of a table and boy am I glad that I asked. We were seated in Amanda's section and she was just a blast in a glass! The food was great and the service was AMAZING!  We will definitely be back and will ALWAYS request to sit in Amanda's section! 5 stars, 2 thumbs up and a thank you very much.  Oh and we stopped by the bar while we waited to be seated and the bar tenders were great. I will recommend this restaurant and bring my friends and family who visit! Oh and the fried ice cream.... Omg and I don't even like sweets. Great great GREAT!

PUi9hvzAggZh8SRcgejyqg.text: Lunch margaritas are big, delicious, and cheap. The food is amazing and the portions are very generous. The servers are very friendly and attentive. We loved every aspect of our dining experience.

xZkLzLLGICU9UYnNByP1AA.text: Awesome fajitas that they light on fire at your table. Warm chips with an array of dipping options, along with roasted onions and jalapenos. The two person option was enough for three, well worth the wait to come here!

GktqifRJlRK9_fWyx230eA.text: This is by far my favorite Mexican food restaurant in Las Vegas, and I don't even like fajitas.  The food is great and the service is better.  They also carry local beer (lovelady).  Overall this place is awesome.

WpFgi7jZP9jUmnLoEdzP_g.text: Delicious! Affordable! Amazing Mexican food ... my husband and I have been here many times ... the staff is always friend and the food is always great what more could you want? I recommend this place to anyone in the mood for a great margarita and awesome fajitas!

vEBPfkrr8FM51ey9VlvrHA.text: This has to be the best Mexican food in Las Vegas, I'm convinced. First off they start you out with complimentary chips with salsa, beans, and a plate with grilled onions and peppers. (Delicious!) Next it gets even better with their house margs. They have happy hour everyday from 4-7 so a 16 oz margarita on the rocks was under $10. For meals, my boyfriend and I had the shrimp enchiladas and the pollo asada tacos. Both were absolutely delectable! Each entree came with a Mexican soup as well as beans and rice on the side. The portion sizes were just right, not too much and not too little. To finish off our meal we ordered the fried ice cream for dessert, definitely recommended! Love this place! Great service & great food!

d9YhuJ1C3BUuSVbfh5Lymw.text: The best fajitas I've ever had in my life!! Such huge portions! Share! Service is little sloppy  and slow but other than that great place!

xtS-_nHrdfkTPpaa9UW46g.text: This is my new place for fajitas in Las Vegas the prices are good for the amount of food that they serve you.    As the name implies the flaming fajitas is the best part of this restaurant it's cool when they set it on fire.

fHTRF9OZKyW6QHxzui7Wzg.text: My friend and I were craving Mexican food so I found this place on yelp. We went for lunch & it was okay. We started with coronitas which were very tasty. I had the shrimp fajitas and my friend has the fish tacos. Over all the food was good but nothing amazing to where I have to come back again. I liked their chips and salsa that they served before the food came. Wish they had a better selection with fun alcoholic beverages or fresh Mexican waters.

FPzmrynbNW_V-uNRS8SDBw.text: Went to dinner here last night based on a recommendation from my brother and sister in law and it was fantastic!! The restaurant was busy (I had called earlier for a reservation but they were all booked up). We got there at 7:05pm and were seated by 7:20. We were a party of 5 and immediately greeted as soon as we sat down. Chips and salsa (both delicious and fresh) were served within seconds. We ordered both chicken and steak fajitas and they were seriously some of the best I have ever had! Very hot and flavorful. Loved that they were served on a sizzling platter lit by fire from the waiter. Great show! Additionally we had the pleasure of listening to live music provided by the roaming guitar playing musician. He was wonderful and even took our requests and sang to our table! Perfect! Our waiter Gustavo was a "10" in terms of service and professionalism. Definitely worth every cent of our 20+% tip! We never waited for refills or plates to be removed. He was very prompt, polite and attentive. Our party agreed that we would be back again SOON!! Give this place a try! You will not be disappointed!!

ZDaKGnK-lhmLos8uk2qtrw.text: THE FOOD LIVES UP TO THE REVIEWS!  They are a long way from my house, almost 40 miles round trip. Which is why we waited so long to try it. Nothing fancy or like interior authentic, just really good food and plenty of it.  The chips and salsas are tasty but the grilled onions and jalapenos take the whole amuse bouche (sorry don't know the Spanish term) to another level. The Sopa de Fideo reminds me of Texas in the 60s.  The shrimp ceviche was so fresh tasting and a huge portion. I will need to tweak the Margarita Martini a little to get it where it needs to be but they have Bohemia; absolutely the best Mexican beer by far and harder and harder to find Outwest.  My GF ordered the Chile Relleno. Now a short discourse on that dish; it should be made with a Poblano chile that has been roasted and peeled NOT deep fried and peeled. An Anaheim or long green is too mild and somewhat insipid tasting, deep frying leaves the pepper al dente. Even though picadillo is also traditional filling, I prefer cheese with a thick but fluffy batter. A light red sauce and some queso leaves you with a 9 out of 10 relleno!  I had the green chile burrito enchilada style (an homage to the Jungle Club/El Jardin) and a cheese enchilada (because I am from Texas). The enchilada sauce was darker than I usually like, a little bitter but really tasted homemade and the enchilada was great!  Rice and beans are well above average and the service was excellent. $60.00 for 3 beers, a $9.95 Margarita, a huge appetizer, and 2 combination plates. Living La Vida Loca!

t-xY3OQgh6Rh7YaYu5zBGg.text: Just great! First time here and I gotta say this will be my new spot. We had a pitcher of Cadillac Margarita ($33) and then we order a regular pitcher, all I got to say is pay the extra $9 bucks. Its well worth it!   The food is great, we had the Chicken and stake fajitas and it was Amazing. The kids had Rice, beans and a cheese quesadilla. They loved it!   The staff is great and very kind. The manager offered us an order of free churros. Those were so good, next time I need to try the fried ice cream.   Over all my experience was great!

K4H6qnBI7WjHwIvYcBR8rA.text: The pictures of the salsas, chips, bean dip, and onions/peppers drew me in. I judge all Mexican restaurants by their salsa. Theirs was great! I came during happy hour and they had some good specials there as well. I got a combo platter of nachos, flautas, and quesadilla- it was too much for just me, but really good none the less. I frequent Vegas often and have just found my new go to place. :)

injOn5Mu2W7_yxlmxO3YTg.text: Love love love Juan's.  Food is great.  When you sit down they load you up with chips, salsa and my fave the bean dip.  The food is great.  I like the bar area too.  It does get busy.  Be ready to wait if you come at peak dinner times.

NoblHrWBHR8JQ4dh9urdRg.text: It became tonight our favorite Mexican restaurant.  Very tasty and very generous portions.  The whole team serves you from the first second you sit down  I have been a restaurant owner and I know about service.  They are on top of their game Yayaira happened to serve us tonight and we would not be more happy! Please ask for her.  She is amazing.

n4ljiYxML5Cm1UlEja0bqw.text: Awesome fajita presentation. Flames at your table!!  The flaming fajitas for two is a TON of food. Ceviche was bomb, full of flavor!!  I will definitely go back!

u4o1k6QJbfkrOG-rBy_QMw.text: 3.75 stars.   Because of past experiences with other large party-friendly, expansive "Mexican" menu, margarita-obsessed restaurants (*cough* El Torito, Acapulco *cough*), I almost dreaded having dinner there.   I expected watered down, over-saccharine drinks, bland meat, weak salsas, and to eat my weight in tortilla chips.  What we got were surprisingly good margaritas (even the happy hour one I ordered for the first round, nicely charred sizzling meat and juicy shrimp, and a trio of dips to include two tasty salsas and a dip bean that ensured I would still eat my weight in tortilla chips.   Let's back up to the margaritas. Happy Hour margaritas are usually 99% margarita mix and have no strength. They're also usually some ridiculous price like $2. The HH drinks here come in at around $6 on average, but actually have some body to them. I was surprised to find that even the flavored selections didn't wuss out. That said, on round two, I opted for a full-priced spicy watermelon margarita. It was an extra $2 well spent.   The food exceeded my expectations. A first timer should definitely order the flaming fajitas. Aside from the name of the place practically telling you to, you should do this if for nothing else than the sheer spectacle that is the meat arriving on a round custom "JFFC" grill. Said grill is then set on fire causing an eruption of flames at such heights that I wonder how many servers have lost their eyebrows as part of regular dinner service. Come on, man. It's in the name.   My husband and I ordered the combo fajitas for two and opted for steak and shrimp. Oh, yeah. If you have an eating partner, are a greedy face, or like to eat dinner leftovers by yourself for a few meals after, get the combo. It just looks cool. Bigger is better, right (yay, 'Murica?).   My only squabbles on the food would be that the number of shrimp provided and the sides. The portion of shrimp provided for maybe 2.5 per fajita if you used 3 tortillas for the meal. As for the sides, if you're going to the tex-mex, gringo-leaning menu, then cover the beans in cheese. Smother those things. Yeah, yeah. I know I'm Asian and well on my way to lactose-intolerance, but I love my cheese-covered beans.   Aside from that, service was just okay. I didn't get the impression that our server cared much for us, but perhaps it was because it was a Thursday and he was as over the week as the rest of us. He gets a pass.   Based on the scene when I arrived, I would suggest making reservations. When we arrived at about 5:15pm, the lobby area was packed and wait times were at around 25 minutes. Luckily for me, this experienced was skipped thanks to folks from our party having arrived early to snag a table.  Anyway, does this place suck? No. Is it like the El Toritos and Acapulcos of the world? It's a better, upgraded version. Is it the best Mexican food in Vegas? Not by a long shot.   But I'm not mad at it.

Zq6CXrostBuNxVywA7iZDA.text: Had a great night out with my friends all because of Yajaira! All her recommendations were spot on and her hospitality was very genuine! Love coming here and next time I will be asking for her again!

rdqDkMOWyOBxgUAzdNmsLw.text: I've had Juan's book marked for a while and finally went to dinner of a Friday night with the hubs. As soon as the door opens all you smell is deliciousness. For being a Friday night, the place was crowded but we were sat instantly. The place is decent size with tons of tvs around the entire restaurant. We ordered the steak & shrimp fajitas for two and shared the colada de guava drink. That drink was so delicious it could have been a dessert. While you wait they bring you chips, two salsas, bean dip, grilled onions & peppers and sopa. Our food was brought out as soon as we were finishing up our soup. And it's called Juan's FLaming Fajitas bc they pour liquor on top and light it up table side. Hence, the flaming. The fresh in house made tortillas were amazing and so was everything else. The portions are huge. We had to force ourselves to finish. For the price & portion size I will definitely be back. The negative one star is because there needs to be more ventilation from all the fajitas, it was very Smokey and stuffy. Be prepared to smell like fajitas after you eat here.

You don't want to see that. Food was decent but the cheese dip wasn't flavorful like I was expecting even w/jalapenos.

LvHafkDjsuRvoFl72LzibQ.text: 3 stars in a place usually ranked 4.5 in average with over 1600 reviews. Let's break it down before someone pours liquor over my head and set it on fire. Lol.   Wait: Half hour on a Thursday, not shocking because of a handsome amount of good reviews. Be prepared to wait even more on a weekend.   Little things I noticed: the ladies at the front were wiping the menus after being handed over by the staff inside. I appreciate this GREATLY. Good job!   Service: Callie was our waitress for the night and she was attentive and polite. Everyone else who swung by our table to serve drinks, starters and food were absolutely welcoming. Good vibes all round.   Starters: The complimentary starters were cool and a welcoming sight to one who is famished waiting outside for half an hour. Soup was tasty, as was the chips and dip! Loved the side of grilled peppers and onion. Yum.   Now here comes the part I am sadly iffy about:  Table-side Guacamole: Always fun to see someone make your guac fresh. Nothing like fresh guac.   Partner had the pork carnitas to which he said it was bland, given the amount of sides he had. He felt there was no flavour or kick to it despite hauling all the goodies in the tortilla.   Baja fish tacos: batter was so-so on the fish, but what irked me was the slaw. Very confusing on the palette and didn't merge the taco together. Was very sad.  Does one return? On the fence. With the amount of reviews perhaps one came in on the wrong night. Willing to try again. Any recommendations for a good Mexican joint are welcome our way.   Sorry Juan, we really wanted to like your fajitas. Maybe next time.

CKszw9_4Oy7RtmXtGupRDQ.text: Wow Factor- our first time eating here and it won't be the last. So here's the scoop, Saturday night busy of course, looks like a hole in the wall, don't be put off by that, don't be put odd with the 30 to 45 minute wait either, it's worth it I promise. 1st wow factor the table is set with our menus chips & salsas, with bean dip and peppers at the table before we even sit down, impressed already. The server is there mere minutes later taking our drink order. Order Manuel Margaritas it was yum, fresh lime and fresh orange juice delightful. I have a sensitive tummy so though I love margaritas I can usually only have 1 before the acid reflux hits, they put some magic fairy dust in there cuz I had two and I'm good! But I digress, the food, ok, our thought process is you go to place with Fajitas in there name, you should probably try the Fajitas, they don't disappoint. They have a deal for two, we highly recommend we're stuffed and had a hefty doggie bag. So many goods, homemade tortillas, soaps before the meal, the guacamole fire, the roasted peppers, just wow. But the biggest wow is the staff, the wait staff so attentive and knowledgeable about their product, but the bus staff we were so impressed, the hardest working bus staff, they had tables cleaned and ready to go in minutes. All the staff really, Mo the manager chatted with us for a bit to check in our experience, they have something special here for sure, we'll be back!

MKwDFYnh398TxSLoJKzSQw.text: The perfect Mexican restaurant!  We have always enjoyed this place. Expect it to be busy. We are on a keto diet, so we enjoyed a steak/chicken combo of the flaming fajitas.  And, yes, grab your camera because it  really comes out on fire! Forthose on keto, you can swap the rice and beans side on the fajitas for vegetables. You can also swap tortillas for lettuce wraps. Excellent!

VJFmueiRqaz9OmaZC1uaGg.text: Vegas has a plethora of Cantinas and Mexi restaurants....some good and some no Bueno!  I used Yelp to find one close to us that could handle a larger group, have a diverse menu (for picky eaters), great reviews, and good value.  Bingo: Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina!!!  Located right next door to the In N Out drive thru (on West Trop.) Juan's is a legit Mexi restaurant. Food was very good especially their Fajitas...go figure!   Free chips and two types of Salsa and a great bean dip!!!  Great ambiance! Great bar ( killer patron Margs!)! Their combo plates are legit too!  Service was super friendly and helpful. Table side guacamole is cool!  Juan's also has an amazing happy hour every day and daily specials (each day is different so check out their website). The day we were there it was 15% off for Veterans ( That is Awesome!!!! Thank you!!!)  Plenty of parking. Weekends get crazy busy so beware.  Yelpers get $5 off their $50, or more, purchase!

YeSREcux7wjmyo9-zBK_1w.text: Attentive service, these servers rock. Salsa, grilled jalapenos and onions. Just terrific. This place is just terrific. Arrive early cause you will wait after 5pm.

d6e3wPUpgzRWQOzBi82XbA.text: Juan's was amazing. I expected it to be great based upon others reviews and the food didn't disappoint. This is one of the best Mexican restaurant I have ever eaten at. I was slightly concerned about how far away the restaurant was from our hotel on the strip, but the short drive was well worth it.   The meal began with with free chips and salsa with a few other additions (Bean dip, fried jalapeno, and grilled onions). All of it was delicious. We also decided to order the large guacamole and an order of queso. Both of our appetizers were excellent and came quickly.   After a few minutes reviewing the menu, my wife and I decided to get the steak fajitas for two, smothered in Monterey Jack cheese. The restaurant is known for lighting the fajitas on fire table side, which was really neat. The jack cheese was a perfect combo with the steak. The steak was cooked perfectly and was high quality meat.  Service during the meal was excellent. The staff was very attentive and stopped by the table frequently to refill beverages and check in. Omar was our server and we enjoyed his service.   The restaurant and bathroom facilities were very clean. Overall, an excellent experience and I will definitely return.

VigPkwveDnoE0yECNWpv7Q.text: I have to admit when you get Fajitas at this place it's pretty impressive. They are literally flaming as they're coming out which is pretty cool experience. My only negative comment of this place is that I have a dairy allergy and when I asked the server about it he had no idea what "dairy" meant. I was a little nervous ordering the rest of my food because I definitely didn't want to get sick. I asked if someone else could come by my table to help me with my order, which they did. Food came out in a timely manner and it was really good

x-kIxZlpF6-KRukhWKhrPA.text: I ate here with four other family members and my goodness, this place was amazing! We had roughly a 45 minute wait but the place was packed with people waiting, showing how popular the place is. We ordered some drinks, most of us enjoyed ours but my uncle didn't enjoy the Moscow mule he got. He kept saying it wasn't made right but he didn't enjoy mine either so he could possibly make his differently. My family ordered two orders of the combo fajitas for two with all four meat choices while I ordered the pollo asado burrito. My parents really enjoyed the steak, shrimp and chicken fajitas. The pollo asado burrito I had was to die for! I ate the entire burrito and I normally can't eat half, but was so enjoyable I wanted to finish it. I will definitely be back!

kfcKfhRKZyv_vd5pLPV81Q.text: It's insane trying to go here. The wait is crazy and there is no waiting area. The food was pretty good unless my friend bit down on a staple in his fajitas! He was in so much pain that he didn't even eat! Not I worth it!

Fr9ekvggz_J2T_YWSg8W8Q.text: We were actually on our way to another eatery when we passed by Flaming Fajitas and I checked its reviews! The place was bumpin' (there was a little wait) and now I know why! The service was great--very quick. There were also so many 'freebies'! Chips, red salsa, green salsa, and warm bean dip all come with the meal, as well as free sopa de fideos. The green salsa was amazing, but the beans were not as flavorful as Ricardo's. I ordered the guava magarita (virgen/slushie only) and the chicken fajitas. The margarita was absolutely delicious! It tasted very fresh and was the perfect amount of sweetness. The fajitas were the best I've ever had--and they arrived with a show (they set them ablaze at your table)! Jesse ordered the Tex-Mex shredded beef enchiladas and enjoyed those as well (but the fajitas are where it's at!). The atmosphere was chill. Sports were playing on the TV's. Overall, it was great (aside from the rice and beans being on the bland side). A great (BIG) meal for a good price. I'll definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shredded Beef Enchiladas

rbstah7yDfxrCiAgKUqV1g.text: We had early 5:00 reservations for a party of 4, our friends recommended Juan's. There was a line formed already when we got here, that's a good sign.  Located at the end, tucked in a strip mall, but ample parking. Fajitas are their specialty, seasoned beef, chicken, shrimp, pork or a combo, served on fire in a caldron with sides of refried or black beans salsa, guacamole and tortillas - husband god the steak said it was delicious. Friends got the chimmy stuffed with steak fajita, they also had some Jalisco specialties which you could order any protein (chicken, steak, fish or shrimp) and they had different combinations of sauces/vegetable specialties such as cactus, chipotle/cream/wine sauce, mole poblano, Vallarta sauce with capers and peppers, a chili/poblano cream and Monterey cheese sauce - these are great. They have an extensive menu including appetizers (excellent ceiviche), salads, soups....typical line up of enchiladas, tamales, burritos, chimmy's, combo plates. Go for their specialties of fajitas or off their Jalisco plates, u can't go wrong. Services are excellent.

The flaming fajitas are so, so good. Had a delicious burrito tonight. This will become a weekly "go to" while in Las Vegas.

The complimentary chips, salsa, beans, peppers and onions are great.  I had the gringo enchiladas. They were tasty because of the great cheese sauce. YFK0A-DGSxBN4RvRsDPtqA.text: This is probably my favorite Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas.  The food is always delicious, service if quick and courteous, and it's reasonably priced.  I've yet to visit JFFC when is wasn't busy.  The only thing I don't like is that when I leave the restaurant my clothes smell.

ofwRcOOzGTQ51zc5p1W85g.text: My favorite part of Juan's flaming Fajitas is the bar area , they always have the games on the machines are always a plus for players. This place has really great service. Depending on who the cook is or how or what you order can determine the number of stars I'd give. At an overall rating for price , food quality and timely ness I give it 4 stars. Juan and Alex behind the bar are both great bartenders.   Pros : good happy hour             Bar/ TVs/ Machines             Patio             You can switch out your rice or beans for veggies  Cons : if you go to Juan's during busy hours there's a chance it could be really packed    If you have to be at work or somewhere you'd rather not smell like fajita smoke save this occasion for another time  Parking can be a bit of a challenge

5BUbiIqXvAY3CruMSvKwGg.text: Always packed. Always good. Always super smoky from the flaming fajitas. Definitely our go to Mexican restaurant

_Y-TrHZzykspmGnUy5myFg.text: Me and my mom were hearing so many good things about this place that we were dying to try it. With so many great reviews we thought we'd love it, unfortunately this place was a disappointment.  The wait was expected to be a lil long as it was dinner time and it actually went by really fast the only down part is this place is so small and there's barely anywhere to wait to be seated. Good thing it was only about a 20 min wait. Chips and salsa came with beans and grilled chile and onion which was good.  We ordered margaritas blended and they were so watery. Good but not frozen.  Plates come with Fideo soup which the noodles were overcooked and mushy.  We ordered chile Verde plate and this is where the most disappointment stood, the pork was extremely tough as it had not been cooked long enough.  My jaws hurt after from biting into the hard meat. The sauce was so runny and watery that my rice and beans were soaked in a plate of sweet green sauce.  Not so appetizing eating soggy rice.  Our waitress was nice checked on us a little too much, you know seeming like we were being rushed out. We felt as in hurry up and eat and get out so we can get others in.  Very uncomfortable.  There was a gentleman cleaning the table next to us and he was sweeping like a mad man saying "little kids" over and over as he swept up the floor banging the brooms on the highchairs shaking his head. Also uncomfortable when ur sitting enjoying your meal.  I'm not sure if this was just a busy night, which I wouldn't be surprised as to every night is, but we held high standards for  this place and we weren't impressed. We will stick to Pancho's! Maybe give another shot in the future...

aTQkdlxNMVhFQzNsm5Pdsw.text: The Best Mexican Food in Las Vegas. We have been to your location many of times for lunch and dinner and yesterday had a to go order. Food is absolutely delicious and authentic! Service is always Excellent!  Thank you! Juan's #1

2geaff7EelDZ09zCqwbIdg.text: By far the best Mexican restaurant in Vegas, and there's really not a close second. Starting with their chips and salsa, it can't be beat. I don't even care bean dip, but I love theirs. Then of course, their fajitas are amazing in every way. They also have a great house Sangria you should try. Every visit the food is the exact same great quality, every single time. The same is True of the service. Even if there is a wait to be seated, once you are sat, the food comes out within 20 minutes. Anytime I have friends or family in town, I take them to Juan's, not only because I know they'll have a great time and a great meal, but it gives me an excuse to feed my addiction!

wO_A5rTkekS-BY_I2HyICg.text: Freaking amazing fajitas!!! Parking lot sucks because In-n-Out is right there and their drive thru lane blocks a lot of spots. We went on a Monday and waited for 45 min for a table. But it was well worth the wait.

RzSOGb5TBLscgrALHy0RJg.text: The experience was AMAZING! The food was absolutely delicious and Yajaira is phenomenal! The happy hour portions are huge. 3 of us ate for $50!!! Definitely our new go-to!

iKJ0KPueHvtH39O4qg8oWg.text: Everything was pretty damn good! I might have to say those were the absolute best fajitas I've ever had, and their presentation was pretty cool to boot. Two things I think could be improved, one: check on your tables a little more often (everyone was extremely friendly and very accommodating, I just would have liked to have my drink refilled w/out having to flag someone down) and second: the lights were very dim and the ceiling fans were going a little slow creating a very odd effect of making all of us dizzy; had to walk to several tables before finding something acceptable to dine at. Mind you I was pretty tired but I've never had that happen and I think it could have been avoided by either turning the lights up or even down a little bit more. Could have just been an odd occurrence but everyone in my party complained about it as well. Wish we had saved room to try the desserts because if the entrees are this amazing I bet the sweets are just as good! I would recommend this place to everyone...give it a shot!

JXCW7MRU1eCRVizH1AOJAA.text: Love the food here. Their salsa is the best!! And the service is incredible especially the restaurant manager is so customer service oriented which is such a breath of fresh air. I go their almost once every 2-3 weeks .

vAyGNP3DTAICB8wAy0p7sQ.text: Fajitas are amazing !!! Great service and atmosphere. Recommend this to anyone visiting the area you won't be disappointed.

9JGaTF3tWynkwZhiZJtwbw.text: Better than as good as it gets, ITS FANTASTIC, Better than Excellent service, Food is outstanding, prices are super.  I'm sorry I didn't find this SUPER restaurant sooner.  I will keep coming back, this is now my favorite Mexican restaurant.  Thank you for the Best Service I've had in Las Vegas for years

AF3aCu18xZPvahpBEA0jyA.text: First of all, I would just like to point out the fact that this place has not been open very long. Maybe a year or two, max. I remember it being a barbecue place, with that said, it has more reviews than other Mexican restaurants I was looking to take my husband to for his birthday. So, to me it says something that a place that hasn't been established long has so many great reviews.  Service- everyone there is very friendly and go above and beyond. Example- we brought our 17 month old and after seating him a lady brought out a drawing game for him to play with, this ended up being a lifesaver!!!!! I also saw her bring one out for an older boy, as well as the standard coloring paper and crayon. Everything came out very fast and was a pleasant experience.  Food- the chips, bean dip and salsa were good! They literally bring it to you as your seated! The sopa de fideo is so tasty even my picky toddler gobbled it up!!  My husband and I both ordered a 3 item plate, chicken tacos, beef flautas, and cheese enchilada. The beef was shredded and moist and oh so tasty, I didn't make it to my taco, but it was generous in size and my husband said his was great. The enchilada comes with red or green sauce, which to me can make or break the enchilada. The green sauce was very good and so was the red. The portions are HUGE so expect leftovers. We ordered the churro, even though the server recommended the fried ice cream, now I wish I had gotten that. The churro wasn't really anything special. Not something is get again, bit hey, I don't typically have room for dessert at a Mexican place, so it doesn't knock off any stars in my book.  The place has happy hour every day and it's not crowded at all...yet, although the way the reviews are going I'm sure it will get there.

y7gXMCrVSqaIdjLaxGX23A.text: We tried Juan's for lunch for the first time today after it was recommended to us by some friends. It was terrific. Perfect-sized portions, excellent, friendly service and fair prices.   The flaming fajitas looked great when the waiter arrived with them at our table and they tasted as good as they looked. We also tried the Chicken Chimi and a Green Chili Pork burrito. Both were perfect; very flavorful. We liked the chips, salsa and bean dip served as soon as we sat (included with the meal.  All in all, a very good lunch. We met Juan, the owner, afterward to tell him how much we enjoyed the meal and his clean, friendly, new restaurant. We'll be telling our friends.

58o_4EYtGFCnOP3zvgMUFw.text: every looking for a taco salad? come here!! I always get the shredded chicken taco salad and oh boy do I eat it all! the chicken is full of flavor  and and soooo Juicy 10/10 HIGHKEY RECOMMEND

3BH_XYY9TVUNDeVw5xKO4w.text: Excellent, straightforward Mexican food.  Definitely try their signature fajitas. The flaming at the table isn't just for show.  The herb-infused vodka adds a great flavor to the meat.  The fajitas for 2 would easily serve 4, and we are looking forward to the leftovers.    The place's decor is nothing special, but the service is.  Friendly and always there to refill your chips, salsa, or drink.  Highly recommended!

OxzLTSjDJ2mUfU1PndjrMA.text: We ate here again the other day with my brother and mother.  This time, I got the Chimichanga with shredded beef and sopapillas for dessert.  I really liked the flavor of the beef in the entree. It was not over powering and had just the right amount of spice to it.  Again, we all got soup with our meals, free beans, salsa, and chips.  They also brought tortillas when we asked.  I got the dessert to go and ate it at home. You can get an order of 3 or 6.  We got the six and had some left over the next day.   It came ready to go with butter, honey and cinnamon sugar.  Again, Juan, the owner, was very visible and came to all of the tables to check on the meal.  Very nice!

LUDrQzkkD7Dk1qzJHU8RAw.text: Wonderful food, service and music!  Delightful atmosphere and delicious food  every time we go to Juan's.  Guacamole tacos were super and enchiladas super cheesy and food came quickly even though restaurant was packed.

xKQKayv_N6WG20m-QbVPqg.text: I know why this restaurant has food reviews, all friends of probably the owner. But let's face it seriously needs management, the food was wasteful. I ordered the mole inchelada which I could tell the chicken was pre-cooked and overlooked. Why are you guys wasting sour cream and lettuce? Nobody eats that, I could of gotten an extra enchilada for what was wasted in lettuce. I went with a party of five, I can tell the cook needs major improvement you can tell that none of the food is fresh. And for the price per plate I rather go to Denny's. I don't see this restaurant open when their lead is over. The Ambience is dead boring, the manager took the waiters check which I don't approve of because I have worked in the restaurant business. The place can use a touch up, and I can save the owner more money Nd put more quality in the food myself. The French fries and chicken fingers my kids for we're just plain crap they didn't even eat them because it was so gross.  Cut back on the waste, fix the lighting. Have some Mexican music playing, make me feel like I'm in Mexico for some real Mexican food. Not some microwaved feel dinner, no offense. I give it two stars because the mole sauce was good that's it.

aiDrev2nYd43fyq2X7fzbw.text: I really like this place...The Fajitas are really good and the custom made iron pots that keep them hot and cooking are fantastic.  Service is superb and food fantastic.  Overall a great place.  This location has seen several restaurants come and go.  Hope you support Juan who is a hands on owner that I would love to see make it!

T_6bxtUMVulujvknmjD35Q.text: I've been meaning to dine here for sometime. Many friends and acquaintances have shared there always positive experiences at Juan's. They were all spot on! The food was excellent, starting with the chips, salsa and bean starter. Along with that trio , came a wonderful grilled onions and peppers combo. That was the first time I've ever witnessed that accompany chips and salsa. My family and I felt it was necessary to try the dish the restaurants namesake is, fajitas. We ordered the combo chicken and beef, and they were excellent. Full of flavor, neither the beef nor chicken was dry. The portion was plentiful. The fajitas were accompanied with rice and re fried beans. The rice was soft and flavorful and the beans perfectly seasoned. My first experience was excellent all around. The service was attentive the moment we sat down until we said thank you and goodbye. I will return and make sure I inform anyone who hasn't dined there to give it a try.

HuXIDSpPUYZ3H4j4ifn-qA.text: Ate at Juan's today for lunch and everything was ok, not great, not bad, but ok. The service was definitely lacking compared to what we're used to getting there after many, many times eating there. The fajitas were burnt on the bottom and that took away from our experience as well.  We haven't abandoned Juan's and hope that when we return everything is back up to par next time.

u5G47uWlRfLbdSpbDUi_8A.text: Had to try the fajitas.  They were flaming and yummy.  Im shocked they haven't started a fire here yet.    The chips and salsa were also excellent.     I would recommend this place.   The bar area does get quite loud so I would ask to sit inside in the normal restaurant.

TrL3c1lNmdB6b3nrMog9EQ.text: This is by far my number one Mexican restaurant in Vegas. It's fresh and authentic. Just by tasting the salsas, you know it's going to be great. I come here solely for the bartenders. Venny and Alex. Being in the bar industry, I have high expectations and they more than fulfill and satisfy every need of mine and their other patrons. I am very observant and always come by myself so I can't help but watch how attentive others are with their guests. They are AMAZING! Always on top of it. If they're not charming their guests, they are cleaning or preparing wonderful drinks. Two of my favorite bartenders in Vegas, hands down!

yCeVOoa0UHI9farlwmvibw.text: ahb-sooo-loooot-leeeee the best mexican food in town. great atmosphere.. great staff......it's my 'cheers'...

TotUWK-a_H7Ovflq3-S3Pg.text: Wow.  Where do I begin. The food is authentic and delicious. Before your meal arrives they bring out chips , salsa and some tummy refried  beans. So delicious. Great bar & Micheladas are yummy.  The place is always super busy. Its always worth the wait. Everyone is super nice. Thanks For always giving me amazing service. Cheers

u8qwyrsX6rnN5o_41RKNOw.text: Good authentic Mexican food here. I was impressed when they had a side of mixed veggies. Prices right as well.

YeObqkY9E3M6MqaLFFopBg.text: Excellent Mexican food! Their fajitas are amazing and their tableside guacamole is so good!

CUvcSSZnBg9zI1zd9b56iQ.text: Thank you, Shirley B, for choosing Juan's Flaming Fajitas for your birthday celebration. If not for you, I probably wouldn't have made it to this place. I also probably wouldn't have developed an obsession with homemade flour tortillas, either! Yes, it's that good, and I can't stop thinking about it...  Okay, concentrate Suzy. Let's write about the other awesome stuff:  Service. The water/sodas were filled continuously throughout our meal. Endless warm chips, salsa, and delicious bean dip were replenished quickly. Too quickly! Food delivery was speedy, too. Shirley B & Terri R both brought outside desserts and the staff was more than happy to supply the candles we forgot (oops!) and present it with an enthusiastic birthday song and sombrero for the birthday girl! Awesome, friendly, and efficient staff!  Value. I don't frequent Mexican restaurants very much, but I think it's a great deal. All entrees include unlimited chips/salsa, fideo soup, choice of vegetables or rice/beans. Our party ordered the infamous fajitas. Get the combo if you're sharing, it's definitely worth the price. Even the other items, such as the big bowl of pozole my boyfriend ordered was only $4.95.   Food Taste: I've had the shrimp fajitas. Big shrimps! My party loved them and Chad S loved his carne asada burrito. We've returned back a 2nd night and we ordered the Dulce De Leche Fried Ice Cream. Yum! We have to go back to try their Sopapillas, for sure!  Homemade Flour Tortillas. (Yes, it's that good) I've been a deprived girl who hadn't been exposed to authentic tortillas very often. From now on, I'll be comparing future flour tortillas to Juan's. And yes, I know, if you're eating authentic Mexican food, you're supposed to be eating corn tortillas. But I can't help it, I love them! Served piping hot, it's so delicious that you can just eat it by itself. Or with a bit of their bean dip. It's worth the drive just for these. I'm planning my next trip there as I write this...  There's TVs to watch the game, decently clean restrooms, and has a very festive atmosphere like most good Mexican joints. Come here for your next fajita fix. But bring me back more tortillas. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weekend brunch menu
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips, bean dip, salsa, peppers &amp; onions - all the goodies you get before you even order!
