kfh6ZELwGq4EnJYQIOXdEQ.text: Checked this place out after hearing great reviews and we happened  o be in this side of town. We were there on a busy Saturday evening the wait for 4 was about 45 minutes. The front waiting area is a tight squeeze and a lot of foot traffic of people coming in and out. Once we were seated we were greeted with bean dip, two types of salsas, and chips. Our waiter came really fast before we even looked at the menus, but my kids knew they wanted horchata. They thought it was just okay. I had the guava colada and my husband had the sangria. Both drinks were decent, but we've had better. The food portions were large enough to share, but since it was our first time we all wanted our own dish. They had a live musico who my kids enjoyed listening to. Our food came out fairly fast and it was good. We'll try it again!

hYzlp8B4FVW1QHhOgThKhQ.text: Had dinner here with a couple of co workers and wow the service was the best! They bring chips and salsa out first with some kind of bean sauce that is AMAZING. I had the appetizer sampler which had quesadillas taquitos and nachos and it was so filling. We ordered the cheese quest bake that they have and would definitely recommend that as well. Our servers were so attentive and nice they really made the experience for us!

omHUabtgvhjBGDwweVpgdA.text: We were in the looks for fantastic Mexican food and hit a homer in with amazing place!!  All little things done with love, care and home style  flare!  Outstanding server and busboy!  They were like mother hawks taking care of their young!  Never missing a beat!  The serving are delicious large portions that are hard to stop eating!  Come hungry & ready to chow!!

F7PlLTd41Fh6vX-Pb5Uyfw.text: Happy Birthday, Tita Shirley B!! For now on when I think of Juan's Flaming Fajitas, I going to think about Shirley B's Birthday celebration. It was Shirley's pick to come here. And when people asked her why Juan's for her birthday, her response was "because it's MY birthday". I agree with your choice, Tita. Juan's was a great dinner. One thing I love about fajitas in general is that you can chose to make it a high calorie meal or a low calorie meal. It really all depends how many fajitas you plan on demolishing and what you put in it. But Juan's is more than just their infamous flaming fajitas, right? Sure it is. At Juan's there's a huge selection of Mexican dishes and by the looks at everyone's orders around the restaurant, the dishes are definitely hooked up. Review their menu...you got burrito options, taco concoctions, salads, nachos, ensaladas, soups, chimichangas, and of course, fajitas. But before I even talk about their main dishes, I have to mention their bottomless tortilla chips. My goodness, it should be a crime that these are bottomless. The chips didn't even have a chance. After multiple chip refills (i.e. 9 basket of chips), I came to the conclusion that their tortilla chips are addicting. I swear, they should rename this place to Juan's Flaming Fajitas and Tortilla Chips. Just saying. Everyone on our table, with the exception of Chad S and Mr B (aka Shirley's husband), got the fajitas. I didn't try Chad's Carne Asada Burrito, but was able to sample some of Mr. B's Steak Taquitos. The taquitos are bigger than most. It's was more like a mini-chimichanga if you ask me. Terri and I shared the steak & chicken fajita combo (yelp.com/user_local_phot...). This is huge, feeds two, and was served flaming. Yup...this was one good dish. Both the steaks and chicken were seasoned, properly cooked, tender, and fresh. Hard for me to describe, but their fajitas is pretty much as good as it gets. As for their service, I thought that it was pretty good considering how busy the place was. The restaurant is decently sized with the bar on one side and the main dining area in another. Both had one thing in common...tons of TV's from every angle. Yeah buddy!! Not missing sports at this restaurant. Our server was Juan. No joke. We had Juan, not THE Juan, you know the one. He was great and treated us like we were his only customers. It's like Juan on One. Hah! All joking aside, Juan was great. By the way, there's 3 other Juan's working here too. I bet you can't find that anywhere. I wonder if I go to Mel's Diner would I find 3 other Mel's. I bet not. Juan's allowed us to take our own desert, which consisted of Hello Kitty cupcakes and an Niner/Hello Kitty Birthday Cake. All for Shirley B. Juan and the staff at Juan's brought the deserts to our table while singing Happy Happy Birthday to Shirley B. Overall...fajitas and a lot of sugar with friends equals a great time. Happy Birthday, Shirley B! Go Niners!!! PS: yelp.com/user_local_phot...

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Quesadilla
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Steak Fajita Combo For Two
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mel C was here!

Ws_q8b2tu-gPJaxvM1f_Bw.text: As the name describes it, they server flaming fajitas. The concept is great, the taste is just decent. They bring your fajita in a skillet and they set it on fire on your table, it was actually pretty cool!  I feel like the meat needs some more flavor, it was a bit overcooked and under seasoned. Chips, salsa and guacamole were very good. I really do not have a lot of bad things to say, but I was really not impressed. The service was good, the atmosphere are price are excellent! Fajitas, rice, beans, guacamole and sopa de fideos with two choices of meat for just 24 dollars! It really sounds like a good deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen margarita

FR4Z5AI9dS5culMs5_4qtg.text: I absolutely LOVE this restaurant. You might have to wait for a bit to get a table, but once you're seated, you're in for a great time, every time. We normally sit in the bar area since it's a lot less noisy than the other dining area. The bartenders are friendly and attentive. Vinny is THE BEST. When they bring out the jalapenos and onions, ask for them to be extra crispy and put some lime on them. Delicious!! There isn't one thing on their menu that isn't fantastic. Hands down, one of the best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas.

DHtLc_DnRrrXMBc0qjlmIA.text: I really don't know how I've never been to this restaurant considering that most of the people I know have gone and talk about it being so good. I had the steak fajitas and it really was probably the best I've ever had. I'll be back. Wow, so good.

D5GnzMB4AOB3YKN2gdXT6g.text: This place definitely deserves a 5 star rating.  I had the flaming fajitas, yum, yum!!!

aFXXwVubJMknm1YflpCa8g.text: Love the happy hour specials here!  Food is straight forward and simple how mexican food should be...  All the other mexican places around Summerlin try to make classical dishes with all kinds of flashy small portioned crap.  That's why they don't last and dissappear after 6 months... I've visited here at least 20 times and always great service and delicious food...Orale Flamer Juan!

DsB2wgOc96TnaAu_uCRh5Q.text: Authentic, appetizing, and simply delicious Mexican food. Their fajitas are outstanding. The restaurant isn't called "Flaming Fajitas" for nothing. They literally flame the fajitas right next to your table and serve them hot and fresh. Service is the best part about the restaurant. I must say, there is no better service anywhere else in Las Vegas. I'm not exaggerating. Once you become a regular, they really take care of you. 5/5

F3C44HRlRsMmWzo7sxDBkA.text: This place is my absolute favorite Mexican restaurant. Their food is amazing from start to finish. The chips and salsa also come with bean dip and awesome grilled jalapenos. Their fajitas are delicious. I especially appreciate that they can be ordered with grilled vegetables in place of rice and beans. The fideo soup is also delicious. I drive forty minutes from my neighborhood to eat here anytime I want Mexican food. The staff is always friendly and attentive. Our drinks are never empty and the food is always served fresh and hot.

ZubQkreeFNQbdNopOH7xMQ.text: Our first visit July 26, 2017. It won't be our last! Fantastic authentic Mexican food, huge portions, excellent service. More than your monies worth. Highly recommend this restaurant.

d-QqFMbGP01osltnkX0VYw.text: My family has been back to Juan's several times since my initial review, at least six. Every time  the food & service are consistently good. By far our favorite Mexican place.

Hytw3s1Pqj2vA01ycw1ahg.text: This place is the best.... And they have modelo on tap. The fajitas are great, so is the taco salad and nachos. They bring out chips with bean dip and salsa, as well as a delicious soup. I'm satisfied every time I come here, and I crave it. It's amazing. The service is fast, but I have noticed the place getting busier. We got the last booth tonight. They remembered us too, which I like.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips, jalapeños, onions, bean and salsa dip

jtMmJ4rEDCCyVVsF_DVuOw.text: Have been to this place a few times and have not been impressed. The chips and salsa are average at best and the drinks are very watered down. IF you go here the only edible dish is the fajitas! All the other dishes I have sampled have been bland and tasteless. If your in Vegas save your money for the Casinos and not Juans.

PozK0-urFc7uWfxlxHPtcg.text: We've been coming here since they opened. Everyone that works here is really nice and really good at their job. I never feel like I'm bothering anyone by asking for anything there. They will always put on Pittsburgh sports for us, even though I am pretty sure they aren't Pittsburgh fans.  I really like that they have a vegetarian menu, but last time we were in there, the waiter told us the fideo is made with chicken broth (I knew that) and so is the rice (I didn't know that). I mostly don't worry about stuff like broth when it comes to Mexican food, but I do think they need to either tell people or get it out of the rice, because it's a little misleading to call it vegetarian when it isn't. On the other hand, I did ask Juan once if they'd ever consider tofu or fake meat for the fajitas and he told me if I brought some in, they'd try it in ours. I'm not sure if I'm going to do that, but it was nice that he offered!

z7Z8OVzcQQxqKHWc6Luu1w.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. I had been looking for a close replacement for my favorite Red Iguana in Salt Lake and this was just as good!  Food is amazing and the staff is awesome.  The only thing that's a little annoying is if you eat inside, everything you bring in will smell like fajitas  but that can be easily solved by eating outside. I also noticed the smell wasn't so bad when we ate in the bar area. I still love this place but wear things you can wash easily!

7ilztPH8qNzVHxq8GAi5Rg.text: Great food and good service! Thanks to our server Arturo. The busser was also very attentive. Enchiladas and guacamole was very good. My son had the Colorado burrito and he loved it. 4 1/2 stars

F9xc6WXj1UOPKLbXLRsb1g.text: I love this place! We have been on several occasions and they never disappoint. The flaming fajitas are always delicious, my favorite is the shrimp, cooked perfectly every time. The plate of grilled onions and jalapenos are also good, I need a plate to myself. Service is always awesome!

USgm5DJVLmudQEyS4toB9g.text: The food here was very good and I recommend the fajitas. It's a show when they come out, everyone turns their heads and wonders what you ordered. Sit at the bar, the main bartender is quick on customer service.

JknGzGqfWWXLEA7QgebX6A.text: The food was delicious, the service excellent ! The Margarita!s the best! They also have an amazing Happy Hour! I have eaten here on several occasions and have never been disappointed !  The Fajita's are the best in town, Holy Mole, you must try the enchilada mole!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Skinny Margarita Yum!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The enchilada Mole was delicious !!

Jg-HH8dCEkWg-_mhX1hwUg.text: Some of my family came here for dinner when we were visiting my uncle. Despite the great Yelp reviews, this place was not really busy on a Saturday night. That might have been because it was a long weekend but it was fine as our part of 7 got seated immediately. From the moment we walked in, the service was really friendly and excellent.  They give you bean dip, salsa, and chips to start. The chips were okay; the salsa was good but pretty spicy, and the bean dip was a nice alternative to the spiciness of the salsa. The drinks are really reasonably priced (like $5-6 for margaritas and less for beers) and looked good although I didn't order anything. The menu is pretty extensive and has a ton of options. Everything we ordered looked awesome and what I tried was really good. They light the fajitas "on fire" which is a nice presentation. More importantly, I tried some of my mom and brother's fajitas and they were really well seasoned and perfectly cooked. My cousin had one of the platos, shrimp with the mojo de ajo. He liked it a lot but I found it way too spicy.   I had the enchiladas de mole. I liked my dish, but I found the mole sauce a bit disappointing. I think it had peanut butter in it did not compare to other mole sauces I have had. A bit too heavy and sweet, but it was alright with sour cream and I liked the chicken inside it a lot.   Based solely on my dish, I would probably give this place 4 stars but I think it definitely deserves 4.5 based on the other stuff I tried, and I round up because of the service. They have a little stage so I assume they have live music from time to time and their happy hour looks good also. I would come back again when visiting my uncle.

vUwozLqPe5Z1B8MOJweBhA.text: Pretty good for what we had. We of course had the fajitas and they were ok. Not the greatest flavor in the meat or veggies but overall I would say I will go back and try something else.

50CzpE9IDZdvwYMyRtNVfQ.text: I really enjoyed my plate. ... since NOTHING was left on it when I was done.. :) I had a fish taco and cheese enchilada... So delish! I've been to a few spots and had sopa and weren't impressed however the sopa here was good... not too salty. BTW.. I could eat the roasted jalapeno and onions that they serve with chips every day! I also had a frozen Don Julio margarita that was amazing! I will definitely come here again.

nJDw-1IyvEMwxCIhOXO8Gg.text: Hernan was our waiter and he was exceptional. Every time our glasses were close to 1/4 empty he was refilling.  Drink were amazing, strawberry margarita and corona magarita.  Fajitas were quite a show, they looked delicious. Hernan recommended the steak and shrimp and it was money.   The strawberry sopapita was fantastic.  Definitely recommend that you try this place , great atmosphere and service to back up great food.

mm7hOxTP929sM0ZTLRoi3A.text: Food was ok. Service was very horrible.  Our waiter OMAR was very rude :(  The food was wrong. Instead of apologizing he brings back the food and throws it on the table. Horrible customer service.

l1daewRvPYIMOez7UIhkKA.text: Super Delish!!   Very impressed with the level of service, the quality of food... Ambiance. All great. Nice bar, Happy Hour deals thru whole restaurant. We will absolutely be returning here again. Yummy!!!

aBKEHnwB1IWgRbG4UHEmJg.text: My family and I go here every Saturday, it's really good for. We sit outdoors and Mimi is usually our server. She's a sweetheart and already knows what we usually order. One of the best servers in town!

yGY0JAImKZz2nA19DqS1cQ.text: Had heard and read a lot of great things about the eatery - and since our family is a big fan of Mexican food, we were eager to give it a try.   Didn't have to wait long for a table, despite the fact that the waiting area was crowded. Once seated, chips, salsa, bean dip and a (kind of weird - what do you do with this??) plate of grilled onions and jalapenos were promptly delivered to the table. Our drink orders were also taken. Then, the "chip guy" inquired whether we'd like more bean dip, and quickly brought over an additional four bowls. Seemed a bit like overkill, but OK.   But then, nothing ... for about eight minutes. No one came to take orders. Our waiter noticed (finally) that we were ready to order, but said he'd be back in a moment. We ordered chicken tacos off the combination menu, a kids' enchilada and chicken asado tacos. All came with bowls of fideo soup, which was on the bland side (and mine was hardly warm).   We also ordered the queso fundito appetizer. Don't bother: It's a lump of melted cheddar (not in a good way, but a stringy, difficult to eat way) with a few tomatoes and onions mixed in. Thank goodness it was discounted for happy hour (as was the strawberry margarita we ordered - good price, but nothing to write home about) or I would have been REALLY disappointed.   Overall, the quality of the entrees was just OK - much better than the salsa/beans and queso, thankfully. I just wasn't as blown away by the flavor as I'd expected to be based on all of the terrific things I'd heard. The food was pretty run-of-the-mill. The service from everyone (with the exception of the the chip guy, who was top-notch) was spotty throughout.   Will we return for another meal? My spouse answered that best: "If Lindo Michoacan is ever REALLY busy, this place could be an acceptable Plan B. But Lindo's never THAT busy" - in other words, we likely won't be back.

5nWBA9lba4R0VrqIGEYMBQ.text: Fantastic by Far. We are very fortunate to have this place on our side of town. FOOD is by far the best we had here in Las Vegas.  Service is quick and efficient.  Worth going back again and again.

8QI5nxxX0P5HaNgfo7vpPQ.text: We ordered the fajita's, which were excellent. The service was continually excellent throughout our visit. The service alone warrants 5 stars. My drink was never empty!

aN-UI_WXOGAzSuvJfbXtHg.text: This place is so much fun and really adds a great twist with the fajitas being served flaming at your table.  Casual atmosphere but not your typical Mexican Restaurant.  I recommend it to anyone.  The margaritas are good too!

y3Z8uP2kof7zMvQcu1ILGA.text: Not a huge food guy but this place is fantastic. Great service, great prices, and some of the tastiest Mexican food in town. What they describe as the small fajita for one easily works for two, and the happy hour deals are nice as well. Just a great restaurant!

SzF5vbrm6FvAZp3pRT6MIw.text: Five stars!  The fajitas are literally flambeed tableside.  The mole sauce is complex and delicious.  We discovered Juan's while on a climbing trip to Red Rocks, and the food was so good that we ate here twice in the same week.  Really good service too -- on our second trip to Juan's, we arrived literally 30 seconds before the end of happy hour, and they happily took orders from all six of us at happy hour prices.

4HNeRgDeYjK6UpOUS9AuLg.text: I loved that they offered vegetables for a side. Usually Mexican food is so heavy but this was a pleasant surprise. And the veggies were delicious.  Actually everything was delicious.  We will be back.

pcKurs3hEJPv6bnDviMtcg.text: Great lunch specials, the fajitas were very good and the service was attentive.  I'll definitely go back! One of the best fajitas in town. Better than lindo michoacan.

NfcqORY0sXx8d2cQv6PesQ.text: Very good food. The fajita nachos with steak were very delicious and the carnita platter was a good nice size portion. The strawberry Margarita was very tasty.

r0jJ7vJIQgwx-SYqbBLxlg.text: Ask for Amanda! She is the best. The food is great.it is Mexican food. With all the varieties. Plus some tex-mex..Visit them instead of In n out.

PWR5TSbgsWTGzNAmiPNK3A.text: Service was beyond friendly! Everyone was so accommodating for my two little dogs as well. The vegetarian menu is great, I went with fajitas and put just a tiny dab of habanero sauce, they were so good. Portions are so big we ended up taking half of everything home! Highly recommended if you are looking for somewhere with authentic food and stellar service.

VOTIx5Krq6_WkdiPftfDrg.text: I have to give Juan's five stars. Our party of four was immediately seated, and we had immediate service though the place was pretty busy.  They have a number of different Mexican beers on tap, and they had a happy hour going when we were there at about 6:00.   Chips and salsa came immediately and they were excellent. We had chicken fajitas that can be ordered for two, and they came out with a spectacular sizzling, flaming, presentation.  They were dynamite, and the portions allowed us to take quite a bit home for later.  The server was real and down to earth but very professional, polite, and competent.  I will certainly return the next time we feel like eating Mexican when we go out.

d2E-3GD2QZuuM8CkuYrA3g.text: We were looking for a good Mexican restaurant and wanted to get away from the strip, so we took to yelp and found Juan's. The chips and salsa came with some beans and grilled onions which were both a nice surprise.Three of us went, and all had different things. All excellent. The Chili Colorado, and the Carnita's were excellent. Really really good! planning to go again when we get back to Las Vegas after our Grand Canyon side trip vacation.

o-6cNJfim-o1TvFtdNZZ3w.text: This place is FUN!  Good food. Excellent wait staff. And, out-of-this-world Margaritta's.

sa7d8wY78shbsuIpueekEQ.text: Yes is is not on the strip but it is definitely with the drive. My two friends and I spent the day hiking and were ravenous after a long day. We started with the chips and salsa then ordered guac to start which could have been spicier but was fresh as could be. For dinner, the three of us split chicken fajitas for 2.the chicken was done perfectly. Stuffed and satiated does not even begin to describe our food coma. Unfortunately, we were too stuffed to partake in dessert. The churros and fried ice cream looked phenomenal!

Apa61bSnUduhCGVdYOwU6A.text: Went there sat with high hopes of finally finding a decent place to eat..as we were looking over menu..Juan the owner came over..we told him it's our 1st time here..he said order the fajitas..it's the best you'll ever taste..and he said if we didn't like them..he would buy our meal..so we ordered chicken fajitas for 2..and I ordered 1 crispy beef taco..server was horrible..had no knowledge of the menu or ingredients..the food came out..of course the fajitas smelled awesome..that's from the liquid they pour on to make sizzle..after the sizzle dies down..I could really tell the chicken had no flavor at all..hardly no bell peppers or onions like they should..didn't like my taco..I want shredded cheddar cheese..but it came with the white crumbly cheese that I don't like..I couldn't even send it back..because after the server..which had no personality whatsoever..dropped off our food..he never checked back not once..so I finally got someone to get the manager..he felt really bad..and he bought our lunch..which we hardly touched..which was nice..he then gave me his card with a 10% discount for us to come back and give it another try.. the salsa had no flavor..and it wasn't even a little spicy..tortillas were overcooked..I have no idea how this place got 5 stars..I honestly think people dont know good mexican food...

QSHr_awsvKsy0iimwPWl-A.text: This place is taaaaaaaasty!! I've been here twice in the past week. Last Friday on a whim instead of going to In n Out, and today for a bday lunch. I loved the fact the owner immediately recognized us and welcomed us with open arms. Their lunch specials are a great deal and comes with a drink! Score!! If you leave room for dessert, you have to try their churros! Better than Disneyland's!! Can't wait to go back and try their happy hour. 7 days a week 3-7 HH is prime time on my book!!

fh4OONu6hKpYF9BwSKMzCA.text: We went here hoping for a good Mexican meal, but got much more than that! With fantastic food and great, accommodating service, I would definitely come here again any day of the week. Chips are highly addicting though so watch out!

dBS5DoqWimqYLvdqSwk0rA.text: We really like Juan's . The service is consistently excellent and Juan is cordial and hardworking.  Lunch is a super deal.  We really enjoy the chicken fajitas.  Have found the steak fajitas to be tough and the shrimp tend to get overcooked.  Stick with the chicken and you will be happy.  Chicken chimichanga was large, but salty.  Ice tea tastes freshly brewed.  My very critical 86 year old mother gives  Juan's the thumbs up.  I don't know a better recommendation than that.

o6ZMy-Dddy-Z61eFv8lDiw.text: This places earns a legit 5 stars. Came here for lunch and was severed endless chips with bean dip and salsa. Chips, dip and salsa were so good we couldn't stop eating while waiting for the lunch entree. They were on top of drink refills and chip refills like some kind of magic from Disney land. It's hard to make me feel like I am on vacation while on lunch break but hey I really felt that way. I got the Mulitas and it was very good. The service coupled with food quality were out standing for the price. I will be back for sure.

NglTLxDFikrDzYUPw-qIvw.text: The service was great no complaints, the chips & salsa also come with bean dip for your complementary starters. We went during lunch on Friday (today) not crowded, we ordered burritos off the lunch menu ( I think the menu it was slightly priced to high ). The food was good, not great. We saw allot of the flaming fajitas come out, probably try on my next visit.

BUFV6bm2_JlGpCpUnXmqog.text: Food was pretty good but the service was fantastic. Even though we walked in 40 minutes to closing, the staff was attentive and polite. I will stop by next time I'm in the neighborhood.

Q08I-fT3AiSt2J7aadpBiQ.text: I've been several times for lunch and the food has been fantastic every time. The fajitas are so good I can't bring myself to try anything else on the menu. The onions and peppers are perfectly cooked with just the right amount of caramelization that makes them irresistibly tasty. Price is great as well.

yjpRRCVHggNgO0GEf1HluQ.text: My go to spot for Mexican food. Service is consistently good even though they are usually busy. The fajitas are the star, but I enjoy ordering their chicken mole and other Jalisco dishes. Chips and salsa are good. Sometimes they have live music. A guy and a guitar serenaded our table. Added to the atmosphere. Always looking toward to coming back.

Lcl1WQCtwBtc2TFhom9NKQ.text: This place is so good. They serve the best authentic steak tacos in town, all for a good price. If I want to go to a good Mexican restaurant I'm going to this place.(Do NOT go here on Saturday night, it is super crowded, if you are coming here on Saturday night I recommend making a reservation.) All and all one of the best authentic Mexican restaurants in the city

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The free appetizers

AZFuui0ansCie7LQ6dnp9A.text: This place is very good. Has excellent service, nice and friendly, and always checking on you from all the staff. The food was great and didn't take long to get your food. Food was hot and fresh. I had the fajitas and loved it lots of food and good prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-W6lGtdQptOukr5l7PhOEg.text: This was suggested by a friend that lives in Las Vegas and I was glad I took her advice.  As soon as you walk in the door the aroma of the fajitas about knocks you over.  It smells sooo good and you get more hungry while you wait to be seated.  The food is good and the staff is friendly.  I'm headed back when I come to town again.

V_KnrCgDNJ3PAusx1Z04ug.text: I hate giving out one star reviews and it's been on my mind to give Juan's another try. While our 1st visit was good, the second visit was rough. But the 3rd visit puts Juan's back in 4 Star territory. And there are two key reasons for those stars. Our server, Omar provided great service, and then there's the steak. The OMG, melt in your mouth, cooked to perfection steak tacos that my wife ordered. It was so good she shared some with my son and I and it got a unanimous vote of approval. One bite and we gave each other "that look"... the smile that comes from when you order something and it exceeds your expectations and is just amazing!   Parking was a bit of a pain as always but the wait was super short, the front door staff actually paid attention to us this time and then when Omar took over we were well on our way to a good experience.   Try the queso, and don't ignore the plate of jalapenos and onions they bring out. Dip those jalapeno slices in the queso and you'll be hooked. I'm also a fan of their fish taco. It's one of the few that's not overly cooked or more batter than fish.   I'm happy to bump Juan's back to 4 Stars, and my wife is like we gotta try the steak fajitas next!

ihdOVi6McOqbyj-4Eli0hA.text: This restaurant was recommended to me a couple months ago. My daughter was craving Mexican food! So we checked it out!!! Omg!!! She ordered the kids bean burrito with rice and beans on the side. I ordered the steak fajitas. The food was authentic and the customer service great! They brought out chips and a few different salsas. Our drinks never were empty. I had a great experience! My daughter loved her food!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Date night with my daughter!!! Mommy daughter bonding time over great authentic Mexican food

Uy8VtI2RfBPUss8TiKnunQ.text: Very yummy, not too overpriced. The service was fast and the food was good. I would recommend to anyone

c_o_cxsbKbqzNdVIuNtIJw.text: The best Mexican food in Las Vegas! The food the services everything is great! I have people coming for out of town craving Juans..... been going to Juans since they opened and nothing changed! Love love love

Dbkdb4Q_G66DBGcD0a6VmQ.text: Good surprise I don't like Mexican food too much but my wife felt like fajitas and we tried the chicken and shrimp fajitas and it was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IluQafS0uCrrBSRJDA09Fg.text: Unbelievable!  A cross between saginaki (opa!) and fajitas. 100% homemade food. Excellent drinks, chips, salsa, and our server, Christian, was a True professional. We enjoyed all the little touches like sauteed peppers and onions with the chips and salsa and the soup that's included with the meal. You can't go wrong.

g4LGPPSGpm0nJceHH4-fxA.text: Me and my girlfriend come he often and we share the juans flaming fajitas. The food is good but the service is outstanding!

Z_oJgKK_bXh_P-iOpVr9iQ.text: Upon entering Juan's we were greeted by friendly smiling faces. It was perfect weather to dine on the outdoor patio. The patio is nicely decorated with fresh flowers and most of the tables were in the shade at 6 PM.  Service was prompt and we started  with a pitcher of margarita's. A complementary appetizer of sliced jalapenos and sauteed onions was well received along with chips and 3 types of salsa. The Chicken Fajita for 1 was large enough for 2. The entree is served on a dutch oven type pot and is flamed table side. The chicken and vegetables were cooked perfectly and piping hot. A very tasty and satisfying dish that is served with tortillas, rice and a choice of black or re fried beans. The black beans were excellent.   Our server Hernan checked on us periodically and also refilled our margarita glasses. Juan's has a very comfortable atmosphere and treats it's guests like family. I look forward to a return experience as their menu has a large number of choices.

P-yx8D597_DTTobovp7AZQ.text: I loved the atmosphere, the food and the flaming fajitas, that was a nice surprise.  For sure it's a nice place to get a great dinner!

0JY-FRUIXnyb6PzG8CzXww.text: Holy crap! like the name of the place says thier fajitas are flaming! Located close to Tropicana and Fort Apache in the same center as In n out burger. When you come in you can go right which is a bigger dining area or go left which is their bar area which also has ample seating.   They got TV's by the bar area so you can watch your sports (golf was on...?) this area is pretty tight so impossible to get bad service in my opinion because staff is always walking by you, they really can't miss you.    You start out with noodle soup which I enjoyed, wasn't spicy. I ordered the steak ranchero, basically a steak with melted cheese on top. Comes with rice and refried beans. I enjoyed my meal but was thinking maybe I should have ordered the Fajita. Ellen F. ordered it and this guy rolls it out on a cart and whoosh! sets it aflame.   Wifey ordered it for one and aside from eating my steak I was able to pick at it as it was more than enough, they also have an option for two. We ordered margaritas and we're with my parents, they had booze to and some extra sides. All in all with Steak a Fajita for 1 and Fajita for 2, booze for four people it came out to about $81 with the 15% check-in coupon from Yelp.   Word of advice if your going to a place with the words flaming Fajita in its name, have the Fajita. As you want regret it, next time I'll try the shrimp Fajita.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Presentation.

44kxE_zJV6-IBtqoE6ouJg.text: Came here with hubby, bro in law and a friend after a day of moving. We were seated promptly and were given chips, salsa, and bean dip. The staff was very friendly and they even had a guy playing guitar and singing some old Hispanic ballads.  We ordered the chicken tacos, shredded beef burrito, and chicken fajitas. Each entree came with a yummy fideo soup (tomato soup with noodles), a choice of rice and beans or steamed veggies, and guacamole and sour cream. Everything was pretty good but I've definitely had better Mexican food. The chicken was a little bland in my opinion but then again my best friend is Mexican and her mom is an amazing cook!  Would we return? Eh probably not unless we were on that side of town.  Happy hour is worth checking out though. They have a good assortment of appetizers and drinks on it.

VyUJwrviiB4jG6L5QUmM2Q.text: Great Mexican spot with good service and excellent food.  This place gets very busy so plan ahead and show up early.  Great place.

PqhD3efO3O-hIhpY_8rAXg.text: Seriously amazing fajitas! The queso fundido is a must! You get three kinds of salsas which taste fresh and delicious. Great service and food comes out hot and fast.

srmu4dz7UMVx_VjOI3EbCQ.text: Loved this place went on Friday afternoon,  May 4.   Waiter etc fantastic service.  (Except hostess not friendly at all, sorry to disturb you).  Even met Juan himself.  Great service and loved the fajitas for 2 and happy hour margaritas- delish.  So glad to hear they are opening in Henderson end of September.  Will tell my friends and family

oj8_kKmThShbtpZfCjPbfw.text: Im a hair stylist just nearby the area. After being told by a few clients of mine how amazing & authentic the food was at flaming fajitas, I of course was more then happy to drop by and try. In a city where it's not easy to find authentic Mexican food., I was very pleased with this place and how good the food and service was. Th bussers and servers were very attentive. They have a great happy hour menu, and margaritas are amazing. The only thing is that it's always busy and there's almost always a wait. But the wait is worth it. I will be back again.

TFv8RZg4w8q1Ogwk_Ef65g.text: Great break from strip . . Local place great food, good service and good value.  Solid portion sizes very fresh food

zdyJkvUvhxXHDV9oFAd_GA.text: A few months ago, Flaming Fajitas was only a month old, we stopped in for dinner while my sister and nephew were visiting. The five of us were eager to try the newest restaurant in the neighborhood. You'd think Las Vegas of all places would have great Mexican, and while it does have a couple gems, it really has a poor showing overall. However, Flaming Fajitas has brought some heat to the scene. I mean that quite literally.    I love spice. And Flaming Fajitas delivers. I love the plate of grilled onions and jalapenos that gets you started and the salsa is quite tasty. This is often the weak link when I dine out, but it fresh, bold and well balanced. The staff aims to please and they were more than willing to accomodate special requests made by our group. We were started with delicious fideo soup. Then, a short bit later, hot plates piled high with food swirled around us. I ordered the tacos al pastor. However, what was presented before me was not tacos al pastor. I don't know if the kitchen made an error or if they prepare them differently but these had no lingering flavor from chilies, nor a hint of pineapple. Whatever it was, it was decent, but fajitas is the name on the building and it's what you should get here.   My brother went with their signature Chicken Fajitas and there is quite the presentation; far more showy than any fajitas I've seen before. Usually you can hear them sizzling, but these are actually set on fire tableside.   The fajitas are excellent. So much so, I took my husband the following night we shared the steak and chicken fajitas for two. The chicken is far better than the steak. I noticed they also offer pork. I will try that next visit. I also prefer the corn to the flour tortillas. They have a great and reasonably priced beer selection to quench your thirst and come for happy hour to enjoy great specials.

kbnonggivE0buFmmd0GXbg.text: The Caronaritas are amazing!!!  5 stars for sure. We had the chicken and beef fajitas that they let us split. I am amazed anytime I receive amazing customer service!  This is on our go to list for sure. A ton of family members have went just from us telling about it. Omg chips and salsa they do let u fill up be care cause you won't have room for the amazing meal your about to eat :)

R81eQ6rlqe9TU_2Gk8FowQ.text: The food was good but the whole place was very dirty, also the service was not that good we didn't get our Fido soup until after the main course arrived but that was because the buser was more interested in flirting with the girls at the bar. I won't go back until I hear that this place has been cleaned up.

k04uECb9RHifKtuboHzYxQ.text: We've been going to Juan's since shortly after they opened and we absolutely love it!  The food is great and they continue to update and add to their menu to make things even better.  The happy hour is a great deal for sure and we always try and hit it! Saturday's are insanely busy, so just be forewarned! We've tried to call ahead but they only do call aheads for large parties.  I really do love that they always remember us and stop in to check and see how our meal was!

bMQPELbOG7Y1QWtd9E9U5w.text: Fajitas on Fire.  5 beers in a bucket for $15. Good chips and Salsa.  Mariachi Band.  Strategic TV's for all seats.  Excellent Margaritas. Kid friendly. This place rocks!!!  Out of all the places in Las Vegas to pick for Cinco de Mayo food, drinks, and music, we picked this one based on YELP reviews.  We were first time visitors.  We will definitely return very soon!    We arrived early to avoid long waits and drunk people.  By the time we left, we might have been the very people we were trying to avoid!  Drinks aside, we enjoyed the flaming fajitas!  We ordered the fajitas for 2 with steak and shrimp.  It is more than enough for 2 people.  My hubs and I made 7 fajitas from the meat.  We can't speak to any of the other food.  OH WAIT!  Now I remember, we had an AMAZING desert.  A sopapilla topped with ice cream and strawberries.  It was DELISH!!    We met Juan the owner who welcomed us and our little toddler.  Juan said he built the place to accomodate families and that their daily Happy Hours are restaurant-wide - and not exclusive to the bar only like many places in town.  Their daily happy hour from 3-7pm looked really good!   Our server was very friendly and the service was great!  The Mariachi band was an added bonus - we would love to return to hear them again.  They were very good!    This is a place worth visiting!  Good food, good drinks, good prices, and good service!  Locally owned.  Flaming Fajitas - what more can you ask for!!!

WOMAJkPNVqq2K4NooLBYDw.text: Excellent! Several people had the "flaming fajitas" and others had combination and all was just delicious!  Loved the chips and different dips.  Service was outstanding

nbNlUiGw00qDy0ubZe39fg.text: Honestly, this place is probably one of the few good non chain mexican restaurants in Vegas. The service was great and the food was sooo good! The chips with salsa and bean dip was spiced well. My mom ordered the chicken fajitas which were amazing and had flavor. I got the grilled fish tacos and chicken tamale with green sauce and it was very flavorful even the rices and beans were. The prices are a little cheaper compared to Lindo Michocan and way better quality. Even the margaritas are good. I got a mango margarita. I will be returning to this place more often. Oh and every entree you order you get a delicious fideo soup which is my favorite.   TIP: Ask for side of roasted jalapenos (free)

NksjU4Jf4tQaeOwMf2eJ3w.text: First time visitor and went because of the positive reviews. They did not let us down. Food was very good and nice proportions. Will definitely be there again on our next visit to Vegas.

m8NQ7aOtLz3-6g6toYBaew.text: Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is my new favorite Mexican Restaurant, I found this restaurant on yelp which was our first visit and we did not know what to expect. Ambiance was nice plenty of booths arrived at approximately 5:15 PM seated within Five minutes, which was a surprise due to the line. the patio area was large and numerous people were enjoying their meals seated in the patio which had misters also they have huge welcoming bar area. I ordered the shrimp fajita and my other half ordered grilled fish tacos which were incredible with home made Corn and flour tortillas. i also ordered the fajita Nachos for happy hour $6.95 which was an incredibly generous portion. Shrimp Fajitas were great not to be forgotten is the Fire presentation for the Fajitas that arrived at our table. Omar was a warm and wonderful waiter who could not have given any better service. Jose the bus-boy was extremely attentive and ensured that all of our needs were met without having to request water or napkins.Jose needs to be promoted as a server as quick as possible.  Happy hour is from 5:00 PM until 7:00 PM so worth the visit you will not be disappointed also the prices were quite reasonable for the size of the portion. Who has happy hour on Saturday? very rare! Juan's offer a happy hour which you will enjoy.  I was so excited about Juan's and our experience i almost forgot to mention the bean dip and salsa with the best grilled onions and grilled chili peppers.       Omar and Juan thank you for a great experience and your exceptional service which is uncommon to have it all.  I love this place.....

KNTHWUwCW1LLIOBUw7_O4w.text: Wow, thanks Yelpers for leading me to this spot. Nice to have a high-quality Mexican place on the West/Southwest side of town.  The service was great, food was equally as good, and prices were reasonable. My drink stayed refilled constantly. Chips with salsa and bean dip, both tasty, to start, then Fideo soup before the meal. They've only been open a couple of months, but there is no reason (other than maybe location) they can't give Bonita & Lindo a run for their money.  Will be going back often.

YtcV7-uisrW1Ouw2UqnnNg.text: I don't eat Mexican cuisine very often, so I was very impressed by this restaurant. Absolutely fantastic service. Our waiter, Ernie, was very knowledgeable-- I had to ask him what he would recommend and we went through a gauntlet of questions just to get it exactly right. And I'll tell you-- it was perfect. The staff looks happy to be there, and genuinely care about their customers. It's fantastic.  The food is absolutely delicious. They serve up the fajitas by setting it on fire first, then serving it on the table. Super cool, and really pulls the atmosphere together.  I love this place, and will definitely be returning.

2MPMqpHc_oExEe03rsDPEw.text: So happy I decided to stop in to dine. I've been passing this place for months, and finally I told my husband "lets try this place" and I'm so glad we did. The margarita's are on point! The service is Great! and the food is Awesome!! We are definitely going to return. Can't wait to try their happy hour!

HNjadCHSsutrAcz_x5US_A.text: I frequent all varieties of  Mexican restaurants, from Roberto's to Mundo, but Juan's Flamin' Fajita is on the do not return list after my meal.  Many of the items that came to the table were not made in house. The chips were not fresh, some store bought variety. The salsa, despite many other reviews, was not fresh and pretty spicy. The margarita was the worst margarita I have ever purchased. The mix they use is super sweet and just plain terrible (and probably old). I tasted very little tequila and even less lime, odd for a drink that consists mainly of those two ingredients. It was so sweet  that my girlfriend couldn't even drink it (and this went completely unnoticed).   I ordered some of their "Flamin' Fajitas," and was not impressed. It reminded me of something you could find at Chili's. The flame they give you at the table, while fun to watch, is terrible to taste. The protein was cooked beyond well done- chicken being super dry and steak being very tough.   I will say the service was pretty good.   The manager did notice our apparent dissatisfaction with the food, but at that point we knew we were not coming back and did not even bother explaining everything we found wrong with our visit.    Overall, it was not the worst meal I've ever eaten, but our experience was no where near five stars.   And on an unrelated note about Juan's, the font on their menu is horrendous. It is childish and ugly, I think they should change it. However I will not be returning to check.

dmVqvseGcOoOSGVfMfD9pg.text: I love this place! They have an amazing happy hour, great drinks, and pretty authentic Mexican food. I'm pretty picky about Mexican food and they definitely met my standards. They make really good margaritas and have such reasonable prices. The chips and salsa are the BEST I've ever had! They give you 2 different salsas, refried beans and cheese, and grilled peppers and onion. Really great to munch on while you drink and wait for your food. The service is also outstanding. I love their chimichangas, fajitas, and enchiladas. Their shrimp ceviche is pretty bland and tasteless, it's definitely missing seasoning and that tangy lime juice taste. They could definitely improve on that. Overall one of my fave spots in Vegas. Five stars!

zdUSRFXkVF7SU-n8Vzs5rw.text: From out of town the Bay Area was visiting and went there for the first w/ my friend. We were both very satisfied w/ the service and food.   We were seated in the bar area.  It was a live atmosphere had Spanish music playing as you watched sport events on big flat TV screens.  There wasn't that many people at first. You don't want the place to be to crowded either.    We definitely will be coming back again. The food was real good and the prices were reasonable.  Recommend eating at this place.

NxSCdybp5D61G92hEc88Lg.text: Oh my gosh! A MUST stop when in Vegas! Been here several times and have never been disappointed, and the service was 5-star just like the food. We will be back Juan!!

gLOn0ysAbN7payEaT4ujNQ.text: I have finally found some very yummy Mexican food!  We have been here twice now and both times have been super delicious!  The shredded beef flautas were so good!!  The hubs loves the steak fajitas and we both enjoy the margarita made with don Julio tequila, maybe just a little too much!  Service is great and the restaurant is clean!

cD5ReaDoy7hPPMKBHlvGbw.text: I cannot stress enough how happy I am that the talent behind the recently closed Viva Mercado's has found a new home here.  I was really hoping that I would find the same level of service and quality of food when I went here last Friday and I must say my expectations were far surpassed.  The happy hour deals were superb and the food was absolutely the same, if not better, than the food I used to eat at the old place.  You will not be disappointed with the food or service at Juan's.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect dessert combination @ Juan&#39;s!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table-side Guacamole @ Juan&#39;s

8k6mIyqASGQ-xQv6H-zb2g.text: Came here for Cinco de Mayo and had a great experience.  Obviously very busy, but did not deter the customer service at all.  Two kinds of salsa and a bean dip come with chips when you sit down, as well as grilled onions and jalapenos. All of which were very good and a nice touch compared with most other mexican restaurants.  Ordered the civiche as an appetizer which was very fresh.  The main course combination platter of a Chile Rellano and chicken flauta was very good.  The star of the show were the steak fajitas.  Outstanding taste and the steak was perfectly marinated and cooked.  Flour tortillas were obviously made in house.  Will definitely order them again on our next visit.

WIm4Ce17iaT-jXUT_atQZw.text: I have no idea why anyone would eat here!  Anyone can make better mexican food than this at home. We ordered the Chicken Tostada, Chicken Chimi and Pork Fajitas. Chicken was extremely salty and frankly kind of gross. Fajitas were boring... same quality you would get at TGIFridays or some chain place like that. The free chips and salsa are all store bought crap. I swear the bean dip comes straight from the can. The quality and service are low! There is way too many good mexican resturants in town to eat here ever! Lindo is close by.... go there! Frankly I think Roberto's fast food is better then this place!   Almost forgot about my terrible Coronarita... cheap margarita mix in a normal drinking glass with a corona sticking out.

jjekQ9gEl0drm-8_Cfjp-A.text: What an awesome place !! It was packed and hard to find a spot to park . My friend has been telling me to go here for over a year and finally made it .   This place will not disappoint....   Service was on point from the start . They were fast and ensured we had everything we needed from drinks , napkins and chip and salsa .   The chips included two types of salsa and a bean dip . Never had to ask for a refill . By the time I turned my head it was all replaced with fresh chips and salsa .   My wife and I had the Steak Fajitas for two and took half home . Everything was cooked perfectly with your choice of sides and tortillas!! The meat could have used a slight more seasoning and lime but was still excellent !! My son had the California burrito with no sauce and devoured it . My Brother had the New Mexican Enchiladas with an egg on top and it was on point .   Everyone was super nice , thoughtful and fast . Truly loved the food and service and that is what always counts the most ....   We will definitely be back . Priced reasonably and plan on waiting a little bit . The good news is they will get you taken care of .

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Burrito w/ no Sauce !
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Fajitas for Two.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican Enchiladas with an egg on top!

U7te0rPSuZtikPHFwhxzsQ.text: Gloves need to be worn  The food was good.... service was good.... my only complaint was how they served the chips. They placed my friend and I at the table in front of the window where they make the tortillas. So I had a very clear view of the tortilla bin. When I saw that the servers stuck their hands in the tortillas to place them in the baskets I was in shock. I was surprised not to see some type of chip scooper or someone wearing gloves ....something !!!! And the people that were taking the chips out were also taking peoples money, credit cards, etc. I'm pretty sure if the health dept. came through that would be a violation. Let just say I was good on eating any more chips.

ZjGtBi5swkbaRUOw5MdrKg.text: Loved this place we happened to come across. The chicken fajitas were the best I've ever had. Definitely coming back here! Thank You!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fajitas

eUJxkl5gwtqz0VOkchT1eQ.text: How have I not reviewed this restaurant when I've only been going here for e last 4 years? Anyway this neighborhood restaurant is always packed for Lunch and dinner. Go before 12p or after 2p for lunch, go before 6p or after 8p for dinner.   Of course the name says it all, order the fajitas they are all good all the combos. We usually order the beef because the chicken when reheated tends to dry out. They're generous with refilling our salsa and bean dips.   The Chile verde and all the soups are winners for us. But there's so much choices for everyone. The only disappointment is that the shrimp cocktail is not as good as I hoped it would be. Not enough flavor or Clamato.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UKxluLUPyoBaspeEcWvTpg.text: This is just as good as the Henderson location and perhaps a wee bit less crowded. We were able to get a seat in 10-15 minutes. It's an hour in Henderson, usually. I still maintain this is the best Chili Colorado I've ever had...again! My companion had the mixed fajitas which he loved and they're always a show. Juan's really has something special here. I hope they're around for a LONG time!! Vegas needs truly good Mexican food. This is it!

jbjJeLv2M9SO7WqzVe3_Vw.text: Came into town and found this place!  Amazingly authentic!   Great service!  Anticipated needs or wants!

9bVZWs-Y_syNgSgVEhBD_w.text: This place is a hidden gem!! I can't believe I live 5 mins away and didn't try it till today. This is your authentic, lively, homely Mexican place, not fine dining.   They start you off with complimentary chips, 2 types of salsa, bean dip and grilled onions and jalapenos!! Service is excellent and every one is so friendly and efficient.  Excellent lunch specials (including $3.95 lunch margarita!!) served with rice and beans. I appreciate the fact that they mention their bean dip is not vegetarian but you can request their vegetarian version. Kids meals include soup, entree, drink and choice of fries or rice/beans.   Happy hour is in the entire restaurant and everyday from 3 pm to 7 pm. Lots of margarita choices, also have wine/beer, well drinks and food specials.   I did not get to try fajitas this time but they looked really great. Can't wait to return for happy hour and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SQImb0aX6dc2d56XEfTtTQ.text: This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant. With all the great reviews, I don't know why it took us so long to get around to going here.   We sat in the bar area, which was less crowded than the main dining room. Our waiter, Alex, was right there waiting to take our orders. I try to stay away from mixed drinks these days, but the wine availability is very limited. So I decided to have a small (12 oz.) margarita. Because the kind of wines I wanted wasn't stocked, I was treated to HH pricing and my choice of tequila. It was the best margarita I've ever had, by a landslide. Not too syrupy, just the right amount of ice, and the slice of lime in the bottom of the glass kept it flavorful to the last sip. Next time I won't care about the wine; I'll just go straight for the hard stuff.  We ordered the flaming fajitas for two - chicken for my husband, Mr. Cluck, and shrimp for me. I was so happy to learn that we could have regular or black beans, rice or - be still, my heart - steamed veggies, and could choose two of those in any combination. I swear, in my next life I definitely WILL be a vegetarian! The veggies were a mix of many kinds, and fresh and unadorned, just as I like them. The black beans didn't taste like they came out of a can. The tortillas were the lightest I've ever tasted, which explained why the complimentary tortilla chips were light as air, too.  Those tortilla chips were accompanied by a dish of grilled onions and jalapeno strips, and two salsas and a bean dip. When I tried the bean dip I thought I tasted lard. I asked Alex, and he confirmed it, then asked if we wanted dip without lard. It was replaced before I could blink.  To top off the fabulous service and food, the background was my beloved Mariachi music, making me yearn for the good ol' days, when I was in school there for three summers and then visiting the country often twice a year. Juan's is that authentic, and I look forward to another visit very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love that veggies are an option!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sopa de fideos comes with entree
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our terrific waiter, Alex

RW3cpDRqxlt9YAB630zeVA.text: Always extremely busy but the food is definitely worth the wait. I got the shrimp fajitas which could have had a tad more shrimps on the plate for the amount of tortillas they give you and the price they sell it for. But overall, I recommend everyone to at least try it once.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Fajitas.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their famous Flaming Fajitas!

pEfnPrnCnZL7zV0d2Oc-ZQ.text: If you are looking for Mexican food that is close to authentic, this is the place to go. It is not fancy, so very casual is what the environment is all about. I liked the fact that there was a vegetarian menu section. I myself am vegetarian for the last few months so this was very nice to see. I ordered the vegetarian fajitas and they were delicious! They brought a nice portion of sour cream helping to the table with it. Apparently, the beans are not vegetarian but you can request vegetarian beans and they will bring it. The rice was just OK but the beans are delicious. The meal starts with a small portion of Fideo soup that was yummy. They also bring fresh tortillas to the table and three different sauces come with it: a mildly spicy salsa and a spicier salsa and bean dip, as well as a plate of fried onions and jalapenos. My friend ordered a different vegetarian enchilada with she greatly enjoyed as well and we ordered a chicken enchilada for her son and he loved it.  The margarita was the house margarita and it was only four dollars and for four dollars it was pretty yummy. The service is very friendly. So why only four stars? I would have given this place 4 1/2 stars if I could, but the reason I did not give it five stars is because we found it to be way too informal. There are other Mexican restaurants in town that work on giving it more of a flair with a nicer environment. It was too plain and we did not find the seats comfortable. It was the closest one to our house which is why it was ideal, but there are other Mexican restaurants in town that have food that I believe is just as good, if not better, with vegetarian options, and are just more comfortable and much nicer to look inside. That is my only critique of this place.

0VPqMgT_kKyr2LBSFGI34g.text: After a terrible take out experience at another restaurant just days before, it was an absolute breath of fresh air to get take out at Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina last night!   You know the food is good when the restaurant is super busy on only a Tuesday night, jam packed with at least 30 people waiting for a table. While I've eaten at Juan's for lunch before, this was my first time at the restaurant at dinner time and getting takeout.   Elizabeth provided great, friendly service at the hostess stand and happily accommodated the special requests in my order. And amazingly, my take out order came out accurately with the special requests, it came out with everything as I ordered and paid for and it came out in 10 minutes - 10 minutes faster than the originally quoted 20 minutes and while they were extremely busy!  And on top of awesome service, the food was delicious (especially love the salsa) and so much food with ordering just two entrees! With people still waiting for a table while I left with food already, you might as well just order take out, save lots of time and eat in the comfort of your own home!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much food for $29! Chicken &amp; steak fajitas w/ soup, rice &amp; beans, veggie burrito w/ soup &amp; veggies and chips w/ salsa &amp; bean dip.

Qq_0LdwF-VXZPFbvuxHQ5g.text: This place is always busy - which is great for any restaurant!!  Wife and I both agree that the "Flaming" fajitas and Micheladas were both pretty good..   Kids said that their meals were only "ok" so we gave a 4 out of 5.

yj2YlBO_pcPl7jB4KciZjQ.text: The hubster better watch out - I'm in love with another man, and his name is Juan. The fajitas for two are more than enough food to keep both parties satisfied. The chicken and steak are particularly good! If you come during happy hour, the delicious margaritas are available for a discount, and they are awesome!

p7S_dNeVZO6FqUulKOCHmA.text: I've been to Juan's three times and every time I'm really pleased with the experience. The employees are always friendly, from the hostess to the server to the managers.   I wouldn't call Juan's anything special, but I would say that the restaurant is good food at a good price. I've had tacos, chicken fajitas and steak fajitas. All were delicious! The fajitas are lit on fire table side before serving them, so ladies and long hair guys.... watch your hair :P They do serve chips & salsa with meals, but their queso and/or guacamole are worth upgrading to.   For some reason, I've only ever sat in the bar area, which is loud and nothing fancy. But it does mean that ordering drinks is easier and drinks arrive faster! They have an outdoor area which would be nice if Ft Apache wasn't a busy-ish road. There's also a bigger, non-bar seating area that has some traditional-ish decor. It's a pretty sizable restaurant.   Overall, it's a fun place and the food is really good. I highly recommend it

YnXnhXTQhfLtRIwg8pH_9w.text: Came here for lunch and had a great time!!  The chicken and steak fajitas were delicious.   The service is quick and food is amazing!!   I love the fun filled atmosphere, Oswaldo was our server and he was pleasant and attentive.   We've been here for dinner and the wait times are long, I try to come early.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friends bday!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Fajitas

P247u1t6J6efQ1_g0EMs3A.text: Love this place. Great food and always able to adjust orders to preference/diet needs. Their table side guacamole is the best!   If you plan to come during peak hours, expect to wait as this spot is always busy. Well worth the wait however!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas, no oil or butter and romaine for wraps. So good, high protein and all the micronutrients.

I4_k5EYUft9oTMNgZNpGew.text: We waited about 15 minutes for a table on a Sat night at around 5pm.  Table was already set with chips and salsas (very good) when we sat down. Very busy but service was prompt and ordered margaritas as it was still happy hour and they were great!  First visit so got steak and chicken combo fajitas for two.  Food came pretty quick and the flame show impressive.  Food was fresh and hot with great flavor.  Corn and flour tortillas are homemade and really good.  Sopapillas for dessert were hot a fresh.  Not as fluffy as some I have had but ok.  We will be back!!

jlpcJZcqbVTxC9VINEzqiA.text: This place still rocks!  Went on Saturday when they opened and had a very nice experience.  Grabbed a couple margaritas to start, fell for the waiter's upsell on the second one and got a Cadillac with Patron.  It was better than the house margarita, but not sure it was worth the extra cash.  The chips/salsa/beans were great, as usual.  The flaming beef & shrimp fajitas were good, as well as my wife's chimichanga.  By about 1120, this place was packed and servers were hauling butt to keep up.  Highly recommended!

38BYeOecLdnOhRDbMnaNew.text: I gained 10 lbs!  I couldn't stop eating the oversized amount of Fajitas for 2, the complimentary chips with salsa dip and bean dip AND the grilled onions and peppers!!!  Did I mention they gave you a complimentary plate of onions and peppers...  did I tell you they were the bomb!!!  Salsa was amazing, I ate it like soup!!!  Well we both were treated great by our server Christian!   We had the chicken and steak fajitas, and they were great...  not even sure we need menus the next time!!

Our server was also extremely friendly and prompt.   The host desk was slightly disorganized. We were sat after 15 min, at the empty table we watched from the front area. It seemed as though this was happening a lot from the grumbling of the other patrons around us. I just don't think they knew what tables were open in the restaurant.

PUz98vyp-1oDyEXU1RaFFw.text: The food and service was amazing...we ordered the fajitas for two and it was more than enough food for the two of us that we had left overs for the next day. The wait wasn't too long for a Friday night and the server was constantly checking on us which is was awesome! Will definitely be going back.

sT-xIHlz3sk4KHUHymk0AA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! We're locals and have been coming here for a while. Get here early or else you're waiting in a small waiting area. Besides that service is great and everyone is so friendly. Yajaira was our waitress whom was extremely nice and courteous and Demitrio was our busser that was extremely attentive.

sfi0ROPm0BTO6yWrdVH2rA.text: This place is AMAZING!!! Very good food and reasonably priced. Drinks too!!! Get the fajitas for two!!

lNOd2MmqpaR3niiglhu9fQ.text: I always love coming here!  The food is amazing!  I just wish I didn't always have to wait so long to be seated. I'm hoping that they will eventually move to a larger location with more bathrooms.

qJaTuU2TE5xYxRgbtXqZPA.text: I'm from the East Coast and I've been told when you go to the west coast, you gotta try some really good authentic Mexican food. So, I landed here and I must share that this place had some of the best Mexican Cuisine! I had the flaming tacos. Yummy!!  I enjoyed their Margaritas too. If you go during happy hour, you'll get some nice options of food and drinks at a great price point. Truly a great experience, friendly staff, decent portions and upbeat ambience. This establishment also offers some nice Decour and is family friendly. I would definitely go back again when I visit Las Vegas!

MNYVgqYHAYMs0aJwwGeRtg.text: I lovvvvvve the shrimp and steak fajitas! Every time I go to this place that's what I order with the large guacamole that is so delicious! Eat here on the weekends when it is busy because I have gotten food from here on the weekdays and it wasn't fresh or great tasting like on the weekends. On the weekends the food is on point!

lB-rLzLh6EVSo_Op77z7qA.text: extremely affordable and very solid food.  recommended for families or people with big appetites.  accommodating with requests

YNMrqKcd_g6micHJQtRV8Q.text: Went here for my husbands birthday with friends we call family... MAN those fajitas are yummy! We had drinks in the bar while we waited and the salsa with onions and peppers... whoa! Holy bean dip... can I get some pepper with my chips?   We really had a great time... if you can wait it out... it's worth it!!!

gTONU4B7G1yycaAxH6W-uQ.text: As a Vegas local this restaurant came highly recommended by my coworkers, the restaurant wasn't what I expected. The best part of the meal was the chips and salsa. The $30 margarita pitcher was weak. I ordered the flaming steak fajitas, and they weren't anything to brag about. The main reason for my two star review is, the service was awful. The waitress was very rude, and I felt that she was just rushing me out. Don't waste your time here, there are so many better options in Vegas.

VaiHfZuDQflR_Ft6ST-ldA.text: This was our first time here and the service and food was excellent.  We took advantage of there Tuesday special (2 item combo for $10.95) My wife had the cheese and green chili tamale with a cheese enchilada. I had the chili relleno and chicken burrito.  Both combos were a good portion and we walked out stuffed. Lupe was our server and she was very attentive and made sure that our experience was memorable. If you are in the mood for some great Mexican food come to this restaurant! Thanks again Lupe you made our night!

AiOvfuv0FP9KdBqWQAnVgg.text: Went here on a Sunday night for a family dinner. It's great for any party size, big or small. The vibe is lively and you might even catch a guitarist making rounds singing and playing the guitar! Once you get seated you are greeted with chips, bean dip, salsa, and sauteed veggies. Be sure to save some room for the actual food you are ordering! Their serving sizes can be very big so be warned!   They can get busy at times so prepared for a wait time.

z_yDLylf4IZ1pNbHU_2cbQ.text: I cannot say enough good things about Juan's.  This has become a once a week staple for my BF and I.  I have tried several items on the menu and have never had a bad experience.  They are also super accommodating to special requests.  The only problem is so many people know how great Juan's is, if you don't get there before 5pm you will have a wait.

Mjgxl8V7o46HccE0liewOQ.text: Consistency is key! My fiance and I have been to Juan's four times now, and the food has been nothing short of amazing every time.  Service has been spotty, unfortunately, as once when we sat at the bar, the bartender was rather unattentive (outside of peak hours, mind you), and another time when we sat at a table in the bar area, we had what amounted to an absentee server. During our other two visits, we received impeccable service. I can't even deduct a star for the spotty service, however, as the food is so good that it compensates for service issues.  They have a pretty good happy hour. Get there early for it though, or you may not get a seat.  Speaking of getting there early, if you visit during peak dinner hours, particularly on a Friday or Saturday, you'll be face with around a half hour wait for seating. It's totally worth it. However, your best bet for avoiding a wait is to get there before 6pm or after 7:30.  In Joey Tribbiani voice: Entrees? Good Queso? Good Gauc? GOOD!  I haven't tried the fajitas yet, but their tacos, taquitos (which are very cheap during happy hour by the way), nachos (also a good HH special), and burritos are all delicious. The grilled chicken is easily their most flavorful protein  The crispy rancho style taco is my favorite thing on the menu so far. Ordinarily, I don't care for crunchy tacos, as it hurts my teeth and gums to eat them. This taco is actually not crunchy though, and "crispy" is the perfect descriptor. Order the combination plate and get a couple of them!

14wMeqOLDA6IL-rKzdAIoQ.text: Let tell you that the first time I came here with my family was two years ago and we had the worst service ever.   So worse, we didn't come back for two years and we actually flipped a coin, it won.   Well to our surprise, the same waiter that we had two years ago that was so rude and a horrible human being, was the same waiter.  But this time, he was a changed man.  I don't know if he was complained on before and management talked to him, or their was a mandatory class on how not to be a horrible human as your waitering? Let me tell you, he was great.  The food was great and my family had a change of heart. Two weeks later(about 6 days ago), we returned to the restaurant and continued to have a great time with the staff and food.   So, after a bad experience we gave this place a second and third chance and came out, loving this place.

7O8l24Tufqr3PDnLOWayUQ.text: Came here with local friends. Food is delicious. We had the ceviche appetizer and guacamole. Tacos de la Calle are tasty and plentiful.  Friends has the fajitas for two and they looked incredible. Come hungry because portions are large.  Service is worth 6 stars.

hLpdO-arQK6sey42AW9pRg.text: The food was delicious and the wait staff fabulous.  I will definitely visit here again.  If you love Mexican food, this is your place.  The food is fresh and tasty and the atmosphere is nice too.  My husband and I had the seafood combo for two which included sea bass, shrimp and scallops.  So good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NM-b7K-2gDUKOxUyZyTqcw.text: This is by far the best Mexican sitdown Restaurant in Vegas.  Known for their fajitas, we definitely gave it a shot and it did not disappoint one bit.   You get it sizzling.  We got the combo with steak and shrimp.  It gets really busy so expect a wait.   I've gone there 3 times and there was always a wait but is worth it.  Service is quick and awesome.  Alcohol selection is great too

wU1OVpccZ2lBGaNBlssbbg.text: Great Mexican food !!! Great cinco de Mayo celebration!  Tried seviche n also the flaming fajita !  Yajaira was great server !!

aPRRxelQwY9pWm7-X2ka4Q.text: This place is excellent! I was shocked to see how many people were coming in. It was only about a 30min wait since the staff was on the ball getting tables turned over. Thankfully they have a bar you can grab a drink at to wait.  I did the fajitas with steak and shrimp. They come out literally on fire and smoking on a giant cast iron plate. You also get a side of rice, beans, pico, sour cream, and gauc along with your tortillas. The veggies had a little of that char flavor, and the meat was tender.   They also bring out chips with 2 kinds of salsa and some bean dip that was all amazing. I definitely can't wait to go back and try some of the other food!

b0xJCiMtkNmWnTLm_Io_RQ.text: I love Juan's! I've ordered chicken or steak fajitas to go several times, and my order is always ready to go, the staff is super friendly, and the food is delicious--fresh, savory, with generous portions. Highly recommended.

whW_ZruKqc2S9zqYBHcg0g.text: Sebastian was the real deal!! So was Marvin. Such great service. Very polite and thorough. I will recommend Juan's Flaming Fajitas to everyone I know that loves great Mexican cuisine. Six thumbs up for Sebastian. Six thumbs up for Marvin and six thumbs up for Juan and his fajitas. Fire!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas son fuego.

SIU4tjFa80GPO_C_Dx8uCw.text: The food and atmosphere in this place are incredible I can not say enough good things about them ! Not once have we gone and been disappointed. From the chips and salsa to there most creative dishes, they hit it right on the head EVERY SINGLE TIME ! A+
