tJcOJQ4xu4zB0rfLR1tL2g.text: The most consistently great food and service in Las Vegas. This is the best Mexican food in Nevada and maybe beyond. Try the chicken fajitas as they are to die for!!  Table side Guac is equally amazing. If you are a local or in town for any reason this is a must try!  Only one complaint is they really don't take reservations unless you have a huge party. So plan on arriving early and probably waiting a bit. While worth the wait....still a bit of a pain.

5cKp9cScZbX2dpba2t1wrA.text: A lot of reviews are a little off base and not legit...LEGIT waited 20 minutes for 2 margaritas... service was a 0... I'm sorry but it really was ... food was a 7-10 pretty decent, nothing to write home about though. Lindo is better..  Update   The owner contacted me and reached out. Lunch was very good and the service was much better. Thank you Juan I will be back again.

-WSPB-7aRUl_X7t7hbdUpw.text: This is - hands down - the best Mexican restaurant you will find in the USA. Heck, in North America.   Everything was made to perfection and the service was outstanding.   This place will now be the PRIMARY reason for me to visit Las Vegas.   It does not get better.

5S633ktK8_oe5mZQcw1abw.text: Omg thank you for the previous reviews. This restaurant lived up to all the hype and more! It was delicious and authentic! The shrimp ceviche was so fresh and delicious. The chicken fajitas for one, fed 2 of us with leftovers. I highly recommend!!

nanJvhAFu0qPio93XztiWw.text: We went here with a group of 11. The service was wonderful and the food was amazing! Highly recommend!

n_z8FSVQM4SpVfmRRnZvmg.text: You guys are SO AMAZING! Seriously! From the servers, to the drinks, to the manager who walks to each table asking if the food and everything else! And the main reason why I come- THE FAJITAS! I recommend this place to everyone who wants good fajitas and a cool spot to eat with friends and family!! It's one of the best in the state, hands down! I love that I'm so close to this location as well! Makes it hard to stay away.. keep up the great work guys!!

0CeU2WfW_8lIZXmhAZc_0A.text: I ordered the steak fajitas because of the name of the resturant.  They tasted really good, and their service was average.  I could be going to too many Mexican resturants, because my baseline expectations are no longer reasonable, which is why I still give them 5 stars to help them out.

QpvRk7YDbm9DhCKgKC8KlA.text: Absolutely amazing chips with three different awesome salsas and beans complimentary, sampler appetizer platter is to die for if you get the beef taquitos and the steak fajitas are simply the best!  Skinny margaritas are phenomenal if you ask for whole lime to add and jalapenos!  Fantastic service and authentic Mexican music!

FaIzuXqSJQHnqNNdzzT6pQ.text: We decided to try this restaurant based on the yelp reviews and we were very impressed with the food and the customer service. We got there at 5pm and our wait was 30 min., but we knew there would be a wait a head of time. We were told by staff that there is usually at least a half hour wait all day long. The complimentary chips and salsa were awesome and came with two different salsa options and a warm bean dip. We had the shrimp fajitas and chicken fajitas. Both were excellent. Service was excellent even though they were extremely busy. Every employee from the hostess to the manager were polite, friendly, and efficient. Multiple staff members kept checking on us to see if we needed anything. Additionally we witnessed the Manager, Amanda, deal with a verbally aggressive husband and wife very professionally.  From what we gathered the husband and wife were upset about the wait they had and the wife cursed at the hostess. Once they were seated, Amanda listened to their concerns and tried to diffuse the situation. No matter how rude the husband and wife became Amanda was very polite and professional in dealing with them.

lm_HZoJEdjR-ysuMQCfSpg.text: If i could give a zero star I would. The manager was terrible. We walked out and not even two minutes later realized we left our to go box. Within 5 minutes in total of us walking out and walking in they said we never had a to go box and they obviously threw away our food that we spent 50+ dollars on. Not only did they say we lied about not having a to go box but she said I can't accommodate you. We go there all the time and when we said we wouldn't be coming back they just said okay ! Terrible customer service. The night manager is awful !

plIpE3PbfLDLaSJiJX231Q.text: Carne Asada burrito with red sauce are my favorite,  I always order 3.  Chips and salsa are great.

KJFCci7HIMcFJX5v5jQXmQ.text: Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is probably one of the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to...  Great service, nice atmosphere, tasty drinks and the food is SO, SO good. I have had the "Moriscos Adobados" witch is shrimp, scallops over a base fillet in adobado sauce  3 times now and it is out of the world..  If I had to say anything bad about the place, there always seem to be a waiting list to get in, but being so good, I understand...  I have marked this the best Mexican restaurant of anywhere I have been... Gracias to the help and owners....

QMbp74LgmdTogqq9hBLr-w.text: I have been to Vegas for 4 weeks in a row and I have come back every week. Fantastic food with great service. A must!!

Kqn4Wg70DEz3sfZWv7XgVA.text: Awesome food and service! Went here to "Waste" time before my hair appointment, and had a great experience! Service was outstanding! I will definitely come back!

HvkFdlDh1So9e04VC4hwfA.text: Food was pretty good. My favorite was the table side guacamole. Defiantly better than Roberto's

vXMItcd1wqUi3eeo71ZhAg.text: The service was outstanding!! Our food was delicious!! I love all the way in Aliante which is a 35 min drive. Totally worth my hour 15 min round trip. Growing up eating Hispanic food. This is as authentic as it gets. 5 stars without a doubt.

ICoIiDWe6z0RBgG9TO4hQg.text: I have nothing but great things to say about this restaurant! We choose it because of the reviews and the ratings. The shrimp and chicken fajitas were excellent. Flour tortillas & salsa so very fresh and tasty . The atmosphere was very authentic. I give the restaurant 5 stars for the cleanliness in the bathrooms. I'm a firm believer that you can tell how clean a restaurant kitchen is, by how clean their bathrooms are.!  Staff was extremely attentive! We will go out of our way for a return visit on my next trip to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent shrimp &amp; chicken fajitas!

lZ9U8fZhzXSK7iPv1AoWig.text: This place is really hard not to LIKE! I do not really know if anything is Superb about it, but I found the atmosphere great and the staff was very friendly and the servers we on it and made sure we had everything we needed taking care of us very well. I cant say the Fajitas were "the Greatest" I have ever had, but both the Steak ones and Chicken were very good and they brought the food out to all of us at the same time and that was five steaming plates. The Salsa was very good, some of drinks seemed amazing others had as I just had Iced Tea, but I had a very good experience at a nice place not too expensive....  Overall Very good and will be back soon to try some of their other Dishes.

KNS_Jua0qoMeIcvvWrizlw.text: My nephews are in town from Denver for a BB tournament n after today's game I mentioned that had to try my favorite Mexican Restaurant...they said ok. We order (Tacos Adobados, Tacos Ranchto, Tacos de la Calle, Pollo Azado Tacos), Arturo was our server. As always, excellent service, polite, quick n when they would see a drink almost empty they immed ask if we need a refill. The food excellent ..my nephew's keep saying "thank you Auntie for bringing us here"  - not sure how many times I heard them say that. So than I see Amanda (1 of our favs)...we say hello n she brings out  churro!! And what I hear my nephew's say...

nWuweEMEDYepxc2UBCQcOQ.text: Good service. Good food.  I like how their food doesn't taste heavy like most Mexican restaurants. Chips & salsa to start while you look over the menu, soup while you wait for your food & then the entrees! Everything tasted delicious.  & our server, Omar(?) was very attentive & very nice.   I think I found my new favorite Mexican restaurant!

CwSu8wlOF4kahZtVPx6rCA.text: Awesome mexican food and a fine margarita too. Can be a bit hard to find but worth the trip.

r4gmE1S5hjHZBz1FE-EGnQ.text: Great food, great service and great atmosphere. The fajitas were awesome and you can't beat their margarita's . Would highly recommend and we will be back soon. Best hidden Mexican food off of the strip

IdAu_9OaqlqVwqao44SO1w.text: Best margaritas in town and obviously the best fajitas(just look at the name). Impeccable service. The moment you sit down, chips, salsa and water are served. Food is super fresh..... the table side guac is TOTALLY worth it. I HIGHLY recommend getting the warm churro WOTH vanilla ice cream. Not kidding, LIFE CHANGING! Thank me later!!

xxINbriW15U8rkw1VvURKA.text: Great Mexican food!  The service was spot-on, Gustavo our server and Jose our  busboy were so attentive and always made sure we had plenty of chips, salsa, water, etc.  The food was yummy and plentiful and the restaurant had a nice atmosphere.  My son had the flaming steak fajitas, which were delicious, and I had the enchilada suiza, which was also very tasty.  We really enjoyed our dining experience at Juan's!

ecIhFFhZPQ_FhohQLR2ONA.text: Omg the food was awesome. I know good Mexican food and this was it!! I also got the seal of approval from my sis who only orders rice and beans and ventured out and ordered a taco and tostada which she said was awesome. Please go see Amanda our server !

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas combo-Steak and fajitas. Awesome

NptGlp2Kolkqj-Vo0jqn_Q.text: This place was amazing from start to finish. My hubby and I ordered the fajitas for two (just under $30) and were overwhelmed by the amount of food we got. Chips with two kinds of salsa and bean dip, two cups of soup, six tortillas, two plates of beans and rice, two trays with pico de gallo and sour cream and guacamole, and a huge serving of sizzling steak, shrimp, peppers, and onions. Which they lit on fire when they brought it too our table, which was awesome. It was delicious, and for the sheer amount of food, the price can't be beat. (The leftovers made a huge lunch for us the next day.) We also ordered horchata, which comes with free refills. It was on the sweet side, but I enjoyed it. Very impressed, and we'll go back again the next time we pass through Vegas.

pCbPTfTeFvexZ2t7M6XEJg.text: Holy crap!!! Get their queso fundido with carne asada and mushrooms!! It's so freaking good!!

6JzvCbY7DdoqRMzuNiTYFA.text: Incredible customer service! We go about 2 times a month since we are near by for doctor appointments. First time we stopped by during lunch and got the fajitas lunch. Almost didn't eat because the chips and salsa can fool you into getting full before food comes out. The entire staff are always friendly and coming by to check on how we are doing! Definitely our go to when in the area!

uowvFr_rF9IInDPOEBqftg.text: Seriously, this place has the BEST Mexican food in town! The staff is always amazing, which is just icing on the cake. My family and I have been coming here for years. No other place compares!

CARjJqVD4ONuEJb6MStYRA.text: AMAZING & Won't go to any other mexican restaurant .. This was our first visit & will return to have many more..  First off:: FREE beans, salsa, peppers with onions & chips.. Sauteed and yummy! Delicious Cadillac margaritas for $9.50: HELL YEAH.. And can taste the liquor!  Then food arrived with a fabulous presentation on the fajitas.. Table Side fire in air & very juicy!! Free sour cream, guac as well.. *many places charge extra.  Amanda was our server:: very personable, friendly & knowledgeable on menu..way to go.. GREAT dinner.. Highly Recommended

qDq2o-k-e0gHFCoqjqid3A.text: Wow, call to make a reservation lady checks availability, comes back and says you have to have a party of 10 or more? I am bringing 7 other people to spend money on food and drink, guess it's not enough business for them now.   Funny how I have made reservations there for over a year with the same amount of people, thanks!

IikafEeorYnEtrUA0-WgYw.text: Great food!    But BIGGEST pet peeve ever: When the server brings your change when you pay your bill, but they short you the coins.   Not the first time they've done this.

0nnDzpWD9FvU0ZnwEJNy0w.text: Stopped in on a Thursday for lunch. Place was packed. Service was speedy except for the missed napkins I had to request a couple of times. Food was mediocre I thought as well as my dining partner. Ordered a chimichanga & it wasn't crispy or hot. Rice & refired beans were not warm either. Sadly disappointed. Maybe I should have ordered the fajitas as they light them on fire tableside (would have been warm @ least). The old SuperMex on Green Valley Parkway & Pecos had the best chimis. 3 for the great service when they were packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas

eq3BP9QMsPUQWQOkppn4DQ.text: Wonderful. Staff service is excellent. Friendly, warm and attentive. All we've had so far are the fajitas and the guacamole. Both were excellent. Plenty of televisions, bar area is great. Just can't find anything to complain about.   Oh, and the fideo soup they serve before every meal is fantastic. Have had a lot of different fideo soups, and this is number one without a doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamin fajitas

oan5Mdh3jtOHdG_8leBk5w.text: I have been to many taco joints and Mexican restaurants in Henderson Nevada and Las Vegas and I must admit  that even though I live in Henderson, I will take and make the journey of pure joy to Juan's Flaming Fajita.  Our waiter was excellent and was always there to fulfill our hankering for some seriously awesome street tacos.   By the way, they have happy hour specials on a Saturday which was a nice surprise.   Truly fantastic eats and beverages.  Awesome wait staff.  I will never be able to complain about driving for 25 minutes for awesome eats and drinks.

Qy_InhQwQJ5mN7vVSrzsTg.text: This place rocks! Cant believe I've never been here in the last 4+ years living a minute away. Now I know why its always busy. Best quesdillas, better than Cafe Rio and the overpriced places on the strip. Did wish they come with rice and salsa. Fajitas are defintiely big enough for 3-4 people. Free chips and salsa and soup during dinner dine in. Super friendly service too, but very busy on weekends. Happy hour everyday and great prices.

dxCu0Lw51c5tgC9mGKIOSw.text: Yum yum yum!! Such great margaritas!! And food!! The service is great and fast they keep you eating never had to ask for anything even in such a busy restaurant

FJKI3a3tBXytvYOoevN44w.text: Amazing fajitas and food , however I would recommend booking a reservation as this place can get pretty busy. Also plan on coming on a fairly empty stomach as the portions are huge, but do make great leftovers as well. This is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas.

VZ_GjU_z7BmhGD24Y93MEA.text: Great lunch spot. Service was spot on. Had the shrimp fajitas- full of flavor! Will definitely be back again.

YCu_EfTShnZgVDIkO8TwzA.text: This is the first review I've ever written about anything. This is the motherf'ing place. Nobody messes around. I suggest eating the candy by hostess's before being seated and on your way out the door. Everyone was on top of their shiz. EVERYTHING tasted delicious, the fajitas were incomparable, the French fries were even the best French fries I've ever had. Everything was quality and delicious. 11/10. Went there yesterday with my dad;) for the first time, going there tonight for the second time.

GZIm0szi1fCOoUWiw4ke9w.text: Juan's was one of the first restaurants I went to when I moved to Las Vegas. It also happens to be about two blocks away from my home, so maybe that has something to do with it. This is a fantastic lunch spot and I've been here about 20 times in the last two years. It's a pretty large place between the restaurant and cantina side so if there's wait it usually isn't too long. I work from home and have often just came here for lunch where I almost always get the shrimp fajitas for $11 and leave stuffed. This can be attributed to the fact that I eat way too many tortilla chips because the warm bean dip they bring when you sit down is addictive. Service is usually pretty good here and I've never had a complaint about the food either. Perhaps the only thing I dislike about coming here is that it's in a busy shopping center next to In-N-Out so parking can suck sometimes, but it's not really a big deal.

9_LNZyi5um6mF5pwicAwDA.text: This place is really good. Good prices and great food. Always busy but make reservations and you'll be fine.

QxH-BxIsI8zJ5fx6K8DE5A.text: Came in today for early dinner ! Came in for happy hour, had to have their delicious food ! And was really needing a Margarita. Our favorite Mexican restaurant. Good food and great service.

vdvl4fF0GcroT-bICIo2zA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for sometime. I am so glad we did. Came here for my birthday dinner and had a great experience. Great food, giant portions, great service and all at a good price.  I will definitely be coming back again.

ud6uuRZYh0YTk8Gz-mLJsQ.text: Let me start by saying the service was fantastic. Our waiter was attentive and funny. Food was great and the portions were quite large. The is a staff member making fresh tortillas in a corner of the room so I know that their food is fresh. I was so full on the appetizer that I didn't need a full dinner. I am fussy about Mexican food and I was very satisified here and will return. The managment staff is present during the evening and I received a very pleasant follow up note from the Owner. This is definately a restaurant that  cares about their customers. This makes for an all around good experience. In my opinion, once you have found gem like this there is no reason to look elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef fajitas for one

5ryKCy11AMafXZtEev6rYQ.text: Excellent! The food, service, and friendliness were all 5-star! I loved that the chips and salsa came with onions and jalapenos! The fideo soup was perfect, too! My mom and I shared the pork and steak fajitas and had plenty to take home. Our server, Omar, even lit them on fire for us a second time because the baby liked it so much!

RanPHtqNhhnV84nxw7oxjw.text: I was in the mood for some delicious Mexican food and came to trusty Yelp to find it. Juan's isn't close to me, but I was willing to travel to meet a friend for dinner so this is what we decided on. We got to the restaurant at 7:30pm on a Tuesday night and it was packed! They told us the wait would be around 40 minutes. Both of us were okay with the wait, so we stood outside chatting, waiting for them to call our name. The wait ended up being only 20 minutes or so and inside we went. We were brought chips and salsa fairly quickly and within 5 minutes of sitting down, we ordered our drinks. I ordered a Mai Tai and it was amazing. It was strong and tasty and not expensive. Then a few minutes later, the waiter returned to take our orders. I ordered their flaming chicken fajitas and my friend did enchiladas. About 15 minutes later we received our food and a show of sorts when they light the fajitas on fire in front of you. I also asked for a side of cheese which is an extra $1.50 but holy mountain of cheese Batman! They do not skimp you on anything. Now, the food. No lie- THE BEST CHICKEN FAJITAS I'VE EVER HAD! Ever! The flavor was on point. There was no one seasoning that overpowered another. The portion sizes were good as well and the food that I took home for leftovers was devoured the next day and let me tell you, it tasted just as good reheated as it did the night before. As we finished up, we noticed it was close to closing time, but no one rushed us. We were able to enjoy our food and take our time. When we got our bills, I was so impressed by the total! It was less than $40 for both of us. For good drinks and great food? That's unheard of! I will be singing Juan's praises to everyone, because it was that good and I look forward to returning as soon as I can!

08eMOh_tFhQnOm0T0tU7pQ.text: Amazing food, fun atmosphere, highly recommend!!!!  One thing , went on a Tuesday : make reservation at least call and check but way worth the wait. Best fajitas hands down. Steak and shrimp yum!!!!

x6r2j2WzmYpriYcEJj2bEA.text: A fun, lively atmosphere, solid food, and good service make this one of the better Mexican restaurants in town. The top item to try is the one they're known for -- the flaming fajitas. It's a tableside show of high flames that kids will love. The beef and chicken fajitas for two is the way to go. Portion sizes were large enough that two of us had some left to take home.   Their guacamole is plenty good as are their margaritas, which they have several to choose from. Try a two item combo if you can't decide what to get. I opted for a chicken tamale that had a masa texture that was somewhat thick and gummy, but the flavor was solid. The al pastor burrito was filled with chunks of smokey, deep flavored pork. To finish the meal we tried their churros -- unfortunately too oily.  This place doesn't try to redefine the cuisine, they just do a solid job of executing typical Mexican-American fare at decent prices in a great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros ($2.95)
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two item combo ($12.95) - Al pastor burrito topped with special sauce and melted cheese, chicken tamale
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders

RuqYWlRfpx39TllOw0RRuQ.text: This is super yummy Mexican food!  You gotta get the fajitas--it's in their name and they don't mess around!

GhN2WdYuSatN9pwsAoCyvg.text: Worth a shot, nothing stands out to me on flavor but it's not bad. Salsa and bean dip is good. I don't have much to say about it but maybe because I've been going to chapalas for so long my palate loves the flavor of their food? Idk, try this place and find out for yourself

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They aren&#39;t stingy thank goodness
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portions are big

GnaszFsNAYyWY4wo-5ICyQ.text: I really like this place.   Fantastic prices on their lunch menu...even a cheap lunch margarita on the menu.  Most of the food I've had has been amazing...with a couple exceptions that were merely ok.  My favorite is the steak tacos! Muy delicioso!  The thing I really love is that when they bring you chips and salsa they also bring you been dip as well as a place with grilled onions and jalapenos. I LOVE the bean dip.  They also have patio seating, which is nice.  The staff are always friendly and helpful.

99ux4GShEp9Jt1mQXyC99g.text: The best Mexican food in town.  Everything I've tried (and I've tried a lot) has been delicious. The food, the service and the staff are 5 stars every time!

ilhxEAcHzkF2uEXdvfoZFA.text: Simply excellent food. An array of complimentary salsa's with chips, all great. I had the lunch Carne Asada. Great flavor! Attentive service, bit noisy at lunch time if you plan to have a business meeting. Overall, it was simply excellent.  Will definitely return!

BxYxZxSouCJOp7FjHzEQLw.text: This place is absolutely incredible!! When you first sit down they immediately drop off chips with bean dip, two types of salsa, and grilled onions + peppers which was incredible. Not your average and boring table-side chips and salsa. The fajitas are amazing, they flame them at your table and it's a very large portion which also comes with a soup as an appetizer. The amount of food you get at this place is incredible and the prices are great! Our server was incredible. All around, it was an amazing dining experience and I look forward to coming back!!

ROW1vrtrBM_oD4XzCobH0g.text: This is another 3.5 star situation for me. But because of a few things, it just feels more like a 3 than a 4.   My girlfriend and I went here for their happy hour (3-7 daily), and since I love margaritas and very infrequently get them, I was excited about their margarita on happy hour. We got there and we ordered a margarita, a daiquiri, the quesadilla, and the nachos.   On the happy hour menu, they have a bunch of apps which looked good, but we were sticking to cheap and the nachos and quesadillas were listed as 3.99.   My margarita was... Bad. It was a house margarita, and weirdly enough I had the exact same experience at a NYC restaurant with their happy hour margarita. It tasted like toilet cleaner. I guess when they pre mix a huge batch for happy hour, it's easy to mess it up. I told the bartender and he switched it out immediately, I don't know if it was because it was good service or because this happens a lot. I barely finished my sentence and he was making me a new fresh one.   The quesadillas were very very good, and we had agreed to get chicken on it instead of just cheese. I figured ok. At 3.99 we could take the upcharge for chicken right? Well unfortunately he failed to mention that by adding chicken it was no longer the happy hour menu item, so it was $7 dollars. Not a big deal, but was expecting a little bit less.   The nachos were... Very bland. They had way to much bean on it and it honestly canceled out the cheese taste. It was covered with cheese but you barely tasted it, and nachos without cheesiness are a waste IMO.   Overall, I liked my second margarita a lot, the daiquiri was pretty good, and the quesadilla was delicious. The manager also checked with us as did the bartender multiple times to make sure things were OK, so clearly they care about service. However, with that bad first margarita and very mediocre nachos, I just can't give this place a four at the moment. Will go back to try again!

KB3z147W4E5oqQy0mqX9iA.text: Took my wife to this restaurant since she wanted to check it out . Great service! We went during their Happy Hour and had their ceviche and drinks at a good price!

m5cDbTvXSbSVM7TnE0OdEw.text: Absolutely amazing place to dine. Excellent food service and atmosphere. Highly recommend it to anyone who's looking for excellent Mexican food and wonderful service. Family-friendly.

UhP10d-4tg8pjTKVmppl5Q.text: Every time. This place is so. Freaking. Good.  Ordered delivery again, this time with a friend in town. Time after time, Juan's delivers (pun intended) high quality, fresh, delicious food. Their carne asada (ordered in salad and burrito) is so good!   I love the healthy options - their steamed veggies aren't lame carrots either, it's a mix of zucchini, cauliflower, and broccoli -- AND they are small pieces not giant chunks.   And once again - that green salsa is bomb.  I love this place!!!

XUKN3s3gJ72vmRLUIFiiuw.text: Chile Verde was epic, and  as you might expect, the Fajitas are outstanding. Muy Bueno!

ouYzLzjLQNQd_snVxiOatA.text: Excellent service, 3 types of dip, plus onions jalapenos and gigantic chip bowl, super fast service, great prices. Couple of quiet booths Otherwise open Cantina, casual floor plan. Definitely will be back! Oh and $3.97 margaritas for lunch all great!

m4K03ZP0hlAHJh2BjT6yrw.text: The wait was longer than I would have expected on a Monday night (20 minutes) but luckily there was room in the bar.   We got there a little before 7pm and were able to order off the happy hour menu. We got the queso, which was good but more cheese than 2 people should eat in one sitting.  For my entree, I got the 2-item combo (I love a combo!) with chile rellano and chicken enchilada. I enjoyed both, especially because the chile rellano wasn't heavily coated with batter. Came with soup, which I liked so much I also had the hubby's portion. For dessert, we ordered the fried ice cream which I liked. Ice cream is a combination of 3 flavors (I think caramel, vanilla and chocolate?) and was still very cold inside the deep fried batter, but the batter was chewier than I expected.  My overall experience was good. The only thing that dampened it was there was a large projection screen in the bar, which was showing the hockey game and the table next to us was overly loud and obnoxious with their hockey commentary. But that's not Juan's fault, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream

nj_RQMqLxeAkgtvB8FQieA.text: Had to check this place out with such a high rating!  After a fun filled day of adventures we were starving driving back into Vegas so I went into my bookmarks and decided we were going to finally come here. I have to say this place is doing it! Lots of people waiting to be seated when we came in and when we came out. That's always a good sign!  It's crazy loud. Lots of celebrations going on everywhere and tons of tv's all around playing multiple games. I wasn't into all the tv's and it made it feel somewhat of a sports bar and the decor wasn't my favorite either as it was a tad on the commercial side. It reminded me of visiting the super touristy spots in Mexico that I didn't enjoy too much. But everything else was great.  The service is very friendly. The food was delicious & filling, especially if you're extra hungry and the best part was the older gentleman walking around singing Spanish songs with his guitar. What a nice touch! Also ~ all Yelp check-ins receive 15% off! Thanks Yelp!   We of course had to try the fajitas and they are cooked in front of you sparking a fire that warms the entire room and I had a cheese enchilada with a hard chicken taco that were very flavorful. Everything was great and it's definitely a very fun and energetic place. Expect a possible wait time as this place is very popular.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hard chicken taco &amp; cheese enchilada :)
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming steak fajita!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hurricane :)

2Py0ciFxUVeLMbAWSFAjVQ.text: All I can say is this place is Exceptional!!! The best customer service my fiance and I have ever had in this town! Staff is very friendly and attentive. The smell when you pull up to this restaurant is AMAZING!! The food is fantastic! We couldn't ask for a better experience! We had the steak and shrimp fajitas and the steak is so tender, definitely not tough to eat and the shrimp was also great. My daughter got a vegetarian enchilada plate and she loved it!!!  We give Juan's Flaming Fajitas 5 stars in quality of food, customer service and just being super awesome! All of you rock!!!!

tHA3MG3koyEMm7Erxc2IMw.text: We first went to Juan's for lunch. We followed that up with a visit on Cinco De Mayo. Great food. They had strolling musicians that day., a nice tough. Our grandsons loved it s much as we did.

wuLaFW76yx8HMZSO0EGnmg.text: Fantastic Mexican food!!!   Great service even though they busy.   Recommend them as one of the best Mexican Restaurants in town.  The Fajitas are great!

kp31pK7uWMeND1epT16gwQ.text: This is the best Fajita place in Vegas! Every thing was excellent from start to finish. And don't forget to have the sopapillas at the end of your meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BfoOIOn9BOB5xf-uAqMD8Q.text: I asked my mom what she wanted for lunch and she mentioned Mexican. I have had my eye on Juan's Flaming Fajitas for a while so it was the perfect opportunity to try a new restaurant.  We arrived around noon and the place wasn't busy at all. We were seated in the bar area and given the full menu as well as their lunch specials after our drink orders were taken. The lunch specials were all very reasonably priced and they all include a soft drink or iced tea. I decided on the steak fajitas with corn tortillas and my mom chose the chicken mulitas. Both came out quickly and of course the fajitas were flaming as promised. The first attempt didn't work out, so the server had to go back get some more oil to stoke the fire, literally. Second times a charm and they were certainly flaming. The fajitas were good. I don't typically order fajitas, but these were solid. I wish they were a little less well done, but all the flavors were right and the portion was generous. I enjoyed the entire meal.  The best part about Juan's is the fabulous service. Our server was so friendly and attentive and the rest of the staff checked in with us regularly, made sure our drinks were always full and that we had everything we needed to make our meal the best it could be.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flames
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajita sides
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajitas

hef4WD0TAgMukZeHl3uWcQ.text: Hands down the best Mexican food I've ever had!!! Oswaldo, our server, was fantastic!!! Impeccable service, very attentive staff and super tasty margaritas!

um1eX-X5zQaUH_VY6ClGNA.text: This place is delicious! I am a sucker for good Mexican and this place had it. My husband and I ate here after the Knights game on Black Friday. The place was packed but we were able to get a table in the bar right away. They had margaritas on Happy Hour, which we ordered and were glad we did! My husband ordered the carne assada burrito for dinner and I ordered the chicken rajas with sour cream. Both meals were delicious! Another reason I liked this place is because they do 15% off for military every Monday. I am not military but have family that is and I know they appreciate these types of things!

Np075LPxID3bjv_dQeDoBg.text: So good.  Just go. And bring your picky eaters with cause they'll be satisfied too. I don't eat meat, & this place satisfies. Great selection of non-meat dishes & they are Delish!  Not just over salted, over cooked limp veggies.  We're talking perfect like you'd make for yourself! Portions are huge, salsas are fantastic, staff super friendly, prices reasonable, atmosphere awesome cause everyone's table seems to get fajitas and they lite that puppy on fire & that's super cool.  Only bad thing, parking lot is tight!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place da bomb  And I&#39;m super picky so... Vegetarian section even!!  AND I mean real, excellent tasting no meat meals.

W2tYX1ZUGx4oum9hSW4wdQ.text: This restaurant is so bomb!! Definitely a go to spot that never ever disappoints. They always check if you need a refill on your chips,salsa,  and water. Food is so fresh and their fajitas are amazing. Always be aware of what time you go there because it can get super packed. I would recommend going for lunch or as early as you can for dinner cause I have definitely waited a decent amount of time to get seated. Worth it though!

uwC53oSQ8D-Z7pVCcTfSxA.text: Went here for lunch, since it was local and reviews were decent. Arrived at the start of happy hour. They have a few good deals for happy hour appetizers and drinks. I would suggest trying the Queso Fundido.   Food was above average for most Mexican restaurants, and service was the same. Portions are huge, I'm 225 # and ordered three items off the combo list. Two of them I had to take home in a box. Price is about the same as lunch at most places, around 12 to 20 per person with a house margarita.  Im in town for the week and I definitely plan on going back before I leave. I have to try those flaming chicken fajitas.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. QUESO Fundido, chicken burrito, Pollo asada enchilada and chicken tamale with verde.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZxTRKWSa7TqigxMqvU2qqw.text: I did a take out order from here and the woman who answered was very nice. I went and picked up my food and I was SO surprised because she was nice enough to give me chips and salsa to take as well. The food was AMAZING and even my kids, who are picky eaters liked it and want to go back to dine in. I would recommend this place!

BNBqvkp_4zAfUKjhqPh7Vg.text: Food is great! Portions are very large ! Kids love going here . The wait is long , but well worth it. Family owned , so they put a personal touch on there decor . Cozy authentic Mexican restaurant..

Q3cNPUhCTU6YqsBHdCnkYA.text: This place rocks! First of all, they show up with two different kinds of salsa, a pot of refried beans dip, and some sauteed jalapenos and onions just with the chips. Delicious! Prompt and courteous service, chicken and steak fajitas were tender and tasty. The pork enchilada and ground beef enchilada with their own separate sauce was tasty. Highly recommend!

P3CTEYpMn5aliedg5_6eKQ.text: This is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas! The service here is unbelievable and the food is simply fantastic! We met Juan the owner and you can just see that his passion is why this restaurant is doing so fantastic. Unbelievable food, you have to check it out.

ALMIBCMnvREsSPLA8NC-Mw.text: Food is top notch and the service is even better! The wait can be long to get a table on the weekends but it's totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MUoS3yZidT1mfflvpTuKWQ.text: First time and it was so good.  Ashley our server was friendly and attentive to us during our visit.  The food was amazing we ordered the street tacos with carne asada, the carne asada dish and the shrimp ceviche all was excellent flavor.  The margarita was delicious. We had leadership come by our table multiple times making sure we where well taken care of.  I definitely recommend this restaurant.

2DX8qUyedH1hQ1kpIaZXXA.text: I honestly can't remember the last time I've eaten good authentic Mexican food at a restaurant until now. Holy guacamole, this place is legit. The parking lot was packed and there was a 45 minute wait but we decided to wait it out and I normally roll my eyes to people who say, "it's worth the wait" at restaurants, but shiyet... it's worth the wait!! (Cue eye rolling)  The service was friendly and quick! They have mastered getting you in and out since they probably always have a wait. Their guava margarita was strong and good, their shrimp ceviche was delicious, and their steak sizzling fajitas were tender and amazing! We only ordered an order of one for the fajitas and it was actually perfect for two! We also decided to order the fried ice cream and that too certainly did not disappoint. We practically ate the whole thing. I see now why this place is bringing in the crowds....  You want Mexican food? This place is where you need to be.

yectqdABFuQC0eQJn7-caQ.text: Why did I give it 4 stars? Well their speciality the fajita which has a great flaming presentation but lacks flavoring. I mean it's bland without the usual meat marinade so one must use the salsa to give it a boost. I'd suggest ordering something else in all honesty.  On the bright side their appetizers are freaking fantastic. The sampler plate is a must and I'll probably order that for dinner if I ever go back.   If there is anything I'd like to 5 star. It's the service. Our server was super attentive and on the ball. Our beverages never ran out and her timing was perfect.

TbfqZYTNdM_dtgRespc_uA.text: My boyfriend and I 's favorite Mexican spot. 10$ fajitas and it's enough for us to share :) with leftovers - 5$ margaritas :) friendly staff and fun patio -  absolutely - No complaints

pI5r5J8I9RZsoMoQLcu5Sg.text: Personally I enjoy the happy hour menu items here.  The fajitas are overrated and overpriced.  The last time I went there they were very skimpy and cut me very short on the steak fajitas but charged me full price.  I even mentioned it to the waiter..who did nothing.  The bean dip is very watered down without much flavor.

rSOq3KuHVg5T7f7IyLn1qA.text: The food is really good. Service is always spot on and there always busy which is a good sign.  On my most recent visit I had one issue that I will touch on later. The chips come with 3 types of salsa. All good. I ordered the combo with burrito, fish taco and tamale. Great portion size I left with lunch for the next day. They do have a happy hour where you can get good deals on drinks.  Now my issue. While eating my food I noticed something sticking me in my throat. I figured it was just chips that didn't go all the way down. After drinking copius amounts of water it was still there. It was uncomfortable and irritating but I just figured it was part of a chip and or would go away.  I finally went home, 17 miles away and just decided to look into a mirror. I noticed like a splinter at the back of my mouth. I had to use scissors to pull it out. I added a photo.   Juan's has a great reputation and by no means is this an everyday occurrence. Food is great, better than great. Service is always good but I can't ignore this this one issue.

b_LoU7WS4s8PJx6Xw7geDQ.text: Every time we go there is a huge waitlist because they're always packed... IT IS THAT GOOD! I've been to a lot of Mexican places in vegas this restaurant by far is the best one we've ever been too, they're Guava margarita is delicious and their fajitas too!

9vl0sfAi66iWUyubF7tOkw.text: Wow Juan's!!!!  You guys delivered on food, customer service and deliciousness. This is my second time visiting Juan's and both times I have been impressed.  On my first visit I ordered a yummy chicken chimichanga with rice and beans and a 16 oz draft beer. The portions are so big that I had plenty of food left over for lunch the next day.   On our second visit my fiance and I ordered the smothers steak, and shrimp fajitas for two and oh my oh my. Each person get their own plate of sour cream, guacamole, rice and beans and a choice of flour or corn tortillas. If you sit close to the kitchen you can see someone making fresh tortillas while you wait for your food. I also order a strawberry house margarita and it was delicious. They have all different sizes but I opted for the 12oz and it was perfect. Amanda out waitress informed me that the house margarita is popular because it is in the happy hour menu so it is ordered more, but her favorite was the top shelf margarita. (I'm trying her suggestion on my next visit)  I love how as soon as you sit down someone is there to take your Drink order and give you complementary chips, veggies, bean dip and salsa. I am unsure if soup comes with every meal but the two times that I have visited, I have gotten yummy soup.  The menu has a ton of food options and a great happy hour menu as well as lunch menu.  If you're ever in the mood for some delicious food I suggest giving Juan's a try. You want be disappointed

oa3zfzdLPTYaha9qxpcD8A.text: Today I decided to go here based upon the yelp reviews and location. So for my experience is not even a good one and I did not even eat here. Upon entry of the business, I went to the front counter to hopefully get seated for myself and two more members of my party. To my amusement, although I'm in front of the hostess's- they don't seem to know where the line starts or ended. So after two other parties that came in before me were checked in, I decided to leave. Overall, I would have to say customer service here is a fail. I'm willing to come back and give this place another try later and update my review but as it stands... not for a while.

PNFluwvqa2uV0C9WIrklJA.text: Oh my goodness!  Delicious carne fajitas!  I came here due to the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We arrived around 4:30 and there were already parties waiting to be seated.  Luckily my friend had arrived earlier and had already secured seating.  The service and food was great.  The carne fajitas were tender enough I could cut them with my fork.  The flour tortillas were very moist; sticking together in the tin foil(not a bad thing).   The salsas provided with the chips were delicious.   One of them looked like a roasted version and it was my favorite of the salsas presented.  The only item I would say that I ordered that I did not finish was the refried beans.  To me they were good, but on par with my other favorite Mexican restaurant beans.  You can feel the heat coming off the fajitas when they flambe them table side.  There were a couple of times when they would be serving other customers nearby and I was concerned that one of people in my party would have her hair ignited as she used a lot of hairspray and the flaming fajitas were very near her!  Luckily, she stayed flambe-free.  I wish the tables were not packed in so close together.  You have to maneuver carefully so as not to bump into people seated as you attempt to get to and from seating.  I realize they are popular so they pack in as much seating as they can, but it makes for feeling like you are also dining with others nearby.  I was too full to try a dessert; a good reason to come back.  There is covered patio dining.  The parking lot is challenging as the spaces are packed in like the seating inside the restaurant.  These 'challenges' however will not deter me from coming back.  I've been here once and anticipate returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno and chile Colorado.   Delicious!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno and chile Colorado enchilada.   Delicious!

qtGVH72y7G2qCJFQ22GBoQ.text: Food is the most important meal: It's a showstopper!  For when you want an event, get the fajitas since they present with a huge flame - hence the flaming fajitas part.  It seems dangerous and the pots are still extremely hot when placed on your table so please be careful.  You can order various choices like beef, chicken, or shrimp or get the combo for 2 and save a few bucks.  Served with chip and 2 kinds of salsa/beans.  Then you get a soup with noodles in it (see photo).  Fajitas are served with sour cream, salsa, and guacamole as well as corn/flour tortillas.  I thought the flavoring of the steak and shrimp was pretty good. The real go get 'er is the frozen margaritas.  Quite a few awesome choices like mango or guava and I loved the guava!  It is a really strong margarita too so keep in mind you light weights   Service/Ambiance: good service, cleaned away dishes well.  We were a huge party and our name wasn't on the list even though we made a reservation so they still made room for us even though we made a reservation.  Glad they could make room for a large party since they had made the mistake, very nice business!  Ambiance is whimsical, otherwise very packed since so many people want fajitas on fire!    Get them while they are HOT-HOT-HOT

OkDWrhIa1_eACvwHhmE7zQ.text: I enjoy Mexican food to the fullest. This place was mediocre compared to Casa Don Juan.  I enjoyed the steak fajita with beans, rice and fideo. The soup was AMAZING!  The meat was cooked just right, along with the veggies. The only downfall I had was how greasy it was. I tasted the greasy parts here and there. Next time, I'll try something different. :)

-PMR39tZy-sLAv-BnQ-CYA.text: I was there last weekend  for my Birthday again and it was awesome  the food was really good and not saying the service  Robert and David  were super attentive and professional  can't wait to come back to Vegas and come and eat here again

rDl8SPOjUqaXzZ8ZzMn3rQ.text: We decided to give Juan's Flaming Fajitas a try tonight for family dinner and we are so glad we did. Absolute five star experience. The steak fajitas were excellent! The bean dip and salsa verde was delicious but the white cheese dip is exactly what we were looking for. I could finish off a cup on my own. Honesty everything was excellent.  Special thanks to the wait staff Yajaira and Paty, we never ran out of soda and they made us feel right at home. Entire restaurant is super clean and comfortable. I'm already looking forward to our next family dinner at Juan's.

2CUYRbhKeuRnNN-YDt8B7w.text: Shouts to Areceli for taking care of us. Reasonable prices, great food and service with a smile.  Busy which isn't a surprise so get there early.  Crazy good happy hour deals too.

lZjHRQA_8PrfspaO2vfMuA.text: If you're not looking to read a long review but want to know whether this place is worth a visit then YES IT IS!! If you fancy great Mexican food, go right now!!  Ok, so a break down...  My partner and I tried this place for dinner and despite it being quite bustling, we were greeted and seated right away.  The restaurant itself is fun aesthetically, casual and from the art on the walls, it's got more of a coastal Mexican vibe with beach scenes and little bar tops that stick out and covered with straw.  Lupe was our server and got us some complimentary water and chips and dip straight away. The chips and dip were a great size to share while browsing the menus and the onions, chillis, sauces and beans to accompany were really flavourful and tasty, rather than bland and gloopy like I sometimes experience in restaurants.  My partner went for a straightforward soda. I on the other hand asked for a mocktail-style drink - orange, cran and pineapple with a splash of sprite. Lupe was only too happy to oblige and it tasted good!  We ordered some taquitos to share as a starter and it was a lot larger of a portion that we envisaged. Arrived hot, full of tasty, juicy meat, wrapped in crispy tortilla and with a delicious guac/lettuce mix, sour cream and salsa. So good!!! Would have again in a heartbeat!  For mains, I went for the JFFC taco salad. This one comes with steak for less than $1 more than the ground beef version and it was delicious! FULL of flavour, ingredients and the bowl itself held really well without going soggy. I loved it!!  My partner did a combo plate with tacos Al Pastor & a tostada. He loved them all and as part Mexican, he's had his fair share of Mexican food.  As I asked him to remind me what he ate so I could write this review, he told me he's hungry again and wants to go back tomorrow. That's how good the food was!  Staff were super attentive throughout our experience and offered napkins and takeaway boxes before I even had chance to ask because, of course, we ordered too much!  Both my partner and I loved every dish and every part of our time at Juan's. We'd come back in a heartbeat.. possibly tomorrow..!  Give it a go. You won't regret it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. JFFC steak taco bowl. Full of ingredients and so tasty!! 5/5
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo of tacos Al Pastor and tostada. Delicious 5/5
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips with retried beans, sauces, onions and chili. Delicious!!

uyyQFvIXhyccnwcxQtEfyg.text: Wow.  Just wow.  Fajitas on fire, y'all! Dropped in here over the weekend to check out this place because of the Yelp reviews, and was NOT disappointed. The food was scrumptious, and the service was more than fine.  It's a bit dark and cavernous, and a little noisy and chaotic, but it's a definite return!  The servers are above average in hospitality.  They greet you warmly upon entering, and if there is no line (if you're lucky like we were), you will be taken directly to your table.  The decor is kitsch and pub crawl.  The menu is the typical oversized, overabundant offerings.    But the food...the food is Tony the Tiger, GRRR-EAT.  With an emphasis on "eat." They actually bring you something like an amuse bouche, a tasty, piquant tomato soup that just opens your appetite. You are also gifted with perfectly cooked onions and roasted jalapenos that are not so spicy that you cannot enjoy them by themselves.  The chips and salsa (my favorite) are like a meal in themselves, they are so flavorful and hearty.  We picked the shrimp and steak fajitas for two, and were delighted when they arrived IN FLAMES! What a show! If you have small kids, (well, heck, even us!), they will squeal.  The show was not just eye candy.  The food was really good.  The steak was well-cooked, as were the vegetables.  The shrimp made you feel you were in an oceanside town.  How could they possibly taste that plump and fresh? The fajitas come with a side of tortillas that taste made in house (whether they are or not, I don't know), and rice and beans that will make your Mexican grandmother proud.  Forget keto.  I ate them all!  The price for the two of us eating to our heart's delight came to $36.00 before tip.  Can you say, "bargain?" Yes, you can.  Will we be back? Why, yes, I hope we will.

M2P8tf6RD1DRbiZF4R-jxQ.text: I was a bit skeptical but it was very authentic!! & definitely felt like home. We went this past Sunday which seemed to be right after their rush.   The hostesses were very welcoming & we got seated promptly. I noticed we got sat next to a bigger party which our sever was also taking nonetheless he was still very attentive and didn't forget about us. His busser (wish I could remember their names) took our drink order which showed great team work.   They have really nice chips & salsa/beans, accompanied by Chile's toreados & cebollitas which they bring out right after you're sat. I ordered the ceviche as an appetizer which was great. For the entree I had their Camarones a la Diabla & as soon as the server said they add Chile the arbol & other extra spicy spices I was all for it. FINALLY a la diabla style that was actually spicy & still enjoyable (for me). My mom & her boyfriend had the fajita dinner (it was their second time there and they loved it before just as this time)  Before we new it we were the last table left after they closed (which we apologize for as we know how annoying that is) yet, besides the fact, our server still talked to us and didn't seem to be rushing us out in any way. Definitely knew how to make us have an enjoyable experience.   It's just about 5 min away from my house so will definitely be back!

8WDg0hY029MfeO2PUt-R5g.text: Service, food and speed were all fantastic.  Staff is friendly.  Food is fresh and hot.  Atmosphere is great.

j_cHDXBgmaKVbdS0G1-JfQ.text: So yummy. I ordered the carne asada. It was so good. And the staff are all very friendly . Will definitely recommend this place

SHPnTVhpCxsXQIxxB26w_g.text: This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. I had been looking for years to find a great Mexican restaurant. Finally the quest was over when I ate her.  The chicken nopalitos is amazing. My favorite! Anything I have had there is outstanding. Hand made corn and flower tortillas.  The wait staff is friendly and courteous. Always a great experience!

DFB73Z6-LjuHX0n-3vNLag.text: Darn Yelp... My favorite Mexican restaurant has been discovered. Arrived  at 6:00 on a Sat  night and had an hour wait. Totally worth it though  I enjoyed carne asada tacos. My husband had a huge burrito and we both enjoyed an organic margarita. (Excellent)  Food-Excellent Service-Top Notch Price -Very Affordable

UtHqmF_7G5JOeIVuwzvneg.text: Service was fast great. The wait was long but well worth it. The food was exceptional free chips and bomb salsa. And the atmosphere was amazing. Super busy but the live mariachi band walking around was cool. Please visit at least once!!!!! Eat here and enjoy

-uXVLmsrRTNoZDZCXdecNg.text: My wife and I are new to Vegas, and after an underwhelming return from our google search for good Mexican food, we decided to try Juan's out.  The restaurant is nice enough: good appearance, well decorated and thought out, everything appeared clean inside and out.  Be prepared for a tight parking situation if you arrive during the lunch hour.  When we went, Juan's was not busy, but its already narrow parking lot is situated right next to a popular In N Out location which can make things a bit tricky around that time. Not a real problem, however.  I enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa.  The chips weren't served warm but they were fresh and tasted quite good.  The salsa was enjoyable too.  It was a pretty standard house salsa but I didn't mind it at all.  Most Mexican restaurants offer free chips and salsa when you dine in, but what I really appreciate about Juan's is there unique addition to this tradition.  They also bring out a bowl of refried beans (very tasty), and a plate of roasted Jalapenos and sauteed onions to the table.  Honestly, I love snacking before a meal, and im a spicy food fanatic, so these complimentary offerings really speak to me.  I can't say I enjoyed the rest of my experience as much. My wife ordered a steak fajita burrito and I got a two-item lunch combo with a chile relleno and an enchilada.  The presentation was decent, but there were no stand-out flavors.  Enchiladas are one of my favorite things in the world to eat and I've got to say that Juan's take on them are just sort of average. I liked the relleno a little better, but it wasn't great.  The meat in my wife's burrito was pretty good but she didn't like her meal, overall.  I'll admit, it's a little unfair to visit a place with "Fajitas" in the title and not order a fajita platter to try on our first trip, so maybe we'll try that if we ever return.  Juan's serves pretty decent Mexican food, the place is clean and the staff is friendly.  I didn't hate anything, but nothing really left me wanting more.

V8atJRjHTFbcYk2ZXlyIsQ.text: Came here with my girlfriend and we loved it. Price, portion, food, and service were all great so it deserves a five star in my eyes. Our server was really attentive and nice and so was the wait staff assisting him.   Some tips: Unless you're dangerously hungry, an entree should be enough for one person. We got an appetizer, entree and drink, and boy, were we filled. We ended up taking a lot of to-go.  The food itself is awesome though. What we had:  House Margaritas ($3.50 during happy hour from 3pm-7pm. Felt like a generous portion of tequila. I like.) Juan's Sampler (Tasted great, but wow did it fill us up.) Combo Beef & Shrimp Fajita for Two. (Great flavor and very tender. Comes with a good portion of sounds. They even light it on fire before they serve it, awesome.)  There are also the complimentary chips and dip. Honestly, one of the best dining experiences I've had. Great place. Our server even mentioned they were planning on increasing the store hours for later nights since they have a full bar and all.

-E6ZykukcIaJoPeOqCmkqg.text: We should of known when we walked in on a Saturday night and it was nearly empty.  But seeing so many positive Yelp reviews we had to try it... what a mistake.. ugh.  So the question is?.. "How do you ruin Mexican food?!"  I'll tell you how...  store bought chips store bought tortillas store bought re-fried beans store bought rice store bought pre-mixed margaritas pico de gallo so old it looks grey bland fajitas awful atmosphere luke warm service  Now I know why the place was nearly empty.  Don't eat here.

KxmJcrRngVGsXiPX1oNa6A.text: I love the atmosphere in here, it is family friendly which I have 3 kids and they have variety of kids food choices, the food starting from the appetizer is absolutely delicious, the fajitas are the best in my opinion, the customer service is very friendly and very attentive right away, I'd have to say I recommend this place to everyone!

fZNVWCmzYGZYuq3JJMa45g.text: Seriously the most amazing HOMEMADE TORTILLAS in the world. I have never been somewhere else with such good tortillas! Also, the fajitas are delicious! It's one of my favorite places to come for authentic mexican food and never disappoints! Bring the family here!

She suggested that we try the cheese dip with carne asada and it was extremely good and we also had the flaming fajitas. Chicken and beef and both were absolutely amazing. To top it off we had some amazing margaritas. We would return there anytime. thank you so much we enjoyed ourselves and our waitress was a huge part of that

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing flaming fajitas

HyJV0KVJb3gWnOiTh3jXLQ.text: Juan's Flaming Fajitas is a surprising great dining experience that is only 8 miles from my apartment. Don't know how I missed it and or never heard about it till last night.  First pyromaniacs will love this place! The name "Flaming Fajitas"  is well deserved and quite frankly and understatement. When they bring your Fajitas out the server ignites the dish and the flames shoot 3 to 4 feet into the air!   The food was top notch fresh and flavorful. The only negative experience of the entire night was in relationship to their cheese dish I ordered to go along with my chips. It had to be cut with a knife and fork and couldn't be spooned up by a nacho chip. It had great flavor but I won't order it again as it was to much effort for chips and dip.  The wait staff was great, drinks were never more than half empty, the complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip was similarly filled whenever they appeared low. We had one main waiter but he was getting help from everyone else on the staff and he was helping out the other waiters and their tables. It would appear they are a highly functional unit that wasn't worried about sharing their tables tips. Simply stated it was a True pleasure to dine here.  You could read that and guess it was a slow night but no, there was only one maybe two empty tables in the entire restaurant.   If you live near or far you must come experience this dining experience its something you will not regret!

-sNWRrkqKjuujIY2rMS0zw.text: Open for about three months, I didn't even know about Juan's until I saw Misti's review and then my gal pals suggested it for dinner because it was close to Sweet Addiction--hah!  See how I pick my friends?  Always thinking about the sugar!  Anyway, we had a solid meal here, going with the flaming fajitas, of course.  I got chicken and my pals shared a chicken and steak combo for two.  Both courses came out in a timely manner, with the flaming presentation for each, literally.  It's cool to see your food on fire.  I enjoyed my chicken fajitas and my pals rated the chicken better than the steak, too.  The chips and salsa were nothing special.  Service is attentive and friendly and the rest of the menu is quite extensive, but for my first visit I had to have the fajitas and not bad at all for $13.95.  I'll come back to try something different next time--nice to have an option for Mexican cuisine on this side of town, near Sweet Addiction AND Perfect Scoop ;).

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They really are flaming fajitas!

X_ch_38b_8mmoRrjmVlrCQ.text: Every bite was delish from the chips and  salsa to the finger licking good chicken fajitas. The chicken was very flavorful and veggies tender but still crisp. Cooked to perfection!  Dave the Manager stopped by our table twice to chat with us.   Can't wait to come back and try some other offerings here.

TDLAPwsq241VMdKRdZ123Q.text: First time here...bean dip and salsa was great!! Ordered baja taco , tamale, and shredded beef enchiladas...food was good...margarita was sooo yummy. Will come again

_V1Cp93NkV3vfuod3O6Xig.text: We visited juans on Sunday and as always were very happy with the food and great service by our waiter Omar and his busser.   We started with 2 happy hour beers and an iced tea.  Omar always starts us with a heaping plate of chili's toreados and queso fundido.  We love the fried chili's and onions rolled in tortillas.   Our meal started with a cup of fideo soup always yummy and full of flavor.  While the draw here is the flaming fajitas our favorite has always been the seafood parillada for 2.  It is shrimp, fish and scallops on a bed of grilled onions.  While it was for 2, the 3 of us did not finish it and there was still some fish on the plate.  Omar finished our meal with a complimentary fried ice cream.  Service and food have always been top notch here and all your requests are easily met.  We have been coming here at least once a month since they opened and if we did not have a 45 minute drive across town to get there it would definitely be more often.  Our bill was $45 + a $15 tip for $60 total.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood parillada

6xoqbvZoxMsdlObjdWJKhg.text: We made the trek down southwest to try this place after seeing all the positive reviews. It ended up being pretty decent but not worth repeating the trip from downtown.  The chips and salsa were fine, in fact, the salsa was actually pretty flavorful. The fajitas were very enjoyable, but the accompaniments left a lot to be desired. The refried beans creeped me out a little, and my wife reported her guacamole to be quite watery at the bottom. They just didn't seem very fresh.  I had a pretty strong-ass Patron margarita, too. Although - and this sounds totally lame - the balance was a bit off. The tequila overpowered the rest of the drink. I know - that's the dumbest thing ever to complain about.  Overall, Juan's is pretty decent but not good enough to justify the long trip.

_m2l7X3XFyvTBtRaTsbF5g.text: The most disappointing visit ever. It is always busy & today was no different. We waited, we're seated & pleasantly greeted by Claire who began our service with a smile. It went downhill quickly from there. We had to make multiple requests for replacement dip and our appetizer was completely forgotten (Claire did apologize & comp the table-side guacamole). It was made (AFTER our dinner was served) & was very bland. No offer was made for enhancements. Our chip bowl was crumbs & was never replaced. No one came to check on us. We quickly were out of napkins & were using the beverage napkins. While we were still eating we were offered to-go boxes & plates were removed- WHILE WE WERE STILL EATING!!  We have been here when it was busier but this visit we were made to feel like "Hurry. Finish. Don't let the door hit you in the a**."  I wasn't even able to utilize my Yelp offer. Wow. Still good food but wow is all I can say about the lapse of service overall

sT3Qz_Kv6LKIXWOAwsbJLQ.text: LOVE this place, and here's why...... - GREAT, friendly and fast service. There are always 3-4 people coming by your table and refilling water/soda/beer/chips/salsa/bean dip! They are on top of it! - Fresh tasting food. A lot of Mexican food around town (and elsewhere for that matter) taste like it's been sitting around for hours waiting to be served. This almost always seems fresh. - Fair prices! The prices for items and combos are great! Great happy hour too.  I recommend the rancho style tacos and (of course) the fajitas!  I hope people support this place and keep it in town. This is a hard location for businesses to prosper it seems. SUPPORT GOOD BUSINESSES!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!

h9NXd8gAvJdN4F5M6_uQmg.text: Excellent service and food. Consistently great, Amanda and Juan make the place so inviting. Juan the owner is HANDS ON, always checking on customers! Their Fideo soup is great, I've had others around town, not as authentic. chicken Fajitas are excellent!

Y48JM_DU3rzLCp_c7vSu7g.text: If you like Mexican food, this is the place to go when in las vegas. Food and the service was awesome!!!. I ordered nachos off the appetizer menu and it was enough to feed 2 people.

vISPR47U8PmsujnQ2ADmnQ.text: It's a must you get the fajitas! Other than the fact it's in the name, their fajita are bomb! Go the extra step and ask for the cheese on top, I promise you won't forget it! The verde sauce they bring to the table was delicious and the jalapenos and onions were damn good! There was some secret garlic salt on them or something, I ate the onions and I hate onions! I was disappointed with the albondigas soup though because the meatballs did not taste fresh and the seasoning was off. That is my favorite soup so I was a little bummed.  There's a reason this place is so highly rated, do yourself a favor and go get yourself some flaming fajitas!

Pbopp9H1gVBEatCXxvvexw.text: Came in with a group of four coworkers for their lunch menu- several plates available, along with combinations consisting of tacos, burritos, flautas, tamales, and such. Nothing too complicated, most dishes $10-12.  Interior of restaurant is nice and service is polite but painfully slow. Complimentary chips, salsa, and beans stave off hunger, but after half an hour (and being one of few tables, early on a weekday), no one had been served. We let the staff know we would need to get our orders to go, and it still took an additional 15 minutes until we were brought our food and checks. No one ordered anything more complicated than tacos, burritos, and a chicken breast. We were never given an explanation for the delay.   CHILE RELLENO: overly battered but tasty, not spicy, quite cheesy. GREEN CHILE PORK BURRITO: wrapped in a flour tortilla, dry, more like an enchilada than a burrito. Didn't care for this. Side of GRILLED VEGGIES was an odd assortment of broccoli, cauliflower, and squash- considering this is a Mexican restaurant I kind of expected onions and peppers, maybe mushrooms and squash, so it was an odd but tasty.  Restaurant entrance has several posters with their daily specials, and they also offer a HH and MNF specials. Seems like the fajitas are the best thing to get here, given the name and the fiery presentation.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 item lunch combo with veggies

cr2llmykgvFN056jN_69dQ.text: This place is amazing! The fajita's are always a good amount and they have customer service! We went for a birthday party and they were super festive. Don't a place your want to go again!

2dKt1eao6Hw7kxkOx6FLzA.text: Literally my husband and I's favorite place to relax and enjoy fajitas! The happy hour is amazing, the staff friendly and attentive, and the food is delicious. You will find yourself returning over and over again! We've brought friends local and visiting and it never disappoints.

O5qztTHuhu8nMS3UQr0Epw.text: If your from Los Angeles, and moved to Vegas, it's hard to find a decent Mexican restaurant in Vegas, well I finally found , Juan's Flaming Fajitas, it is, hands down the best authentic Family Mexican restaurant I've found to date. The staff, the food, and the atmosphere are all five stars. After my 3 year search, I know longer need to look any further. Thanks Juan.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet  burrito, excellent!

Xyd-y8p0FxtyJd-Vfo58rQ.text: Seriously amazing! Great food, great service, plentiful portions and a dessert on the house... what more could you want?! 6/5 stars!

fM5fDF61BhauGue3uGtVPA.text: This place was awesome! My fiance and I shared the steak fajitas for two and ordered our kids a taco and quesadilla meal off the kids menu. The portions were awesome and very filling. Their margaritas were yummy. I got mine on the rocks but think I will try a frozen strawberry one next time! The service was fast and excellent. Not to mention the price to feed a family of 4 only costed us $60. I will definitely be back soon!

M7lzUY0e9oEOMq0pXebuog.text: I tried Mexican in USA for the first time. I am not sure what the dish speciality was. The price is actually high as a visitor from oversea. I do not see anything special about this place? Maybe I missed something?

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XRA80V-HH0gtwtO2Janthw.text: Arrived on a Thursday around 4pm, seated right away. not too crowded but busier within the hour .server came right away. got two HH house margaritas, which were good. have had better and worse. good for the price, chips and salsa were brought out right away. 2 salsas & beans. also plate with cooked onions & peppers = good. I ordered the HH carnitas  quesadilla which I thought was Very good & would order again. wife had the Chapala Seafood Quesadilla which was GREAT. so glad she shared. service was very good, efficient but not overbearing. would return again when visiting LV  and would like to try other menu items. this is one of the better off strip places I have dined in LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CHAPALA SEAFOOD QUESADILLA. VERY GOOD.

Fr6hqL7LFe7E1C-Rff9qhQ.text: This is a great restaurant if you're looking for good Mexican good on the west side of town. I found this yesterday and have driven by and never stopped. Discovering the great service and food was a real winner for the week. Get here early as by 4:00 the lines start and the food was to write home for !!!  Go try...

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cfFyHovHHE8IZP0jLz0Z9Q.text: I've gone twice.   The first time everything was perfect.   This last time, not so much.  The food was a bit salty.   However, I was impressed at how the manager immediately jumped to resolve the issue.  He sent the item back and offered to bring a new one.   He also provided dessert on the house.   I think that every restaurant will every once in a while have a missed night.  What made it 4 stars is the manager taking steps to rectify the problem.  I salute the restaurant and the manager.   Will be back.  Great fajitas !!!

ZbZ1kjx-b9TBQplJHlN2zQ.text: Back again...... Best Mexican Food in Vegas !!!!! Love the ambiance, the service and of course the prices, wouldn't dare go anywhere else, if your unsure come anyways and I promise you won't be disappointed ...

CbxoYvx2zP-4cHySFIgGoQ.text: Best place ever!  Best service, best food, best price and best management!  Thank you Juan for having such a wonderful place.

XsEQlSBIycUJL_9ts-yc1A.text: I come here anytime I want Mexican food, Everything on the menu is good and so are all the drinks. Honestly I enjoy this place best in Las Vegas

qXl8EqBKrGPehF2D2e121w.text: Best fajitas in town with great service. I recommend Juan's Flaming Fajitas to all my friends and they've all been very happy with the food and service n

DIL-uy37p_1UT_kxkuy4ig.text: Went for the first time this week and had to get the fajitas for the experience. Wonderful display and great conversation piece. Couple of things threw me off though. 1 the size of the plates in comparison with the size of the table. I was so uncomfortable trying to find a place for everything (and squished next to my husband) and that's with two couples ordering only 2 meals to share! The second thing- I ordered veggies as my side with the fajitas expecting veggies I could add into the fajitas? Corn? Additional peppers? Something? But it was steamed cauliflower broccoli and carrots that reminded me of Marie Calendars. Just unfitting for the restaurant lol

YiFMKhC_D6a1QhJipyp8gg.text: I loved everything about this place. Our hostess when we came in was very friendly and excellent. Our server gave us fast and great service. I just want to compliment their amazing staff and workers here. They made us feel welcomed and enjoyed our lunch. Came here to eat lunch with my friend and her daughter. I ordered the shrimp fajita lunch, my friend ordered the steak fajita. My shrimp was big and juicy which was awesome. I  got rice and vegetables with my fajitas. Loved the vegetables that came with it. We both ordered cocktails. My strawberry margarita on the rocks was perfect and yummy. It came in cool cute glasses. They give you chips with three different dips while you wait to order and get your food. Our food came out and everything was delicious. The price here was affordable and not overpriced. I got a new favorite Mexican restaurant here in Vegas and I would recommend this place.
