Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious !
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas !

7pFFMY-2nObIsKDzDZB4ZA.text: The food and service (especially at the bar) are really great!! My only complaint is it's not very well ventilated. the bar area is better ventilated than the restaurant part however I have a serious shell fish allergy and since they have "flaming fajitas " if they walk buy with flaming shrimp it's very hard for me to breathe. if you have an allergy I'd definitely suggest sitting on the patio since the smoke consumes the room.

kdvA2qSbvLw_idVHO733bA.text: Omg GREAT FAMILY DINNER!!! Food is delicious EVERY TIME and prices are affordable so that we have made this our family "let's go out" spot for years!!!

A9IkhP1z6GPdBWduR6t3vg.text: The customer service is exemplary! They give you complimentary freshly made chips and salsa. They even gave us a complimentary queso for waiting. The fideo soup was delicious and is also complimentary. Everything was fresh, including their handmade tortillas. Best tamale I've ever tasted! We also had the flaming steak and shrimp fajitas. Margaritas were great. Best overall Mexican food I've ever had in my life. This awesome experience is also attributed to their friendly staff. I definitely will be coming back on my next visit to Las Vegas.

tEahVeWxjNqwLWysdh3mbQ.text: Great food! Staff is always fantastic. I would recommend making a reservation or try to get there early because this place gets slammed fast! Rarely say this but I have yet to try something on the menu I didn't like. Thanks for the amazing food! Highly recommend!

u9LEr5J9mxkXyYuaSV-CPg.text: Absolutely love the food but the service is suspect. Fajitas are so good I went twice in 3 days, but... 1st time the service was abysmally slow but that happens, 2nd time they over charged us on multiple items.   If you go, you'll love the food but double check your bill and prepare to wait.

3XEug1ZyLBF2iEeNzw1vBg.text: Great vibe. Just like a restaurant on a beach in Mexico. Food was delicious. Best Chile Relleno ever. Margaritas are very tasty. Expect a wait. My new favorite Mexican restaurant.

heXwkGHuF3KmlkQ19KgMZA.text: First timer Wife and I had the fajitas they were brought out on a cart  sizzling and then alcohol pour on it then lit up nice show. food was good portion and very good rice was not dry but the tortillas were kinda hard.Service was good  will return.

OsYcDBx3gQYXRtUny6XRnQ.text: This place is awesome! great service and authentic food!

4eXAkq-_KGaHXTD9iQT4dw.text: The hubby and I love, love, love this place!    The fajitas are amazing - I have always loved fajitas but hubby was never a fan until we came here!  Now whenever we come here we share the most delicious steak fajitas we have ever had.  What I really love is that you can get grilled veggies instead of rice and beans.  Their pico de gallo and guacamole that comes with the fajitas is fresh and delish too.  I love the grilled jalapenos and onions that come with the delicious salsas and a basket of chips when you come in.  What gives this four instead of five stars is the chips and tortillas - they are not made in-house.  The chips can be on the stale side.  I'm also not a fan of the soup that comes with the meals but no biggie - more room for fajitas!  However the warm, friendly and attentive service more than makes up for store bought chips.  Most of the time Juan himself comes and checks on you and service has always been terrific!  We love this place!

Q8mvz-diy_PXYADfYdfuig.text: The Fajitas at this place are no joke, I guess they should be since that is what they are named after.  Super delicious.  I've been here I think 3-4 times so far, and I've tried the Fajitas and enchiladas, both were as good as any place I have ever eaten.  One of the things that I really like about this place is the chips n salsa they serve as appetizers.  The chips come with usually 3 or more types of salsa which are all very good, as well as comes with bean dip which is also very very good.  The atmosphere here is really nice.  They will often (usually at dinner hours) have a man playing Mexican guitar music while walking around the dinning area which is nice.  I have also been extremely amazed at how quickly the food arrives.  Normally with any Mexican restaurants, my family is able to go through 3-4 baskets of chips before our main course arrives, but here we are getting our food right around the time we finished the first basket.  Now this may depend on how busy they are, but so far I have never experienced a long wait for the food.  I will say the one downfall I experienced (which really isn't a negative on their part), is that we had to wait a long time to get seated due to them being so busy on one occasion.  This was around the dinner rush time on a weekend, so the line was all the way outside, but still it was worth the wait and I can understand why so many wanted to eat there.

69adyHkzmr5edDViTaC5qA.text: Seriously some of the best Mexican food in town. It's a bit of a drive from the Strip if you're a tourist, but if you're craving Mexican food then I highly suggest this place.

LFSrW46xs16DCZNq01gZRw.text: I have to admit that I was skeptical of all the great reviews ... I must qualify that by saying I am very picky about Mexican food. ... Because I love it & eat it all the time!!  1st visit: I had the chorizo tacos ... Excellent! Rice and beans were good, too I was especially impressed with the fideo soup ... very tasty broth.  I don't usually like fideo [Lindo you better step up your game]  Service was excellent ... I came after work, and got no grief for asking for a booth even though I was solo.   I'll probably give 5 stars after trying a few more items!!  2nd visit: less than 1 week later, I'm here after a hard day's work. Happy Hour ... YAY!  Enjoyed the HH classic margarita on the rocks. Today, I tried the Juan's sampler which included taquitos, nachos & quesadilla with sour cream, and guac ... Again enough food for two meals.   Excellent service, upon arrival I was asked if I wanted my usual booth ... Of course I did, glad the host remembered me.    I wish they were close to home, but they're close to work so that's OK too

3s2U6iPXpFnYZtAe3FqNwQ.text: Super yummy fajitas! The chicken is my favorite of their fajitas. It's served with peppers, rice and beans, or vegetables. The fajitas also come with a bowl of soup which is very good!  You get a lot of food for what you pay for, so you will leave feeling very full! Good service, very helpful and the wait times to get seated are generally pretty quick.

P4JYRMlZjSuPbvDFY65umA.text: The only negative here was that our pitcher of Pacifico was heavy.  Crowded, but seated right away, service was great, food very good, large portions, tasty, and a good presentation.

3CoogzvN27qSoMKq_BAE5Q.text: We only stopped in for a quick happy hour but are looking forward to returning during our next visit.  Had a couple of apps and a margarita and really enjoyed it.  We also tried El Dorado Cantina on this visit & preferred Juan's.

doC7SOIm9NIHZHxC92b6zQ.text: Best Mexican food I've had in a VERY LONG TIME. I've tired several Mexican places in Henderson and they come no where close to the yumminess of food from this place. We all had a variety of their fajitas so can only comment on that for now. Their rice was delicious and their bean dip with chips was out of control! Definitely going back.

Wo7kI_fQ1TS3Y5SoePH-sw.text: The chicken fajitas are the best I've had so far, waitresses are nice and speedy service.

JJahZQrLHEqD2ORH8ZLipA.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!  The service is impeccable--every time! The grilled onions and jalapenos.....DROOL! The shrimp in the shrimp fajitas are PLUMP and large! The fajita burrito is to die for! LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

ykvb6Udo1-trDcoQr_Vo5Q.text: The service is absolutely the best I've had ever in a restaurant. Seriously. The free chips n salsa and grilled onions and peppers sometimes hit the table as I'm being seated. They are very attentive and friendly.   The food is worth the 20 min drive to get there for me and is the best Mexican food I've had in Vegas and I've ha a lot of Mexican food. My favorite lunch plate is Mulitas and my favorite Jalisco dinner plate is the Pollo Asado with Rajas con Crema. Try it! You won't be disappointed!

jasfkN0UK9RyTDqkDr457g.text: Its REALLY good. My best friend and I came in on a Monday night a little less then an hour before closing. It wasn't really busy, there were about 4-5 other tables occupied. Service was exceptional (6 stars!). The staff was so friendly, through out the entire meal. We lost track of time talking and didn't realize that all the patrons had left and that it was waaay past closing (45 minutes +) and no one rushed us out. Even after we left and were getting in our car, someone came out just to say thanks and to have a good evening. On top of the outstanding service, the food was excellent and well priced. The complimentary chips and salsa came with beans and grilled onions and peppers. We ordered the guacamole and fajita steak nachos. Margaritas were only $4.50. Everything we ordered was delish! I highly recomment this place for a casual spot for good food and sipping on margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajita nachos, guac, chips, salsa, beans...super good...my tummy is happy!

7aPDuvEHR5_PEkPHRzpnEg.text: First time here! The food was good, the service is great and super fast, always making sure our drinks, chips were full....the flan is delicious!!! I would definitely come back here!!!

DlTovSvic9leHcxNMnVaFg.text: I love fajitas. When I hear that sizzling sound coming toward my table, I am a happy camper. Unfortunately, in every Mexican restaurant in which I've eaten, the fajitas cost twice as much as the combo plates, so I've been eating combos because I get 3 selections, and they fill me up. What separates this place from the other Mexican restaurants are the fajitas. They are reasonably priced, AND the portions are bigger than most other places, so for me, it's the best of both worlds. I can't fault them for being on the other side of town, so I'll just eat my combos closer to home, and when I'm in the mood for fajitas, I'll drive the extra 15 or 20 minutes and go here. It's worth it! Really, really good!

znGQWXYin8JGnWfgTpc4hA.text: Yum!!!! Had the taco salad and it was delicious!!! I also loved the beans, grilled onions, and bell peppers that came out with our chips :) Great place to eat!

U_EHOyQ-nCxwInLMxgVjxw.text: Great food! Awesome service. They were on top of refills, chips, extra napkins. Every and anything you think of. Highly recommend this place! Awesome staff and yummy food. Can't be beat

Je5Eq-byeuPlaUXFm7xiIg.text: Loved this place! drove by today and  decided to stop for a lunch. Let me tell you my friends this place is great!!! We went to the bar and the bartender (I did not ask his name) was the coolest guy. We could see he took a great pride at what he did and really enjoyed his workplace. The owner (or manager, I was not sure) was constantly checking on us making sure everything was to our liking and there were no complains from our side. We used to go to Mi Lindo Michoacan a lot for its Queso Fundido, now this place can easily compete with them. Got a pitcher of margarita made with Corralejo Anejo only for $28 and that's some good stuff!!! Bartender recommended Steak and Shrimp Fajitas and that's what we got for an entree. When the food runner brought it to us he actually flamed the cast iron skillet. Great presentation! Now the flavor was....WOW!!! Shrimp were so fatty and juicy and steak had nice charr, just the way we like it.  They told us it's going to be a great fiesta for May, 5th with mariachis and drinks specials, so we will do our best to make it there ( we are in the middle of moving). Thank you gentlemen for taking such a great care of us! We will be back soon and I would highly recommend it to fellow yelpers! Cheers!

RZb7hOjYM59qhZ48xFMY6g.text: it was AWESOME! we went for dinner on 5/5/14. The was a wait, though not long.  Only 30 min. And it was 20 or 25 minutes and we were seated.  My wife had a chicken taco salad,  which she said it was "Awesome". The boy had a chirzo, eegs, and potatoes burrito.  And I had Beef Fajitas, which was amazing!  Definitely going to be back soon.

2j4onc4L7doF4VsFsMxCug.text: This is the best Mexican food I have ever had I had the combo chile Reano and chicken enchiladas WOW! But can't wait to try the flaming fajitas. Don't miss this place your in for a treat!!!!

myAxsLMNZLTcb7H6Qf_4XQ.text: This newer establishment was a pleasant surprise. We found the place based on other yelp reviews and the reviews were right!  The bartender went out of his way to be funny and engaging with the patrons (here's your shout out - forget about the menu print font)  Food was good as was the service. Get the table side guacamole. Live music and Jose Quervo ladies were an added treat.   Try this place!  You won't be disappointed.  I'll be back my next trip to vegas.

4DImCtWCGGem0IXDlUDExw.text: Juan and his crew are amazing.... I've enjoyed Lunch, Happy Hour, dinner by myself, with friends, and with a large group.. Always outstanding service, HUGE portions, and the onions and peppers served with the chips and salsa are insanely delicious..

9r6ljZXmybLVMT_iVSb1qA.text: Best Mexican hands down. Service was excellent,  as was or last visit.  Ask for Omar! He's the best and very personable.  So glad we discovered this place. My father in law said that the chicken chimichanga was the best he ever tasted.  And you can't beat the happy hour menu.  Forget about Lindo (over priced, and tasteless). Once you come here you won't go back to other Mexican restaurants. Enjoy!

JjFZh30KapvUPUWzQPwlCA.text: We tried this on a Yelp!! Recommendation, and we were not disappointed. We were greeted and seated immediately hostess was very friendly. We chose to sit in the cantina area, and as soon as we sat down Vinnie our waiter was table side with drink order chips and bean dip and salsa. Also grilled jalapeno and onion taster. They have 7 day a week half of drinks and appetizer happy hour. I ordered a beer Josie a Mango margarita. Both arrived promptly. Josie had a chicken taco and I ordered a Beef chimichanga. Chimichanga for me was really tasty. The guacamole was quite good. It was a smaller portion than most Mexican restaurants but that is good I did not leave overly full or waste leftover food. The staff was ON IT. Never had empty water. Bonus!! I recommend this place can't  wait to try other dishes. I also liked the fact that many regulars came in and were greeted by name and staff came through to say hi to the regulars. Have to say, best experience I have had eating in quite awhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips, bean dip, salsa and grilled onion/jalepeno taster.

qgRXqJjGrEWpUi8KUBgQdQ.text: After a busy day, I was starving and craving a little Mexican food. After checking Yelp, we decided to give Juan's  a try.   We went early around 6 pm and were seated rather quickly.  The service was very good and the server, busser, and manager were all attentive. They brought out bean dip and salsa immediately which was so good.   Once we ordered , we received fideo soup which I could have eaten 5 bowls of.    I ordered a shrimp chimichanga w veggies and my hubby ordered a carne asada burrito.  Both of us cleared our plates!    My first margarita was a little strong and just ok. But it was happy hour so it was good for the price.   I definitely wouldn't go that early again as the place was packed with kids. I'm not anti kid but don't think they should be allowed to run around and scream in a restaurant.   We will totally go back again soon and will recommend to friends.

i7Rbf8QOZKrTTIu1gVMF4A.text: This is the best food in Las Vegas. We came here with a big group from work, and came back two days later with the family. Everything is so good, I could eat here every day and not get tired of the food.

1ZZu4nEc6cfA0VooRCZHZg.text: Great Fajitas! We had the combo for two, shrimp and chicken. Food came out fast, and service was awesome! We will definitely be back again!

Jqz5NF4MJMo-rK3pgOzj4g.text: My husband and I found this place while searching for our next Mexican hot spot.  We are actually here right now having dinner.   It's part sports bar part Mexican restaurant but all yummy.  We have ordered the chicken pablano faitias and the beef taco they were all amazing.  The quality of food is def up there and the prices r very reasonable.  Anyone out there searching should stop at this great spot.

qlSjbXxvZoMYVQDCJ62TCw.text: Second time here, we sat in the bar, it wasn't very crowded.  It took an hour to get our food, 3 other tables around us got here food first after they sat down after us.  I had to go to the bar twice for drinks, my drink was made wrong the first time, and our waitress never came back.  We had to ask for water 4 times and they didn't bring it, finally the bartender brought us some.  When our waitress finally brought our food it was the wrong order.  Finally got our food and it wasn't great or outstanding.  We won't be back very disappointing, and we live close by and had hoped we finally found a good Mexican restaurant close to us.

kuMIByyiRMBrOxWjgPPavw.text: We frequent Juan's a lot since they opened, sometimes more than once a week. We take everyone from out of town there and it's fantastic. But I realized when you are put in the bar area and aren't drinking you are forgotten. Tonight was our second awful experience and we will never let them seat us there again. It wasn't very busy at all but yet after 10 minutes we had to ask for someone to come over to us. Everything took forever and one guy even sat at a table to talk to a girl instead of working . The guy who took our order kept asking things over and over about our order so I told him he should write it down but he didn't and our order was all wrong. We couldn't get a refill on chips or salsa. I couldn't even get my water refilled. I know this isn't typical but tonight was a huge disappointment and things like this really turn you off from an establishment.

laxeZdeq3gbveFAgFdEIRQ.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants on the west side. Better than Lindo and definitely on par with Frank& Fina's. Can't wait to go back.

v0kdLcWqJFJgs0EHMk4vVQ.text: Juan's is our favorite go to Mexican place in town.  The service is always outstanding.  My husband enjoys being greeted by the manager who will help him with his Spanish.  The bartender always recognizes us.  The cups are never empty.  The chips, beans, and salsa are always refilled.  Food always comes out Flamin' fresh.  My husband and I always get an iced tea, a coke, and chicken fajitas for 2...  We love getting the two plates of grilled veggies rather than the rice and beans. With tip it comes to $36.  How can you beat that?  That is enough to take home to add to lunch salads for two days as well!  For great food, friendly service, and fun atmosphere, check this place out!

IbSlLoRRjoFPgze5ZbrSGw.text: Wow!! So happy we found this place! The first time we visited, the waiter recommended the chorizo fundido for an appetizer. Good call! It was delicious! My husband and I ordered the fajitas for two...again, excellent call! So much food! We had plenty for lunch the next day. My new favorite Mexican restaurant. Oh and service is great too!

B1iTtqVn2Jxj9i8dB8z-wA.text: This was my first visit at Juan's restaurant. I took a group of 16 people and everything was great. Especially the SERVICE! Excellent. We all had separate check and tried all kinds of things from the menu. The food was so good. All were very pleased. We will be back. This is a keeper for Vegas.

UAgQhv7ti6JD0KXng15gFg.text: Food was good, how ever the service was the worst we ever had, the waiter forgot about us for more than 20 minutes, he then sent over another person to take our order, never brought the drink we ordered, had to have the manager get it. when my fajitas came i asked for a plate and next thing i know, our waiter is standing around talking and forgot the plate. another person in our party's order was wrong. the 2 tables that came in after us were more important and got their food before we even ordered. when we told the manager, he was less than concerned and explained that there was a large party on the patio, like that is okay for them to ignore everyone else. would not recommend this place at all. after we said something to the manager both him and the waiter avoided our table, very unprofessional and uncaring towards their patrons.

L2LFP-OaH89dLYqlpI-7jQ.text: Great service and good food!!! Went for early Mother's Day dinner and had a large group.  We all enjoyed the food and service.

Cj7ch1Ar08C5seCK20qVJw.text: We always have an enjoyable meal at Juan's.  Personally I love the Carnitas so much that I often don't stray away, but I did order the Juan's sampler last time.  It was terrific. The staff is so friendly from the minute you walk in the door to the time you leave.  You get a lot of value for your dollar.  I give it a thumbs up, all the way.

HgVewPx7QzEhL2CiYSW2Og.text: Great food and service, make the drive! what are those Jalapeno grilled onion appetizers you serve with the chips called?

SQvVnLisA4WdVreJbD9I6w.text: This place is Deeeelicious!!! You need to try the Fried Ice Cream it's Amazeballs!!! I will be coming here more often

LQ4seKEnmMK5PYKtFcaT3A.text: I don't normally say things are the best but these are the best fajitas I've ever had. Chips are perfect ,salsa is perfect, bean dip is perfect, and the best fried ice cream I've ever had. Plus the service is great.

jQtGd9dPqm8_WnTAFPZIMg.text: Me and my husband decided to try this New Mexican Restaurant (despite already having a "usual" Mexican place we frequent). We showed up 10 minutes before they closed and honestly expected a little rushing on their part perhaps a little attitude .... I know how it is when customers come in minutes before closing when you're expecting to start clean up and get out of there. However, we were treated very patiently and kindly by the hostess, waiter and busier. We were really hungry and they brought out chips, salsa, retried beans, and grilled onions and peppers! It was great. I was even more pleased to see that they had a section on the menu for vegetarians!! I was thrilled! We got our food rather fast, it looked great and tasted great. Serving size was perfect and we were able to take home leftovers. Bathrooms were clean, restaurant had an overall pleasing atmosphere. Hubby and I decided to make this our new home Mexican restaurant!

8Qn4fTpwTobtRRYERmzehA.text: The fajitas were flaming...the marg's flowing...above average Mexican...excellent service last night!

u8oux6hvEvXrmMh8386OkQ.text: If you're looking for great, flavorful food, this is the place!  Aside from the great chips, salsa, bean dip... They serve grilled peppers and onions with it, awesome!  And a really good cup of fideo soup.  The fajitas are the best I've ever eaten and the way they are served is so unique.  I would love one of those pots they use.  I can't wait to take my family, they are having a 3day Cinco d Mayo celebration that promises to be lots of fun!  The staff is great, service the best, this is one place that really wants to provide a great experience.

YhrVLWxeYHwqvU_nJ-5ZUA.text: Awesome food. Excellent service. The staff Is extremely efficient. Since we have found this place we go at least once a week!

PdFgx-xSXs97IaOauYuKIg.text: Great food at very good prices here. For $26.95, we get the flamin' fajitas for two, I get shrimp, he gets steak. The food comes out quickly and the portions are huge. The best part is after you get served your chips and salsa, you get a cup of yummy fideo soup which is a great complimentary starter to your meal. There are big screen TVs there so you can watch the game while you eat, there is a separate bar area and a dance floor. The wait staff try very hard to be attentive. It can be hit or miss depending on who you get and how busy it is, but if you are not quite happy or if there is a something amiss they do not hesitate to try to fix it. Luckily, there were no big issues, just a misunderstanding with our fajitas for two. I wanted the shrimp cooked separately and not mixed in with the steak fajitas. They offered to remake the meal, but we declined and ate it anyway and it was delicious. Try this place, it a new business that is working very hard to make a great impression on every single customer.

nY82RBgTXt8k7I_ora_2nQ.text: After reading all the reviews my friend and I could not wait to try this restaurant today.   The service was so poor we had to go find out own eating utensils and napkins, which were cut in strips from a larger napkin.  The happy hour margaritas were so sweet that we had to send them back.    They brought us new ones which were better but still not very good.   The chips were ok,  but the salsa, beans and the sauteed jalapenos and onions were really good and a great idea.   It took a long time for someone to take our order and the place was empty except for one other table.    We ordered the flaming beef fajitas but again I expected a "wow" moment upon my first bite.    The flames were the only wow about it!    I would not recommend it.

q14lzHodbFAqYTK3WN7kVw.text: Overrated. Took over 30 minutes to get fajitas. No desire to return

maFZgBhUBH-6aV9uQGUsjg.text: I dined here on 12/16/14, the food was very mediocre, nothing to rave about. The service on a scale of 1 to 10 was about a 7. My margarita tasted like window cleaner, it was the weirdest thing, really bad. Also, on the way to the bathroom, there is a swinging door leading to the servers stations, I saw a server put sour cream in a container and licking his fingers, I was absolutely grossed out by this, if I had seen this prior to eating my meal, I would have left. I have a restaurant background, this is so dangerous and disgusting I am speechless!!!!

CYnGvGh47r4u5ODSgxgxSQ.text: Our new favorite Mexican restaurant! I made my mouth so very happy by feeding it New Mexico enchiladas! What flavor! Chicken wrapped in a blue tortilla surrounded by New Mexico chile sauce. mmmmm-mmmm-mmm! I love it when I meet such wonderful medleys of flavor provided by an array of well-balance spices. Didn't need to drown it in salsa. Didn't need salsa!  The table next to us order their specialty, flaming fajitas. That's what I plan to order next time!

kVLZ5Dhog4dXAxcI5PaWuA.text: Hands down the BEST Mexican restaurant I've been too. Everything came out fresh. Our server was amazing (can't remember name). The fajitas for two, which was shared by my mother and I, was a lot and we had some to bring home as well. All of the staff was very friendly and smiled at us. I will be bringing friends and family here from now on.

-hs3P9WWS9BYsRSmDSqIbA.text: Food was good, service was ehh.... Then again I only eat at Viva Mercado's.. So yeah I guess all things would seem mediocre in comparison

FqI5F4qQxLsIKkgt4jlbwA.text: First time there.  Ordered from lunch menu.  Very extensive and priced reasonably.  Service was very good!

BuvX-ZxviklFb5pQHSM-ZQ.text: This place is a little hidden gem.  We tried it on a whim and now go regularly because the food is Great.  The staff is super friendly and welcoming and the atmosphere is great.  After chatting with Juan (who is almost always there) and expressing interest in a particular beer, we found out he was willing to order it for us!  Now we go and eat and enjoy our special beers while we are there.  Also, they will make menu substitutions and suggestions if need be.  Try it... you will love it!!

EOcgsYasQ-G6sOQI2H2nww.text: Good food, extremely friendly service both in the bar and in the restaurant. I had the grilled fish tacos - you have the choice to substitute your rice for veggies. They were grilled, fresh, and a generous serving  - much better than I would expect for veggies at a Mexican restaurant! Reasonably priced.

EQ2CRr2brxMhyVn3LTww9g.text: Love this place!!! drinks, chips, salsa, bean dip and the fajitas were delish!! Good service too!

wUUDSOmaEYgZs2tcmCYM8Q.text: I have frequented at the place often. They have the best Mexican food in vegas in my opinion. The happy hour is every day of the week. The HH food portions are perfect and their drink prices are wonderful. The staff is always super friendly and accommodating. They are known for their fajitas and they always deliver. I recommend this place to everyone.

V_OeyvNyfekdAbYMeGLn-A.text: Ordered takeout last night and wasn't disappointed. You can tell a lot about a place when you order to go. The way everything was packaged and separated shows real care and attention to detail. The same goes for the quality of the food. We had cerviche, tacos, fish tacos, guacamole, and the chicharrones which is so good you can't stop eating it.  Great atmosphere inside the restaurant too. It's a winner.

pry7Zj8MP257vxYdKuZqAA.text: Food - 4/5 Service - 5/5  Food There are a variety of mexican selections from nachos, tacos, and burritos etc. I decided to try the Carne Asada Burrito which came in a huge portion with rice, beans (substitute with veggies) and guacamole. The burrito was very filling for the price, if you don't eat too much, two people could have shared the burrito. We ended up with a lot of to go.  Prices The Burritos were all about $12.95. In my opinion, it was a little bit pricey for a casual lunch.  Service The service was great. They also have complementary chips and salsa for us which was great for us when we were talking and waiting for the food to arrive.  Overall The food was good and met my expectation. The price was a little bit pricey so unless you want to spend $10+ for a burrito, might want to consider ordering something else or sharing with a friend. Otherwise highly recommend for some tasty mexican food when you want to avoid the fast food places like Cafe Rio and Chipotle.

df2YmAKtbeDNwqrFslFlog.text: This is by far our favorite Mexican restaurant. We have been going there for a few years now and have never had a bad experience. The food is consistently good, the service is great. Staff is friendly and service is fast and friendly even when they are very busy. (and they can get VERY busy at times) We love their flaming fajitas (shrimp and/or steak) and the fact that you can choose between rice and beans on the side, or fresh healthy veggies, which are NEVER mushy or overcooked. Some of our favorites are the Beef Taquitos, the Table Side Guacamole, the Shrimp Ceviche and those wonderful roasted Jalapenos and onions they serve for free when you first sit down.  Portions are big, we always end up eating too much, but food is just so good you can't help but stuff your face. Margaritas are fantastic too.  The place is family friendly, good prices for what you get, great for dining with your kids.

cFn9kmRpGv2pFwILSDu0bQ.text: Our first time here. We were impressed. Great service. Lupe was our server and she was wonderful. Really good food. We've found our New Mexican restaurant.

VAwcyqVZrXTg3ZyV4dzZKA.text: After reading the reviews, we decided to check this place out. It's only 15 minutes or so away from the strip. The environment is pretty much fun and festive, with a live guitar player. Man, the service and staff are so friendly and attentive. The portions are generous and the food is pretty tasty. I really love the chips, salsa, grilled onions, beans and soup they brought out before our meal. We tried the entomatillo enchilada and it was really good!  Of course we got the flaming fajitas (for one)  and we were kinda let down. Presentation is on point and exciting, but the taste was just ok.  I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free chips, salsa, beans, grilled onions and soup!

5Ipo4u5iVRDZyj-WLv-KcA.text: Great chicken fajitas. They actually add accelerant and flame them up at your table. Our waiter wasn't very attentive, but the person who filled our drinks was very attentive. He deserved the tip that I left. Would recommend them for lunch or dinner. You won't be disappointed.

vE56LMabVU6AJKap5upJJA.text: Best mexican food in town. LOVE the guadalajara special!!! The service is fantastic!! We are here at least once a week.

GjYLvkQ0wE0OEfAlKZ4VfQ.text: Another amazing meal with the best service.  Had the two item combo chicken taco soft on a corn tortilla a cheese enchilada with green sauce an rice an beans. Another hit. Loved the chicken taco omg all white meat an seasoned perfect. Its a def must have. The cheese enchilada with green sauce was also very good. Thanks for another awesome meal....

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken soft taco on a corn tortilla cheese enchilada with green sauce an rice and beans.  Yummm

wTempEr8UHMUj8mJsKlOow.text: I gave them 3 stars because my food was a little plain tasting even after i added salt. Also i ordered the shrimp fajitas and they literally gave me 6 shrimps and probably a whole entire onion to fill in where the shrimp was very much missing. i would have been happy with more shrimp and they'd  have more stars. The restraunt has a nice atmosphere the staff is quick and very friendly the and the horchata was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5JUPTzwFMsD4H7S-m41lZQ.text: It is worth the wait!!!! Everything and anything you can order here is beyond amazing. I've been coming to JFF (Juans Flaming Fajitas) for over 3 years now (sorry this is my first review). Before I had even visited JFF I had this image of a robertos type place and oh, was I wrong! It is very spacious, family-style restaurant and it can seat parties of 20-30 (I've been to 3). An authentic feature is that they make their own tortillas in the restaurant while you're dining.  I have brought every family member, friend, coworker, and even my dog to JFF. Yes...you can dine with your pooch on the patio (just let them know before hand and they'll let you and your pup in the side entrance). I have never heard a complaint about the quality of the food, the presentation, or the pricing from any of the several affiliates I have introduced to the JFF family. I often get invites from people I brought to JFF asking me to join them there because they are now JFF (Juan's Frequent Flyers).  About a month ago I was entertaining family on the strip and while chatting it up with a bartender at a well know Mexican restaurant, she actually mentioned JFF as the best place for locals! That just speaks for itself. I'm excited that they'll be opening another location soon.

QuuuRTdRGpmUOhtUSeeunw.text: Our waiter Omar was the best as usual, he is always kid friendly and very personable. Great service from the staff from hostesses and bus people.

2-JWSXH7D0g3gUrHir7xSg.text: Everybody's so nice and friendly, and by far they have the best fried ice cream I've ever had!!

JECzerq87aHFTAFjsAW8QA.text: After seeing so many of my friends check in to this place and proceeded to give it no less than 4 stars, I knew it had to be good. Just the pictures alone made my gut instinct (also known as my stomach growling and my mouth drooling) tell me it was gonna be good!  So I take my wife here to dinner on a late Friday afternoon around 5. We are greeted warmly and are seated immediately. Nice place. Very spacious. They even have a little stage for bands to perform I assume. Before we even see our server, there was already another guy putting down a basket of chips, salsa, and bean dip on our table. Talk about calming down a hungry customer! What an awesome feeling it is to chow down on some delicious chips and salsa while trying to decide what wonderful menu item(s) to order. Besides the chips and salsa, they also give you a cup of fideo soup before your entree comes out.   So we go with Juan's Flaming Combo for 2. It's your choice of two meats (Chicken, Steak, or Pork. Shrimp is a dollar extra), grilled with onions, green and red peppers on a sizzling fajita skillet. We chose Steak and Shrimp. When they bring it out, not only is it sizzling, but they throw some alcohol on top of it (some kind of tequila I think) and ignite it with a lighter. Which at this point makes you understand why they call this place "Juan's Flaming Fajitas and Cantina". This dish comes with your choice of rice, beans, and pico de gallo or sour cream, guacamole, and sauteed veggies. I went with the first choice while my wife went for the second so we can try all options. Turns out all items are very good. Of course to round it out you get either flour or corn tortillas because what is a fajita without the tortilla? It's like having a gun with no bullets or brushing your teeth with no toothpaste. It just wont work without it.   As for the service, we didn't have to ask for anything. One thing that really stood out was that even though our server was doing an excellent job already, another server from another area saw me finish my water and as I was putting the empty glass at the edge of the table, she proceeded to fill it with fresh water. Wow! I like the fact that other servers are not just looking after their own area, but are more than willing to help out their fellow servers when it comes to simple things like refilling water glasses. Bravo to whoever does the customer service training at this place. Keep up the good work for im sure every customer will notice these things.  So any time I see or hear of anything fajita, I will automatically think of Juan's Flaming Fajitas! Im looking forward to bringing my friends and family here! Ole!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Text JFFC to 40518 to get exclusive offers, promos, and coupons!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juan&#39;s signature Flaming Fajitas Combo for two!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Chips, Bean Dip, and Salsa! Not pictured is Fideo Soup.

RLJ5l6Qg9JO8c1jJsoh-kA.text: Great service, friendly staff.  Food was good. Love the fajitas here.  Great taste.  Good atmosphere even for a very busy time.

ZTEDpjS3Ti5tAhdT9sMLCQ.text: My family and I have heard great things about this restaurant! After eating here I will be recommending and eating here more often. Great food and great service! It was my parents and I first time trying this place, and it did not disappoint. The place was packed, so we had a 10 minute wait. When we sat down we were given salsa and chips and soup. We ordered the steak fajitas for two that came with beans and rice. It was $28 so I think it's a great offer! When the food came out the presentation of the fajitas was amazing! The portions are pretty large so it's quite filling and really flavorful and tasty! If you love Mexican food than this is the place to go! I love the variety of the menu so when I come back I will try more things off the menu, this place gets my seal of approval.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Fajitas and chicken quesadillas! Definitely recommend trying either one! Really filling, so start off small!

QVIJypr4l6JSZh4xdSfAPw.text: Amazing food.  4 days in Vegas and we had 2 dinners here. Deserts were great.  Drinks are awesome. Service was super.  I couldn't say more

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After I finished the amazing.soup I thought about a pic.  More pics of emtpy plates to come.  Food is to good to wait...

Ba5vUU6gU9OzVg07liJtvA.text: Finally found the best Mexican Food and restaurant since living in Nevada. This place did not disappointed us! There is usually a wait to get in which alone should tell you it's pretty great. Highly recommend the queso dip! Fajitas are yummy, you definitely get your money's worth here as the drink prices are very reasonable as well. The only thing that sucked was the waiting area is way too small and you have to be inside to hear them call your name but it's pretty cramped with people and is uncomfortable. The Host, Waiter and Bussers were so awesome. Overall will be back again and again and again!!

aFeqD67IPvdf523D6OXiDw.text: Another great meal at Juan's!  Great food, great happy hour, great service.   Amanda's the best!

zDPefo8DlIv7edAlfl7W8w.text: This place gave me terrible stomach pains. By stomach pains, I mean I ate wayyyy too much! Come prepared in your finest stretchy pants. Service was quick and the food was great. We ordered the beef and shrimp fajita for two. The serving was plentiful and came with all the fixins, including a cup of fideo. They also give you chips with beans and salsa. The only thing I didn't care for was the horchata, too watery. Other than that, I left pregnant with a food baby. Success!

_Moex_Jsy1VJi5rkDCl1OA.text: This place leaves Lindo Michoacan in the dust! The food is delicious and the service is exceptional. I frequent here often and I have yet to be disappointed. Hernan is the reason we keep coming back. He is always very attentive and makes sure we are full taken care of! This place is definitely worth our drive from Henderson.

l_dEe8IQcor5RJXNpi_3PQ.text: It's good! The service is great, and the fajitas really are flaming. Everything you'd expect from a decent Mexican restaurant. Chips beans and salsa included. If fajitas aren't your thing they have plenty of other classic Mexican dishes. The margaritas are delicious. It's always packed and you will have to wait. Parking is terrible.

czMpG5U8_k4cembG2jz5TQ.text: It was flavorless.  I had the chili relleno and black beans.  Both had no pop of yum.  I'm pretty sure they opened a can of black beans and popped them in the microwave.  The chili relleno wasn't oozing melted cheese.  It was luke warm which lends to the idea it was a frozen product.  There was very little cheese in the chili and it wasn't solidified not melted.   Chips and salsa were good.  Service was great.

abVNWb8yiVJ-juMNAxkfeQ.text: The place has great family ambiance which makes up for the flavor or lack there of. We ordered the steak fajita (for 2) with cactus and vegetables instead of rice and Beans. The server brought our rice and beans and the fajitas without the cactus. We politely explained that it want what we ordered and wanted the cactus in the fajita and the vegetables not the rice and beans. The fajitas smelled and looked great. She took the fajita back and the rice and beans. We waited another 20 minutes for the right order to come out. It seemed as though they literally re-cooked that same steak with the cactus ... the steak was burnt and dry and the vegetables were over heated and dry. They should have cooked a fresh meal but instead basically served that same order but te heated it and added the ingredients ... this altered the quality of the food greatly - the bill was over $50 which was ridiculous considering the burnt food I couldn't even consume.

Nc_CCXXMFI_K0H_u0JwItg.text: I went to flaming juans yesterday evening with a friend of mine. It was about a 20 minute wait with most people standing outside. The patio was closed also. When we finally got seated, it looked like there had been people already at the table as there was plates, waters, and chips/salsa already setup. Drinks were served promptly and the meal was out quick. My friend and I did the 2 Fajita share with chicken and steak. We also ordered a few drinks. The white queso dip was phenomenal. After a little bit of time, the manager came over and asked for us to move and be reseated to a different location within the bar. I have never, at a restaurant, been asked to be moved to another table after a certain time. Now, we were comped a $5.00 off next visit on the next meal, but after being asked to move, my friend and I promptly left the restaurant.  If you are looking for some great mexican food, this is the place, but be wary of the service coming here. The parking is a little rough at this restaurant too. There is limited spaces.

They were huge, and tasted awesome! Super glad for the extra tortillas. Chips, salsa, and condiments were great.

zVli74zARYzdTmXs5D8ZWA.text: So I finally decided to try this place.   I was honestly not expecting it to be any good but to my surprise it was very good. The place had an authentic flavor in their food and great service and great size of portions. Being actual food itself was so good and flavorful and the prices on it was not bad at all I recommend this place highly.

AkfR55xqgJ81vwJ247QDog.text: Just got here for the first time...but I can already say - the green salsa is bomb af! Cadillac margaritas are on point too - Yum!  Edit: Thoroughly enjoyed the food and dining experience! Great atmosphere, fun staff made our visit very enjoyable. Without a doubt, I will be back!

r0FnNPNy1_Smz75SeDtEaQ.text: Went here for lunch, got a carne asada steak, medium. Waitress forgot to ask us if we wanted rice and beans or steamed veggies. When I noticed and asked the waitress said it was too late to change it and that our food was already on the plate. Note that we still haven't gotten our food yet, not sure what's that difficult about changing the food from a plate of beans and rice over to a plate of veggies. She could just give us the steamed veggies on the side and I would have been fine. Not trying to come off as entitled to get asked what I want, but I feel like she was not trying to help the situation. Also my steak was definitely well done, should have saw that coming given how thin the steak was. Been here more than a handful of times, and every time was dealt with good service but it just takes one bad time to write a negative review unfortunately.

omyPqn27RnbB__NR91Oi3g.text: It was delicious as usual..  our waiter was so friendly and helpful, actually the entire staff was amazing.. I wish they would have added another level to the restaurant in order to get seated quicker, but the wait is always worth it.  C. Lusk

I've been here countless times and they are consistent across the board - including takeout. A++

r7qrpouxAOWI-NF5-fa3ig.text: This is the best Mexican food in town! As a rule of thumb, if the restaurant has a food name in it, such as "fajitas," they better be good at cooking them! You won't be disappointed eating here. Just make sure to get there early or be prepared to wait. If you do have to wait, at least know it's well worth it!

UP-CO-0nZcChLUHEfTbo-w.text: Absolutely killed it. Great service, my glass was never empty, staff was very friendly. Portions of the meal was very filling . And the food was reasonably priced. This is a must go to for the family and friends.

6T49DhTxmLS3YuIJiO7GSw.text: This is our go to local Mexican restaurant. Service is fantastic. Food is consistently great. Great happy hour and generous portions.

vr3ia3cV00IcWFi-5XPoSw.text: This place came highly recommended by a friend. I can't say how fantastic the food was and the customer service was exceptional. It's nice to see servers hustle when there is a crowd and they are eager to please, refill drinks, and get food out quickly. We will return for sure!

NA7LxFi4Nl8HbL4DUJe1RQ.text: I'm usually a pretty tough judge, but rating this place is easy. The service is excellent, and the flavor of the food is awesome.  I've been here for lunch and dinner and have always been impressed.

F11iHdd8VAUZL2D9qV00oQ.text: 1 of my favorite Mexican restaurant went on fathers day she took our names she said about 30 minutes i said thats fine 4 families came after us and they were sat before us i got up and told hostess she said sorry we just walked out and wont be back again will give my business to someone else!

Yc2ibdAdIdnpsKtDXAZbdQ.text: Love this place! Come here all the time for lunch. Service is always amazing & food is AMAZING! Love that they give you peppers and onions with your chips and salsa. Queso dip is fabulous. Would recommend anything on menu. They never disappoint.

Q5Z1QjRTphWB0943Y4JC-A.text: Amazingggg food and the service was even better!! Thank you Flaco and Alex for your exceptional guest service and delicious drinks

VunPixa1oRMGnXDr1BUJHw.text: By far my favorite restaurant ever!! I have known Juan for a very long time and he always takes care of my family and I! All the staff is very friendly and professional. Anything you eat is amazing and taste very good! I always recommend Juan's to everyone!!

LDeFu8Fc5I8pdFzicpMQVQ.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Vegas. Best margaritas in Vegas. Best customer service in Vegas. If you like good food, sports, etc., this is your place to be.

565ANnH9Jbb6KHmsc3XaAg.text: I've tried this new place several times now so I figured it was time to write a review! I'm a big fan of fajitas and Juan's does it right! The veggies are really good and the seasoning is tasty. Best of all, the kitchen uses high quality meat and it shows. If you don't want beans and salsa, they'll sub a very hearty portion of garlic butter vegetables that are really yummy!   The tableside flaming fajita show is a lot of fun for kids and adults. It's a neat gimmick. I do think the portion size on the fajitas for 2 is a bit small; you are better off paying a little extra and order your own fajitas.   The chips are pretty good and the salsas are tasty. I really like the bean dip, it's my favorite. The service has always been absolutely amazing. Out of the few times I've dined here, only once did it take a super long time for our food to come out of the kitchen. I don't know what was going on, but it took over 30 minutes. Usually they are pretty fast, making this a great spot to grab a quick and healthy meal before going to a movie, out shopping, etc.   I only have two criticisms for the place: 1, make the portion size on the "fajitas for 2" a bit larger and 2, I wish the kitchen would serve homemade tortillas. The tortillas are so bad I usually ask for none to be brought to the table.   Overall, the restaurant is cute and comfortable, the prices are fair and the food is good. What's not to like?

RLqHTLrHy3qlfL4BQtB2eg.text: The people there are awesome. Very helpful and friendly. The chips, 2 kinds of salsa, bean dip and peppers and onion made a great appetizer and the chicken fajitas were fun to be served and very tasty. Parking is horrible and the restaurant is small and they have the tables pretty close together. Food and people made it all good.

mVztSaN2RnTIxhzJNUX18A.text: This is by far the best Mexican restaurant ever! The chips and salsa, with warm beans and a jalapeno salsa, are like heaven in your mouth! They bring out complimentary soup...not being a big fan of soup, I was hesitant to try it but I did and I loved it! I ordered the chicken enchiladas with rice and beans! They were phenomenal! The service was absolutely amazing, quick and very attentive! This is "our spot" now! Salute!!!

ZcMad05Ix7M8LMbGvbBJcA.text: Holy cow I finally found a great Mexican place in Las Vegas! I have been on the hunt since we moved from California & I'm happy to say the search is over. Excellent food & excellent service. Such great service we tipped our waiter, Omar, quite well. I don't mess around when it comes to something I love!  Since finding this gem we go about once a week for dinner. Fajitas are huge and delicious, the fish tacos are great & the Margaritas are amazing. Plus all the staff are friendly. Try this place out, you won't be disappointed.

BeqhXS1VizFVrP8yDp0qTg.text: This is a great restaurant definitely a family favorite. Fajita's are good as are other items. Don't hesitate in going here. It would be 5 stars but our service wasn't great. The place is extremely busy but the weren't serving as quickly as possible to move ripple in and out. We had to ask for extra salsa and tortilla's. The servers weren't loafing but just didn't seem to anticipate the diners needs. But, again, this is a minimal complaint. I look forward to out next visit. Hint: Go early. The place gets busy after 5:30-6:00.

mSUMxgt73_opOYlAZUKbiA.text: This place is a great spot with great food. I came here with a buddy and we were on limited time, the prompt service and quick turn-around on our order was just what we needed. Of course, right off the bat when we were served Hot Chips, Salsa and BEAN DIP, I knew we were in the right place. Any Mexican Restaurant that goes a little beyond to satisfy their customers is a winner in my book.   Food was awesome. We both ordered Fajitas, Steak and Chicken and man oh man.. it was tasty. The homemade tortillas... Whoa! If I lived in Vegas, this would be my go-to Mexican spot. I'll be back for sure!

dzRBEVy3nLdhvv-jzgA4iQ.text: Excellent Fresh Mexican Food!  Generous Portions, Great Service.  It's a busy place, so get there early or after regular service....like 1PM for lunch!    Go Juans!

Zu9sOb0IH0iqE1N9FPEoCA.text: Excellent Mexican food!  The fajitas are great, as well as the burritos.  The margaritas are generous and fabulous.  I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L6mG4clAswvHH6oYss_VqA.text: If you needa fajita, your search should end here. From service to environment to flaming, delicious fajitas, Juan's has all of the bases covered for a gorge-worthy Mexican meal.  The restaurant is huge and provides the perfect setting for a variety of purposes. There is a spacious dining room, perfect for families and date-nights. There is even a stage, and when we visited, they had a live mariachi. There is a bar area with one gigantic and several smaller screens, perfect for all your sports viewing. And, then they have a spacious patio, perfect for basking in the perfect Vegas sun. They also have a daily happy hour from 3-6pm that can be enjoyed anywhere in the restaurant. It features food items and $1 off adult beverages.   From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted with smiles and genuine service. Everyone who visited our table was clearly concerned with ensuring we had an enjoyable experience.  And we did! First, I thought the salsa was delicious, and I appreciated it was actually spicy versus the mild you typically receive. In addition to salsa, you receive bean dip and grilled onions and jalapenos. Meals also come with fideo soup.   We had to go with the flaming fajitas for two, and we decided to sample beef, chicken and pork. They are happy to split up the meat. We were told by two separate employees that the meats are marinated for 48-hours, and I believe them. All of the meats were tender, juicy and flavorful. For the first time I can remember, my husband and I actually finished fajitas for 2!   Considering every detail of the experience, it is definitely worthy of 5-stars. I am sure we'll be adding it to our regular rotation!

XNudeHGl0VtTlv5G1GkQAw.text: This place was amazing my girlfriends and I had a taste for Mexican and we were so pleased with the food and service! great place to eat and not far from the strip with a car!

XYkbMfY_CRO-2pmYQCynsw.text: It's been awhile since I've walked out of a restaurant and thought, "wow, that was awesome!"   No wonder this place was so crowded. They don't cut corners with their guests - they feed you well. The portions are huge and flavorful! The staff is very attentive and polite. The ambience is lively.   Can't wait until next time. Great joint.

An-KAEeho31Ga-v1677bfw.text: Always busy, a wait for a table...well worth the wait! Good fresh food and always more than you can possible eat , take home the leftovers for another meal tomorrow. Fresh flavors, good eats. We say check them out, don't be put off if you have to wait, it's worth it!

D-CLwqyhW051Ez6WFNQE0w.text: Stopped by for lunch, and their food rocks - the flaming fajitas are superb, delivered literally on fire, on top of a mini flaming kiln. Would definitely come back for dinner and happy hour.  ~ @DowntownRob

tQYllL_0u-geG02ZjEw5sw.text: Great food, great service, was seated immediately even during a pretty busy lunch rush.   Free chips with 2 salsas and beans. We ordered queso to go with the chips and it was delicious!   I got the steak fajitas and the meat was so tender and flavorful, husband got the chicken and it was also tender and flavorful.   Usually when the places are "fun" like this, the flavor falls short but that wasn't the case here :)   Our server (and his helper) kept our drinks full, was refilling them as soon as they got below 1/2 full! Very attentive, but not overbearing!   We will be back!

KaWIDdpd8Ow8qxycXUFhdQ.text: Brought my cousin here when she requested a Mexican bill of fare for lunch. We both went for the "special" flaming fajitas which were ignited table side vs in the kitchen area; nice touch! Modest serving size (even for lunch) and not much in the way of anything special in regard to taste. Average at best except for the table side presentation which accounts for the higher than average "3" rating.

Be careful about the smorgasbord of salsa's, beans, freshly grilled peppers / onions they bring out with chips to everyone. Fills you up completely before your meal. Happy hour margaritas at only $4 are trouble too.   The fajitas were amazing - so moist and juicy. They lit them on fire as they delivered to our table. It felt like a party. The only thing I'll advise here is that they're big. We got Fajitas for 3 and only ate 1/3 of them.   Enjoy, this place is a treat.

bb65jeaS1N0j6KQxxiZ03Q.text: The best Mexican place all around that I've been to in Las Vegas. Excellent service from the time you walk in the door to walking out. The food is excellent. They have an awesome happy hour with good drink deals and food deals. The queso dip is the best I've had ever. I will definitely stop here every time I come to Vegas.

dt_ZDcXtcn5bZ6ZeCShWxA.text: Happy Hour Daily 3-7pm  Happy Hour specials are beer, wine and margaritas for under $4-$5.  Apps range from $5-$10.    Sat on the patio which was really nice.  Started with Peach and Mango Margaritas.  For food we ordered the JFFC's Nachos, Queso Fundido and Shredded Beef Taquitos.  Food and drinks were great.  By the time we left we tried all 5 of the flavored margaritas and loved each one.  Can't beat the price of just over $5 (+.55 for flavored).  Service wasn't the best.  We felt rushed even though there was plenty of room of open tables.  Even with the service issues still a good choice for Happy Hour.

LlD87GJyMtyk6VAWEsgQGA.text: Great place! Good food and great staff. The food delicious and authentic I recommend getting the fajitas and or the burrito!

ocKlL_-U6KGHgJUCk0VozA.text: It's our first time at Flaming Fajitas and I have to say everything we ordered down to the kids meals was exceptional. My husband and I had shrimp & steak fajitas to share for $30. We were served with chips & salsa & bean dip! Then we all were served soup. We had fried ice cream and sopapillas for dessert. We will definitely be back here again! Our server was Yajaira & she was extremely attentive & kind!!! Thank you Yajaira for a great experience & dinner. We will be back!

OJxF2H5apbLhW3xqT2PouQ.text: I've had this spot on my list for awhile and I finally made it in this week. The food and the service were definitely five stars.  The service was great. We were seated quickly and the waiter didn't delay in taking our orders. The food came out so quickly! Our waiter continued to check in on us and refill drinks well before necessary.   I ordered the Shrimp Fajitas and loved them. The flavor of the shrimp and vegetables was delicious. The tortillas were warm and soft. The sides that go with the fajitas were tasty as well and I really liked the guacamole. The salsas and grilled vegetables that come out with the chips before the meal were all great too.  Something unique to this restaurant was the option to get healthy options. Fajitas can be ordered with romaine lettuce instead of tortillas and rice and beans can be substituted for steamed vegetables. I love when restaurants offer healthy alternatives.

yEuDlObyQ15HvOfk-M6w0w.text: My order was wrong. I order mariscos adobados and got carne asada a la tampiquena. And I was overcharge on my drink.

eRMEo-fn00zBHDDOAAJkgQ.text: Best fajitas ever. Very efficient staff. Food came out fast and staff was always present. Will be coming back very soon!!

DebrWRI1JJSiEjmU1Aw-zg.text: One of our favorite spots! Whatever they season their fajitas with is amazing and that queso fundido is like cheese heaven! Arturo is our favorite waiter. We love him and always get the best service from him! Hands down one of the best Mexican restaurants in town.

2lRQ_myZMPR6fgiiAC8tDQ.text: Busy and very delicious Mexican food.  The meat quality is perfect and they serve good seasoned food. Nice chips and salsas ( red and green ), bean dip and roasted peppers and onions. Need good Mexican food? Simply put....this is the place! I'm a fan!!! A++++

yWRMEsA-hqANVne8JiuFhA.text: Mmmm.... I'll give them another shot.  My dojo admin team and I have a debriefing dinner after each big event. It's a chance for us to go over the success and failures in an effort to make our events better each year. But mostly we like to have a few drinks, good food and chat. We had heard a lot of buzz about how great this place was so we braved a Friday night 30 min wait for a table of 4. Considering we were in an active conversation throughout the experience, the server did a great job of getting us what we needed. Everyone enjoyed their Margaritas (5 star), there were a few fun flavors to choose from, my cohorts got creative but I went with the classic Cadillac. The food is where they fell flat. It wasn't bad, just not great. There are so many really great Mexican restaurants in the valley I can afford to be that picky. All in all I'm going to revisit them on a slower night to see if they were just a little off.

iIdokFObsdfXcudG62skPg.text: I've heard many good things about this place but I am not impressed in the slightest bit. It appears to always be full and busy the two times that I have come. I usually am invited and that is the only reason why I come. Both times I've ordered tacos and they did not do it for me.

dwwmz3ydINL2yqw3oK6HWA.text: I've visited JFFC plenty of times in the last few years and I've even had them cater two separate parties. The food is amazing and authentic. Love Juan's Flaming Fajitas and the staff is warm and welcoming. Highly recommend JFFC for dining in or taking out or catering. You won't be disappointed!

nMSYZFr58J7p-QdjNVoBgA.text: Enjoyed our time here. Super cheap and super delicious, the portions are generous too! Gabriel & Chapo are the tag team you need  Will return. Also, super cool how you get so many accompaniments with your chips &  (salsa)

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada plate! About $11 after tax :)

Urzs4An9IloaRtDK1gWi5w.text: I was a little hesitant to wait a minimum of 45 minutes to eat here, thinking it had to be overhyped. The outdoor seating was closed off for a private event that seemed to only be hosting a few people so there were a lot of empty seats not being used. And groups were showing up after we'd been waiting and getting seated before us so there seemed to be preferential treatment to regulars or people the hostesses knew (we were told they don't do reservations or waiting lists). Once we were seated everything was great. No complaints whatsoever about the food and honestly the best horchata I've ever had. We came three hours before a show we had tickets for and because of the wait to be seated and then service being backed up we nearly missed the show so I'd say come when you don't have plans for anything afterwards. But the food really was great!

-uOlsrZjGS4J0PDaHLqJew.text: First time at Juan's Flaming Fajitas  on W. Tropicana.  Everything was GREAT ! Ladies at front desk very courtious and greated us well. Our Server was Yajaira and she was Fabulous ! Very attentive and informative.  She made fabulous suggestions and we absolutely enjoyed our visit . Margaritas and Ceviche Was Amazing ! We will definitely be back!

QjAk9qeOZdSD9y7yUwzu2w.text: Average, fajitas not enough flavor, bland. Prefer old lindos on Decatur better...........

NFLTEntrEDfNAoKCXTB2UQ.text: First time here and no regrets! The service from the hostess to the servers was excellent. The dishes are a good size and super tasty. The jalapeno margarita was bomb. Overall, the prizes are good for what you get. We will definitely come back for more.

qOCs1FYtThf7yVwW2rnTCw.text: I've been to so many different Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas, but I probably won't be to many more. I've definitely found the best that Vegas has to offer. The fajitas are amazing and the staff provides better service than any restaurant I've ever been to. I would give Juan's 6 stars if I could!!!!

0qmtp24vJcTgHr0Lqgj6dw.text: When they say flaming fajitas, they mean it! I love this place because they have authentic mexican food and are crazy enough to set their fajitas on fire! Everyone loves this place so prepare to have to wait a little before being sat at a table! 10/10 would recommend this place.

zrOYVOsi0XuXT0I6ADlvAA.text: If you enjoy a sit down gimmicky Mexican restaurant, well come on over! Fun and lively atmosphere with someone serenading and flaming fires on the fajitas are awesome. But when you put the fajitas in the spotlight, they are flavorless and dry. Paying $16 for an bland entree served along with rice, beans, tortillas, sour cream, salsa, and guac, is pretty much an do it yourself burrito. I would rather go to an fast food Mexican spot to indulge myself with an carne aside burrito that can satisfy your palate with flavor. I'm glad I gave this place a chance, as the curiosity will no longer be.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajita, added 4 shrimp for $6

odVFm_HAR4zeHOoIDYJi0w.text: Food was GREAT!!! Service was great! Beverly attentive to their customers! Very relaxing and enjoyable!!! Must try this if you want forest Mexican dinner. We had fajitas and ordered a single person order and the two of us ate on it and still had left overs! Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lcPKXHIGsmhQp9Np2bV8eg.text: This place if FANTASTIC!  Food is very good and service awesome.    Check it out!

hPD3HRIwWu4M8FELiLbn-Q.text: We have been to this location several times and have always been pleased not only with the food, but the service as well.  We recommend going before the 5 o'clock rush, however, if you don't want to have a long wait.  We were able to get right in, get a great table and enjoy our meal.  Servers and team members are on point and do their job, without being intrusive.  Food is always good, and we highly recommend it!

4TXH2vGsDtV7Mn6guu5mBA.text: Fabulous Mexican restaurant!  Awesome welcome appetizers (chips, three different salsas, and onions and peppers.  We ordered the table side guacamole and it was fresh and delicious.  Of course we had to order the chicken flaming fajitas and they were so good!  The wine was also great for "house" wine. We will definitely be spreading the word and will be returning

sU88sFMKNlZEFlEjjirLig.text: Amazing 1st time here had the fajitas for 2 everything was amazing we left with more food then we ate.

MG_H02lnTaKVeM-qeH2dLA.text: Juan's is fabulous!  My husband and I have been looking for good Mexican food in the SW and we found our spot!!  Marguerite on the rocks was delish and my husband had a draft Pacifico.   I was amazed that we not only were served chips, salsa and a delish bean but also a tasty plate of roasted peppers and grilled onions. Amazing!! Lupe was our waitress and she was  terrific.  Very attentive and just a doll.  I had Poblano mole steak and it was so delicious.  Very generous portion.  My husband had the Carne Asada  and he enjoyed it very much.  Friendly service, delicious food, generous portions at reasonable prices.  Highly recommend!!

Sz8Vmez4m5zGYRDJ0K1Mig.text: The food was great and the service was excellent! The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Especially Yajaira and Manuel.

avhNZyoiWBjP-CI-Is68sA.text: Place is crowded, but food is very average.  People like it bc of the singing & atmosphere.  However, if you want authentic Mexican food, look elsewhere.  It's a tourist spot, plenty of gringos will love it and that should tell you something.

TTv0_SKGD5V8E0jhRBrYGQ.text: I love this place, good quality, okay service. Come here about three times a week. Love the birthday song.

8numAIwUTw2xSAoIDugxaQ.text: The Service is absolutely amazing! Yajaira our waitress was an absolute delight!  Would recommend out of 10!

OgLNdiHDGZIi9utwmvQSkg.text: This place is wonderful! We drove across town to try it and was soooo worth it! Our server  was Claire and she went above and beyond to make our first experience here amazing! We tried the guacamole, shrimp ceviche, tacos and taco salad. The salad was enormous! The churros completed the meal perfectly! We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gErKS3JpGyCyLwBWWNoBdQ.text: Place is awesome. In Vegas disappointed in finding good food for a decent price. 4 of us had shrimp fajitas. Everything is awesome and two frozen margaritas will Knock you out so take an Uber. Go here, don't waste your time on the strip. . Service was great, 5 stars at any price.

iEqQJa5FMLA_NBhJxEPZ1A.text: Best Mexican food hands down! Will return when I do go back to Vegas.   Must try the Guadalajara! Customer service best I had.

eKRYevm8g_-_EulWtTumFg.text: Must try their flaming fajita when you come here! They didn't name their restaurant after it for no reasons haha the fajitas are delicious! I like going here for lunch, as they have many options for only around $10. Their portions are also generous. I always have a leftover to take home. Best of all, a margarita is only $3.75 during lunch! Scored!! I also love that they serve their chips and salsa with a bean dip and grilled onions and jalapenos. Friendly service all around. During busy hours, parking can be tricky as they share the space with an In N Out.

8Qy5NL5FetOs42Ox6CZrRQ.text: The food is so delicious, I like the enchiladas, fajitas and chile rellenos. The bar is nice and the drinks are always on point.   The hostes is very friendly and the waiters / waitress are amazing.  Ask for Yajaira she is the best. She knows the menu very well. I will definately be back and recomend this place to family and friends.   Thank you Yajaira!!!

530az8nv6TzFwP_U9wK4iQ.text: What can I say but the best!  We originally ordered thru Postmates but they cancelled the order.  I called Juan's and the person who answered was so nice.  He understood our issue.  We ordered 2 steak fajita meals and carnitas.  A side of chips salsa and bean dip.  The portions were huge!  Easily enough for 2 meals each.  We got all the sides and condiments.  The food was awesome!  Our go to for Mexican food from now on.

SWotYURPbFMFCXBVVt3dKg.text: Why are you reading this? You have skimmed by other reviews of this place and still haven't gone? Ok if you have to hear it again here we go:  This place is great! The service is always excellent, the food has never disappointed and the complimentary chips and salsa are easily worth the trip alone. The atmosphere is fun and lively, there are TV screens showing sports mostly but you can still hold a conversation.  The only downside to this place is that sometimes there can be a wait. They will quote you 20 to 30 min, which is reasonable for a great place like this, but you will usually only wait 10 to 15.   My advice for this place is to come hungry because will definitely leave full!

CTPo09MNqYVa_i91GNIQlw.text: The food is amazing!! The employees here are so fast and friendly. I never had to wait for anything... the chips, beans and salsa were fresh. I had a flaming steak fajita and it was perfectly cooked

Oq6mDFDlGBY-vwwvlG_O0Q.text: This is now my favorite Mexican Restaurant. The experience was wonderful, the service was excellent and the food had so much flavor. We enjoyed Pozole, Menudo, and Fajitas.

x9RZwkBz7VEApywZgVthwA.text: I love this place. Great food and atmosphere. Staff members are accommodating. Only negative thing is the long wait, but with food this good, there is no way around it!

UenVpVNnGfZG5NP_aQHh5A.text: Definitely my favorite Mexican restaurant in the valley. I haven't had a dish here that I did not like.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quezo fundido a few minutes later

o71bKiNW3j3mp9mRyqb4ZA.text: Add mine to the five star reviews!  This place was packed and for good reason. We received excellent food, drinks and service. The four of us each ordered something different, tacos, enchiladas, taco salad and we were all very happy with our meal. The margaritas are large and boozy! As good as you can get Mexican food.

xZ4JjezFt-9n0DEvhLMg-w.text: There's nothing decent about this place in my opinion I had a awesome dining experience here. The chips and salsa was on point with their sauce was very good. As for starter we ordered Pozole, it had so much flavor in it, and the meat was tender. We ordered a alcoholic drink which was the Micheladas for about $8-9 can't remember?  For our final entree we got the fajitas for two combination of shrimp and steak. They do live for their restaurant name for "flaming fajitas" as it put on a fire show infront of our table as they served it. It came with your choice of rice and beans with pico de gallo for two. The meats were not bad but not the best I ever had. Overall the service was great always checking on us, and the environment has a good warm welcoming feeling.   Will come back again soon to try some of their enchiladas. They do offer 15% off for checking in which saved me a ton.

Hernan was our waiter and he is extraordinary! He made my birthday so special and so very great for my friends and family too! He helped create great dishes for our table and had us all smiling. Thank you Hernan!  And of course the food is magnificent!

5ySnlpNAwx7Or2XbFNJcoA.text: Fast & efficient Service. came during my lunch with a few co workers and was in and out with the hour. wbJGOBop68PUIl2uZiG3HQ.text: First time here...The food (and I mean the fajitas) was fantastic! But the service was even better! We sat in the bar and Yajaira and Adriana were beyond amazing! Some of the best service we've had in a long time. Can't wait to come back again!

dOREJXWGLTOkymjs_b3xCQ.text: Try to make reservations because this place gets pack during prime hours  Came here for my birthday and they were very accommodating for large parties. This place smelled so good the moment you entered the doors.  We all tried their flaming fajita which is what they were known for. As the dishes come out they come sizzling and the server lights up the fajitas and it was flaming!  Ordered the steak and shrimp fajita and the flavors were on point! The plate didn't really burn the meat or shrimp and it was not over cooked. The servers were very friendly and even brought out a special hot sauce for us which just added a habanero mouth water king kick to our fajitas !  I will definitely want to come back and try their happy hour menu! This is also a great place to bring guests who are coming in town to visit.
