Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and shrimp fajita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The infamous flaming fajita!

WJqRiX08b_vHmlQvgeF4gg.text: You really can't go wrong here!  The food is amazing and the service is great.  The fajitas are served flaming on a cast iron pan.  I think the tortillas are homemade and the side dishes are always fresh and good.  The drinks are well done too.  It does get busy and sometimes there's a short wait.  Parking can be a pain because it's so busy but this is a very well run restaurant that serves amazing fajitas at an affordable price.  UPDATE: We're still eating here regularly; food and service better than ever! I'd say one of the best run restaurants in Vegas- really amazing; highly recommend!

t_VElKWMEHu61VXSTylGYQ.text: We're from SF and eat out a lot and I have to say that Amanda is one of the best servers we've ever had.  The complimentary Fideo soup is fantastic.  Amazing bean deal comes free with chip as well as sauteed onions and jalapenos for the chips.  We had fajitas and chile relleno it was all excellent.  They even set the fajitas on fire at the table.

JaVx6gMhsUAK2KTwlMLJLg.text: This is like Chevy's but, worse. We ordered the Juan's sampler app and shared the steak fajitas. No booze. All the food came at once but, once the server saw our huge eyes of surprise, the flaming fajitas were returned to the kitchen. What happened to them back there? Who knows! :/ My husband was immediately sick when we got home and didn't fully recover for 2 days. Not to mention, we left smelling like a dirty, greasy, fried onion tamale. 2 stars because the staff was nice.

MbifojrRhBDZVO0zSh7Ptg.text: I thought I had yelped this already but here goes.... This place is AMAZING.....beats Lindo by food and price!!! My family and I go at least once a week and anytime we have out of town guests we take them too. Fajitas for 2 is the best deal in town (it can actually feed 3 depending on your appetite) They also have a great happy hour and you don't have to sit in the bar to order from the happy hour menu. Def my favorite Mexican food in Vegas!

qSIz5o0z8nJDRs3toabAHQ.text: This place is good!  Love the cocktail menu and guacamole.  The service is excellent and the prices are extremely fair.

BmsHvYXCe0MvNF_LG70hdA.text: I am giving five stars for customer service.  Juan presented me with a gift certificate.

YJ7v3j8wikJ91723dK5Edg.text: This place is yummy!! The flaming fajitas are delicious and fun to watch table side. Great customer service from the staff as well. Check this place out if you're craving great fajitas in Vegas!

Fdm0hVXk6W9Ues9cf4z10Q.text: Shrimp fajitas, amazing!  Omar (our food server), amazing! Fried ice cream, amazing!  I am a Mexican food snob and this place is off the charts yummy!  It's always busy, so be prepared to wait a little, but it's oh so worth it!

U2f6DSaLrUwxYXLKetCbmQ.text: Love the fajitas, the atmosphere and the staff!! This place is awesome for a family dinner, a team party or a date night. Great ownership and management that Truly cares. It shows every time we come in. We love our local favorite restaurant.

AZhp-ckAkTHh-P_V7JhVKA.text: Okay first time best shrimp fajitas I have had in town yet  Service is quick and friendly and even the wife who is not huge fan of Mexican food loved it.  This place is much better than Pancho's in Downtown Summerlin.  Great happy hour but get reservations or early it's so good you might there for a few till you get a table.

t29qKL9vwlHPHQHqAfXM4A.text: This place definitely lives up to its 4.5 star average review. I'm from California so I've been spoiled with good, authentic Mexican food for my entire life. I was sad to find that good Mexican food is surprisingly hard to come by in Las Vegas. After trying a half dozen places and being sorely disappointed at all of them, I turned to Yelp and found Juan's. Over 600 positive reviews? Can't go wrong with that, right? Right! Everything I've tried here is amazing.

ddOvMQcxsI3s-2YBj2p-Ow.text: Tired of those little, itty-bitty fajita plates at those big chain restaurants? Want really awesome fajitas, that are so good they are literally on fire? Then Juan's Flaming Fajitas is the place for you. And it doesn't hurt to know that the red sangria is pretty darn good.

CvJTt0QMADSiWYJEGYckrA.text: First time here. Visiting a friend for the weekend and we decided to try this place after our hike at Redrock Canyon. The service was great and the food was very delicious. Top it off with a skinny margarita and you won't leave unsatisfied. Definitely be back next time I'm in town.

Xs_bDOUzzZUHWEzFqaq2Tg.text: Great service, great menu, great taste! It's a fun ambiance and you can tell all the customers are enjoying the experience. Ordered the 2 item combo plate with a carne asada burrito & cheese enchilada. The homemade chips and salsa variety was superb but the bean dip was my favorite. Don't forget to order a frozen margarita.

etd4lVn9N8L7GchXzPHx_w.text: This place is awesome! The fajitas were amazing. Very tender beef. They serve you chips, salsa, beans, and grilled peppers & onions to start. That in itself was really good!   The service was also great.

cPNJHqXkmVeaa83ztXkb8g.text: Love this place once again. Came for lunch and the special lunch margaritas $3.75. Service was great as always. We will be back.

MzsjCeosGvBkuF9lPI1uBg.text: Been here several times and it has always delivered solid food and service.   The chips, salsa and bean dip here are to die for. You can probably just order an appetizer and the chips, you are good to go.   Their combo for two people is a good deal. For $25, you get their famous flaming fajitas (choose from chicken, beef, pork and shrimp), rice, refried beans, pico de gallo, guacamole and a soup.   The service here was also great. Fast and very attentive.   This is one of my go to places now for Mexican food.

4vU1e04H_C4BdImC3OnWPg.text: Delicious.....like homemade! And they treat me like family.  Very reasonable prices too. Highest recommendation!

cXmGarvYcxe-u5JVHO5Aiw.text: First time in my 22 years in Vegas, Best margarita I ever had, and on Wednesday it's only 4 bucks all day. The happy hour Fajita nachos is the greatest. Love it. I'll definitely be back... Frequently! Yummm

pXzoH4P5rNnsdlh76xv2ew.text: Everything is really good. I was skeptical because most Mexican restaurants out here are crap but this one really surprised me. It's real Mexican food. (I'm Mexican af) trust me. Legit

PEPZukQjpbLnyRqiwfYzyQ.text: The food and the service was excellent. Amanda our server was so attentive as was the rest of the staff. The plates were well served and the food was authentic. We will be back.

kAbYPkK1dw_hvYMupMVA7A.text: You have to try the fajitas at least once. So FUNNNNN. Big portions for fair prices. Nice employees.

iCEdTi-l04jI2ABnfBzyYA.text: Delicious!! Highly recommend this place. The hubby and I filled our faces with chips and salsa/bean dip before our entree came. Chips tasted homemade. We had the two person fajitas chicken, steak & shrimp. It was so yummy. Tortillas were homemade and the rice/beans were tasty. We def will be coming back. Not only was the food delicious but the service was great.

rXZ30QL2qZyCxu7aO9cCvQ.text: So good! We visit Juan's at least once a month. We usually order combo plates because I like to try a little bit of everything, but right now I am so in love with their chile rellenos! Perfect melty cheese in a flavorful chile---I feel like I could eat 20! Lack of a star is only because a couple times shrimp fajitas were ordered by someone in my group, and there were very few shrimp both times. But otherwise a great place!

Qe79tS_R5tCWY3DMttezyw.text: The fajitas were delicious! Happy hour was fun with $3.95 house margaritas. I'll be back when I'm in the mood for some serious deliciousness!

x_ty586LZtqhZdJ1E1EpoA.text: We ate dinner there last night. THE FAJITAS were great and service was also good. It is worth the drive from Henderson.

IDfLn50BERKUxLzJWOEmjw.text: This was such a pleasant surprise indeed. We are vacationing from Australia and asked Siri where the best happy hour Was in our area and we ended up here. So delicious, fabulous service. We're definitely coming back here again before we head back home. Highly recommended

amSfVDFHrnF-nH5UVl-BbA.text: Very good service, it's a really nice place. The only downfall is the parking sucks. But that's not their fault so don't hold it against them. The food is excellent. Very attentive and wonderful waitstaff. Will definitely go again. The sauce is fantastic love the food love love love!

dRDHDyGeGwH35UL4TpVtwA.text: The patio was puppy friendly.  Service amazing!  So accommodating even to the three year old and the dog. Food (fajitas) fantastic. So were the chips, bean dip, salsa, and jalapenos!  Even had kid friendly salsa. Could not have been better.

jGECV0ecbbU669YRIKZajQ.text: Consistently the best:  food, service, ambiance.  Chips and guacamole outstanding; all fajitas are excellent.  Omar is a great server.  Management takes personal interest in every guest.  Just a fantastic Mexican restaurant.

ke39cg9spGbcYH8CP9dzRA.text: Great food awesome Server. Visiting from Idaho . Juan Armenta was our server n what great service we received. He said he had only been here for a month or so but he was able to help us get around. Next year when we come back, we hope Juan will still be working here.

mP80BIJMqKN5K8au26jfaA.text: By far the best Mexican food I've had in Las Vegas and I was born and raised here. This place blows Lindo Michoacan and Bonito Michoacan out of the water. We came here on Friday at 11am and it was PACKED! That says something right there. We waited five minutes to be seated and within a minute one of the servers placed two different salsas, refried beans, and fresh tortilla chips on our table and took our drink orders. Im one of those guys that goes through three glasses of soda during my meal and not only did my glass never go empty, they refilled it when it was only half way gone. The service is unbelievable! I ordered the lunch special and opted for the carne asada burrito and the chicken taco. I've never had carne asada this good. Tender, juicy, hot, with just the right amount of spice as to not overpower the meat. The chicken taco was also delicious and juicy. My wife chose the chile relleno and she loved it as well. She kept saying the word authentic (She was born in Mexico City) and that this tasted like a meal her mother and grandmother would make. The only downside to our visit was we got so full that we didn't save enough room for desert and we wish we should have because they looked amazing. I can't say anything more about this place other than you should stop reading and go in.

acvMe0me2aeS9h4oZnWLVw.text: If you're looking for real Mexican food, you need to come here! Very family oriented. Very clean. My family and I LOVE this restaurant. Most of the workers know us by now! LOL It's family owned and the owner always walks around to make sure everyone is doing okay. The food is amazing. The service is awesome! They're always super fast to bring out our food. I'm sad because we are moving in about a month - our house now is right next to this place and our new home is farther away. You better believe though we will be driving the extra miles though just to come and eat here. My favorite restaurant!

I4MLC6wlDX_DzprBPjA5Ig.text: Very delicious. Arrived at a busy moment and was told the wait was 30-35 minutes. We are a party of 5 with 3 kids all under 3...waiting is always unpredictable. Waiting area is small and felt in the way with people going in and out. We were actually seated in 10 minutes! Had the table right in front of where they make the tortillas! This was great for our almost 3 year old. Wait staff was grand; never had an empty drink! Chips and salsa were wonderful! Added bonus was the grilled veggies that came first! Ordered steak fajitas for two (loved the fact you could choose rice and bean or veggies) and a children's quesadilla (had choice of rice and beans or french fries)! Fideo before entree was another added bonus!  All food was amazing! Kids started to argue over the one orange slice so asked waiter for another one, he brought six! Fantastic place and we will definitely drive all across the valley again to come back!

0cY6D30gOc7eMSB8_3u_hA.text: This is absolutely my new favorite mexican restaurant. The New Mexico enchiladas are my favorite. They are amazing, (as is everything else I have tried) and the customer service is superb! This place operates like a finely tuned machine. All the employees help eachother regardless of if it is their table or not and the manager also works the floor to ensure everything is up to par. If I could eat here every day, I would!

U4yIWaCn_SGnvAGqXjAdcg.text: Thanks again to Juan's crew for the excellent service and food. Always can count on Flaming Fajitas for the best Mexican food in town. They always take care of me and my family. Thank you!! Jason and the girls

nkIpDCNiAnz13eZqh8oI_A.text: My family likes Mexican food and they like this place. The food is very good and tasty. Service is friendly and quick. It was a special treat to see how they actually light their fajitas on fire. They are tasty too :) A family favorite!

7UTpl6mTOE-9VFz-k27XbQ.text: My husband and I are obsessed with this place! The food is great (we usually order the fajitas for two), the staff is amazingly attentive and super friendly, the service is quick, and we really enjoy having a great Mexican restaurant close by. Highly recommend Juan's!

QoSwgYOo55ptZM9Kko_FiQ.text: The food was great!!! Everything from the chips and salsa to the main course rocked. They give you bean dip and sauted onions/bell peppers along with the usual chips and salsa. I am a fan of the salsa because I like it mild and well blended. So good! We had the chicken and shrimp fajitas. Very very good. The service was good too. They offered us tons of napkins over and over for our messy 1 yr old. We are going back for my birthday. I am excited.

3p8E-sS00BHG024OEOGV5w.text: Awesome place and service. The food was so good. I can't wait to go back. You won't be disappointed :)

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m5dOYwNEXhnDnvS0s5_pMA.text: I absolutely loved it! The food was great the people worked there were friendly very good service clean fast.  I will highly recommend it!

KsI32DlXMh7ojskw-TTCSw.text: A very good Mexican style restaurant on the West side of town. We've been a few times now & have not had any issues.the service has been great, even considering how busy this place is all the time. The food has been fantastic, and the prices are very respectable. The table side guac seems to be a fan favorite, but we have found the large guac was just as good...and cheaper. A must try if your in the SW area.  (Be prepared to wait, it seems to be very busy all the time)

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese enchilada &amp; pork tamale combo
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m-50jsDOrSFh0K-j1vKOfg.text: I'm mad at myself for not coming here sooner. My friend has been clamoring about this place for over a year and finally I decided to stop in. Amazing service, amazing food, and amazing atmosphere. The chips and salsa that come out first were so good I almost filled up before the meal. My Pacifico was cold and came with lime, the fideo soup was exceptionally good, and the carne asada burrito tasted like heaven. Both my drink server and server were friendly, engaging, and made me smile. Can't say enough good things about this place. Easy 5 stars.

BbyC00oTw47CAnRv7lWsFw.text: So freaking good here! Service, food, atmosphere, specials.. definitely one of the best in Vegas!  They have Happy Hour everyday from 3-7pm. You can get beer & cocktails starting around $3.50 during HH. You get free chips & salsa, but don't fill up too much because their portions are pretty big. Each entree can feed 2 people. They are very good on refills too.. when you are not even half way done with your drink, they come by & fill it up for you.   You definitely need to try their staple, Flaming Fajitas. They set fire to it at your table! Also, let them know when it's your birthday.. you will get some tasty caramel churros on the house!  Don't forget to Check-in to get $5 off $50.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Why they are called &#34;Flaming Fajitas&#34;

Y_ZEYsVHgj05C8ZWO27P_A.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants of all time. Definitely has the best fajitas hands down.

tsP6b2eCQK2g6Njqh8WmSw.text: After 2 years in Vegas I've finally found my go-to Mexican place! You get great value for food here.  Complementary chips come with 2 salsas, bean dip, and roasted onion and peppers.  Most of the entrees come with a cup of fideo soup.  If you're looking for a bit of a show get the fajitas, which they flame tableside.   Be sure to stop in for happy hour sometime for great margaritas and good deal on beer.  Food offerings on HH special are prefect especially for cheese lovers - go with the Juan's sampler or Juan's nachos to share for the table, otherwise it'll end up being your dinner. I've also come in for brunch and their breakfast burrito offerings are excellent!  Brunch meals even come with a beverage

FyPSRCy83qqgV9Y5yN6_6g.text: best guava margaritas! Amazing customer service! The host, the server, everyone was super friendly. Food and drinks came out super fast. Love love the food. Definitely will be back again. Would post a picture of my food but I ate it

tA5ghV1g1VlK9ExQ_dl4mw.text: Coming from san antonio we have found it difficult to find mexican food that compares.  Then Juan's opened up and it has been consistently amazing for the last few years.  It is always busy, so expect to wait at least a few minutes, its usually less than estimated and definitely worth the wait.  The service has always been great, there is usually a server and server's assistant to fill drinks, chips, beans, etc.  You will never go without at JFF!  Food is always great as well, my picky husband loves that there arent vegetables in the rice and we all love the flavors, quality and variety of everything.

8j2hykH6zqWZOIMQ8ux39Q.text: Coming from So Cal we are so happy to have found Juan's...amazing service and excellent food...love it!

IY9nBzNFz7yfCRePA2wamw.text: This is by far the best Mexican restaurant I've been to. The food is amazing and the staff is always super friendly. I have never had a bad experience here. Everyone I've brought here has fallen in love with it too! I would give them more stars if I could.

Vux9351S-Uf3Vszd9sDORQ.text: Best Mexican Food Experience I've had since I moved to Vegas from a lifetime of good Mexican food in SoCal. Highly recommend the fajitas here, hence the name!

S5jdh0Jc69AGVom1B2YitA.text: Where do I begin?!  This place is AMAZING!  Everything was perfect as soon as we walked into the doors!  I highly recommend the Cadillac Margarita to start and definitely go with the Flaming Fajitas!  We did the Fajitas for Two and it was the perfect amount with quite a bit for a to-go Box.  They were absolutely incredible, perfectly cooked and the flaming dish tableside were a great touch!  Definitely check this place out, you won't be disappointed!  A+++

4uk6I_W41Q67Hhrwx3If0w.text: This place is one of my "must haves" when I'm in Vegas. The crowd is always intimidating, and you'll worry when you'll get a table. If you're a party of 2, you'll get right in. From the tasty and fast margaritas, to Christian the super star who got us right in, to the super amazing service from Lupe. The place was PACKED to the doors and the service and timeliness of our food were incredible. We ALWAYS order the flaming fajitas, and we always leave with a goodie bag because the portions are more than sufficient.   OMG! I forgot this! They serve beans, two salsas, and a plate of grilled onions and poblano peppers with your tortilla chips. And tasty soup when you order the fajitas.

abLJCh3mwVmWRlCQJ24T-w.text: Fantastic food and even better service. Super attentive and overall great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8wRt7WhYjkanqUzOHEo5VA.text: Wow, this place has amazing food, and that is considering that it is in Las Vegas with some of the best chefs in the country. If you're looking to get off the strip and have a good meal that is priced well below the average on the strip, you have to try this place out. The atmosphere is typical of a Mexican restaurant and the servers very fast efficient at their job and did very well. I had to fajitas and they were perfect, the fortunes are huge and the chips and salsa comes with three different dips, two sauces and one being dip complementary. I will definitely come back here next time I'm in Vegas I get tired of eating buffets

YYw5tq2n_KhUS7cKB7iO4Q.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants in Vegas, maybe even the best! Service is always good. Staff are friendly and efficient. The fooooooooood is always on point, drinks are made well - happy hour is again one of the best happy hours in Vegas. Dinner time is always busy, so don't expect prompt seating during dinner hours. Usual wait is about 30 mins during dinner time. But other than that this place is worth your money!

N9_lCkbJ_3NBzNZiYCpmrA.text: This place has excellent staff, amazing food!!!!! Very quick service! My first time here will not be my last! Ask for Yajaira at the front desk 10/10 customer service!!!!

MiTu4ClS5TbL81BnCDUkeQ.text: this is the best food on the planet, no where in this realm of existence has better cuisine, period. come here . ask for yajaira.do it . your life will change forever.

GSSi4Bf8cegmn64iqFZcaw.text: We had several ppl race about this when we asked about their fave Mexican. We feel the same now!!!! The food was amazing and they just keep bringing it!!!

GFezHGNaFMWTZYsxLmH1NA.text: We really enjoyed our visit, after all our strip walking this meal hit the spot. We arrived to an overflowing crowded entry area, however, in no time the crowd dwindled down. We were seated much sooner from the time originally quoted. The hostess alerted us of the soon approaching end of Happy Hour, and we began with the best House Margaritas. They served chip and dip, 3 kinds of dip. My favorite was one made out of bean, so good! We after had some type of shrimp ceviche, very good & entrees. I was happy with whole dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best House Margaritas

wnRbseKIbqG_b7WS-aL1IQ.text: I was really excited about trying this place because I love Fajitas. The service was okay, and the food was good too. But there was nothing really special. I probably would have enjoyed more if I would have actually ordered fajitas. But I got the fajita chimichanga with chicken. I would return to try more options. The margarita was good and so was desert!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lz4Igjp7rsgITNESCGFDCQ.text: Great Mexican food.  We enjoyed the two salsas, bean dip and grilled onions and jalapenos.  Very authentic.  We also got the cheese fundido, which was very stringy and oily.  It was on the happy hour appetizer specials.  Next time, we'd choose guacamole instead.  Entrees were a combo platter of a burrito and an enchilada.  Both were very good. The best thing we got, however, was the fajitas.  Very authentic and very good food.  We will definitely be returning.

gJFqgJBk8eBtGX6aNArCVg.text: Have eaten there 5-6 times. Every time was a good experience. Love that they serve a hot bean dish with the chips and salsa, along with a small plate of grilled onions and jalapenos! The house margarita is pretty good, too. On the rocks! I say give it a try - I've always had the fajitas! Burritos are LARGE. Atmosphere is okay.

_Q2eMXfw_-vZw5Is5a1BLA.text: Vegas has a lot of Mexican food. This one stands out among many others. Good food. Good service. Nice environment. Nothing to blow your mind but safe bets

gSAtpy8mtpuYqb-wcFkTxg.text: Once again this place never lets me down always good food True authentic mexican restaurant i shall return!

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. i keep coming back for more always a good portion of food. Chip an salsa an onions is my favorite. keep doing a great job !

ECmodajD3zEtaPHYDmE1gw.text: My go-to place for watching football! I live around the corner, and come to sit at the bar. The female bartender always remembers my drink order. The complimentary salsa and beans are better than Lindo's (yes, I said it!). There are also tasty grilled onions and jalapenos that come out to start. Their shrimp fajitas are great, but I honestly come for the ceviche. This place is a neighborhood jem!

EYab4t67O7OZoZwoqI0XxQ.text: The food & ambience is worth coming down to check out this restaurant.  It's great for large groups celebrating special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margaritas &amp; Fajitas? Perfect Combo

JHOupKLDyYhd25bEBo_Gvg.text: The food is absolutely wonderful!  The entire family loved their meals. Chips and salsa were great along with the grilled onions and jalapenos. The kids meals are large and the adult meals are huge. Bring your appetite when coming here. You'll need it!

7W1QAix0dOESH2l34-FaTw.text: I rarely write reviews but this place is pretty awesome! I took the wife and kids here for brunch . I had the carne sada ala tampiequen which is pretty much a surf and turf with a Mexican kick. Wife had the steak and eggs breakfast and we had a couple of michelladas .   Food quality I give a 7.5 Customer service a 10!!   Definitely will come back based on the customer service. The manager even dropped by and said hello! Great little hole in the wall spot.

u8nOI6pGwfQQL02kDaBQDA.text: Wow.. Best Mexican Food I have had in along time.. Well worth the drive from the east side of town.. Service Great.. Food Amazing..will return..It was my daughters birthday and we all left happy..

vBrGjMEtwkahPtsqteHMcw.text: Reasonably priced! Great service, great food(steak Nachos-two thumbs up), and margaritas topped it off! All around good experience

n1ay9_LHWYVX-JuvnRobKQ.text: This place is awesome soon ask we enter the door we were greeted and sat right away. We sat down and immediately was serve Chips and Salsa delicious! And fajitas were the best i ever had seriously will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XixY175q1efu--tPmu4obA.text: Everything here is amazing! The food is delicious!! You start out with complimentary chips, salsa and refried beans along with grilled jalapenos and onions AND soup - all free!! The entries are huge! ~$25 for two for chicken, jumbo shrimp or steak fajitas served with a plate of rice and beans for each person. And their margaritas are good too! Family friendly. All around good place.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary grilled jalapeños and onions!

L5lyMYAmAhmM8D55mopEiQ.text: Great authentic food, great attentive and friendly service. I feel so welcome and comfortable every time and the flaming fajitas never disappoint. Just go.

kVkT_aGPxxeypYiiXRvlHA.text: Fajitas have great flavor.  We tried the chicken and the steak.  Very good chips and salsa.  Fried Ice Cream is delicious.

TJMC4GYPOXadmINbLApO6A.text: great food, great atmosphere.  Love the outside patio in the spring and summer.  The Margaritas are to die for.  Huge servings.  We were out to dinner w/ friends and they were about to close and we were having a great time, having conversation and didn't realize that they were going to close.   The server told us to stay, relax, finish our food and we stayed much later than closing and never felt rushed.   This was great customer service.   Can't wait until the spring to go back here and enjoy a Margarita and great food!

HdWA0fCtLpWnD6F8xwi-ZA.text: So glad I finally managed to resist the temptation of the In-N-Out across the street, because Juan's was an incredible experience.   The food is clearly great. We ordered the chicken fajitas - they were juicy, flavorful, and the spectacle of the flames made them even more enjoyable. (One other thing to note: one order was requested to be well done, and the other wasn't; the restaurant did an excellent job of cooking those two and they even came out at the same time). The free soup was good, too. I was definitely a big fan of the salsa since it didn't have huge chunks in it and it also had a little kick.   But, the main selling point of this place was the customer service. Every staff member we interacted with was kind and attentive, bringing the sides/condiments we needed with no wait. We never even had to ask for water refills or extra tortillas; they were always on top of things. Everyone seemed genuinely interested in how our experience was, as well.  Just as we thought it couldn't get any better, our waiter returned with a complimentary churro dessert to commorate our first visit! It was an extremely kind gesture - this place really knows how to lure in customers and keep them coming! Make sure you visit this place if you're looking to be treated well and eat the most delicious fajitas on this side of town.

sIe32IoJqfzTlkpEJAj9uQ.text: Juan's flaming fajita is my favorite Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas. The food is very good and the service is wonderful!

9KFHIfV1pBi-uU1HWWi0dg.text: As promised, I returned with friends in tow. The food was as good as I remember. Right from the start, our friends commented on how good the bean dip was that was served with the chips and salsa. My girlfriend and I had the chicken fajitas and our friends had the steak fajitas and the enchilada de mole. Everyone loved their food as evident by the lack of sharing. :-)  Thanks Juan and team! You never disappoint!

m9K_c1RrZmOD6z7hL1ym3Q.text: I don't know why I waited so long to come here! This place is legit. Great customer service and amazing food. Will definitely be returning to try more on their menu. I had the medium size bowl of menudo.. It was almost as good as my dads home cook menudo. I also had a strawberry margarita mmmmm so good!! My new favorite Mexican restaurant!!

xtbS0avM5LPLH4EHSLPBNw.text: Food is always great with fast friendly service, not to mention the margaritas. I've come here often and have never left disappointed.

avbiNnHPuxU3RqBg9RVROw.text: Im a Dallas native and I have been living here for over a year. I have yet to find such a stellar Mexican food restaurant. The food was absolutely great and the customer service was AMAZING!  Not only were they so gracious and sweet, but they waited on his hand and foot with a smile! I will definitely be bringing everybody that I can for happy hour and food here I cannot wait to go back and I'm so glad I found this little hidden gem!

URT-fOhodcysXGf8Tf7wxw.text: Had tacos and a few beers.  The food was good and the server was fast and friendly

KH_5YU3BRbyWPzKgCMAD2g.text: As always great food!!! Good chips n salsa! Great food and service!  Our favorite Mexican restaurant!

B8_HAURnT0VbNCuGvL1k_A.text: My husband and I LOVE this place!! What a hidden gem this restaurant is. We love the complimentary grilled jalapeno peppers and onion that they bring out w/ the chips and salsa.  The staff is very friendly and efficient! Their food is delicious and generous in portion size.

X5LXowLDk02UDz1mURGrqg.text: Good place for Mexican food.  The service is good and the food quality is good.  My only complaint is the wait time during semi-peak times and the waiting area is very small.  Overall a good place just don't be in hurry to get seated.

L7DwSO5r56Z0qFdgSfdLMw.text: Amazing food! Great service, friendly staff. Located right behind In n Out and not easily seen. Best Mexican food in Vegas.

iDe30YzfCXSgW5DE9wnOuQ.text: I loved this place. They bring chips, beans, and salsa to start, all of which were good. The strawberry margarita was delicious. But the steak fajitas were amazing. They come with rice, beans, guacamole, and sour cream. You can chose your meat and corn or flour tortillas. Everything was so good and the service was great. I would highly recommend eating here.

Sv20Tqq9P4DewkbkWaS3dA.text: I love this place. It's nestled inside of an old strip mall adjacent to an In-N-Out at Trop and Ft. Apache. The view from the patio is non-existent, so if you're looking for that type of ambiance, this is not your place. If you want great friendly service, awesome food, a welcoming atmosphere and a fun time out - THIS IS YOUR PLACE. Tried a bunch of things on the menu, never had a bad meal or bad service ever. The drinks are good too, everything is very reasonably priced. It's also super close to the 215, so it's not far off the beaten path to get to or go from. Recommendation; if you are going out after dinner and order the fajitas, sit outside on the patio if you don't want to smell like your delicious dinner.

itPBPzNoeDaS0QvR52GL7A.text: Good food, large portions, swift friendly service and reasonable prices. The real stand out was the soup, it's excellent, we all complemented on it and the perfect temp didn't go unnoticed.    The place was quite full, understandably, so we opted to be seated in the bar rather than wait. Our mistake, good meal in a noisy chaotic environment, bit of a shame, took some of the enjoyment out of it. Fortunately the food is as good as it is and made it worth while.  Would definitely return given the chance.

qqblM5Qv9RznBo9LxkejYA.text: Definitely a family favorite restaurant!! The staff is always friendly and wonderful! They make jokes with our kids and are very attentive! Our favorite place for sure!!

ErQcyflrJiz1PGH4qoMAPw.text: Very good food! They've always given us a lot for our money's worth. I love the shrimp fajitas and I find myself craving their signature soup. We've ordered take out a few times, but when we've dined in, the service is great and the manager (owner?) comes around to the tables making sure things are up to par. I like the decor and the atmosphere is relaxing. Will have to try out the bar area for a margarita or 2:)

b3d32xMRclGipCrqti-4Yw.text: Don't let the name fool you, when you order fajitas, they WILL set them aflame at your table side! Delicious! ! !

dTgfKJjO3HHBmoqcFGFpgA.text: One of my favorite spots! Chips n' salsa are tasty, I enjoy the jalapenos and onions they serve with them, love the complimentary soup (squeeze some lime in it, so good) and LOVE the sopapillas for dessert. I've tried a few different entrees, and wasn't that impressed with them until I tried the fajitas... now that's all I order!  Service has always been great. If you're looking for something easy, casual, and tasty, definitely recommend this place.

BpQpQDqmHP7Esn26cOJjrw.text: BEST. MEXICAN. FOOD. IN. SUMMERLIN!  I saw this place every time I was going up or down Trop (we live nearby) and always wondered how it was.  Our friend told us she loves the place and we had to try it.  Ho-leeee Mo-leeeeeeee.  Their food is amazing. Authentic Mexican (we're from San Diego - we KNOW Mexican food).  I would go on and on and on about their food, but suffice it to say, EVERYTHING is beyond FRESH and DELICIOUS.  They start you off by not only bringing chips (which by the way are really good - not greasy, light and always fresh and hot), they bring you the salsa, some beans and a bowl of fideo soup.  If you haven't ever had fideo soup, you haven't lived.  It's so easy to scarf down those chips, so be careful!  I order the fish tacos - and I swear they make their own tortillas. I keep meaning to ask every time we're there.  If they don't - they're the best corn tortillas you'll ever eat in a restaurant.  My husband usually orders tacos, enchiladas, or burritos, and he's always loved what he's got.  Never one complaint about the food. And I'm picky.  Especially with Mexican.  I grew up eating it in Tijuana.    The best part?  AWESOME wait staff.  Never have to wait for refills, always checking on  you, and always very very pleasant.    Definitely check this place out if you've been curious. I wish I could give it more than 5 stars.

QwaV0x3OSHThKDNHtYAhCQ.text: Quickly seated. Enjoyed the Fajitas.  Great place knowing the food was fresh.  My entire family enjoyed our experience and will return on another vacation.

WmdWw-G0Lz-YBqYpFc0McQ.text: The staff is super friendly and the food is nothing short of AWESOME !!! I will definitely be back ... Thanks !!

mWxesUQwavCu2xPon2d1dg.text: 3rd time here from Los Angeles. Service has always been very consistent and excellent. Fajitas are awesome.

G_UQyr7QyWdY7zeKDlBdiA.text: Excellent Mexican food, your in for a treat when you come here. Staff is very attentive, food is superb, atmosphere is perfect. High marks all around.

zJSc5AahHWlYSz_M_pNEgQ.text: Stopped in at Juan's for a late lunch after a long flight home.  The food was delicious, our waiter was wonderful and the margaritas were superb.  Prices were fairly cheap considering the huge portions.  I left happy, full, and ready to return.

srWY4CuX6dzulr9UXXck1g.text: Okay, to be honest I was a bit skeptical of this place with such a high rating...but we just finished our meal and WOW! These guys are legit! Service was impeccable, food was divine, atmosphere was on point.  Chips with various salads and sauces, soup, even before your meal! We split an al pastor burrito and the steak fajitas. Seriously!!!!! So!!!!!!! Good!!!!!!  We also split 2 pitchers or Margs at such a good price.  We will definitely coming back. A near perfect dining experience. 5 stars guys. Keep it up.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eMVaT8utnvUHxbXDraaopQ.text: After playing a long Hold Em tournament I was craving some legit Mexican food. Wanted to eat something filling and great tasting. Honestly this place was good but not great.   I think because I live in So Cal and eat the best Mexican food (LA, SD, OC) of all time my review might not be fair. We literally have the best Mexican food in So Cal. It's hard to compete with the Mexican restaurants and taco stands in LA.   But this place has some legit food don't get me wrong. Service was also on point. Our server was very attentive and nice.   THE FOOD: I got the Shrimp and Steak Fajitas. It was good. Shrimp was better than the steak. Steak was a tad bland and being on the flame grill was a little overcooked.   My dad, mom and sister also got the Steak Fajitas and they felt the same. Nothing spectacular. But still good.   We all shared the Ground Beef Nachos. We all liked this dish. Very good appetizer.   This place definitely has a variety of more authentic Mexican plates with Pork, Chicken, Fish, and Beef as well as the more Americanized things like Tacos, Enchiladas and Burritos. So there's something here for everyone.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Shrimp Fajitas

S7ocbbfiKdx4WQ9hnCQOmw.text: Simply put, the "Best" Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas Valkey. You can check all the boxes, Service, Cleanliness, Great Chips & Salsa, On site made Tortillas, Great food, Great drinks, reasonably priced. #Boom

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juans Flaming Fajitas on West Tropicana. Muey Deliciosso

FkKJTS1jjWlWVd0zhJimNA.text: Hey when a restaurant's specialty is part of their name, it would be a good idea to make sure you order it without hesitation!  Juan's is known for the fajitas and it's because they are awesome. We had the shrimp fajitas for 2: Grilled onions and bell peppers garnished with sour cream, guacamole, beans, pico de gallo and corn or flour tortillas. Served with sopa de fideo.   Grilled peppers, onions, chips, salsa and bean dip are standard starters.  Without hyperbole I can say these are the best fajitas in town, the shrimps are large, plump, and perfectly cooked and the veggies are fresh and tasty.  Happy hour appetizers are outstanding-the queso fundido is excellent and the Mexi fries with Chile Colorado, Diced beef cooked in red chile sauce are a decadent double fried treat, think Mexican poutine!  Service is friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable. The decor is warm, clean, and comfy. The staff does a great job accommodating customers even at peak times when they are crowded. A popular place that does an excellent job.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary desert awesome!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexi fries, Mexican poutine!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp sensation!

c4LndhpQcbzUZ_GgHu1d-w.text: I've been to Juan's twice and am totally a fan!   - Love that bean dip and grilled jalapenos/onions are served with salsas & chips  - Guac was fantastic - delicious and fresh  - Fajitas lived up to the name! Presentation was great, came out on a cart and the server literally lit the entire dishes so that they were covered in flames. Shrimp was my favorite out of the three (chicken, steak, shrimp) however - all fajitas were well seasoned and full of flavor!  - Large portions - perfect for sharing  - Cadillac margaritas were dangerously tasty/strong   Colorful, fun decor and ambiance paired with yummy food, drinks and friendly servers. I look forward to coming back!

cKY84jFH7OrxXxXds0g7dg.text: Introduction:  I come here a minimum of once a week, no clue why took me so long to write this review.They have the best fajitas and 2nd to Javier's on their Carnitas, except a third of Javier's pricing.  Quality: 5/5 I usually have the Chicken Fajitas, which is OUTSTANDING.  However, their fish fajitas is even better if you like fish. My friend love their Carnitas, once again, it's way up there and we go to Mexican restaurants quite often.  Furthermore, they have amazing chips and salsas. The green one is to die for and their grilled onions & Jalepenos that serves  with the chips are also outstanding.  Customer Service: 5/5 Exceptional! From the moment you walk in, they acknowledged you loud and proud and makes you feel super welcome.   In addition, all their waiters and waitresses are Superb as well. They're both, patience (if you are picky like me) and very friendly.  Atmosphere: 5/5 I must say due to the friendliness and how accommodating everyone is, the atmosphere itself is great. From the volume of the musics to their playlist choices are also great. Makes you feel you're authentically and legitimately in Mexico.  The only thing I don't really care for is that you walk out smelling like fajitas, but that's not their fault cause they're so darn good that everyone and their mom is ordering them. So rating on everything else when it comes to atmospheres, it's an easy 5 stars rating.   Quantity: 5/5 Two words, too much. Yes, that's possible,  I am not complaining cause I always have enough to take it to go for next day's lunch or dinner & then some.  Price: 5/5 For what you're getting, service, atmosphere and their general portions, another easy 5 stars to give. Even minus the portions, they still get 5 stars cause their service and quality is that great.   Tips: They get very busy depending on the time of day you're going.  However, they are super organized and moves really fast. Definitely 110% worth the wait.

tOX0c2_Ul6Ie-iFK5HW5LA.text: First time here and the food was great. We ordered the shrimp ceviche, taquitos, carnitas quesadilla and a kids chicken plate that came with sopa de fideo. All of it was good even my sons fideo. Vegas is not known for their micheladas and theirs was pretty decent. Margarita was good and they have a great happy hour. Only complaint was the server was not very attentive but the bus boy named Francisco made up for it. He was awesome at attending to us. Great job Francisco!!!! Came today at 8/6/19 around 4pm.

wbj-uBZ3SA5QZRPvadi18w.text: The food is great!  It's so nice when you can enjoy some good Mexican food nearby!  Juan is that place!  From the chips and salsa to bean dip to ceviche to fajita's  All was so good and fresh tasting. They take such good care of you that you can notice!  La familia That's how it is, that's how it feels  It was our first time there but we'll definitely be back. Thank you Juan's for a great and delish experience. The food comes out quick and steaming hot! The smell is great and so is the restaurant itself. Muchas gracias por todo :)

baptBg9xPiCn4g2YywumDg.text: Very good fajitas and Jaunita at the bar was very nice also. I sat at the bar, it had a friendly comfortable vibe.  I recommend trying if you are into a casual fun Mexican place.

IxAopnVeSZuGwL_YwEE3vA.text: Worst experience today at Flaming Fajitas! I have been here many many times before, but I have never sat at the bar. Maybe that was my mistake.   I ordered a skinny margarita (from Flaco) to start which was extremely weak and I could not taste one drop of tequila. Then I waited and waited and waited for the bartender to acknowledge me so I could ask him to make it into a Cadillac (add grand marnier) and I also asked for a shot of tequila on the side as well so I could make it stronger. He took the margarita and added grand marnier but never gave me the extra shot.   Then the busser came over to drop chips and dips...my husband said, "oh, we didn't need any chips" because we told the bartender we wanted veggies to dip instead, and the busser walked away taking everything else with him as well. Then when my husband told him we only didn't want chips and we will take everything else, he got an attitude with him and myself like it was too much to ask.   Then we ordered queso fundido with mushrooms and corn tortillas. We received flour tortillas and we had to wait again quite a while for an acknowledgement by the bartender saying that we wanted corn tortillas...meanwhile cheese getting cold......he brings 3 corn tortillas, great! (There are 2 of us) So we eat two tortillas and then are waiting for an acknowledgement again....cheese is getting colder.....by this time, the cheese is too cold to eat because employees at Flaming Fajitas obviously can't do simple math and see that we are two people and maybe, just maybe, we would prefer an even number of tortillas. Also maybe, we would like enough to finish this damn cold cheese!!   I think I'm done with this place. There are too many other superior Mexican restaurants in Vegas to eat at without having to deal with clueless employees.

h2ZBEMepNlgEPUtRG4cB7g.text: On point, the taste, the atmosphere and the price. Happy hour is added bonus. Will recommend to all my family and friends

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very delicious and good flavor

Y8qlljGa4m4gzI3oFyMGWA.text: Love that they added the new phone system where they text you when your table is ready! The food is so good, portions are big and reasonably priced.

wXQYUqa7r4EBhNDv6OdVBA.text: I have to say this place had it dialed in.  Service was great!  Fajitas for 2 good value and good presentation! I could have used a little more seasoning or marinade on the steak to give it the extra flavor. Perhaps a little squirt of fresh lime would have set it off. Still good tho!  Chile relleno was/is  LEGIT! Truly the best in the Vegas!  Kid friendly  We will be back 4 sure!  Thank You for the great experience

We always order their flaming fajitas because that is what they are famous for. Everything is really tasty and hot.   For your birthday they make you wear a sombrero and give you a churro with whip cream. Super nice!

N3q6gMo298FqraLmkesmWg.text: Love this place, I've eaten at many Mexican restaurant and I have to tell you hands down the best food. The atmosphere feels as if you're in Mexico City. The employees are friendly and the service is on point. Reasonable price food and drinks, so If you love Mexican food I suggest you check this place out, and another thing, you may want to make reservation cause this place gets packed.

qqI5zOtE33hRQgolAJkRpQ.text: I see why this place had a line of people out the door at 4 PM - the food here is excellent! I sat at the bar to have an appetizer and some margaritas. They do run a happy hour special with five dollar margaritas. I will say, the margaritas for happy hour are weak. So I upgraded to the Cadillac peach margarita and it was awesome! Definitely worth the extra few dollars. The queso with chorizo was heavenly. It came with fresh warm flour tortillas and the portion was huge! It could feed three people. I was impressed also with the chips and salsa - the chips were fresh and thin which I really like. The fried onions and jalapenos that come with the chips is a nice complement. They were well seasoned and very tasty. I did not try the fajitas but they looked great, maybe next time!

xyQ4r3ErROvKUsa-qYpvPw.text: I want more!  I admit, I came for the giant flame.... and it was so worth it.  By the way, "Thank you," to the waiter who flamed my fajitas twice, while I got my camera ready!   So, I have lived in Mexico and my expectations are high when it comes to Mexican food.  They don't really have fajitas in Mexico, but the flavor and style of the food here, was FABULOUS.  In fact, the fajitas were AMAZING. The best I have had in a very long time. The sopapilas were a great follow-up as well.  Definitely save room for dessert!  The service was quick and friendly.  Much appreciated. Very laid back atmosphere.  If you like Mexican food, I highly recommend coming here.  Bring your appetite!

_bE3Koq4Un3osdxL9fxIcQ.text: The BEST Fajitas I've eaten in years.   I often forget to "check in," so this review is based on over 6-8 visits over the past year.   This past visit, the three of us had the combo fajitas plate for two, the happy hour chicken nacho plate, two glasses of house Cabernet and two large beers for....$67 total. Great price plus left overs!!   5 Stars AGAIN for food 5 Stars for CONSISTENT customer service from the door to the bar to the server. ALWAYS!!   I've always had a great experience. Tv's to watch sports, patio, safe parking lot, VERY family friendly.   Busy main street nearby so just watch when entering or leaving the parking lot. I suggest exit and enter on the slow residential street.   Check out my pics for the fajitas arrived bing to your spot at the bar or table.   If your vacationing in Red Rock/Summerlin area, and you have a desire for very good Mexican food...you'll be very happy.

yLOoBN4y12JcgnSPVaqKYg.text: So a friend insisted that I give Juan's another try, that maybe I had just visited them on a bad day...so I did, got a large bowl of Albondigas soup, the one item I raved about in my original review. 56IbysFV-Px8g1JPUqbNug.text: Love me some Juan's, my husband and I come here all the time! The fajitas are to die for! I do however wish the drinks were less pre made and more fresh juices but the happy hour is unbeatable so I won't complain! We bring our families here every time they're in town! We love it that much! Definitely one of my favorite places!

mOnc-tib-H7oney_fzsWHg.text: This is now my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas! I would always drive by and see the parking lot packed regardless of what day it was and a coworker mentioned it to me so I decided to try it out. I'm sooo happy I did. Last time I ordered the nachos which are big and amazing but on this visit I ordered the chicken fajitas. Whewww, this is a must order. The fact that the food was hot and fresh and they give you enough food to feed an army of people is the bonus! It came with soup, the most delicious beans, chips and salsa. It is worth the drive from whenever you are in Las Vegas.

LSuzgEMnuBM44_dRAF6qvw.text: Interestingly enough, I didn't realize I haven't written a review for this place. I have been multiple times and each time was as good as the previous visits, if not better.   Our favorite thing to get here are the fajitas. The shrimp and steak combo hits the spot every time! Fajita platters come with a side of rice and beans as well as guacamole. Of course it wouldn't be called Juan's Flaming fajitas without the fire show that accompanies it. It's worth getting it every time just for that lol. Portions are huge and very shareable.   Also worth noting is their happy hour everyday from 3-7. Plenty of food and drink options and a perfect place to just relax and unwind after a crazy week or day at work. It's a suitable place to have a get together with friends or to celebrate something. Reservations for large parties recommended obviously, they don't really like splitting checks but they'll work with you if you do it in groups. All in all a solid 4 and a place I see myself returning to over and over again.

Overall great dining experience with the family and next time we are in Vegas we will come again!

XcH2S_6Cx4B0KKNChbzxMQ.text: I was VERY uninspired about coming here due to the very cheesy name they chose for the place but I was made wrong once I ate here. Inside the waiting area isn't that larger so patrons are forced to wait outside the restaurant with no added seating while you wait for your seat.    Food is rather tasty and for what it is you'll be happy. The guacamole was super fresh, cold and seasoned well; as were the salsas they place on the table. Fajitas are really good and they're highly recommended.   Service was decent but could use some more training on table maintenance to ensure you have a full beverage, clean plates and utensils.  All in all good place to grab some grub

JgDjDFwEocaZoUHgxF7TTQ.text: Had dinner on Friday night with my wife and introduced another couple to the restaurant.  All they could do was rave about the food and service ... even after an hour wait to be seated.  Amanda, the General Manager, handled a problem with a patron with dignity and professionalism. She even came to our table and apologized for our inconvenience in hearing the heated conversation from the patron.  Miguel, our server, was very attentive, but not in the least bit obtrusive.  We will make this part of our dining out routine.  Harry G.

-c_j52_9QAoJXIfU7hlZzg.text: This is one of the best authentic Mexican resturants in Las Vegas. They are famous for their fajitas.  If you go on friday or the weekend be prepared to wait at least 20 to 30 mins.  They give you lots of chips, salsas, bean dip and grilled onions and jalapenos while your food is being prepared.   You won't be disappointed.

GX8ixj3BybxVwI6AyyjExg.text: Great Happy Hour!  $5 Margaritas and a good queso!  The Fajitas were great and True to form were flaming.  Location is nice but parking can be an issue.  If you can get there early!!!  Service was good, and they have outdoor covered seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UXXpVfndtvv9WM4MIEf3Zw.text: Arrived during a weekend night for my birthday dinner. The foyer was packed with patrons waiting for a table. Thanks to Terri R who made reservations days in advance. Once we told the hostess who we were they immediately took us to our table that already had menus, place settings, plus we each had our own chips, bean dip and salsa already set on the table! I had brought some cupcakes and the host offered to store in their refrigerator as well. What nice start! Menu featured their signature Flaming Fajitas, with choice of beef, pork,chicken or shrimp. You can do an individual order or a combo for two which included your choice of 2 meats. The latter being the better deal at $25.95. The extensive menu also included combination plates, vegetarian dishes, specialty entrees, tacos and enchiladas. Mr. B. got an order of tacquitos for appetizers. It was an unexpectedly huge order too. This alone could be a meal. It sure was plenty to share with our group. The complimentary bean dip was my favorite side. The beans whipped smooth and delicious! It was quite addicting. So our orders of the flaming fajitas were presented at the same time. All three were lighted simultaneously right at our table. Flames shooting a good 3 feet! You could even feel the heat! (instagram.com/p/jGA9r1jS... ) It went out like a flash and charred the fajitas perfectly. The beef was tender, well marinated, good southwest flavor and seasoning. Grilled onions and green peppers were right texture as well. We each had our fajitas in sterno heated griddles that kept our fajitas sizzlin throughout our meal. Service from beginning to end..MUY BIEN! Great teamwork by all staff. They were not only gracious enough to store my birthday cupcakes, little did I know my awesome friends also had a birthday cake for me which they not only stored but they provided the candles and brought out the cake lit up and sang HBD, maracas, sombrero and all! Atmosphere was festive and family friendly. Large dining area, can accommodate large groups. The bar is in a separate section. It's also cool place to watch sports with tvs around the dining area. So summing it all up: Festive + FUNtastic + Foodielious Flaming Fajitas + F(ph)enomenal Friends + Forty Niners(cake s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com...) = FIVE Star FAB Fifty Birthday dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sizzling!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas on fire!

ImjYqecgW6rP9NDl2CwCUg.text: Awesome place if you have patience to wait, yet well worth it. Everything is good from the fajitas to the churros, which are a must. Sometimes I just go for desert

U-04iNi6gNj48IaPKHplig.text: Gluten free friendly the shrimp are always cooked perfect. Chips come out hot. Love the grill onions and jalapeno on the side.

mHYfQooYOTgEQkRzbJrFLA.text: Best margaritas ! There food comes out fast and the waiter hernan is very nice love the people

INgDq4n1Qj0F1i50EulvPw.text: Juan's is ALWAYS busy because it's ALWAYS good. It's great food, but the excellent, friendly service is what keeps people coming back. I've been here dozens of times...date nights, with family, with kids, girls nights. Always wonderful. Try the shrimp ceviche!

TKxSVY1oqIigxiTfzmDjtA.text: Second part for Shirley B birthday party week. I got excited again too be trying out someplace new one that rave all about the Faming Fajitas. Need say more its all in the name of the restaurant. I never ordered the Flaming Fajitas. I felt like constant bonfires going off every five mins looking around the restaurant. So really hard not too order the star or show stopper but thankfully bunch of us so got too watch the show up close. I heard about looked and smelled great everyone said that it was really good.   What I did order was the Carne Asada Burrito. I loved it! The portion size is huge. I know its mexican restaurant so that really should not come as shocker. I felt like you got nice portion of rice and beans. Not only the size but everything on the plate had great flavors and really really good. The Carne Asada meat by itself was fabulous! The thing was the burrito was packed with meat more meat and went with the red not green chili.  The meat was nice, moist, well seasoned, and use base carne asada any style taco, burrito, or whatever be in Carne Asada heaven. The rice and refried beans had nice flavor. Sometimes go mexican restaurant taste very bland or feel like out of can. I felt like both sides freshly made each day. The guacamole was nice.   The chips and salsa start up with highly ADDICTING. The chips were nice, Hot, fresh and crispy. The salsa too the warm bean dip. Be warned might want too take it easy on the chips before your meal. No room for entree.  The service was awesome. We brought in two different desserts from outside businesses. They still more then happy too keep them refrigerated in the back until we finish with dinner. Missing candles they found two candles for us. The whole they never raised stink eye about us bringing outside stuff. The staff guess birthday they sing happy birthday and the birthday person gets too wear sambrero. We slowly but in time we all showed. I felt like they never rushed us too turn over our big table. Never empty glass of beverage or chips on our table the whole night. They more then happy too split our checks. Talk about reasonable family friendly prices. It been while since went too mexican restaurant but here at Juan Flaming Fajitas one that see coming back many more times.!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Fish Tacos! Three orders with rice and beans
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Burrito with rice and beans

m54fCpFqRXdewn485xOWWA.text: They have the BEST Mexican food in town. Period. There's no argument or debate, the rest are terrible. I know, I've tried them all. Originally from Southern California, Mexican food is not only a staple in my life, but it's also my favorite.   The low down:  Viva Mercados USED to have the greatest food, but they closed. Flaming Juan jumped onboard and kept the recipes and food alive in this new location and name. Viva Mercados eventually re-opened in a new location, but the food is awful. Like seriously terrible.   Bottom line:  Flaming Juan (yes I realize that's not the name technically, but this is MY review lol) has done a great job at reviving an almost lost and the ONLY decent Mexican cuisine in this dust bowl of a valley.   Favorites: Complimentary Fideo soup, green chicken tamale, fajitas (any kind), avocado tostada, happy hour specials, and anything with carne Asada.   The staff is usually very kind. Especially Juan (waiter, not manager), and Amanda. They're the best waiters.   * disclaimer * they've recently changed their bean dip and they need to change it back. It's missing something, maybe the pork it used to have, I'm not sure but that's the first sign of bad news if any.

0Uamczm1lfwo0cXaPQSOzQ.text: First plan ahead when wanting to visit. 30-40 minute wait was for us. Let me tell you it was well worth it. The food was amazing some of the best food I found in Las Vegas. The service was by far the best everyone was so nice you couldn't even believe you are in Las Vegas... blown away from everyone definitely coming back!

9oXyK0VtsLGIj_fxgpCt1Q.text: I can't wait for the new location to open on Water Street in Henderson!! This is my favorite Mexican place in town and we drive far to get to the other side of town for it! Yum!

dpebAqSTieV3JVi01WTHeA.text: This is my favorite Mexican food place of all time!! The quality of food is amazing and the customer service is above and beyond my expectations!! Normally there is a wait to be seated but it's totally worth it!! Can't wait to come back!! Harmon was our server tonight and did a wonderful job!!
