OuAMX3iU_yYK1yYR-DyX6Q.text: This place is sooo damn far from where I live so I wasn't sure if it'll be worth coming.. my friend recommended this place to me so I came with my cousins.. the staff is really nice our server was Herran.. he suggested some really good alcohol drinks and food.. he kept coming back to make sure everything was good and that we didn't need anything else.. if I'm ever on this side again I'll be sure to come again

8dgz94NvJS76_6Ec-R3GKw.text: EXCELLENT Always fresh and tasty. They first serve your table with chips and 2 salsas with beans and grilled onions and serranos. Then we always get the fajitas for two with steak and shrimp. It is always very tasty. Comes with sour cream, pico de gallo, guac, tortillas, rice and beans for each person. We dont live close so we have not tried their other menu items, but they all look great. Each time we have been here there has been live music. (GREAT AMBIANCE!) NOTE: Friday and Saturday nights for dinner can be 1-2 hour wait.

J3SiSX_hx16PHcHydWf1ow.text: We recently ordered a catering order for 60 people on a busy Saturday night. The food was packaged nicely, exactly as ordered, and great quality for the price. I definitely would use catering again at Juans and can't wait to return for our regular family meal!

L7M5wLE0xjbRLMWeG2VBMQ.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere complete with flaming fajitas of course, and super nice service! My husband and I had the queso for an appetizer which reminded us so much of the white queso dip you can get in the Midwest - but even better - and we shared the two person mixed fajitas with chicken and shrimp - again amazing!

sqOjXlqlcBZDjyLhwEhSqA.text: Pleasant people and generous servings. If you are hungry for Mexican food and nearby this is a good choice.   Pork Chili Verde for me and was impressed. Wife got  enchiladas and they were OK.

271clUBVwI7zhCgoKx6jvA.text: Best Mexican food in the city by far.   Come hungry and often.  The margaritas are equally as delicious.

lZJbu8TzIaJbxRGQb8Bvbw.text: Maybe the best Mexican food either my wife or I have ever had.  FOOD: 5-Stars. We filled our stomachs with the amazing chips & salsa & beans & grilled peppers/onions. We shared a Steak fajita plate for ONE and were stuffed.  Steak was real thick and real tasty.  DRINKS: After a day of sitting poolside all we ordered was water.  SERVICE: 5-Stars. Waitress had a great sense of humor and was very helpful. "This is great... pass on this... try this..." Even our busboy, Erick, was cheerful and attentive.  COST: I figured it would be $30+/-.  It was $17.25.   DEFINITELY COMING BACK!

BFFGfDf8gqXWifsuvBPH9w.text: It's been a while since I visited this place with my mom. We went on a whim because my mom likes fajitas, which is naturally what she ordered. I went for tacos and my sister sent for enchiladas. At lunchtime food was good and decently and appropriately priced and the fajitas presentation was FLAMING!! I think when I return to Vegas, I'll definitely want to come back.

8boWoTPl5NFpI9oSgZHIXw.text: It started off great! Fabulous customer service, very warm & welcoming. But as time went on, a few things happened. Our chips, fresh out of the kitchen...were stale. Not only were they stale but there were onions & green peppers (IN THE CHIPS)! How does that happen?! It was like someone threw it in there! Then! We watched a server clean the table with a rag from God knows where - without sterilizing the table. The veggies tasted like rubber & had no flavor. It's like they just microwaved the veggies...all in all, not clean & food was not worth $40 spent...Left extremely disappointed.

nxxALxW7v-qHYwERGbGgNg.text: I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. The only complaint I could ever have is the long waits at dinnertime, but it's worth it. I'm a fan of the fajitas with steak and shrimp, but I've tried many other items and loved them all! Great happy hour specials too. Also, I wish I could eat their salsa all the time because it's so fresh and delicious. :)

l9zbO4Kt8lsTrPWj7rJSFA.text: Best Mexican food in Las Vegas!  You must try their fajitas. Seafood fajita platter (Parillada de Mariscos) is my favorite with the Pork Chicarrones dinner a close second. Service is excellent.

XvFC4QXwRuFw0x3oHTH6Hw.text: First visit here and won't be our last. Love the complimentary salsa and bean dip and the fact they have special salsa for kids. The queso with carne asada was mind blowing it was so good. I have the steak fajitas, steak wasn't juicy as I would like. My husband had the chimichangas and loved them. My kids ate off the kids menu cheese sandwich which was on torta bread and my daughter had the taquitos. She loved the rice. Oh and the soup was very good as well. Service is outstanding very attentive. We had to wait a while for the food however they apologized to us. We also got churros not sure if that comes to everyone or due to our wait but better then Disney. Can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ha6sXwMXxxsVox8caLgJYA.text: 1st visit, Wednesday late lunch. Early Happy Hour specials today, good selection. Shrimp ceviche: $7.95 special, very good & large portion. Queso Fundido: $3.95 served in sizzling skillet, hot and delicious w corn or flour tortillas. Warm chips served complimentary w 2 salsas and a bean dip. 16oz margarita specials for $4, good but not very strong. Flaming fajitas, cooked already but quickly flamed tableside for show, kids would like it. Food was hot & tasty, excellent service. Good prices and a lot of food for the price. Will definitely come back!

WspzBEdiUbDLMkGxaImtdA.text: No lie, these are probably the best fajitas I've had outside of Cali. It might even be better than Cali. Everything is so fresh! I love how they serve roasted onions and jalapenos with the salsa and bean dip. Hubby had chile colorado and it was delish. I had the scallops and shrimp dish ( can't remember its name) and it was amazing.  But something about those flaming fajitas keeps me coming back.  And the house margaritas are awesome!!  Service is always on point! We're going back tonight and my mouth is already watering!

hAdUd9yxSfnLEU6SFC8UFg.text: Very good Mexican food, I would come back again.  Let's start off with the Chips and Salsa, you get bean dip and salsa.  It was good.  They carry Tecate in the bottle and that's my favorite beer period.  They give you Fideo soup (it's a tomato based soup with angel hair pasta) as a free appetizer.  I ordered the Steak Fajitas and shared it. It was great.  I took the advice of another Yelp user.  If it's in the name, order it.  I was not disappointed.  One of my other family members ordered Carne Asada and it came out a little dry and bland.  I've had that problem before with other Mexican restaurants so it's not that big of a minus.  Ideally, Carne Asada should be cooked well done and still come out flavorful and not dried out.    One of my kids had Chicken fingers and fries. The fries were a little over cooked. But as I usually say, you don't go to a Mexican restaurant for chicken fingers.  But like most smart Mexican restaurants, they put that on the kids menu for the kids who aren't craving Mexican food at the same time everyone else is.  I will come back again and try some of the other items on the menu.  Order the fajitas if it's your first time, you can't go wrong.

_rrmvwW6Boz1NPjOkI6A9g.text: Excellent and Flavorful! We got the flaming fajita for two and was well worth the money and we will Definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NAStiy9UnXPYAtH6axNZng.text: Yesterday was my 21st birthday so we decided to celebrate and have dinner here. It was the first time my family and I have been here but we've heard good reviews. We had about a 30 minute wait for a table which was not a big deal. So my mom and I went to the bar to order my first drink as a 21 year old. The people at the bar were super friendly and made it fun. The margaritas were super bomb, too. We got seated on the patio and our server was Christian. He was an absolute amazing server and made the night even funnier than it already was. He was on top of everything and just added in to how crazy and loud my family is. I love servers who know how to have fun with a family like mine. The food was awesome and I loved the experience. I'll definitely be coming here on my Friday's for a margarita and some queso dip lol. Love love love

5avWOcwwhmCV7Eyricc5tQ.text: Sebastian was an amazing server! The shrimp fajitas were heavenly. Tried this place on a whim and it happened to be $4 margarita Wednesday. So good! Can't wait to come back!

Pn1MSvqiz1n-FRy2miSipg.text: Excellent customer service. Fajita's are great but so are a lot of other menu items. One of the few Mexican restratunts in Vegas where my husband can get broccoli. Everyone leaves happy!! The happy hour specials are large portions and consistantly tasty.

rAd7pAOEeewnF_A_cLV9Yg.text: Great food-active and colorful environment! Service is fast-but restaurant is a little loud.

h8OOIpIAVbI-YAaztZjNnw.text: Don't let the outside appearance fool you like it did me! It's next to Inn N Out so I've driven by it a hundred times, but never had the desire to check it out, even tho my mom heard thru the grapevine how good this place is, my loss. I had the steak fajitas and they were soooo YUM-EEEE! Very tender and flavorful. Don't get me started on their chips, salsa and bean dip because I couldn't stop! To top it off, the prices are reasonable. There were 6 of us and the bill came to $80 something, and we left stuffed and with leftovers. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hwW0KFUeBbSqGaEU2tpHgg.text: Last night was our first time here and we loved it, friendly service on arrival and once we were seated we were brought chips and 3 different dips! We were then brought complimentary soup which was tasty and my 7 month old son loved it!! Since we were at flaming fajitas I wanted to try them and they didn't disappoint! I got shrimp and they were the best my husband and I have tried for a long long time! I think he wishes he'd gotten them too! Overall a really good dining experience and we will go back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

D5tgVzkanY_c9lh9CuYsOQ.text: Fun atmosphere (indoor/outdoor seating), family friendly, great food, great service, clean facility.

P_YiCGs1UomTmCeVQLHHPQ.text: The best Mexican food hands down. I don't like Mexican food typically, but this place is .

LBYKD2jHpbp4Whrl_d355Q.text: I've been going to this place for a couple years now. The food and service is always on point. I wish I could give it 6 stars. The sopapillas are bomb too.

p3o8Gp608x5U9cdmNrLuIQ.text: Got away from Ventura and was in LV for Memorial Day Weekend.  Hit this spot Sunday for dinner.  Great environment, staff and food was just great.   Great chips, salsa as well.   My kinda place for sure.  But expect some wait bc this joint seems to be popular *(but well worth it for all of us that went) A++++

Umngbmhbi4hPfVoEN0ERBA.text: Juan, there were two fires lit at lunch today, one on my amazing shrimp fajitas and one in my pantalones... for that I am grateful as is my bf. You can light my fire any day!

7hx2hZixycDBcJxPHS0eGQ.text: Every time I come back to visit vegas Juans is a must! Hands down one of the best Mexican restaurants out there!

YE3KreVmQHa9awLfsUiLtw.text: Once again another  phenomenal dinner experience . My wife and I shared parrillada de mariscos for 2 and it was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GGMfS8XWXgsPh-P8VECjoQ.text: What a nice surprise coming off a 5 hour flight from NJ. Did a Yelp search for Mexican restaurants and Juan's came up so in True Las Vegas fashion we rolled the dice only this time you stand to win a delicious meal instead of losing a couple of grand. The service was excellent and the Fajita for two was a great value for portion , quality and overall flavor. I think we'll pop in again before we go home on Saturday. Go Now ! J

bW8t3s5o597JULm1UCBtVw.text: I loved this place! The complimentary appetizers & entree was delicious! The service was good! I would highly recommend!!!

jsvrwf2TqaYHBeAN3b3uHw.text: Very delicious food, friendly staff, clean environment. We ordered the steak fajitas & it was delish. The soup, can't remember what it's called but it was delicious. The refried beans was so creamy & yummy. We will definitely come back soon.

uWU_WpypMLAuND3-SMLeYQ.text: This is was eh, ok. Not eh, I've had better, and not A-OK. It was eh, shoulder shrug.  Came here for dinner with some awesome peeps, Anthony (always fabulous), Cathy and Mark. The company was great. We always have a fun time.   The service was good, above average. However, $15.95 for beef, chicken or pork fajitas seems high to me. ($1 extra for shrimp). For a combo it's $25.95 (again a buck more for shrimp). The side of guac and sour cream wasn't enough (I mean is there ever enough sour cream? Me thinks not). The fajita's tasted OK. But, for a place that specializes in them, I thought they'd have more wow. They serve horchada which I love. And even that didnt impress me. It tasted weak and strong on cinnamon.  They do serve complimentary chips, salsa and beans. I happened to like the beans, but the salsa wasn't good. I wouldn't say it's expensive necessarily, but it's certainly not cheap food. I wont say I'll never come back, but it's not a place I'll be back any time soon.

5joqCfORK38NSe4pT2SKKA.text: The atmosphere is very lively and the food was very delicious!  Prices are very reasonable!!! The staff were all very friendly and speedy service!  Highly recommended if you're in the SW area of town! Thank you for a wonderful evening! Keep up the excellent work!

lDSL5q-sZgjt3sGv0TOZvw.text: After coming here a few times, I think the best time to come here is during happy hour, which goes from 4:00pm - 7:00pm daily.  Some of the highlights:  Import Draft Beers: $3.50 for 16oz or $4.50 for 20oz Well Drinks: $3.50 Margaritas: $3.50 for 12oz or $4.50 for 16oz Fajita Quesadillas: $6.95  Come in during happy hour, and for around $20 or so you can have quesdillas, free chips and salsa/beans, and three drinks.  Not bad at all.  Outside of happy hour I've had their fajitas: beef, chicken, pork, and shrimp.  The fajitas are decent, but not necessarily something to go out of your way for.  The fajitas for two combo is about $25, which really can be enough for three people if you keep snacking on the chips and dips.  Again, not really good enough to warrant going out of your way for, especially since they close pretty early.  Fridays and Saturdays they close at 10:00pm, the rest of the week they close at 9:00, so unless you're in the area you'll want to be sure to come here early.

XbN1UD0uIbEhIqSJYw1G3w.text: This place is great. Hey have a pretty extensive, authentic Mexican menu and it's very affordable. I had the shredded chicken burrito with vegetables. We also had Enchiladas Suizas, which I regretted not getting (they were killer). The staff was great to my kids and they were super attentive. The bar is separate from the main part of the restaurant so it's more quiet if you like that. Drinks were great too. Bathrooms were very clean which speaks highly of the staff and management. I think our waitress' name was Patty and she was very nice! Good little place to eat!!

gCh8m1W0nDS3h0X2i9imBQ.text: Second visit and second time we had Omar as a waiter. Omari's great. He is a gentleman, personae and professional. The food was fantastic. Had the New Mexican enchiladas. I thought that I was back in Santa Fe. Wonderful restaurant.

ncG5m5Ft7BAVghlHPdRKeg.text: Man this place blew me away. Didn't expect to be that good but it was even better and then some. Was freakin delish lol

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada burritos, part of the Mexican Combos, very good

lEeW_vNTQktZ7io2Ygfm_Q.text: This place is wonderful! My husband and I decided to try this out for our Wednesday night date night and went for happy hour....service was fast, food was delicious! We sat on the patio and it was such a beautiful day. I got the Steak Fajitas which were the absolute best I have ever had. The steak melts in your mouth and is so tender and the peppers and onions were cooked perfect! My husband got the Steak Chimichanga and it was so flavorful and the best we have ever tasted. The margaritas on happy hour are a great deal and we got the Sopapillas for dessert. They were so delicious and made you feel so happy! I would give this place 6 out of 5 stars if I could. Love love love and will definitely be back!

54QV-RzOs3rajA0PtpRpMQ.text: The best place for fajitas I been here for more than 3 times and is always great food and service keep up. .

5x95OHjOP1260XckKgnjgQ.text: This place is our go to spot for quality authentic Mexican food. Omar is awesome and the rest of the staff . The margarita are awesome and potent . All and all an awesome place to go if you are hungry and /or thirsty

F5krKMaD4DqmAeScRsc7Jw.text: We live close by so we are here for dinner at least every month. We love it and our kids love it. The food is always great and the staff is always so friendly. Tonight we got takeout and it was excellent! They gave us a huge bag of chips along with salsas, bean dip and soup. Everything was so good just as if we were sitting in the restaurant. Highly recommend this place.

NtkQXC4M1Sw9Q11LlPm0iQ.text: Really good service and the fajitas are great. Huge portions - you won't leave hungry!

D0zof2iNVPX9w1UrmLsfFA.text: Okay, I consider myself a huge fan of Mexican food... We drove 17 miles for this place. Shoulda saved the gas and money. The waiter did give us 5 dollars off. Anyway, the queso fundido was awesome. The bean dip with the chips is flavorless. We got the famous flaming fajitas!! Pork and chicken. Chicken was okay..pork was horrible nasty dark fatty chunks. The fajitas were not seasoned in any way. I got the veggies with mine and took one bite... Ugh no flavor either. Tried salt and pepper didn't help. Also how can you mess up fideo soup?!? I don't know but theirs is no bueno. Was really hoping for a great fajita place but not here!!

Y4XhUj6HGvLsjrUXuVYaZg.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant. we came in at lunch time and the place was poppin! We were promptly seated and served warm chips with several different salsas, refried beans and fresh roasted chiles. Mmmmhmm so yummy all the salsas, I smashed on two baskets of chips it was so good. I order a chile relleno lunch plate, hubby ordered the chicken asado it was all so flavorful, fresh and made my tummy happy! I ordered a medium sized pozole to go bc the reviews said it was yum. Next day I reheated it in a pot and dumped the fixings on top. It was amazing, wish I had ordered the large to go. We'll be back, the service was great, never had an empty glass nor did we run out of chips :)

Shsv7Dks4aDwbnZtYKX2vw.text: The service is pretty aggressive. I ordered a special meal because I have health restrictions the order was wrong and I became very ill.

H9vcLh7JB--jGvYEmP5SLQ.text: After reading all the reviews on Yelp, I made it a priority to make this my first stop after my conference.  Arriving on Tuesday afternoon, the place was packed.  The hostess recommended I sit in the bar area.  Unfortunately, the table they sat me at was right by the door going out to the patio, so cold air would rush in every time they opened the door.  I ordered a house margarita, which was pretty good.  Chips and 3 types of salsa came out soon after.  The salsa was mild.  I ordered the flaming steak fajitas.  It came out 10 min. later, I was still working on the chips and salsa.  One observation about the fajitas, is that they didn't have a lot of seasoning to it.  Besides that, it was some good fajitas.  My waiter Sebastian was very accomadating.  Other staff members stopped by the table to see how I was doing, I was never left alone.  Probably will go back, next time I'm in town.

0Di_gKi6j9hSjUc1lpR67A.text: First time here, and we were not disappointed!!!  Food 100% on point Service 100% Ambience casual- business casual Kid friendly and love music which was very lovely! Thank you for a great time!! Thank you Christian!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much food!!!

dY8Aoz3RMPACGIButxR_Xw.text: Great food and drinks.  The flaming fajita for two is more than enough for two people.  You also get chips and salsa and a soup with your meal.  The lime chicken for the fajitas is the best.    Summerlin Approved!

McrA_l6HaR7qsgntAd9o1Q.text: Wow! Came here on Cinco de Mayo knowing it would be a long wait and I am so glad we did! This place is so delicious and they are all so nice and our drinks never we're empty... Large portions and authentic food! We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aftermath

SDePldnZCQZJqc1QO6zGvQ.text: Good fajitas and Mexican.  Shouldn't be so hard to find good Mexican in this town.  Thank goodness this place is here.  Good job,  thx

AdrqA7e3lLvjDvk590KNUQ.text: Frank & Fina's used to be my go to Mexican sit down restaurant in town until I discovered Juan's. The name is super cheesy but it's the closest I've found in LV that I feel is similar to the food in San Diego that I grew up on.   I like that they give you bean dip and onions with your salsa and that it's not too salty. Though, it'll make you eat more chips than you'd like!   I had the best carnitas plate here. Soooo good. Crips edges and moist pork.....that's my favorite thing there!  Of course, the margaritas are great and the service is always quick and super friendly. Love!

sLu0z7nCzjExsE4fYwScfA.text: If you want amazing fajitas try Juan's Fleming! Not a big fan of Mexican restaurants since I would rather eat homemade, however their fajitas and drinks are great! You'll feel the buzz with the first drink. Been here twice and I'll probably keep coming back! Plus on Sundays they have live music on Sundays. Service is always great, nice and friendly staff.

bz7Zy-0_SMS4_4ZR3TaoDw.text: Great service,  great prices for the amount of food and quality... One of the best happy hours in the neighborhood. You can't go wrong with this place.

7t5pDBUuz-pwhWMIH1q9YA.text: In a city that's known for treating people well, Juan's is the best. Everyone is so busy, so helpful, and all are concerned with the quality of the food, service, and the whole experience. Juan's people are the best!  The food is great, and the atmosphere good too. TV's all around, and a great place to spend some time over margaritas and quality Mexican food. You won't be disappointed.

ND0U4Yb37wsVdkN-SARLPQ.text: Wow, probably the best Mexican food we've eaten in the Las Vegas area and right at the top of the best we've had anywhere!  The flaming chicken fajitas for two were absolute perfection.  Great service, too.  We will certainly have to eat here one more time before we leave the area.  We will make sure to come hungry, very hungry!!

cjk1J5qEbnq5ovz84SK3XA.text: Javier,Gustavo and the hosts are so amazing here! They were so personable. We have been wanting to try this for a long time sooo we decided to have a cheat day today;) and wow it was so worth it! Everything we tried was beyond amazing. Amazing food and great service we will be back with family and friends for sure! Thank you for such a great lunch!

b8eHKTv7AduCa5zrWJ9BDA.text: Very good and the best hospitality I've had in s while  You got to try the fajitas their to die for lunch they have great specials

ooCCl3IRyHhLNvUOqYV4uw.text: Omg! Like they say! Flaming fajitas is real authentic Mexican food! They are crazy busy..y cause they Rock! Our waitress claire was fabulous! She didn't rush us we told her we're not in a hurry! Manager Ruth check on us! I thought she was the hostess!! She is amazing mgr and our waitress and her bus boys! Tremendous!! Bartender on it!

evUgOrNQRGepCko5BtfJGg.text: Excellent food and Service!! Fajitas are one of a kind!!  Can't wait till the wait for the Henderson Location is shorter than 2 hours... so we can go there.  Much closer to home.

eQjeFBlSOZoPgHIF1MFHNw.text: Finally was able to try this place out. Once we entered and greeted by a couple of workers we were seated in 20seconds. Then our server introduced herself and made us feel welcome and took our drink order. Since it was Happy Hour we had their house made margaritas and was very pleased.  Everything was delicious especially their famous Flaming Fajitas. I opt for the steak fajitas and enjoyed every bite. The meat was well seasoned and wasn't over cook but consistent and flavorful especially the grilled veggies and I was surprised with the portion size for a single serving of fajitas.  My sister and I shared a Flan for dessert and didn't regret it, because it was simply amazing especially since we had one in awhile. The soft texture and not so sweet caramelized sauce was perfect.  Our server Noemi was very friendly and energetic like the majority of the employees including a manager on staff. From the outside it look like an average size restaurant but it's large and broken into three sections: Main Dinning room, Bar room & Patio facing Tropicana. Will be back in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Flan!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single Serving of Steak Fajitas w/ Rice, Beans, Salsa, Guacamole, Sour Cream &amp; Tortillas(flour or corn).

rzDbTNC6mc5ToRkiVlM6vg.text: Iv been here a few times I dont see what the hype is personally..the place is small and they try to pack u in like sardines..we went a Saturday night we waited a hour for a table..after we got the table the place was so packed people's backsides were in front of our table waiting to get seated(not something i wanna smell during dinner) the food is cheap and tastes cheap   The service is ok but its like their  rushing you the whole time to get you in and get ur butt out the place is just ok...prolly wont be back i can tell all the crap is out of a can.drinks are cheap but id rather pay extra $4 to be comfortable   Personally i work to hard to not have a great dinning experience u feel Like ur in a high school lunch room

N8INrEGAcz9sbDvtMM6N2g.text: Although the food is really good and the service is amazing, there is something that really bothered me and that is the wait to get in and eat. Now if you want to avoid a wait most of the time you make a reservation. We called to try to make one for 4 people because when we went there last time it was a 40 min wait and that is just ridiculous when you can avoid all of that and make a simple reservation. When we called to ask they said you can't make a reservation unless it's 10 or more people??? So ummm they think people are just going to wait 40 min or more just to eat... I don't think so. Just a suggestion they should definitely let anyone make a reservation no matter how many people are going to be eating.

vjTo_iZjQ0Ef6uEFZzJgYA.text: My last review was about 3 years ago! This place is very consistent. Staff has changed a bit but still all are very nice & attentive. The Chicken fajitas are still amazing! I always love that first bite when that beautiful citrus marinated chicken hits my taste buds. The flour tortillas are made in the restaurant. That's always a plus in my book. The margaritas are great but decided to be brave & tried the pina colada margarita. I'm in love! The best of both my flavor worlds! The green salsa is awesome!!! I always ask for an extra side to take home. I don't mind an extra fee-give me a big one. My only complaint is that we don't go as much as we used to because they are always so busy! Good for you Juan!!!

1iY5GKyHMgEnfTzdpDBn8A.text: We've been coming to Juan's for years and LOVE THIS PLACE.  People are talking about water stains in the bathroom and food not having enough salt. Smh do you go there for the bathrooms or the food? If you need more salt im pretty sure theybhave salt shakers on the table. Stop looking for a comp meal. We wont stop going there. I think we'll go today for dinner.

DcMid8qhW7L9CKinGMnlLg.text: I'M A FAN!!  I have had Juan's bookmarked for a long time, but haven't made it because it's on the other side of town from me. Well, the time finally came and my boyfriend and I were craving fajitas.  We waited about 10 minutes for a table, which is amazing because this place is HUGE and it was very busy. The staff is all super friendly and everyone we encountered was amazing.  They have a lot of options on the menu, beyond fajitas. We ordered the queso dip to start and went to town on the chips and salsa (big mistake!). We then decided to share the steak fajitas for 2, which is SO much food. I love the presentation - they wheel up a cart to your table and set your fajitas on fire. Pretty cool. Each person gets a plate with beans/rice and sour cream/guac. This was way too much food for us and we ended up taking quite a lot of it home.  I have a theory that there is always room for ice cream, so of course we ended the meal with fried ice cream.  Overall, I really enjoyed our experience at Juan's and we will definitely return!

wyJ0Eh29PuUPcEq4cf5IuQ.text: I could eat here for breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack time, bed time, WHATEVER. SO GOOD !

IGjoYqvP6loQ-2lJI3E7KA.text: Really good food, shrimp fajitas and Carne as ada were delicious! Service was great. Only complaint is its super smokey inside and the smell stays in/on your clothes and hair, they need better ventilation.

zx1_0PRM9sq2OfqqiKsddg.text: So I should have ordered the fajitas.  They look and smell amazing.  I work graveyard and I was craving my standard a chimichanga.  But I thought I would throw caution to the wind and also order a fish taco.   So I have never been here before and I show up at 1pm and I am seated in the bar.  Holy cow, if I knew that the chips and salsa and beans and grilled onions and peppers were showing up I would have NEVER ordered so much food.  Either way....... My chimichanga was served with some kind of red sauce on it.  Not like advertised which said it would be served with guacamole and sour cream.  I really did not care for it.  My fish taco was right next to this red sauce drenched chimi, so I couldn't even pick up the taco.  The fish was blah and semi cold.  I was not impressed.   My service was impeccable.  I will be back to give it a second chance.

MRT8pyh2EgcrxEpIKkRdcw.text: Very good place to go eat the fajitas and just the food they bring out looks amazing homemade tortillas you can tell the Authentic Mexican flavor Food there and the service is very good they have great management with great management skills and no one is left behind everybody seems to work together as a team and it's good to see as I frequent many Restaurants in town

FNk3a6XMwu_c_Syo2NM3mA.text: Great fajitas!  Great presentation.  We will definitely come back again.  Great job "Yelpers".

WgcsyCSyJNZ8J02Tx7Ry6A.text: I cannot tell you how much I love this place. We have been here 3 times in the last week alone.  I'm not alone in feeling this way because it is packed when we go. Love the two different salsas they serve (one red and mild and the other is greenish and has some heat) with the chips and also the bean dip. My kids eat it with a spoon, it's that good.  My husband and I share the Guadalajara special. It's carne asada covered in melted cheese with shrimp and scallops on top, sitting in a spicy white sauce. It is magical!  We've also split the carne asada a la tampiquena and that is in a red sauce (not spicy at all) with shrimp on top and an enchilada on the side. Also, amazing.  The kids split the carne asada on the kids menu and it's a good amount of meat for a child entree.  I'm scared to give such a good review because it's just going to get busier (parking is a drag), but they deserve it!

YtAHEAQznZ52ZqNi6ARWOw.text: Great fun place always enjoy it here. Great margaritas and appetizers. Really good place to take guest from out of town. The flavor of Mexico in Las Vegas

YaWiKY14pHF1fOlOFX4fDA.text: Top notch Mexican food just 20 minutes off the Vegas strip.  My lady and I were tired of the over priced and underwhelming options on the strip, so we swung out in the rental to hit a few desert parks on the outskirts on Vegas, hitting Juan's for dinner on the way back.  Juan's did not disappoint.  We sat in bar area, as main dining area was full.  Waiter took drink orders immediately after we sat, then after offered good suggestions on the menu items. Another waiter brought a big bowl of chips with 3 different salsa, some melted cheese, some beans, a plate of fried onion, and a plate of nice hot peppers, a nice damn little meal by itself.  An appetizer of ranchers taco's was 6 excellent tortillas fried crispy filled with shrimp.  We both had Jalisco style platters, she had steak Monterey style, loaded with peppers. onions, and monterey cheese, myself the chicken poblano, a deep, dark mole sauce with sesame seeds.  Both came with a cup of soup, beans and rice and were more than ample sized, that we had take out to drop in the cooler for a morning snack in the desert.  Fairly priced, superior customer service by the wait staff and great portions of real hearty Mexican food and non watered down drinks make this a must stop anytime I am in the Vegas area.

lD6_qv1jzLtgpCqAWfjZDg.text: It was our first time eating there and we had such a wonderful experience. We had a party of three and the hostess was very courteous. The wait was maybe 5 min on a Saturday night. To be honest, we got so full before our entree even came! Hubby and I shared a steak and shrimp fajitas combo. When we sat down, our waitress quickly took our drink order. When she returned, someone also brought chips and salsa. He brought a mini bowl with no spice for our son just in case and a side of grilled onions and jalapenos which was super yummy. We ordered a chicken quesadilla appetizer, which I completely recommend! The quesadilla was HUGE and the chicken was flavorful. Our entree came with a side of fideo soup and they even offered to refill our basket of chips and salsa, but I was already feeling stuffed and our entree hasn't come yet so we declined. I thought I was a nice gesture because from entry, their staff seemed like a we'll oiled machine in customer service. The wait time for all of our food was minimal. The fajitas were superb and it came with a size of tortilla, rice, beans, sour cream, Pico and guac (my choice). I can't wait to come back to try other things on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DPj39mig6G2swKlqsQKcCA.text: I have been here twice now, the first time if I was to rate it I would of given it a 5/5, last time we were on the barside maybe that is why. But the last time I went here it was such a let down. I had a group of four for lunch at 2 pm, we were all seated quickly. Nobody really enjoyed the food all found it bland and the server refilled my drink wrong. I am not sure what happened from the first time I was here. My dads order was wrong, my food didn't come out as I ordered. He forgot our sides that we had asked. Maybe It just wasn't their day today.  and to make it worse, it was EXTREMELY cold in here. Like everyone was runny nose cold. I was literally freezing. and my dad who keeps the house at 68, was even cold and the man never gets cold.  Everyone is extremely welcoming and nice though. Just maybe caught them on an off day.

_rrNk1Sllw7ydHngBzB81g.text: Excellent! Good choice of different salsa and they are all very good. The service is great the food is good!  You cannot go wrong if you come to this place and you want good Mexican food...

A437JICJNJuvzveiBRy3mw.text: This is my 4th time coming to Juan's and the food never disappoints! My family and I had excellent service consistently, but our server, Christian, was just downright awesome!! Very attentive and extremely kind. We definitely will be coming back!

atezfeltMA4AIEXukUAX7g.text: Yajaira is amazing!!! Food is amazing!!! Love this place. Happy Hour is everyday 3-7. I can't think of a better way to spend the day!!

o7R3V85jPMlnj1XYr-_bxQ.text: Ya friend, you're gonna wanna go here, and often! Homemade flour tortillas and truly amazing dishes, cheerful service, you won't be disappointed.

o7wbqhnTLdIPOBty8JcEQA.text: The wait time here is crazy long and people are happy to do it. I waited 45 minutes for a table.  Other people were putting their names down to wait an hour!  Come with an empty stomach because their fajitas are amazingly good and the flambe show is free.  Dinner starts with tortilla chips and a variety of dips and salsas.  All of their fajitas come with a noodle soup and your choice of rice, beans, and wraps. The sopa de fideo is delicious.  I had the chicken fajitas.  My friends had the steak and shrimp fajita combo.  They just might be the best fajitas in the world.

coWRsaEoH4jPLCx-YLTF6w.text: This was amazing. Frozen margaritas   Awesome chips, salsa and some little plate to roasted peppers   Quite possibly the best fajitas I've ever had (set on fire table side)   Thank to to Yelp for helping us find this little gem

UxSwsqMJ5GUfXPD4hibIiA.text: Amazing food, Yajaira is an great server, loved the atmosphere. Ordered the enchiladas, would recommend to anyone trying this place for the first time. Cannot wait to come back for some great food next time.

YOiK3aVSyVkhTt2KqMqKNg.text: The prices were very reasonable and the menu was great! I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the margaritas were amazing.

FzlksUhsYvijAq-wpfZYrA.text: Great place to eat  the food is amazing , great costumer service,  we always feel welcome here ,my wife and my kids love this place , Ernan is our favorite server,  great guy and very friendly.   Whoever is running this place, is doing a great job ! Highly recommended! !!!!

r9JyV--TpTsoaSPOXNJwKg.text: It's rare I ever write a good review on places but wow this place is amazing they start you off with chips with 3 different sauces which is nice I like different varieties and then the fajitas was what I came for and they light it on fire and are very friendly the staff here are always busy and even though they're busy they still find time to ask you for refills and if you need anything else. Next time I'm in vegas I'll definitely be back here again to try the whole menu out :)

BfSbb5vTFCEWEDzlVWciWw.text: I feel like I need to visit this place a 2nd time to give it a good sound review but I really don't know when I would get an urge to come back again. I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and although it's only 5 minutes from my home, it has taken me at least a year to finally make the trip. It might be because I've pretty much given hope on Mexican food in Las Vegas and rather just wait till my trips back to Texas to satisfy my cravings. Well unfortunately Juan's Flaming Fajitas has not changed my outlook on Mexican food in this city.  They provide salsa and refried beans with a basket of chips for you to snack on while you wait. I really liked the salsa but I wish it was a bit more spicier. Or just spicy in general. Kudos to them for being on point with switching out our baskets as we were close to running low on chips.   I think these places are smart to provide free chips and salsa because it almost makes you lose track of time of how long your food is getting to the table while you're snacking away, this trickery didn't work on our party though! It took quite some time for us to finally get our food and when it did, 2 of the 4 dishes were already cold leaving it unappetizing -- cold burrito with hardened cheese and soggy fries in the middle? No thanks. 2 of the dishes down, and leaving one of our friends running to the restroom right away. Yikes.  Luckily I was on the (somewhat) winning side of the order. I ordered the Taco Salad which wasn't bad, but how do you really mess up a taco salad anyway? And it sitting out too long doesn't affect it too much, only made my lettuce a little wilted but didn't completely ruin my meal. My friend ordered the fajitas and although it's pretty cool they have it at high flames next to your table, I honestly think it's just for show and does nothing really special for the dish itself other than warm it up again. They then place this giant cauldron with the fajitas sitting on top of it in front of you, taking a large amount of space with little room left for the other people at the table or even (large) side dishes like your beans and rice.   The prices weren't terrible and it seemed as clean as it could be. I don't think this place is an ultimate failure, we just didn't have the best first experience. Sadly it's the first impressions that matter the most right? So I have to confidently say that it will be quite some time till I feel I can go at this again.

PayGzShci71ESfQ3MNS3EA.text: I just celebrated my birthday at Juans, my favorite restaurant! The staff really took excellent care of us we were never without anything we needed. They are fantastic ! A special thanks to Amanda and all the staff, you guys rock! All my friends really loved the great food drinks and service

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome bday at juans

RXQlm5CagGVUSU2Vh3qMkA.text: Best place to go for the margaritas and food!!! We love it here and it is always packed!! We hate crowded places but this is worth it haha chips and salsa, and there bean dip is what we usually get full on the take our dinner home haha it's so good. One of our favorite food places in Vegas

9uDwNfJP5MLBfwhILxbhIQ.text: The best fajitas in town, my husband and I love this place also the Margaritas are ridiculous good...

EjxqTnR-PFJ351L5qInwnA.text: Omar is an amazing server. Love this place! Weekends are very crowded for dinner so expect a wait time.

L6nmxeS0zsFX-Tx_k-NVrw.text: AYYYYY MUCHO CALIENTE PAPIIII~!!!! haha I have been wanting to try this place just because the pictures look so darn cool! Coming in I knew that we just HAD to try the flaming fajitas I mean if it's in the name of the restaurant then you should probably try the dish right? HAHA Walking into the place it's your typical family run Mexican joint nothing fancy but it was very clean and colorful. There is a full bar and patio area to the left and then the main dining room is comprised of both tables and booths.. I even think they have a little dance floor area. We ordered: -Table-side made Guacamole: ($7.95) They make it exactly to your liking so if it tastes bad it is your own fault! -Chicken & Beef Flaming Combo Fajitas for Two: ($25.95) I don't even like fajitas but these were so good. Good quality meat and you gotta love the little fire show that you get.. I love that the plate is indeed sizzling and pretty much stays sizzling so your meat/onions/peppers stay hot! -Combo comes with guacamole, pico de gallo, sour cream, rice, beans or you can substitute the rice+beans for VEGGIES yay.. I love how they bring 2 separate plates of these instead of 1 to share between the 2 people! Combo also comes with a choice of corn or flour tortillas (6 total!) -Complimentary Fideo soup which is like a tomato based soup with some noodles.. was a little salty for me but I still liked it! -Complimentary Chips, Salsa & Bean Dip: The chips were mixed with the standard yellow chips and red and green chips.. served warm but not oily.. The salsa tasted fresh and was not too spicy and the bean dip was a little too salty for me but still tasty! On the menu it says the first round is on the house but that they charge after that.. They asked us if we wanted a refill and I said yes but they didn't charge us so maybe it's 1 per person? Awesome friendly service from all of the wait staff.. Food took a little bit longer than I had expected but I didn't really notice since I was too busy munching on chips.. I told Juan I found them through Yelp and he said Yelp has really helped them.. I definitely recommend trying this place out.. If you don't like fajitas they have a bunch of other items (no a la cart items though) & they have a daily HAPPY HOUR 3-7! HOT TIP: print this coupon before you go.. I forgot to print mine so they didn't accept it but oh well haha: mobileapp.moneymailer.co...

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Will not honor this coupon unless you print it out ~!!!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

6mVwTBwOVQvPwXCq9LzD_Q.text: Great service, smiling faces, delicious food and great atmosphere! Amazing happy hour deals and did I say the food was deliciousness!!!!!! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Gatorade and chips and salsa!

hOhmYbLgtIf3nQNF0SPl5g.text: Trying to figure out exactly how, and why, this place is so highly reviewed. Honestly, it feels like a Mexican version of Claim Jumper. Portions are too large for an average-sized diner; hence, both my date and I felt guilty for leaving such large portions on the plate.  I ordered the shrimp tacos and they were sub-par. It's never a good sign when a restaurant uses baby shrimp in their dishes. This means the shrimp is either frozen or purchased cheaply in bulk. Not a lot of flavor in the shrimp but the sauce was pretty good.  My date had the taco salad with chicken and claimed it was okay. Like other reviewers stated, there's nothing necessarily "bad" about the food it just seems like your run-of-the-mill place. Nothing remarkable. That said, by the time I finished one taco my date's tostada was getting quite soggy. It was kind of gross.  So, I can't imagine returning unless it's for happy hour when a mariachi band is playing.

d4fSDW0-TDUDmPj6uusoQA.text: Quick tip: If the restaurant is called Juan's Flaming Fajitas, you should order the fajitas.   We came here for our Cinco de Drunko dinner celebrations without any high hopes or expectations. All we were looking for was a Mexican restaurant near the house where we could partake in the national drunk day! Man we hit a jackpot with this joint!  We ordered flaming beef  fajitas (for one) and 3 combo plate (carne asada, pollo asada and carnitas) all tacos.  We got dinner and a show with the fajitas! I'm usually not a big fajita fan because every time I get them the meat is usually dry and rubbery.  Their meat was moist, juicy and full of flavor! (insert gay joke here) The peppers and onions were cooked just right as they still had a little snap to them.   The tacos were decent in both taste and size but could not compare to the flaming fajitas! This place is called Juan's flaming fajitas not Juan's flaming tacos so order accordingly. If the tacos had the same pop as the fajitas this place would be a 5* without question.   The freebie chips and dip were decent. They provided warm beans along with the salsa. One surprise was they provided grilled chilies and onions with the salsa! The chips were nothing special and probably of the bagged variety.   Very friendly and attentive wait staff. We never had to ask for more chips and salsa or to have our water refilled. Our waiter was quick to point out that since it's cinco de drunko that the best bang for our alcoholic buck was the beer margarita since it was only $1 more than a standard margarita. SOLD! No need for up sell here my friend..  I think that we found a new place near our house to get our Mexican and margarita fix.!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres tacos (pollo asada, carne asada and carnitas)
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming beef fajitas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flame on!

o0B_2uyp8X7abL2dM7Y7Cw.text: This Mexican restaurant has the best good in Vegas. Their signature dish, flaming fajitas are excellent and so fun to see flambe table side.

IVImRkVcyw67deNyYp9PZg.text: Came here because of Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed! The best salsa ever. Chips were good though they could have been served hotter. The service was super friendly and the kids menu had lots of options. Small guacamole was worth the extra expense and the bean dip and grilled onions they serve with the salsa were excellent. The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars because the fajitas were a bit - well - boring actually. Very well made and fresh ingredients but lacking the seasoning and juiciness I've had from other places. But still - overall an excellent meal and I will definitely be back the next time we are in LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole was awesome and so were the onions, bean dip, and salsa!

4_JGb9nPdbjeGPuBNnL-Og.text: Food was delicious and servers were very friendly and attentive and always checking on us!!! Got the the steak and shrimp combo fajitas.. It came out flaming if course!! Coming back for sure.. New favorite place to eat!!

gqOlYU2jNIowP7uEUQu7_Q.text: Got salt? If you do please bring some to Juan, he is out.  I've been there once before and the food was good,  enough for me to go back.  But tonight was a different story. The staff was horrendously unattentive. We just about finished our chips and salsa before we were able to flag down our server and tell him we were ready to order.  I could understand if the place was packed and everyone was running around but it wasn't. In fact I saw our server sit down for a few seconds before he jumped up to serve the table by us. The rest of the night unfortunately didn't speed up.  We had to ask for the check after we were obviously done.   The food lacked any flavor.  We had the fajitas. Wow, the worst fajitas I've ever had.  I can make amazing fajitas at home - salt, pepper, a little cumin and spice. Apparently the chef has never heard of spices because he sure did not use any.    Just an overall disappointing experience. I don't go out to eat too often and when I do I expect it to be on par or even better than what I can cook at home.  I doubt I will ever be back.

o0zilMk7dpCBAIEcHTGyZA.text: Excellent. Juan has come to my table multiple times. He knows my parents by name because they come here all the time. The people that posted low stars are obviously difficult customers and don't know how to act in a restaurant. I've been here at least 3 dozen times. It's my regular Mexican food spot. Ive never had a bad experience. I run into people i haven't seen in years at this place. Everyone comes here. The food is always awesome. My order is always correct. They have great daily deals. The staff is always friendly and quick. As I write this review, I try to think of anything negative I have experienced, but I just can't find any. I've had family birthdays, graduations, cinco de mayo, big family gatherings, small mother son dates, and random stop ins. It's always 5 stars.

E4DWZxrZbKEhC1wrZGh-fg.text: Front office and the ladies that walked us in and greeted us in and out where GREAT. Took us outside to the patio and at a corner it was nice. They are usually great but tonight my server was very lacking, no soup delivered to me and my two guests, asked for water twice, Margarita and drinks came out way too late we were ignored as she practically served other tables but just ignored us, at one point one of my guests had to call another guy over to get us plates to get through the appetizer. We skipped ordering Entrees as the Waitress showed up 30 mins later. I gave her a 40% tip like I usually do but it is was for mainly the front of house and the greeters that took us in. Our waitress dropped the ball her big time.

68Zc_kSf6sOmKRBighrxow.text: I pretty much think God invented Mexican food to make up for M-F work weeks.  Because my BF is such a Lindo fan, it wasn't easy convincing him to come here instead.  After our awesome lunch, he was very apologetic for doubting my Yelp abilities.  I came here when this was Buzz, and Juan has really transformed the place.  Looks like a legit Mexican cantina.  Juan himself greeted us at the door and sat us at our table.  3 big screen tvs are visible in the dining room.  Always good, especially during the NCAA tournament (if you are not a Kentucky fan like myself).  Negra Modelo on tap = Sunday Funday.  Although I am a Lindo fan, the chips and salsa at Juan's are much better.  So is the fideo soup.  We decided to split the flaming chicken fajitas because it is the namesake.  Because I will always be 10 years old, I was overly facinated with the tableside flaming fajitas (see pic).  In addition to the show, the fajitas were great.  Came with the aforementioned fideo soup, guacamole, salsa, sour cream, cheese and tortillas.  The only thing I wasn't wowed by were the tortillas, but when your BFF is a latina rockstar and her fabulous momma hooks you up with decilious tortillas, your standards can be pretty high.  Don't worry Lindo.  There's room for two great Mexican spots in the Southwest.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Juan.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fire, fire, fire!

q-4aNinHkVxFb60NSApt8w.text: Love love this place.  The food and service was top notch. They gave 15% discount for veterans on Monday's. There happy hour was reasonable and the portions are huge.  The fajitas was over the top.  Thank you Mario for the excellent service. We will be back for sure

oB_XkJ5p2bBFKnywwv2uzg.text: One of the better Mexican restaurants in LV. Finally a place that doesn't put veggies in the rice! This is our new go to when we are in the mood for good authentic Mexican.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

be3V7yRUoTQf0e_8qK_bGQ.text: I was recently referred to Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina by a friend who was being continuously unimpressed by the taste of the Mexican food in the Las Vegas area.  I found this a little disconcerting being that Las Vegas was essentially a border town of the old west and as the west expanded, Las Vegas continued to maintain the southwest flavor.   Nonetheless, it was a trusted friend, who had turned me on to some other fine establishments, so I decided to give Juan's a try and see why they were set apart from some of the other Mexican favorites in Las Vegas.   Upon entering Juan's you see that the Cantina is set aside to the right.  As much as I enjoy a good Cantina visit, I was here for a lunch date and proceeded into the regular dinning area. Inside the dinning area, I was immediately welcomed with the laughter and good graces of a table of about ten people enjoying a birthday luncheon.   As my friend and I were seated, we were greeted by a team looking to fill our drink order and who promptly brought chips, two salsa bowls (green and red) and beans to the table. I thought this was wonderful, so many restaurants just bring chips and salsa, but then there was more, there was a small dish of onions and sliced jalapeno peppers.  All this just to get us started.    After looking over the menu and the waiter stopping by a couple times, just to make sure he didn't miss out on our desire to order, we made our selections.  My friend ordered the beef taquitos with veggies and I ordered the chicken fajitas with beans and rice.    I don't know if our conversation was just that good or if the service was that prompt, but it seemed like no time at all that our food arrived.  As my friend was served her taquitos and veggies, I knew that I had missed out on a change of pace from the beans and rice, the veggies looked grilled and tasty.    The fajitas were wonderful though, the perfect lunch portion served with three corn tortillas, the perfect amount of chicken and the right ratio of green/red peppers and onions.  All three tortillas were used and there was still a small of chicken left over to munch on.  I really didn't eat the beans and rice, not due to anything wrong with them,but mainly I was sad that I hadn't opted for the healthier veggie option.    The chicken was tender and juicy, with the veggies grilled to the point of almost burnt, just enough to bring out the flavor and the unique flavor that is expected in a fajita dish.   I would say that I am not sure yet that Juan's is better than any other Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas, I believe I need to further explore their menu, but I would say that it is as good as some of Las Vegas' other premier Mexican restaurants.   I would also point out that my friend and I stayed an visited for about an 45 minutes after completing our lunch without ever feeling rushed to leave.  I felt the manager and staff were very attentive to our dining needs.   I would certainly recommend Juan's to anyone looking for a relaxing Mexican style lunch in the southwest side of Las Vegas.

RvZz8RF-XhCBuywx87Zz9g.text: Yay I love this place especially for Monday or Thursday night football. Awesome happy hour from 3-7 and a separate football specials menu. The table side guacamole is awesome as is the shrimp Jalisco Plato con nopales mmmmm!!!!   I've also had the fish tacos which are grilled fish and are delicious. Ceviche is a favorite as well.   Service is always fast and friendly. Huge projector tv in the bar area. Rolando is a great server, my friend and I usually sit in the bar area and get great service. Friendly owner. The place is nonsmoking (yay!!) and they also have outdoor patio seating.

8N85zIuzNHtNSzv3xb7DcA.text: Thee best Sea Bass tacos! Great Good, service & ambience! Hope the Henderson location opens soon so the wait so t be so long.

zK8J-g4hm8_UxeZQ0cb3dw.text: Best Mexican food I've ever had! From start to finish it was amazing!!! If you live here or are just visiting you MUST try this place!!! I don't leave many reviews, but I felt this one deserved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I mean who gives you this many sides with your chips??? Amazing!!! Grilled onions are the way to my heart!

x3TqxngesJi60BK3SIaaUQ.text: Some of the best Mexican food in Vegas! The onions and jalapenos they serve with the chips, salsa and bean dip are amazing! We ordered the Flaming Fajitas for two and it was delicious!! The beef was very tender and well cooked not at all dry. You are given a choice of vegetables or the traditional rice & beans or can you split the order. We split the order and was also very tasty!!  The service was excellent to top it off!! I would highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas

k5K9sd-1yF1FxpZ0DMiFXQ.text: Nice staff, clean restaurant, great menu, and happy hour!  Tacos Al Pastor was a good size and great flavor. Of course I always fill up on the chips with the bean and salsa dips that I can't finish my entree. Also tried the shrimp cocktail (on hh menu) which was pretty good. Got a raspberry margarita (hh) which was far too sweet and lacked any alcohol... The sopapillas for dessert! Great airy perfectly fried dough with honey and whipped cream.   Great place, but could've done a bit more with happy hour menu.

k6_gT0NAzLsgGnl-LHpuzw.text: This place seriously took me by surprise! It's actually good! I thought it was your typical Mexican American  restaurant that doesn't satisfy you at all.   We came during happy hour and ordered rolled chicken tacos that were only $5. We also ordered a one person chicken fajita to share.    On the house they give you chips and salsa with refried beans. Chips were warm and perfect! Then they give you a tomato sopa that was tasty but a slight salty.   When the fajitas came.... FIREEEE! They put on a cool fire show with your fajitas and it's comes so hot and sizzling! The one person fajita was more than enough for me and my girlfriend. The rolled tacos were okay and kinda greasy.   Actually will come back for more fajitas!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary

ivoA-eV_EEBwUqgQl2M2lQ.text: Every time I go to this place it's always better then the previous time!  1. Staff is amazing and is always there to cater to your needs 2. Food is delicious  3. Atmosphere is great and family oriented  4. The fajitas are to die for!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas!!!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piña colada!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed fajita plate for one

rAj3UG-tMDNym5axQ2atfA.text: Always great. Fantastic service. They are fast, nice and friendly.  Chile rellano was super! Batter is fluffy.   I love the margaritas.  We will be back!!!

hRbrs0_-8x33brsrJuarqA.text: Finally found our Mexican restaurant! This place was amazing. The fajitas, queso fundido, rice and beans, and homemade tortillas were so good. The service was excellent too. Cesar did an exceptional job, especially considering he had a large party he was taking care of too. Even the busser was right on it. Highly recommend!

DNO51C9-rN98-WEQ30CJQg.text: 1st time here. Food & Service excellent! Sebastian was one of the best bartender/servers ever

KzJ-j8tDfXYsLvN-j2ZKZA.text: First visit here and i would go back, i was very pleased with all the free items served prior to the meal, the soup, salsa and beans were excellent.  I had the chicken fajitas for one and i was pleased, but i have had better.  All in all, very good and i look forward to trying more items from the menu in the future.

T1XEQgLgcOPPbzwi_xTF5Q.text: If your patio is closed on a Saturday evening...than....you really should not advertise on your website...you have a pet friendly patio. period.   Sun was down....people waiting outside for a table...they had enough business....redic.

jacWSWM221awMgXJ2Fzi5A.text: Juans is the best! Everyone here is so kind & the service is above & beyond for how busy they get. Expect to wait, but it is more then worth it! The food is absolutely amazing! This is by far my favorite place to eat. The fajitas are my go to, but I've tried just about everything. Don't fill up on the chips, salsa, & bean dip because their desserts are so worth being miserful!

39kULbbaUhxJfFhNyaraFg.text: Great food and great service! I've taken my family here twice and everything has been on point. Arturo was our waiter both times and he was really great.  By the way, you get 15% off your entire bill when you check in.

-d5_KQ2K2kfJtnsiz78wQA.text: This place is awesome!! Food is super yummy wait was very short and service was good. I'll definitely be back!!

4PnTh8TRuQ_BPggsZxH2qw.text: Great place for good Mexican Food. The house specialty is the Fajitas but everything on the menu is good. We went there with a very large group and were quickly seated at the Outdoor Patio, perfect for our group. Service was very good and they kept the Chips and Salsas coming and drink refills were plentiful. Our food came out hot and our orders were all correct. Food was delicious. I checked in on Yelp and received $5.00 off of our order. The staff was very accommodating to our group. We will be back. I highly recommend this restaurant

j8y-u4dfTPYvXwUJsQ8K5g.text: You cannot beat this place you have to start with the queso dip because it is hands down the best queso ever. And make sure you get a michelada too because why not. Also the Mexican seafood platter is delicious. I mean DELICIOUS. The scallops literally melt in your mouth. Ask for the sauce on the side of you don't like spicy. The fried ice cream is an amazing dessert to finish it all off with

ii8tUMPJVA2ZHAqkhnCXeg.text: The food is good. The fajitas are put on fire at your table, but are already cooked when they arrive. But I had a margarita, frozen, and was good. It really put me in a good mood for the food. The bean dip you get with the chips is good, get the pork fajitas because those are the best. I can't wait to come back.  The down side of this visit is that there were two large parties right by us. The music from the man with the guitar was good, it really entertained us. But this white lady was the best. She was super friendly and smiled the whole time. Will come back for sure. Large parties welcomed.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The house margarita frozen

EKyXCUOi3ExEAXF-ubJb1Q.text: My husband and I often come here for happy hour or dinner. Their staff is always friendly and attentive. The prices are very reasonable and the food is consistently good! The happy hour shrimp ceviche is a must !!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour chicken fajitas 3/5
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour Shrimp ceviche is always a winner! Large portion is enough for a meal.

du8jlyovsTyz09o5SZZAGg.text: fajitas shrimp and chicken off the hook along with micheladas and mango margaritas ..2 of thoes was all that the wife needed ..lol..first time here will come again 5 star in my book..THANKS FOR HAVING US

1BWiy8AcsHhzZyb5gdf9DQ.text: Took Mom here for Father's Day based upon a recommendation from a friend. From the outside it doesn't look like much, but once you walk in the vibe is quite nice. Definitely the look and feel of an authentic Mexican restaurant. Was a little disappointed that three TV's had the US Open on and not one had on FIFA Women's World Cup.  The place was semi-busy even though we got there when it first opened. They have Coke Zero too so that made the visit that much more awesome. Both Mom and I ordered the shredded chicken taco salad. They came back in less than ten minutes. Now that's fast! But, I have to admit I was skeptical with it coming back that fast. The server mentioned it was a simple process, that's why it was so fast. That didn't help matters for my skepticism.  It was actually pretty good. At first, the taste was not what I was used to. The chicken tasted a little funny, at first. But after a few bites, I couldn't stop eating! Overall it was pretty darn good. And they serve chips, refried beans, salsa, onions and jalepenos while you wait for your food. Good thing because I was starving!  I will definitely come back to try something else on the menu. Until then, four stars. Have to explore the menu. As far as customer service, it was extremely good. And they do not rush you to order or pay, for that matter. Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shredded chicken taco salad. Amaze balls!

3V7XhScJmJWbXHKCQQk0Xw.text: A-W-E-S-O-M-E FOOD!!!!! I haven't had Mexican food as tasty as the one at this place. Oh my goodness! And the margaritas??? To die for!!! I live in Ontario California and come to Las Vegas at least 4 times ya ear. This place is on my regular to visit from now on list. Great food, good music and great drinks! Christian the waiter was really, really nice and helpful! And they gave me a rose for Mother's Day! How cool is that?

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nhFh5GKpuwsLN_yiSHrYZQ.text: The name makes me laugh, the experience left me smiling :)  When a restaurant first emerged in this space when I first moved here, there have been at least 2-3 restaurants that have tried to win over the hearts of the locals in the Southwest, but unfortunately they did not succeed. So when we first walked in and saw how busy the place was (there was even a wait!) we were quite surprised!  We were seated within the quoted 10 mins and the moment we sat down, we saw why the word "flaming" is in their name! As you can see from the photos, their fajitas are literally shooting out flames up toward the ceiling! They're quite delicious, I guess the flames add a flavor only a flame can add :)  Also on the menu: Table side guacamole, raspberry margarita and a coronita. Good, bomb, and meh. I'd definitely have the raspberry margarita again, damn thing tastes like juice!  We loves. We're returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry Margarita... Lethal.

Ns1EA6bEkjbut7aSLQpgQw.text: Best in Vegas! Omar and the servers are great. Bean dip, chips and salsa to start. Everything tasted authentic and fresh! Will only eat Mexican food in Vegas here!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7MBYlPzf5DvTWgkwYacjVw.text: This place is definitely worth the trip and time (if you have to wait). We live in Henderson but made the drive over here based on recommendation and I can say I will be coming back frequently.   I have lived in Vegas for over 15 years and have been to many of the Mexican restaurants in town. Although, there are very many different styles of Mexican food and a lot of great hole in the walls, this place beats the best of them. If your on the fence just go!   Update: round 2 was just as good as the first. Love this place.

K0DcHEnFYlYvL1pK9OpZVQ.text: Second time here and it was an absolute pleasure! We brought my father here for his birthday dinner and we had a blast. The service was stellar and the food was amazing. I recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant with amazing service.

1Oj8ZwJURhHq0sASwqowpQ.text: Gotta say that this was one of the best Mexican restaurants period..if you don't believe me then just try it yourself  And all for under $40.
