Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good! Not as sweet as you would think but that&#39;s a great thing

yK8DGmJlew1_ndDeKt-ecw.text: Omg this place is BOMB... I live on lamb and alexander and I drive all the way over to them just to have there shrimp fajitas. They are the best. Not to compare but they are way better than LINDO MICHOACAN. They have great costumer service they deserve being tipped. BTW I am Hispanic and its rare the Mexican restaurant that knows how to cook Mexican food. There beans are Awesome. I can eat here every day ahhhhhhhh and don't forget there MARGARITAS they are the best nice decent size for the price. I love the mango margarita.

8GO0fhxGMV9tVXClWY8IbA.text: On the weekend of November 26, 2017 our family visited Juan's Flaming Fajitas. In fact we came all the way from Texas to celebrate our Mother/Grandmothers Birthday. First let me say the food was really good. In fact it was excellent. But the service was amazing. We actually had 50 plus people come from Texas. They let us set up a surprise party for her on their patio. Their staff went above and beyond to accommodate us. If you want to eat good food with a side of A+ service, visit this amazing place. The Casias would like to thank Juan (the owner) for what he did for us and for making our Mother's Birthday Special. Thank you.

LOjbLpupHYQskJp2_Rxknw.text: Juan has taken good Mexican food to the masses with Juan's Flaming Fajitas. A wide offering on their menu and a very friendly atmosphere make for a wonderful dining experience.

I5odwje6P4WUjb5gZQDlHg.text: Just wow! The fajitas here are the best ive had in all vegas! And the service! 5star service they even tied a knot o my to go bag lol might not seem like much but to me was that cherry on top

4qnTvmz-ALeMXvn1OyExKA.text: Soooooooooooooooo delicious! My server was wonderful. I definitely recommend coming here.

T9IiMSMHTYcQSbj0teVBpQ.text: Great food ! Good margaritas ! Good service wasn't expecting great Mexican food in Nevada visiting from Texas

mK4sH7TlahzH97Obni9NYw.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Chips and salsa are perfection, Fajitas were excellent, enchiladas were delicious!! Nice employees, good prices. All in all a great experience and a wonderful authentic meal. Will be back very soon.

4fy7_Ea1_nc2b6IWBAvuhw.text: Awesome!  We went to Juans based on reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor.  Not a bad drive from the Vegas strip, and located in a strip mall.  Got in just before the Friday 5pm rush!  I had shrimp fajitas - and yes, they were flaming!  My husband had a wet carne asada burrito, and the meat was so tender!  Homemade chips were served with two salsas, bean dip, and grilled onions and jalapeno - yum!  We also had their special margarita on the rocks, and it was absolutely incredible!  Staff was so friendly and attentive, and helped made this a great choice for us out of towners.   A surprise free dessert of warm churros almost made us ask for a cart to take us out - we were stuffed, but so happy!   We liked it so much, we bought a gift certificate for someone at our hotel who did something nice for us - so that shows you how much we liked the restaurant!  On our list for whenever we visit Las Vegas!  **Edit - we went to the restaurant the next day because we enjoyed it so much, and brought two friends with us!  My husband had the Chili Colorado burrito, and IT WAS AWESOME!!!!!!  Our friends loved the food and staff too!

HmSgv-LukZ6lfWyLAVXgVA.text: Super delicious food, amazing atmosphere,  i like the guy whose singing, margaritas was very cool, servers was very nice and funny.  The enchiladas was amazing, i like that they have meals for vegetarians

D2Xm2geilXyIFDw_JZktgQ.text: The food is so good and so is the service. The happy hour prices are ridonkulous - especially the fajita quesadillas. Also, they service this amazing grilled pepper and grilled onion dish with the free chips, salsa and bean dip.

iS2cw7o11lPhPR7w5g_eSg.text: Went to Applebee's right before this and didn't get service there, so we left and came here. Been here a few times and it's amazing every time! Spectacular service! From the server to the bidder to the managers. There was even a singer with a guitar and he sang a song for my daughter! The food was amazing, can't go wrong with those combination plates. This is great Mexican food and it's solid every time!

jpp_l20KSt5soWb3Mt2b8g.text: Top notch service!!!  Wow!  My buddy and I ate here after rock climbing and we were blown away by the attentiveness of the wait staff. Could not have asked for better service. The food was excellent as well. We will definitely go back the next time we are in Vegas.

ho-TLkN-6aNENqYK68Fusg.text: Always great foot and  awesome customer Service!!!  We've eaten here three times and never been disappointed. Plus there are coupons sometimes!

vYb3wtx9w2k658fWwk41aw.text: great place!!! come with a appetite & leave full! the drinks  are very good... great place & good staff and the price is g r e a t !

ak46mj7iwKN2TdN7y4cAvw.text: Update:The owner called and took care of the issue. Great resolution and he was apologetic.  I am thankful for the quick follow up. Juan took charge and I am satisfied with the outcome.  Check your credit card statement with your receipt!  I went there for the first time a few days ago and gave a generous tip of 30 percent. I checked my credit card statement and noticed the restaurant charged an extra $22 in addition to my bill plus tip! I called three times and explained what happened. I was told the owner was the only one who can help me out so I left 3 messages. I was told the owner would call today but when I waited all day and didn't receive a call, I called again and was told the owner left for the day. I got the impression this isn't the first time this has happened.  It's not about the money, it's about the principal and service. A few dollars added to a handful of tabs each month can make for a nice bonus.

DSIQ8dZfqLXEN_O8C9CN8Q.text: Definitely deserves 1,000 Stars! Mary kindly greeted our party and sat us down to our reserved table. Amanda & Pao worked so well as a team serving our party. They both had such a cheerful and positive attitude & kept our drinks, chips, bean dip & salsa topped. The food is in large portions & is very flavorful, fresh, delicious, 100% authentic, which is a must in my book, 2 thumbs up ! Though the food taste like a million bucks, it was definitely cheap/reasonable, & service is quick & served with a smile. Happy hour drinks was on point as well  lol. The guitar guy walked around and played beautiful mexican music. Everything was perfect and very special as it was my Mothers' birthday. I will most definitely be a returning customer, and this is now our chill & family get together spot. Thank you Mary, Amanda & Pao for making our experience a great one!  Everyone was so friendly & made everyone feel welcomed & comfortable.  I'm so happy we finally were able to try this place out. Best Mexican Restaurant in town, hands down!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Steak &amp; Shrimp Fajitas Combo (definitely enough for hubby and I) Came with 2 rice &amp; beans side plates &amp; tortillas

RVIbe0BuqTvUnOxpgEqYig.text: BEST SERVICE!!! From our waitress AND the busperson(?) who would always come by and take any plates we were done with.. And they use legit NY STRIP steak for their steak fajitas fyi.. A MUST try :) The wifey and I left happy.

mGocyGdhX2Ue_y4O2p6LVg.text: I've been here several times for lunch. The chicken fajita lunch is about $10 and it is always cooked well. Chips are thin and delicious and the salsa is good as well.

P65hVAlDo8Ifn5OhIn6VQw.text: We are from Colorado and decided to try Juans after doing a little research.  Let's face it - most Mexican restaurants are not really authentic but "Americanize" their dishes to fit everyone's boring concept of Mexican food.  Not this place!  The food here is the real deal.  Salsas were flavorful and the sauteed onions and chiles were delicious!  We think these were poblano and not jalapeno chiles - very good!  We had green chile and steak picado and both were very tender and yummy!  You can tell that the owners have put some thought into their menu choices and the ingredients they use.  We will recommend this to our friends that live in Vegas and anyone who will be visiting.  Great margaritas and greatfood

YUhZb35_uu8JCvOocnDVXw.text: This place is awesome! They start you off with delicious bean dip with chips. I always get so full off them I can barely eat my food. I don't care for fajitas in general but my husband loves them. I do enjoy their other foods.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious food!

e_vz22igk2gjeCoszWvR8g.text: This place has been a once a week stop for some time now.  Their food is amazing and prices are reasonable for the amount of food!  Anyone that I've referred here has loved it and gets hooked as well.  Food recommendations: Have only had steak and chicken fajitas (amazing and a lot of food), taco salad, chicken tacos and ceviche are my go to's. Also love the fact they serve veggies instead of rice and beans upon request. I've never had them but the churro's look great too!   We used to go to viva Mercado in village square and honestly no other Mexican restaurant compares to Juan's.  Wait time at dinner time can be long but nothing a margarita or two can't fix while waiting!!!! :)

3t9Z-SAvDWKEItN2ly91cg.text: Such a bummer. We LOVE their food- come here monthly. Needless to say this is the THIRD time we have come in the evening to take advantage of the patio and they REFUSE to serve customers out there. Why have a patio and never have it open? They turned away 30 customers. Unbelievable! What a poor decision by management to do that. We even asked to order "to go" and eat out on the patio so their precious servers wouldn't have to walk outside. The hostess staff was extremely rude and screamed at our group that they don't serve on the patio! Meanwhile, they do have one table out there getting service. Your service SUCKS! Keep turning away loyal customers and watch your sales dwindle. We will never recommend this restaurant again regardless of the food because the staff is so rude and they continually turn paying customers away.

O5IpA50aKNw1g7SKBS5lmw.text: I have tried many Mexican restaurants over the years here in Las Vegas, and hands down, Juans flaming fajitas is the restaurant. If you never have the opportunity to go to Mexico for the food, then go to Juans flaming fajitas. Go experience the food and the ambient of this restaurant.

m5I6YUG5nfv0hh08sh4XCg.text: This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant. The service is amazing but the FOOD!!! The fajitas are the best I've ever had and I love the "show" with the big flames when they deliver the fajitas. They don't cut corners and the tortillas are made fresh there. The soup which is part of the meal is delicious and I absolutely love the shrimp ceviche. Margaritas are also perfection. Try the mango margarita during Happy Hour (it's from 3-7p.m. daily) and you won't be disappointed! I've taken all my friends to try this place out because it really is the best Mexican restaurant in town. Love that they have a gentleman singing on weekends. I celebrated my birthday here and it was great!

FSfUfWoBMdvQ355QYBTqUA.text: Just moved to town and have been back twice in the first week!  Fantastic fajitas, though the chips, salsa, beans, soup & grilled veggies are a meal in itself!  Service has been attentive and friendly both visits, and food arrived quickly. We'll be back!

W0k0EgR7qSPWRtnYkYgiJg.text: Best food hands down! I love far from here but had to try and I'm glad I did. Great customer service and great food portions. Also had great  prices. I will bring my husband to try for sure!

luOQyfQeayIlnQjVr_W-bw.text: I don't even know where to start, this place was the best Mexican Restaurant I've ever been to. I have very high expectations for Mexican restaurants since I am Mexican and it's very rare to find one that has legit authentic Mexican food! From the moment we walked in the ambiance and the staff was amazing very attentive and on point! We order drinks and they literally took like 5min for them to bring them, we also ordered the adobado burrito and the chicken shredded chimichanga, we were so impressed on how fast our food came, they were delish and very worth it!  I'm so impressed with the service the people and the restaurant overall! I highly recommend this place if you're in need of a good Mexican restaurant! Ps: Happy Hour half hour alcoholic beverages between 3pm-7pm ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmm
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen Margarita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shredded Chicken Chimichanga

EYeEEfUIOakGg0hOw8EoKA.text: LOVE this place! My mom and I have been trying every Mexican food place in town trying to find the best and authentic place, and we've found it! Their menu is amazing, all of their food is quality and DELICIOUS, and the service is fast and efficient. I can't speak highly enough of this restaurant, and I'm hopeful they open up one closer to us (and all over town for that matter).

DGLNtFyVxrpYjS26jpqx5A.text: Yo Sebastian is the bomb and everyone is super nice. No complaints, good food, lots of chips, feels super authentic. I'm satisfied.

hhYDqmbAJ0aQZW3h-HvsMw.text: BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS!!! Literally my favorite spot to eat & everyone there is so awesome. I've been there over 50 times & not one bad complaint about the service or food!

Cpde5gloufwhzLAfjEANpg.text: This place is always busy and it's easy to understand why. The service is fast and efficient, the food is good, and the prices are very fair for what you get. The beverage selection is average. Portions are large. The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is the long wait times to get a table and the TINY waiting area.

TA5xbX4kckdOGbPRgglwlQ.text: Food here is delicious. The service was great. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed. I had steak fajitas and recommend them. I will be back for more! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband ordered one of the steaks. Don&#39;t remember the name but it was really good
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the steak fajitas and loved them ;)

uqaqF_jR9UBVnxvwVAtczA.text: This place is off the charts. Incredible Mexican food. My Mom is from San Diego. Her Nani ( born and raised in Sonora Mexico)cooked great food and she would approve. 5 stars to Omar and team. If you are in Vegas... you have to eat here.

ne4uH1OnYt74qVwc2v7eNQ.text: I can't believe I missed this place when I lived closer to it.    Exceptionally good food (pork and steak fajitas on my first trip),  a great happy hour, a fantastic house margarita, and some of the best service I have ever had in town.  WOW WOW WOW.  Definitely my new first and last stop for Mexican meals.  Prices were more than reasonable.  I look forward to becoming a regular here.

udGC55TdF4uwx7CErQBi6Q.text: Place was fun and busy. Beer was ice cold thats why 2 stars. Problem was so was the chilaquiles.  Pork was cold and barely any green sauce. Ordered sunny side up egg no egg on plate.  Will come back for beer but not food.  If looking for good pork and green chili that's hot when served hit up Carlitos. Better way to spend 15 bucks.

Ofj9X2uyvYV7MWvMtAbiTQ.text: I had the fish tacos. They were average. They have a good happy hour here. It was really busy after 5 and people were waiting for tables for quite awhile.

1ESdP7gs1AbU_O3mvaVIkw.text: My friend and I decided to frequent Juan's flaming Fajitas & Cantina for a quick happy hour after work. I have heard a number of good things about this place so we decided to try it out. During our visit I had the chimichanga and an appetizer. A number of people around us ordered the Flaming fajitas which seem to be very popular at the restaurant. I guess it was very popular because it was enough to feed two people off of one entree. When I got my chimichanga the carne asada was overcooked therefore making it dry and less flavorful. I'm not saying that I wouldn't return to this place but, I feel that if I do I should do as everyone else and order the Flaming fajitas. However, on the upside their Margaritas are amazing and they come in a multitude of flavors for you to try. It's Cinco de Mayo coming up I highly suggest you get there early to partake in all of the festivities and nice food that they have to offer.

xC8eEW30pUhYaLVg2wRLBw.text: Just moved to Las Vegas so tried this place out and it is AMAZING! The fajitas are sooo good and they give you enough food that you are bringing home food for sure. I would assume you couldn't go wrong with anything here!

MNi48EhKKMq35H2RXpRGHw.text: Perfection!  Yummy yum yum!!  Great food, great service.  I'm from AZ and have tried every Mexican food place in the city.  This is by far the best!

Dlxdr8-eJQ8tCAvMiRrSLQ.text: In Las Vegas for my Niece's Birthday and I needed a good Mexican restaurant near where we were staying, so I went with my tried and True Yelp App. Juan's had really good reviews and the pictures and menu looked great.There was ample parking in the adjoined mini-mall lot and it didn't take long to get a nice big table for 9 outside on the patio. As soon as we sat down the chips hit the table along with a bean dip and fresh roasted peppers and onions. Right off the bat the service was excellent and we never had less than 3 waiters hovering around for our every request. We all settled in with drinks before ordering our dinners. I went with the Guadalajara special, I got a large piece of Carne Asada topped with scallops and shrimp covered in a delicious brown sauce of some sort.My Carne Asada was a bit overcooked for my taste, but the seafood and that sauce were simply amazing. Everybody got different things including my niece who went with an order of the Taquitos. Her Taquitos were huge enough that they made a meal  for herself and her girlfriend. By the end of our meal the wait staff brought over a nice dessert with a huge Sombrero for my niece as they sang Happy Birthday. Overall everybody loved their food and Juan's really made my niece's Birthday dinner super special.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n7NG1xG0OlI_jH7iAQnZ7A.text: Been here so so many times and always had an amazing time. From the servers to the food no complains. Just wished there was better ventilation so we wouldn't smell so delicious leaving. Lol. I will always be bringing my family and friends to this place and if it's your birthday let the staff know they will sing you a fun happy song.

8PBvaMcDWE_eLsWSfvBWUw.text: I went there with my family, we had a fairly large party, but I felt the service was horrible. We were seated and waited over an hour for the waiter to come and take our order while watching people seated after us already being served their food. I am unable to comment on the quality of food because after almost 2 hours I had to leave to take care of my infant son shortly after the food arrived. I will not be going back. I do hope for others that this just turned out to be an isolated incident.

TZmzIUoq8lXlIuwWSRI7pQ.text: Great drinks!! For happy hour!! The fajitas are delicious and great service as always and especially from our server Yajaira.

0Jalge2KMJnZYdTxjzVeVg.text: This place has the best Fajitas in Las Vegas!   Get there early or you'll have to wait for a table while drinking a yummy margarita!

wRmTZ8TptSXD16dU0EoELQ.text: Love this place, when I'm in the area I always make it a point to get out here. Their fajitas are out of this world and flaming fajita gimmick never gets old. The food here is wonderful and a treat to behold. The service is top notch, and your food arrives very quickly. The restaurant is located in what I guess would be southwest Las Vegas and is nice, but clean and appealing. Otherwise what can you say about the food is wonderful I've pretty much only had the fajitas when I've been there, but hey why not that's what their famous for. Parking can be a little tight as it's in a shopping center with a lot of other stores, and I can imagine this place gets quite crowded on the weekends. All in all, you won't be disappointed with The Flaming Fajita it is simply delicious all the way around.

mpNJAhHajinBXD426zWk7Q.text: Food was amazing and service was excellent. Props to our awesome server, Yajaira  We had the fajita combo with chicken and pork. Pork was an excellent take on carnitas. Margaritas and micheladas were on point, chips and salsa were fantastic, and dessert was spot on. Will definitely be back.

db1jjkqkew51XerO7cJqlg.text: Great food and service and can't beat a variety of choices. Make seafood platter was great as was the plus Ollie

Cxhv2cmM5qzC5NNUgZgFJg.text: Best Mexican food in the Southwest. Locals restaurant, with some good happy hour deals. Best to get there early for dinner, restaurant gets very busy even during the week. Plenty of options for kids.

uZBYa2O4lDKz3MkwtJcCwg.text: I found my new favorite Mexican restaurant! I was next-door getting my car fixed and noticed this place across the street it's always been one of those places where you drive by but never stopped and eat at. It was my best friends birthday so I suggested this place being that we both love Mexican food. Upon arrival we were greeted by 2 really friendly hostesses. I asked if they had happy hour and they said yes from 3 to 7 and it's not only in the bar area like most restaurants its everywhere you sit which is a plus. They have a bar as well as a patio outside. The restaurant had a very authentic Mexican feel, I loved the ambience. I was really surprised with their happy hour menu there were so many choices! The margaritas were amazing and only four dollars for a 12 ounce or five dollars for a 16 ounce you can't beat that! I ordered the pina colada margarita on the rocks and my friend had the blended mango margarita both were amazing and just the right amount of alcohol. I like how they offered complementary chips and three different salsas some restaurants charge extra. I ordered the steak quesadilla and I was so shocked at how big it was two people definitely could have shared it! My friend ordered the cheese enchiladas with red sauce and she was scraping her plate at end it was so good. I informed the waiter that it was my friends birthday and he made sure to bring out a complimentary dessert and they sang for her. Overall I loved the experience at Jauns the service was quick everyone was professional and friendly and very attentive. They have one of the best happy hours I've ever seen I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak quesadilla
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese enchiladas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango and pina colada margaritas

92OjQqXiLwLTIv654rfr-Q.text: Amazing food and service.  It's one of my favorite places ever to eat.  Great happy hour specials. You can't go wrong here with any order.  Try it out.

40-lhbvE1LzLl0_KI8ToFQ.text: Yajaira was an excellent server. This is our first time at Juan's and everyone was very friendly. Service was excellent. The food and drinks are excellent. I will be back.

3tbBg__mcZfPJHQC-u9AWg.text: This was a spur of the moment visit pulled in and we were met by really friendly host. The food was really good, large portions and super great service!! I will come back again and again!

F3ZwV_5cXQjtccXY9RAuyA.text: Everything about this restaurant is PERFECT! The salsas are fresh and delicious, the fideo soup is so warm and hearty, the plates are giant, the waiters are so friendly, and of course everything is delicious! My boyfriend and I adore this place and it will forever be our favorite. My goto dish is the green chile tamale and I highly recommend you taste it!

oczntOEOdAj_Qpxi1ZlhTg.text: First time here. Server was Omar. Started with basket of tortilla chips with 2 types of salsa, refried beans for dipping.  Ordered our meals and we had the 3 taco meal, Chile relleno meal and the salsa verde meal.   We all enjoyed everything. Our server was totally awesome. He would constantly check in on us and kept us entertained.   Dessert of fried ice cream was ordered and it was the bomb!   We would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone. And yes ask for OMAR he is a gem of a server!   We will definitely come here again! Thank you for letting us have a great entertaining night!

veX5MHNnXYnk0I5-L4gfog.text: This is seriously the best Mexican food I have ever had.  I love Juan's. My son took me there while visiting and we loved it!

UfZSlwl6XmThMWWKUa9T_A.text: Wow where to start. We came on a Thursday night during the last hour of happy hour 6:00 pm. The wait was 40 minutes. I asked if the bar was open seating and they said it was. We got there and were so lucky to have gotten a spot at the bar. The bartender Juan greeted us right away. He offered chips and salsa. The other bartender Javier came by and got our drink order. The server assistant was younger and walking around the bar he asked if we needed chips and salsa. All within 10 minutes of sitting down I had three people come and greet me! I was already sold! Great service is hard to find, next we ordered appetizers that were on the happy hour menu (shrimp ceviche, and shrimp cocktail) they came fast and were delicious. They served the cocktail with saltines and the ceviche with tostada. The bean dip and salsa they serve with the chips are really good. They taste like authentic salsa. We were so impressed we wanted to try more food! We ordered the two combo plate with Chile rellenos and an enchilada with chicken and red sauce. It also was served with fideo. The fideo is a light tomato based soup served before the main entree. This one at this location is so good! The food was great and I feel like I'm really picky when it comes to Mexican food. The service, the food, the ambience. They have it all. There is a reason there was a 40 minute wait! I love it I will be returning to try their specialty the Flaming Fajitas!

jG2DqiG9bttR02UyBeZNfg.text: 5 stars because the food was good. The busboy was good. But our waiter gets one star he totally forgot about us. It wasn't until I was pissed and the busboy notice that our waiter finally came over, we got our bill and left. He wanted to try the desserts and have another drink but opted to leave.

Lhegz5UxF3bEdq-tFOjMQQ.text: Service was outstanding across the board. Everyone was super friendly.  Had the steak fajita nachos. They were ok. Usually I love nachos...these were good, just not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qQye3hln-55o4GmsTdgl0A.text: Okay so maybe a little overpriced for what it is, BUT IF YOU DON'T GO FOR THE FLAMING FAJITAS THEN WHY ARE YOU REALLY THERE?? Although not gonna lie, you can't beat $3.95 margaritas for happy hour.    I mean seriously, Vegas sell fajitas everywhere and this place was like "let's put water on the fajitas, light it up, make it flame up, then make it our best seller. and BAM! Thus Juan's Flaming Fajitas was made. Definitely try it. All about the experience.  Their service is PHENOMENAL! It was jam packed busy and someone was always helping us at our table. If the server wasn't there, someone else was attentive to come by our table and ask if we needed anything. They are on top of the way they run things here so don't worry, no matter how busy it gets, they have enough people to attend to you.  Other than that, get the damn flaming fajita. Food was very flavorful, juicy, and what a cool experience to see my fajita go up in a 5 foot flame.   This place gets packed towards the evening with a wait, so I suggest going a little bit before dinner because 1) it's happy hour and 2) it's happy hour

1KPGY9RMDThj9KqWUp5flg.text: We went here for my boyfriend's grandma's birthday as this is her favorite restaurant. We were sat inside the restaurant and there were many TV's playing sports.   When I looked through the menu I noticed a vegetarian section and was impressed that they notified vegetarians that their bean dip was not vegetarian and that there was an option of vegetarian bean dip.   I ordered a vegetarian burrito with no cheese, cauliflower, and sauce. The burrito I got was literally just a bunch of vegetables wrapped in a tortilla with no beans inside. There were beans on the plate and another portion of vegetables, including cauliflower.   The vegetables were good, but I was a little disappointed. I was expecting something like a portion of black beans, rice, and some veggies inside the burrito, but that's just not what it turned out to be.   My boyfriend order the California Burrito with chicken and thought it was pretty good, but not amazing. One of our family friends also did not think the food was that great. His grandma seemed satisfied with her shrimp fajitas.   The waiters were very nice though! They put a sombrero on grandma's head and sang her happy birthday, giving her little churros with a cherry and candle. They also brought a "shot" (looked more like a glass but it probably was watered down) of tequila out per her request and said, "ready?" She said yes and they held it to her mouth and had her chug it, no warning. It was pretty funny.   Grandma is pretty lit.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q3-Mm3XzdgCJTdrJWo9Apg.text: Everybody was starving after an all day flight to Vegas. This place was a hit with a vegan, vegetarian and meat eaters. Loved the bean dip and green sauce that came with the chips . Colorful environment in a strip mall with plenty of parking

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iWjVszc2MhHXz-sCSBFexA.text: My Aunt and uncle turned me on to this place and I have to say it was awesome food full of flavor and when they bring chips they also bring several different types of salsa with it and they make there own tortillas, flower and corn and the price was affordable and servers was very nice. Definitely my number one place .

p-M6N_Abxb3jNQ0mBL7iAQ.text: Food just tastes better here. Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is at the top of my list for Fajitas and Margaritas. The tables always start off with chips, two salsas, and sauteed onions and jalapenos. It's always fun to try the different combinations of each or just pile them all on and enjoy. Their Steak is  always tender, Shrimp are never overcooked, and the Chicken has never been dry. I'll have to get back to you when I try the Pork. The little flambe show is always entertaining and the char on the veggies and proteins from the sizlling hot fajita grill adds a great smoky flavor. It comes with their rice, refried beans and all the sides you would expect so you know you won't be leaving hungry.   I always enjoy their Margaritas whenever I get a chance. They pair so well with the food. I'd have to say my favorites so far have been the Mango, Peach, Pina Colada, Raspberry, and Strawberry. All the fruity combinations have me feeling like I'm drinking candy.  Their Happy Hour menu is no joke. You expect portions to be smaller like other restaurants, but what we got looked like a full order. Juan's Flaming Fajitas has given me more for my money on a happy hour menu than any other place I have been to.   Service has always been friendly and attentive whenever I have visited. I look forward to visiting again. Save a little room for dessert!

F_6v72XjLGhWhbbxSjeIGw.text: As far as Mexican restaurants go, Juan's really hits the mark.  Cheap drinks, tons of menu items, bar area with about 6 TVs, and patio.  The notorious fajitas are priced under $30 for 2 which for their notoriety and what comes with, is pretty great deal.  Sufficient amount of meat with the onions and peppers roasted and "flamed."  Each person gets their own beans and rice and some smooth guac.  Shredded lettuce is only $1 more and plenty to share. They also have a spicy salsa perfect for the fajita.  The fajita was one of the better, more filling I've had.  Steak was the way to go with the chicken tasting cooked but boring.  The free chips had a few salsas to choose from and even some fresh pepper and onion to accompany.  The Happy Hour is every day until 7pm and offer wine and other drinks for under $5.  Juan's has great food fit for a family or a night out.  I would definitely come back, though try to do off hours as every night there is bound to be a wait.

xmXGfeWObQNbB_gfs8olUg.text: The hostess were nice and welcoming. The atmosphere was great. The server and her assistant were both awsome The knights game on which was a bonus. They started us off with chips, beans and salsa. Their green salsa is really good.  And they give you a plate of sautaide jalapenos and onions. We ordered a lovelady to drink.  We ordered the chicken fingers and fries for my daughter. My boyfriend asked the server if they had carnitas as an option for a chimichanga ( it's not an option on the menu) and she said yes, so he ordered that with rice and beans. I ordered chicken mulitas. They start you off with video soup.   The beer was good. Served in an iced glass. The kids tenders and fries were great. My mulitas were really good, but they're hard to eat. It gets a bit messy. My boyfriend took a couple bites but didn't like his chimichanga. The carnitas weren't what he expected. They were a bit dry and weren't the shredded soft kind hes used to so he didnt eat it. He let the server know and sent it back. She asked if she could get him something else but he declined. When we got our check we were still being charged for the chimichanga even tho he sent it back. He talked to the manager Mimi. Her answer was, " you should have asked for the shredded carnitas." She made it clear that she believed she was right and the customer was wrong. She came to the table and offered 50% off the chimichanga meal. I asked her why if they had two types of carnitas it's not on the menu ot wasnt mentuoned by the server. She was very quick to say that other restaurants do it different ,but they have two types. Again i asked, if you have two types why wasn't  it mentioned. She said she thought 50% was fair because we also had chips and soup. I asked her why she was arguing with me if all i was asking was why if theres two types of carnitas it's not mentioned upon ordering. She mentioned  that she still believed that 50 was fair but that if we wanted off the check she would take it off. She walked away with the check and came back with it off our check. We don't go to restaurants to get a free meal. We go to have an experience and try amazing food. A customers feed back should be most important to a restaurand and it's managers. We didn't apreciate Mimis attitude. I loved everything else about the restaurant but vecause her unappreciative and rude attitude, we will not be back. She ruined our experience.

Oxicwh6Xi-xGo8ywD73Wzw.text: Here again because it's the best. And it's national Margarita day. The hostess is washing off menus in between seating people which is awesome. I hate sticky menus.

goLdVmKznL0G5YLApQ2Meg.text: It was super packed but that's what you get for going on a Saturday ahah definitely worth the wait! Food came out super fast and it was DECILIOUS!! Finally a solid Mexican food place

JnvD-PFcjm5UNL_yRpXu7A.text: I can't stay away from this place! It has everything I look for in a great dining out experience!!!! Great environment, delicious food, and attentive service! The food is so good and I always leave planning my next visit. I love the flaming hot fajitas and the feeling that I'm always welcome there and wanted back to return. This is my go to Restaurant for a great night out and it never disappoints! Definitely a go to!

ihSI5Ef-Lh4PysE7IIojNA.text: This is the only Mexican Restaurant I have liked since I moved here from California 9 years ago.  Great food,  margaritas,  and service.   Home made tortillas both flour and corn.   My go to is the shrimp ceviche.  Their fajitas are good too.   The fajitas for two can actually feed 4 easy,  just order a couple of extra sides of tortillas.

he9Eujc9JMoi_lAA9F8bXQ.text: How have I not made a review for Juan's yet!  Fabulous! The service is always top notch, I love that all of the workers work as a team it makes everything run so smooth! The food is awesome and consistent. The fajitas really as flaming and amazing! Taquitos are good tacos are yummy everything has been great! I don't live in the Southwest at all but go that way just for Juan's! Never had any cocktails there but there's a full service bar which is awesome if we ever go without the kiddos. The only thing I really dislike is their lack of waiting area...you're constantly in someone's way when waiting and often end up standing outside. If they could figure out how to expand that area this place would be perfect!

0lewqB3FvlEpod4RtemwtA.text: We ordered the steak fajitas, which come as expected- flaming!  Can't say enough about their homemade corn and flour tortillas, delicious guacamole, and never ending crispy thin chips with lots of salsas.  So fantastic!  As Texans, we appreciate the great food, feels like home.  Today we also had their house margaritas, which were excellent.  Highly recommend this place!!

_xNpCHKeaWw4gMgW2RVriQ.text: Great food and staff! I enjoyed the fideo soup and beans served with salsa for dipping. I've never had that as an appetizer. Fajitas were delicious, serving portions were big and enough to share for 2 adults, 2 teens and 2 little ones.  Mago margarita was delicious. Staff was friendly and prompt. I'd highly recommend.

B7B9yyFAjaN9gx1XFehxUA.text: Came here on a Sunday night during Happy Hour. We were pleasantly greeted and escorted to our table. The hostess informed us we were in time for Happy Hour, so we scanned the menu to see if anything caught our eye. Man oh man is their HH menu extensive!? I was blown away!? We settled on a beer and strawberry margarita. Beer is standard, good as always; as for the margarita, that could be deadly and dangerous. It is so perfectly blended that you cannot taste the tequila. As for munchies, we were given an endless supply of chips, salsa, and refried beans. Yum.  As for our entrees, they were ridiculously good. We both live in San Diego, so our standard for Mexican food is relatively high, but I would come here in a heartbeat, if in the area again. We ordered a beef chimichanga and a chicken enchilada. Both were delicious and flavorful, especially the chicken. Neither were dry either. The portion was just right too. Not something you would share with someone else; if you took any home, it would be a VERY small amount.  The service was excellent, above average I would say. The food was spot-on. I hope this place makes it. It's a hidden gem if you are looking for somewhere off the strip to relax and enjoy.

5umqZUdwN8JBzXObOWjofQ.text: Good service, everyone is friendly. Food is yummy. I like all the extras like the soup and chips and salsa. Fajitas are definitely worth getting.

5-cqPfyj-5J0hJp9hBfXmQ.text: Love the table-side flaming fajitas  Tried this place on a random Saturday afternoon around 3pm when nothing else interesting in the area was open.  Great find.  Obviously if a place is called "Juan's Flaming Fajitas", you have to try the fajitas.  Fantastic.  We like to get the combination one with steak and shrimp.  We've since gone out of our way to enjoy more fajitas here!

yhQY_zB_CBfnJgvvMmmQYw.text: Amazing food and even better service!! Every employee was very helpful in ensuring we had a wonderful meal and experience!

9A75bhf_hNH2ZzFN8hM2iw.text: Really great restaurant! Excellent and attentive service, good food for a reasonable price that was quickly prepared. All of the staff we encountered were friendly; the outdoor seating was very comfortable. And the end of our meal, we received a complimentary dessert from the owner, who expressed his happiness that visitors to Las Vegas were coming to his restaurant. I highly recommend this restaurant!

VKkjUxP0iLcrZvnA-7chMA.text: BEST Mexican restaurant in town!  The staff is friendly and there is a unique flavor to their dishes.

a4hOkopk-n6_1h0GtBG8oQ.text: Coming from New Mexico, we eat Green and Red Chile almost daily. Since moving here to Vegas its hard to find good, authentic Mexican restaurants. This is one of my top picks!! Good food, great drinks, prices are excellent. Suggest you try it out!!

IQb62sAItuYleEHEJmCy-g.text: Best Mexican restaurant in town.  Service is great, food is excellent and queso is perfect.  Chips and queso are a staple in any Mexican restaurant in Texas but for some reason, not out here.  I finally found a spot in Las Vegas that serves it and I'd say Juan's queso would be in the top 15 of all Tex-mex restaurants in Texas

N_ToMdDh_gK5YvCP4gid0Q.text: Great chefs and staff they have been in Vegas for many years. Food is outstanding!  Salsa and bean dip are the best!  Great value!

PbONBcnJiuxrf79ibIewMw.text: The BomB.Com every time we come to Vegas it's our go to spot. Huge portions great service and in expensive and I don't mind paying for great food but it's not expensive. Mind you I come from L.A. Some of the best Mex food out there but this is truly up there with OG as the get like going to my grandmas house in Mex.

Z3SWpwO2NrEi4j05cWVO9g.text: Went here for happy hour and dinner recently with a party of four.  Drinks were fine, prices good (especially happy hour), food was so so.  Although their soup was excellent and their chicken was good, the beef was just rough.  Came out grey and just looked gross.  Flavor wasn't good either.  We all said the same thing about the beef, no matter what it was on: a taco, burrito, fajita, whatever.  Seating outside is nice.  It's a decent place for happy hour and cheap apps, but the food wasn't what it should've been.

uezP76aN-xJeqNM9GzAjCw.text: The food is excellent,  I recommend the steak fajitas! The chips, salsa and bean dip is amazing! The customer service is excellent!  5 stars!  Great price!

KF_5fJnfHS7nE2aubFznLg.text: Nice place to eat for business lunch meetings.   Large portions so be cautious when ordering something's you can actually share.  They offer chips salsas do bean dip which is fresh and delicious.

akIAdGJv24pe1tiFmmhbVg.text: Great food & service.  Only docked a star because the singer lingers at your table waiting for a tip.

A23alWaO7PxN2x_pduDuDQ.text: We have been here multiple times and it satisfies our taste buds every time. This is our go to Mexican place. The salsa, bean dip,  and guacamole are delicious. They also give complimentary fried onions and jalapeno which pair perfectly with chips and salsa and any entree. The servers are pleasant, accommodating and attentive. The chips and salsa keep coming without asking. I have tried their chimichangas, burritos, Sea Bass, and fajitas. They were all flavorful and scrumptious. The portions are large enough to share. The margaritas are good too. We will be back for more!

EUtMHOHjP5cve8XJhDWrtA.text: Came for the first time with family. Didn't even know this jewel was near my place. Ordered the Enchiladas Suizas and those were amazing. Had the Queso Fundido as well....super dope. Definitely a fan.

bN6mEhORWLxLG9RyC4VPIw.text: Great Mexican food CAN be found in Las Vegas and it's at Juan's!  Being from SoCal, I've been in search of good Mexican food for quite some time.  We chose Juan's based on the great  reviews.    Started in the cantina since the wait on this Friday evening was about 20 minutes.  The strawberry Coronarita's were a hit with the group.  Dos XX and Corona Light on tap along with a number of other options.  Chips were good and we couldn't stop eating the salsa and bean dip.  They're famous for the Flaming Fajitas so the mixed chicken and beef were the choice.  In a word, excellent.  Big portions, all the options included (sour cream, pico, guac) along with rice and beans or veggies.  Not only was the food great but service was very attentive including refills on everything from drinks to chips and sides.  We rounded it out with the sopapillas and consensus was, this will be a repeat too.   Will be back soon and often!  Glad we found Juan's!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just the beginning!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget the strawberry Coronarita!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This comes with the fajitas: rice, beans and the sides

dqM28G64cjnx9SwEwm2DHQ.text: This review is long overdue. Been here twice and the food is ok. The reason I'm giving the 3 stars is because of their awesome customer service.

CGpsV-JJojd9sOZrlrbheg.text: My FAVORITE Mexican food in Vegas!! From the service to the food I'd give 5 stars all around!!! Everyone is always friendly and welcoming!!!   I can't ever get enough chips and salsa and margaritas!! My mouth is watering just thinking of it!   It's Soo fun too see the FLAMING fajitas being served to tables and the smell is to die for!!!! It can get pretty busy though so I'd recommend making a reservation if you're looking to go in the evening time, or try to catch a seat at the bar! It's a great family place but also perfect for a date night!!  My husband loves the chicken enchiladas with red sauce but my favorite is the Mulitas!!!! Although I prefer the lunch portion because it's a HUGE serving and I can rarely even finish one!! No worries, you can always take the leftovers to enjoy later at home!!!  Really no place compares in my opinion to Juans, it's just excellent all the way across the board!! Soo happy to finally have a great Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood!! Good job Juan!!! :)

lDQWFxH5TbESTvFHF98cgw.text: We went with 6 people on a Monday night at 830. no wait. Excellent food and drinks for a great price. We all enjoyed what we ordered and the service was excellent.

20Urg9Y7yypEksEBr47sPA.text: I was skeptical to try out this place because of the weird name. It's kind of like judging a book by its cover - I'm really good at that. So as we're driving into the parking lot of the Flaming Fajitas I quickly pulled out the Yelp app and checked some of the reviews. Norm K. recommended the flaming fajita so I decided then and there that that's what I'm getting.   Immediately upon sitting down, a waitstaff came over to our table and laid down a plate of grilled onions and jalapenos, chips and salsa. I absolutely loved the grilled jalapenos and the bean dip that came with the chips - so much that I asked for extra servings of jalapenos!   The flaming fajita serves two people. We shared that and had plenty of leftovers. Normally I find that beef served at Mexican restaurants are always on the tough side. But at Juan's Flaming Fajitas, the beef was very tender and flavorful.   Over all it was a great experience! I will sure to come back to try out the flan, more grilled jalapenos and more flaming fajitas!

hRvlBHTWXi3G7qm_o24Oag.text: I love Mexican food but this was not really my type of place. Just didn't do it for me. I had carne asada burrito and it was not good.

TOueC0qeRgUKCP4aLsY6sA.text: Stopped in with the GF to meet a buddy and his wife for lunch.  The day was rainy and cool; the lighting was dim and coozy; the sizzling sounds and heat from nearby fajita platters kept us warm.  They have a three dollar margarita that will keep you entertained while consuming delicious salsa, bean dip and chips.  The salsa is fantastic.  The smoky flavor reminded me of a favorite haunt back in my home town.  The GF and I split a delicious chicken fajita quesadilla.  Looking forward to trying a flaming plater of meat and vegetables in the future.  Alas, a majority of lunch consisted of $3 dollar margaritas.  The service was at times a little slow, but the server would make up for it with his friendly demeanor.  As the rain continued to fall and eventually start flooding nearby Tropicana.  With check having been paid, I made a run at the cantina.  The bartender was friendly and served up a mean margarita that had a lot more soul and booze than the tres buck version.

3HtMC1H-8PFoMDxBSc4_1w.text: Awesome place had a dinner planned there for a wedding. Awesome service Juan the owner was all over it and one of his managers Amanda was super kind and got everything done that we requested.

hC2XtQ1N8lCUT68qW_snlQ.text: Finally...decent, well seasoned carne-asada. Vegas is hit and miss with Mexican food. I guess I was spoiled being from Southern California and have high expectations. Their chips and salsa were excellent as well! I didn't have any drinks but I saw several other tables ordering some pretty legit looking margaritas. I will be back again for sure!

Opk56-Q_SxliZoYycFRNPg.text: We came to take advantage of happy hour and it was so worth it! The margaritas with coronita or pacifico were great we order one on the rocks and one frozen they bot were equally good!!  Chips, bean dip, rajas and salsa are complimentary and are constantly refill through out your dinner experience.  Our server Mary was very helpful suggesting items and helping us decide what to eat, over all we enjoy every bite and every moment!! Great place, service and happy hour!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp queso
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada queso

iGnOY1P30fwVUjxULzJYcw.text: Ordered today, 7/17/2016, from GrubHub.  Food was delivered within 30 minutes of ordering it, amazing.   I'm from East LA and no other restaurant in Vegas has come even marginally close to reminding me of home.   This restaurant just got it right. So yep, five stars. I'll be ordering from this place again in the near future.

XF6fynwOWbixQKEFHu38hA.text: This is my first visit here. It's a Sunday night at 6 o'clock and it's very busy. Theres a 30 minute wait and we were seated in 15 minutes.  we didn't have to wait for our server to take our drink order and our food was served in 15 minutes. Guss, our server, was on top of things.  I went back last week and had the Fajitas and Margaritas. As expected, it was great

FwN6Tblk5QJFnzbH3S4FNA.text: This is a place that understands you have to do something to stand out in a city where there are many good/great places to eat. Instead of being just another boring Mexican joint, Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina does a lot of little things to set themselves apart from the rest.  The chips came with two kinds of salsa, beans and grilled onions and chilies. They gave everyone a very good cup of soup prior to the meal. The flaming Fajitas were a nice touch and the food was great.  Highly recommend this place and will be a regular spot on our next trip.

W73xXBfaCDw1BmgetolP0g.text: My family and I really enjoyed this place. Super busy on Friday night with about a 45 min wait, but as for lunch Monday through Friday it's extremely fast service. Plate are very reasonably priced with a pretty fair portion size. Staff does a fantastic job of working together!

iVp7EFlDUUvDqIKDpdmkow.text: Amazing food, and great service! House margarita was perfect, and stiff too! Shrimp and steak tacos were big but flavorful.

PVGkrKs6J-z3Gh6s7Ni9KQ.text: Great atmosphere, fair prices, good food, and family friendly. Great margaritas, too. My only complaint is sometimes there is a wait even though it's a decent size restaurant. It's just so popular! Time to expand, Juan!

c1Jxu_zaw58T0etR0ihBGQ.text: I'm not a local, but I found this place as it was recommended by a buddy. It's a little ways off the strip, but totally worth the venture. Portions are very good, and quality of food was excellent. Service was above expectations.  Each person I encountered seemed very concerned with my groups experience. All of us enjoyed our meals. Between us we have chips/salsa/bean dip, soups, chile Colorado, fajitas (chicken and steak), and some really yummy looking tacos.  I tried both, the corn and flour tortillas with the meal and they were also a good compliment. I didn't drink as I went for lunch so unfortunately I wasn't able to rate the margaritas.  Highly recommended.

XteIM85H3lXWHA-18Cg0eQ.text: Best fajitas I've had in years. And I eat a lot of fajitas. Lively happy hour with killer margaritas. Homemade chips. 2 different salsas and bean dip. Flaming fajitas are awesome. Love this place.

DhbGK_b4nAHDvaGQP6BFfg.text: I love this place. Great food, great people, awesome family environment. Menudo is always fresh. The 3 dipping sauces served with their chips are very good and chips are crisp and warm. The grilled Peppers and onions are lightly salted and have are a great starter surprise. Never disappointed when I go their. You know it's a great place when there are lines out the door and everyone is still smiling.

_vFT-ad4XpTIjEtHFoiONQ.text: Excellent food and service!!! My only complaint was the non recyclable styrofoam "to go" containers. Taking that aside, I would give this restaurant 5 stars. Highly recommend the chicken fajitas. Easily enough for 2 as the portions are mind blowingly large.

W1cBXyukYIyLiVeHd8iyag.text: Customer service is magnificent. Food is absolutely delicious! Next time I'm in town will definitely come back.

boS7erEv7Hazvlpz3g8J-g.text: If you want awesome service, great food at a reasonable price you hit the jackpot here!  Whether it's dining in the restaurant with Aurtoro, patio or in the bar with Flacco and Rojas you will be teated like royalty with amazing food and service second to none!    Warning:  this place is habit forming!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CtVhPrpk6RPILJWkTq0XtA.text: My wife and I have been here many times and we are never disappointed. The service is great and the food is some of the best in town.    This last visit we were in the mood for some authentic Mexican breakfast, so my wife ordered the huevos rancheros and I ordered the huevos con chorizo y papas plate. These items are under the Brunch section of the menu and a drink is included from soft drinks to a draft beer, mimosa, or a margarita.  Both of our plates were fantastic and the beers went down nicely as well!! The portions are generous and you also get chips with salsa and beans to get everything started.   During football season, Juan's also has all day football specials that include $3.50 pints of their Mexican beers on tap and an assortment of appetizers and taco plates. On top of that, they have an awesome Happy Hour from 3-7p everyday that also has similar specials.   I haven't tried the actual flaming fajitas yet, but I plan on doing so on one of my next visits. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to enjoy some killer Mexican food in a fun and relaxing atmosphere!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos con chorizo y papas plate....soooo good!!!!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Victoria on draft!! You don&#39;t find this very often!

pMnuJwUa_FMr1BGnQy43qA.text: I am extremely disappointed in my experience this evening at Juan's. My husband have enjoyed coming here regularly since moving to Las Vegas. Their Queso Dip is one of the reasons we like it so much. Tonight, we were having friends over and decided to order their queso to-go to bring home and share. Upon arriving, the to-go waitress brought out a very small cup in a brown bag with nothing else. When I asked why there were no chips, I was told "chips and salsa are only complimentary for dine in guests". I reiterated that I ordered the Queso "DIP" and was expecting chips to DIP in the dip. She again said that "chips and salsa are only complimentary for dine-in guests" but she would be happy to ADD chips and salsa to my order. Let me be very clear, this was not a small side of queso that we ordered, it was an appetizer listed under appetizers on their menu. If the queso is not SERVED WITH chips it should not be listed as an appetizer but as a side instead! The to-go server did not see the problem with an appetizer of queso with no chips and ensured me I could ADD salsa and chips. I had no interest in adding additional food to an order I expected to be complete with chips. She did not offer to bring only chips, only that I could add them with salsa.   In the past, the same to-go/host has greeted us. She's not friendly. The service staff is usually much more friendly. But, we go for their food. After this experience and the disappointing fact that because I'm not DINING in this evening I will not be given chips with the queso "DIP" appetizer I ordered to go, we will not be returning to this restaurant. Juan's is not the closest Mexican Food Restaurant to our house, but we've enjoyed the food. After this experience with their host / to-go person, we will find a different restaurant to frequent.   I want to give zero stars for this evening alone, but I don't think it's fair to the kitchen staff to not at least be recognized for the food we've enjoyed in the past.

zroAv2E_K56C8IO0KnvgHg.text: One of the best restaurants in town! They put on a great show with the table side fire fajitas! Free chips & salsa & beans & grilled poblano peppers! The service was amazing, they never let us run out of water or drinks! The organic margaritas are the best!!! The steak fajitas I had were seasoned just right & sizzling hot! (Hence the fire/flames) We were so full we didn't try dessert but look forward to next time!!! Can't wait to go back there!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great service at Juans Flaming Fajitas! The largest amount of free chips &amp; dips ever, hot &amp; tasty! The organic margaritas are a must!!!

uQmGuEusJfXfQeUWaw8OHA.text: Amazing food and service! Their fajitas are the best you will ever have! I haven't had anything on the menu that wasn't delicious! The chips they bring out come with grilled peppers and onions, beans and salsa. Seriously delicious!! Highly recommend.

Wy0YswX3zGTvm4T7xBqGSA.text: We got the steak and chicken fajitas. It was a very fun experience. The steak fajita was the better one in my opinion because the chicken one tasted slightly bland. Table side guacamole was good, they give you a taste so you can modify it before they serve it to you. Also a lot of TV's, no bad seats for watching games!

XYQpkYWiQSCkWNGVJFX10w.text: Hooray for Juan's!!   We've now visited twice.   Once for lunch and once for a busy Friday night dinner.     On both visits, we were greeted immediately.  They have great customer service here.  The waitstaff and hostesses do an amazing job!  Chips, bean dip, salsa and sauteed toppings are brought out with seconds of sitting down.   Fabulous!  The sauteed toppings include onions, jalapenos and red hot peppers.   Yummy!    With the dinner entrees, their soup is brought out for the table.   It's delicious!  Great flavor!  Honestly I was almost full after the chips and soup! It seemed as if it were 2 seconds after I finished my soup were our entrees delivered.   On our first visit, we had to order the flaming fajitas of course!   What a show!!    The mound of meat and veggies on this are sure to fill anyone's appetite.   They were absolutely delicious and would highly recommend them!   On my second visit I wanted to try the shrimp tacos.  Again, fabulous flavor and filled with a lot of shrimp!  On both occasions I ordered the grilled vegetables instead of the rice and beans.  It's a great side item that compliments any meal.    Our drinks never went empty and our stomachs were filled to the brim!  A fabulous restaurant!  Thanks Juan's!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tacos with grilled vegetables.  Yum!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bean dip and salsa.  Also comes with sautéed onions and jalapeños!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Fajitas ablaze!

RkKzgFvKfHdmZyI6BVB97Q.text: Happy people work here and that's just the beginning. I am so picky about Mexican food because I get a lot of home cooked dishes regularly, but I love the food here. It is like someone would serve you at their home. Omar was a wonderful server and everyone seems like a big happy family. We already have a list of friends to bring here as soon as we get a chance.

WNWnf4AuFvDJbBVivWnj7g.text: Just had lunch here! Such a great environment ! Staff is very friendly. I had the taco de calle, food was very fresh. Will be returning soon.

kTQy15_DAmkd2hkzfsUATA.text: This is what me of my favorite places to dine in!!!!! Hey is all about good service and fresh made from scratch food !!!! Omg is amazing  Christian our waiter is amazing so in to making your experience a 100% I will definitely share w friends and for sure I will go back  (ask for Chris) you will not be disappointed

Ay31ULhiVQzWQMzVRwNesA.text: Man, the service at this place is phenomenal!   As soon as we sat down, we were asked for our drink orders and were served a complimentary chips and salsa/bean dip. All of that happened even before we can open the menu! It's a bunch of different servers working together. I think that's one of the things that made this place stand out for me. We have one server who took our orders but there were a bunch of other people working around making sure our drinks were filled, our dips were not running low, the used plates were out of the way, everything they were on top of it!  The food was excellent too. I got shrimp fajita that came with a side of rice, guacamole and beans and your choice of corn or flour tortillas. I was excited to see them light it on fire! It was surely entertaining! If you order the combo on a Tuesday night, instead of paying $12, you only pay $10. The portions were huge and the sauces they provided were abundant. For two people, it was definitely a feast. We made room for desserts and ordered churros. It was sooooo good. Maybe because I have been craving them but seriously, with a little bit of whipped cream and a drizzle of chocolate syrup, those churros were melt in my mouth good.   Also, I love it when the whole restaurant sings when it is somebody's birthday. It makes the ambiance more friendly and festive. I was definitely a good change from my boring Tuesday nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamales and enchilada combo
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros, delicious!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajita

R8FtUKRj-4U4I1BV8bkBuQ.text: This place is great! I've visited twice now and have enjoyed the atmosphere and food each time. Of course, order the fajitas...I've had the vegetable fajitas, shrimp fajitas, and chicken fajitas. The shrimp fajitas were definitely the best. They're cooked perfectly and the caramelized onions on the skillet are amazing. The wait time can get pretty long if you go around the 5PM hour on a friday or weekends...but I would say it's work the wait.

ZChn_Xd3UYFvOlnL6i9DFA.text: Many of my friends have told me about this place. They said the bean dip was to die for. It was so super good. They told us we might have to wait but it would be worth it. The wait wasn't even 20 minutes.  Within 25 minutes of hitting the door we had our chips and salsa our drinks and our soup. The service was outstanding. Omar was on target and gave us the best service we had in a long time. Thank you for a great meal. Steak fajitas were awesome, tacos delicious.   We will be back.

rWh90x5u0VtM2uSbpSAXFA.text: Finally ate here for the first time and let's just say, the fajitas do not disappoint! Quite possibly the best fajitas I've ever had! I love how they light them on fire before they put them on your table. Great presentation! And I also like how the fajitas are in a round raised bowl instead of flat on the table with those long handles so you're not constantly having to be careful to not burn yourself! The chips and salsa are excellent and bean dip is super good! The service was outstanding. Several workers checked on us throughout our meal and were very friendly. I can't wait to go back. The only reason I did not give it a five star rating is because the place needs more decor! I like going to Mexican restaurants that are all decorated inside like a fiesta! There was nothing fun about the inside of this place. Will definitely go back

4TuL2Vvhe1B7dZRDknLqaA.text: What can I say? Juan's is fantastic! Their fajitas are the best that I've ever had and the service is spot on. My only complaint is that they are super busy most of the time and waiting is sheer torture because you can smell the delicious food but can't have any yet. I would recommend to anyone that enjoys excellent Mexican food. This is also a great place to bring friends/family from out of town. Delicious!!!

aOJpwoNuDeVk48KJ1PlXUQ.text: We're local folks who absolutely love spending time at Juan's...especially on a Friday evening. Great food and the servers are awesome.  Love Maria and Amanda.  We're Juan's Flaming Fajitas happy fans.

mR4CQsnu9QaMliU1Xcf23A.text: We have looked for good, reasonably priced Mexican food since moving here 18+ months ago. This place checks the boxes. Good chips, salsa, and bean dip. Food came out quick and was tasty.   My wife really appreciated the vegetarian option. She bought the avocado tacos which she really enjoyed. I got a two item combo (carne asada taco and pork (al pastor) burrito. It was good.   Staff was friendly and attentive. A/c could have been dropped down a few degrees but not uncomfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. carne asada and al pastor burrito combo

IwUY3kGq5NOiakNJyR0msA.text: This place is always a win. There is always a wait though so be prepared. The wait never takes as long as they say it will tho. They hand you chips, salsas and amazinggggg bean dip right when you sit down. Seriously get a few extra things of bean dip. The soup they bring out is excellent as well. I always order the grilled fish tacos. The fish is so tender and moist. And the homemade tortillas are the bomb.com. Such a great restaurant. Always one of my go-to's when people are visiting from out of town. And the service is fast and attentive PS grab some of the green/white candy on your way out. So good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos, so yummmmy

XxL70RUKfwsfeatDqLxnBA.text: I love this place! So to start off food is amazing, I always get full off of the chips and salsa! I got their street tacos the other day, which were great! Also, tried their fajitas which they are known for and has exceeded my expectations. Secondly, I love how they are a "family style" restaurant. You might have one server but if you need anything else, the others will be sure to help! Will go back again and again.

7LP7FXbooxhxTWvv7_8DhA.text: I think I just found my second favorite Mexican restaurant aside from Red Iguana in Salt Lake City.  The chips were hot and had the right amount of saltiness.  Four different items are served with the chips and each as equally good as the other.  Hand made tortillas were served with the fajitas.   The chicken had great seasoning and the right amount of char and even had a touch of flare with a fire bath before serving.  So good!   Total bill for two during lunch was $24.

w7NVbeWWxKH07q5GLyqd1w.text: Had the steak fajitas. They were tasty. The service was wonderful. Will be going back in the future.

TIV-M8dbDzSUoQdwXczAsA.text: Long wait after check in, busy Resturant however food was great and service was very good and friendly. Our server Hernan made a great margarita and provided excellent service at our table. He made great recommendations and helped keep our 4 year old happy with lots of orange slices.   I had the carnitas plate which was good. Others at our table tried fajitas, tacos, and enchiladas everyone stated they were happy with their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Fajitas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of Flaming Fajitas

Lm6kUSlpidPIzmbQ-3fTWw.text: Always great service ever time me and my family come in, I'm trying really hard to find one problem with this place but I just can't.for ever my favorite place to eat .great food friendly staff. Outstanding management

KjSZyPe5pHdxS_bAgt7_1A.text: It was a great place for good Mexican food!!! Thank you and will be back!!! We got our seats right away, great warm chips, salsa and bean dip!!!

xdHzY7pEgDonkeOia2NL-A.text: Awesome table side guacamole. Salsa was perfect and everything was authentic and delicious. Highly recommend you visit this place if you are in Vegas.

iICEdiu9o3OWLSLeESYugw.text: I went there 3 times,food always  fresh,  Waiter's are very friendly.  Definitely recommend but if you go at 5 you're gonna wait.

PzptHuJFgVroFpscqAvcLQ.text: Yum!  I love the food here, fresh chips and salsa! Everything from server to food is delicious.  The hostesses aren't the friendliest, but everyone else is so nice!  They're usually really busy during lunch and dinner times.  Either you come right when they open or right before they close if you want to dine it.  There has only been about 2-3 times, we only had to wait 10 minutes.  Do expect to smell like fajitas afterwards, even if you don't order the fajitas.  Other people orders it, you will smell.  I wouldn't suggest to eat here is you have some event to tend afterwards.    Fajitas are the best here.  We tried so far the shrimp and steak.  I think I like the shrimp better.  I tend to order the Chicken Quesadilla, Mexican Combinations (tamales, enchilada, tacos, and/or burritos).  Portions are huge, fresh and tasty.    Definitely try to eat here as often as my husband allows it.  LOL, he doesn't like the way we smell afterwards.  Will have to shower once we get home every time.

8BPFwRHFyk1cGIv1KQydIg.text: We went to Juan's on Mother's day. SUPER BUSY....we decided to visit the bar while we waited to be seated. While there we decided just to eat at the bar! The service was FANTASTIC...drinks were delicious! We ordered Queso fundido and OMG....I am a huge fan of Queso fundido but a lot of places do not know how to truly make it...not here! Perfection!!!  The seasonings and gooeiness of the cheese was perfect!  We ordered the flaming fajitas for 2..steak and chicken!!! They literally come out on fire...actual fire!!! The ratio of meat to grilled veggies was outstanding!!! Sooooo much meat. Like no where else!  The veggies were actually grilled...not just warm.  We left stuffed and happy. We took so much home because they give you sooooo much food. Our fajitas for 2 probably could have fed 3...and we can eat! ;)  we will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HAPPY man!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incredible!!!

j80Q6BnmVoLUCkUfdPrnjg.text: I met up with some girlfriends for dinner on a Friday at 430. This is my first time here so I'm really excited and I could smell the fajitas in the park lot. The parking lot is way too small for this restaurant AND an In N Out (just saying).   Once I walked in the I was greeted by the hostess and found my friends immediately. We ordered margaritas off the happy hour menu. They make a mean margarita! Then we had the fundito cheese to start along with warm tortilla chips and 2 types of homemade fresh salsa. The fundito cheese is basically a flavorful cheese melted on a hot ass grilled plate. It was DELICIOUS!  Once we placed our entrees, we were brought out a small cup of hot fiedo soup. It was the best fiedo soup I've ever had.   We HAD to order fajitas at a Flamming fajita's restaurant! So I see the fajitas coming out way. Once they came to the table the waiter ignites the fajitas on FIRE! It smelled so good. My friend ordered the steak fajitas. The meat was so tender and had such an amazing seasoning on it. I recommend the steak or beef opinion. Then to finish off the night we ordered the fried ice cream.  Ambience: Fun but a little loud and smoky a bit during to the fajitas on fire.   Quality: 10 out of 10. Great flavor and so tender!  Price: Very well priced. Between the 3 of us each of us paid $23 bucks  Service: The best. Very attentive without being too attentive.   Once we left the waiting area was full and people were actually waiting outside! So their busiest time is between 5-6pm.   Final thoughts: I have to bring everyone I know here it's THAT good!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner with my girls!

A8Q_K0h6qQV1vSWvCCM85Q.text: I love this place so much!!! The food is so good! The Guadalajara Special is everything. The staff is so  pleasant

z9ejS1qYNqSVeq74uES_yQ.text: Great Mexican food! We came around 4 pm on a Saturday afternoon and it was really busy. We had about 40 minute wait, and decided to hang out at the bar. There was no seating at bar either, so we had to stand, but bar tenders were quick and friendly. They have happy hour EVERYDAY! The margaritas were like $5 and cheap beers. The margaritas were not watered down. I had the Pina Colada flavor, and it had sweet pieces of coconut and pineapple.  I also had a spicy watermelon that was not on happy hour menu, but only $9 nice flavors and strong.  Our waiter was really nice and took our orders pretty quick. Then we had the complimentary chips, salsa, and bean dip. The bean dip is sooo good, but no free refills.  2 other staff members came by to check on us throughout our meal and even apologized to us for the long wait. Our food was delish and tasted homemade. Beans were creamy and full of garlic flavor. My fave was the chile relleno. It was stuffed with cheese and had a nice crispy coating even with the delish red sauce on top. I will def be back especially for the delish and cheap margaritas! Hopefully not much of a wait on the next visit.
