5bLZJJtg19cbzw14NsO8bg.text: Good food, good prices and a show. What more can you want. if you can handle it they have Habanero. Fun place.

lRjHyXWD3SLzgBsM5BJXdw.text: If you're looking for good Mexican food in Las Vegas, you've found your place! We come here every couple of months when we have a hankering for Mexican food. I usually get the blackened shrimp tacos, which I would highly recommend. Last time I was there, I got hr vegetarian enchiladas, which were also quite tasty! I've had a mango margaritas, which is also pretty good.

SR0DjgsS6NWHo2_6lCzv8g.text: I've been to this restaurant several times and have nothing but positive things to say. The service has always been excellent from the hostess to the waiters and bus boys all the way down to the owner (who has been there to greet us multiple times during our visits).   The appetizers are very tasty with good fideo, grilled onion and jalapenos, and salsa and beans for the chips. The table side guacamole is also good a good choice. The only detractor is the chips. I thought that they used to make their own tortilla chips but the last few times they were underwhelming and bland. I don't know where they got them but I would much rather have True tortilla chips.   The meals taste great and the portions are plenty big enough (2 piece combo fills me up and you can add another item still). I've enjoyed the fish tacos and carne asada burrito (red sauce) among other things. The taco salad with grilled vegetables is another highlight for me. On birthdays they will humiliate your friend by throwing a sombrero on and singing their version of happy birthday so that's an entertaining plus ( they get a super sweet churro dessert for being a sport).   Overall I'm a fan of Juan's Flaming Fajitas and will be back again.

uqHJ1JvWoW3tgz5dAgI8kg.text: First time here... EXCELLENT CHIOCE!!!  Food is Hot an Quick to your table.. Must try.. Definitely coming back... Chicharron Plate is MAGNIFICO!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottom- Steak Picado, to die for...DELICIOUS!!! Top- Chicharrron plate- OMG!! Never tasted BETTER!!!

egsjo9KBfvh_pfEQAmqRWg.text: Been here a few times and love everything about this restaurant except, during this visit.  The food was still delicious but the service at the end was uncalled for.    A lady (not our server) asked us if we were done while we were taking a break from munching on our food.  She then proceeded to take our roasted jalapenos not asking if we did not want it (and we did).  While hubby puts away our food in the to-go box, this same lady puts her whole arm in front of hubby as if he was the one in the way of her getting everything off our table.  She comes back to our table and asked if I was done with my plate when here I am, holding a spoon to feed my toddler.  I just didn't understand why she kept taking things away from our table. Why was she rushing us when clearly there were empty tables and no one waiting tone seated.   What bothered me also is that she kept passing by our table looking at our empty water glasses and never bothered to refill it (and this was even before she started rummaging our table).  If you're not going to refill it, then don't look over!  Ugh!    I'm so UPSET!!! I loved going here until this lady! I was so bothered!!!

-iCd0bOSbyLGMjAAErfXjA.text: They give you a couple things to munch on before the meal. The chips and salsa were a great appetizer. Also we loved the onion and green chilies they give you. Our server was so quick and friendly and was very helpful with navigating the menus. When the fajitas are brought out they light them on fire in front of you before serving you. It's a great show. We ordered the chicken, shrimp, and steak fajitas. It was all great! However we both felt the shrimp didn't have much seasoning on it and tasted a bit bland. The chicken and steak were seasoned perfectly! We highly recommend either one.

pHT_HkROUvSIcPAgA5FQug.text: Went @3pm on a Wednesday.  Just in time for happy hour.  There was a wait for the regular dining area so we opted for the bar area.  We ordered margaritas & was served the complimentary chips/dips/soup.  I ordered the shrimp & steak fajitas & my friend got the fish tacos.  When the food arrived he asked me if I was ready because I just had to get the Instagram post of my flaming fajitas LOL ;)  The food portions are good.  My fajitas were amazing of course.  I only had 1 & was already stuffed.  I took the rest home for hubby to try.   Our waitress even gave me a big bag of warm chips to take home.  Overall, the food was yummy & our service was great!  Next time my whole family will be going!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Shrimp Fajitas

ML1bwt9GJCiFO0oKudrFAg.text: I was pestered by my coworkers to try this place out. I'm not a fan of Mexican cuisine because for the most part, it all tastes the same to me. After coming to this place, my opinion has changed and I'm admitting that this restaurant has changed my view of Mexican cuisine.   Juan's puts out complimentary chips and salsa. The chips or nachos are out of this world. Warm and crispy dipped into a bean dip, mild, or hot salsa made fresh. You can tell each element was made fresh and not reheated packages food.   The complimentary soup was delicious and vibrant.   We ordered the steak and chicken fajitas and the queso dip appetizer. The marinade in the meats were on point. We put queso dip into our fajitas and it was an explosion of flavor that I've never experienced at a Mexican restaurant. By the time we finished I could barely move. Lots of people I hear end up getting half full just off the nachos and it's hard to resist them because they're so delicious. I have no idea how anyone has room for desert.   We came in around 4pm. My thought process was this place has to be busy during dinner hours so it's best to go early to get seated right away. When we arrived at 4pm, the place was nearly packed. I couldn't believe it. Even really good restaurants I frequent isn't this busy at 4pm.   I do plan on coming back but with more people. It's too much food for just two people even if you order just one entree. Between the  complimentary nachos and soup, half your stomach is full before the entree arrives.   This is by far the best Mexican restaurant experience in my life! You gotta try this place. The food is worth the wait if you can't get seated right away.

Lrh5haqvohGap7DDBLfEMQ.text: So glad we went here on a recommendation.   We had to get the flaming fajitas and we were just in time for happy hour.  This place was busy with the wait of people all the way out in the parking lot.  The food was really good, everything we had was delicious. We had queso for our chips that were served with a bunch of sauces. We had a taco salad, Guadalajara seafood special and the steak fajitas.   We will definitely be going back. The food and service was 5 star and this is now a recommendation when on the west side for Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xgpAv8qsNvk36Tqz2gehsA.text: My friends and family have been talking about this place for a while and I was excited to come check it out. The food was very good, the service very good, happy hour excellent, and the portions solid for the price.  This place was SLAMMED on Sunday at 4. I imagine it's always this busy. They quoted us a 45 min wait, but it was less than 15. They send text updates and you can check where you are in line at any given moment. That was convenient.   Normally, I'd sample a bunch of items before posting a review. This trip we ordered the namesake: Flaming fajitas. We ordered the fajitas for two with steak and pork. We got margaritas as well.   Margaritas was better than average at a really good price point. $4 during their happy hour. The fajitas give energy to the room as the service gives a table-side flambe just before serving. The tortillas were also solid. The steak was maybe the best fajita steak I've ever had, but the pork was underwhelming. If I went back again I'd just order anything with that steak in it.   Our waiter was busting his behind trying to keep everyone happy. He was a little slow with our check and brought us the wrong tortillas at first. He fixed the tortilla issue though as soon as we asked.   They seemed disorganized and outside of the steak and table-side presentation of the fajitas it was just a run of the mill Mexican spot. I look forward to going again to try more items. Having only had one item, this seems to be one of the better Mexican places on the west side of town.

eFvB_ZmPg_Tky8E8eXwcOQ.text: When you leave this place, your clothes will smell like flaming fajitas!!   With that being said, you need to try their flaming fajitas! FIRE. I have been here twice and I go for the shrimp/steak combo. It is large enough to share between 2 people. As you sit, your table will get chips salsa/bean dip/sauteed onions and pepper, but don't get too full on this. Leave some room for your main entrees. Portions are big and it never fails that I need a to-go box for the left overs. The table side guacamole and ceviche are bomb as well. I like the fact that the servers check up on you often. There can be a bit of a wait especially if you come for dinner time (30-40mins). The parking lot gets full also, since it is right next to In N Out. Food is delish, I just hate that you smell like fajitas afterwards hahaha.

zZGzkFwJMBlxi_tC7b658w.text: I've been passing this place for quite some time now and always smell the food from blocks away. The yummy smell alone is what brought me in. Upon entering their establishment I'm greeted kindly at the door. I'm usually by myself so I go to sit at the bar. The bartender Alex is pretty awesome. I'm handed a menu and asked for my drink order. Always with a kind smile and great attitude. As I place my order to go, chips, 2 salsas and beans, onions and jalapenos are places in front of me. I've been here twice now and my orders have been: chicken al mojo de ajo and the chicken con nopales. Both come with sopa de fideo (best I've had yet) and rice and beans. The food is mouth watering delicious! This place is all in all 5 STARS!! The service from the moment you walk through the door to the moment you leave AMAZING! The food is the best in town! If you haven't been here it's best to check it out!

s93X1x6J8oLvOizD7QMHNA.text: I love this place! I stumbled upon it when I was looking for Buzz BBQ (Buzz closed and Juan's opened up in its place). The staff was super friendly & attentive, the owner even came over and chatted with us for a little. Fresh chips, salsa, bean dip with roasted jalapenos & onions were brought out a minute after we sat. We ordered the fajitas and they even gave us complimentary dessert (churros). SO BOMB. I was so impressed with the food quality, cleanliness, friendliness and efficiency I had to bring my roommate back the week after. They also have a great selection off their happy hour menu; I believe it's daily from 3-7PM. Best Mexican food in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb Fajitas !

yuwLVrGyorJkD882NNDdig.text: The food was good but a little overpriced for what you got. The meat was also a little greasy for for my taste.  Not bad overall.

s8KPVFAxjFHOObZVBmRvCw.text: Typically come here for brunch. But dinner is excellent as well. Fajitas, burritos, everything is great!

nbicYEyVzr7iz7u7r5fr4w.text: Staying on the Strip in Vegas and Yelp'd this place on our way back from a day trip. This place IS as good as they say! Don't be put off by the strip mall location. It's very nice inside. VERY friendly and attentive wait staff. I informed our waiter that my wife can't do cilantro (I happen to like it but it bugs me when chefs toss it on everything but oatmeal (Bobby Flay do you hear me? So he made sure that there was no cilantro (except some on the side for me). He even had the chef slice up some nice avocado instead of giving us guacamole which had cilantro. Super margaritas. Chip, salsa you expect, but the EXCELLENT warm bean dip was a delicious surprise if I lived near here I would come in for margaritas and chips and the bean dip. We had fajitas for two, chicken and pork. SO MUCH FOOD! And skillfully prepared. Very fresh and al dente veg. Cup of soup included was delish as well. Can't tell you about dessert, we never made it through HALF of our fajitas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming bro. No kidding!!! SO MUCH FOOD!

J1cUUZmGGtX_CVBs0GmMiA.text: The taquitos are must have, everything is good!!!! Best Mexican food I've had in a long time that's not made by my mom.

_yzWIkaaDDDsZb0r5pbfow.text: Amazing!!! Fajitas are awesome, bean dip, chips.. yummmmmm! !! The waitress was great, damn if I can remember her name.. kept the drinks full, the desert is fantastic.

92jvZhbYiCgN_Y3DZLLxnA.text: If you haven't tried this place, I highly recommend you do! WOW!!! Staff members are courteous and quick, but the food is what keeps me and my family going back! I typically order the gringo enchiladas and my husband likes the flaming fajitas. We've eaten here several times and only once was our order wrong. The staff was quick to fix it and made it right immediately. Our glasses are never empty and always leave with our bellies full.

CsDSpg5Q-n4f0JoFLnNeIQ.text: I absolutely love this place! Friendly and fast service, never pushy. Food is fantastic. The obvious choice is the flaming fajitas.. I always have tons leftover.  Great flavor and perfect spice level (spicy flavor not just heat) The complimentary soup is amazing and they will remove the noodles for you if you are gluten free. They will also make you a quesadilla on a corn tortilla instead of the traditional flour tortilla if you are gluten free. This may seem like a small thing to some people, but this is huge for me! We go here at least once a week... My pants hate it but the fat kid inside couldn't be happier.

l0Cg1kls7tf246KZuzb4Qw.text: Excellent food, excellent service. Their house specialty is the flaming fajitas, very flavorful not overrated. We are very excited that they have ground beef enchiladas, it's very hard to find that anymore.

hb3br7UrDOS4R7srCCLPeg.text: The food here is amazing. I loved that they had a vegetarian bean dip that is complimentary, and they also bring out some grilled veggies to eat with your chips and salsa and beans. The queso is absolutely to die for and the food is terrific. Their rice was the best I've had. And leave room for the sopaipillas.

jGl1QHAjzNejvdi9EPOQTg.text: Best Mexican in Vegas! Killer fajitas, and amazing service!!! Love this place!!

n8B28dyzppoSW9xx9ly4pA.text: Very good vegetarian options. the best fire roasted veggie enchiladas. The fajitas are really good too. I have been back over 10 times. Good go to mexican restaurant.

FlmG2eIcWZXjvQV2QUBxBQ.text: Definitely get your monies worth!!! A lot of food for a decent price & I like that they give you the option of having veggies in place of the rice and beans. Big menu selection. I will definitely be back to try some other stuff.

Dusrt3PhXWryBOzhzHjMaA.text: Although I'm really not a big fan of Mexican cuisine I can't believe we've not been to Juan's Flaming Fajita's before this. A friends of mine said he heard it was good so my wife and I tried it after reading all the rave reviews online. Well we now have a new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. What can I add to what's already been written? The service is friendly, attentive and overall outstanding. The fajitas are very generous (the two of us could have split the chicken fajitas for one) and my wife enjoyed the enchilada and taco combination plate which she ordered with the fresh vegetables. That's a really nice touch that you don't see often as an alternative to rice and beans (they have refried and black beans). As everyone has said the chips and salsa/bean dip that arrive moments after you are seated are excellent. We heeded everyone's advice and held back so as not to spoil our dinner. We went on a Monday at 6:00pm and did not have to wait for a table. The place was busy and as people left they were replaced by an endless stream of customers. They do have outdoor dining but it was 109 degrees outside, even shade with misters (both of which they have) wouldn't be enough to make it comfortable for me (admittedly an wimpy AC devotee). We really enjoyed Juan's a lot.

7MKEZe5bqEQ5p7GchMjOtQ.text: Great Mexican food The Best in Las Vegas. The Chef and Wait staff are equal to none and by far the best in Las Vegas. Most of them have worked together for  many years for an established Mexican restaurant that suddenly closed about a year or so ago . The Chef has been doing his thing here in LV for many years and is one of the best. Juan's has everything going for it including some of  the best food salsa and Margaritas north of the boarder. This is also a Dallas Cowboys bar and has great deals on appetizers on game days and nights. Juan's is a great addition to the Mexican restaurant scene in LV. It also has a very comfortable bar and patio area. Thanks Juan.

zh4-wAX1O0vfz41PheB0Qg.text: Excellent authentic Mexican restaurant! Came here for my 22nd birthday day yo. This place is popping. Great food. Good vibes!

0kmn7K3aI5h7MWmnbqN7cg.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Always great, till today. Service at the bar was very slow. Got there around 230pm. I ordered 2 Tacos. Tacos came out in about 7 minutes. Still no chips and salsa, no knife or fork. No platform to eat 1 over the gaming machine. I had to ask for each thing. And.. Beans and rice were cold.... Very disappointed

ouNOBHM51Q4S_Y_eJECr8Q.text: After a nice afternoon strolling around Spring Mountain Park, I was feeling margarita-ish. My husband actually utilized yelp and Flaming Fajitas popped first on the list. Since we were in the vicinity...Flaming Fajitas it was.  Upon entering the hostess was on her way to seat a couple before us, but made sure to let us know she will be right with us. Right with us she was because we were immediately seated into a large booth that accomodated these minions perfectly. Booths were high enough so when the 2 year old decides to abruptly stand on his seat he isn't looking over into anyone's way or making eye contact with the people.behind us.  As soon as we were seated, it seemed like we were instantly served freshly fried house chips, salsas, and their bean dip. They also brought a small.plate of grilled jalapenos and onions. In which to my surprise the jalapenos were sweet and not spicy. I'm not accustomed to the non-spicy jalapenos. I thought it was a nice touch as that isn't something we typically see when eating at a Mexican restaurant as a house offering. She then brought out a couple cup size bowls of their fideo soup. Which was awesome because we I ended up feeding it to my 10month old...twas a good tranquilizer. Lol.  They serve their happy hour menu daily from 3-7pm. We came in close to 4 and the place was just filling up. It's a nice restaurant that offers a 21 year and over section, and even patio seating.   I quickly found the house margarita on their happy hour menu. You can choose between a 12 of a 16oz for $4.95. I think the 12oz is for a dollar less. I didn't pay attention because I was looking for the largest size I could get at a deal.   Honestly, I wasn't expecting their house margarita at a happy hour menu price to be potent. I kinda don't expect that anywhere. I will say that their house margarita was delicious! I thoroughly enjoyed it and found it to taste better than alot of margaritas ive tried. I can't imagine what their top shelf margaritas taste like! I would have to return without the kids to find out. 2 16oz glasses of their margarita later, and I literally could of drank 4 more to probably catch a thorough buzz. It did, however, fulfill my taste buds for that margarita crave. Since I had the kids, coming from a quick hike, and bound for the mother-in-law's house...I suppose it was a good thing the drink wasn't doused in tequila or else I'd be heading to the in laws drunk. Not a good look. Lol.  Anyway, with the chips and salsas...they were super quick to refill our chips and dips. I love how they offer a nonspicy salsa for the kids. They certainly weren't afraid to serve those up. I even told my husband if they keep refilling our chips, bean dip, and salsa...I don't even think we'll order actual food.   Which is kinda what happened. My kids just wanted taquitos, which to my excitement was on the happy hour menu. Lol. So I ordered one beef and one chicken in which each plate comes with 4 taquitos cut into halves. So in total...you have 8 pcs to pick at. I had to try them, and thought they were pretty good. There was certainly flavor in the meat.  The husband and I decided to share....we'll what else, a Flaming fajita. You have the option of ordering the Flaming fajita for one or two. Because I wasn't that hungry anymore after all the chips and salsas I had been chunking down...we opted for the one and decided to share that.   Our orders did not take too long to come out. Perhaps I didn't notice because the chips and my margarita was distracting me from keeping time. When they bring out your fajitas....they literally flame it up infront of you. Our waiter, Hernan, fantastic by the way! He drizzled some kind of oil and lit that sucker on fire. And voila, Flaming fajita right before your eyes.  Overall, it's pretty standard. The service was wonderful and homely at the same time. Our waiter counted our 4 boys, plugged in the 5th child girl spill...the lady who kept cleaning our table off always took the time to stop and play with our 10month old the way an aunt would. When our 10month old would fuss she'd come by with crackers...so that was real thoughtful.   We certainly had a great experience. The meats in the taquitos and the fajitas (husband chose pork, btw) were definitely moist and not bland at all. The service completely made it a 4 star experience. We would certainly come back.  Definitely recommend if you are in the vicinity. Kid and stroller friendly! Although, I'd say just leave the stroller in the car just so it isn't in the way, unless, they can seat you in booths that have lots of aisle space. Also, working buckles on their highchairs! Thank you for that!  P.S. Always check-in each visit as you get 15 percent off your bill. Shibby!

u6FcCk7l8v0O101OEtEKWw.text: We live in Aliante but drove here for the great food and service.  Yajaira was sweet, attentive and diligent.   Food was delicious and came fast.  Will drive across town again soon.

Ol_as6DrdbvISt5Q6hIALg.text: This place has great service and some of the best Fajitas I have ever had.  The guacamole is killer also.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here for dinner.  This place has the best guacamole and chips!!!

c6PhpOnZAXBMdwLwDQOHqA.text: Yummy food great service a little noisy but we were there at Happy Hour on Wednesday margaritas $ 4

npQPBhYiOCpwiOIm61_04A.text: Great food and nice ambiance. Servers were very accommodating and smiling.   However, we literally waited 46 MINUTES before our food arrived!!!!!  I would have wanted to walk-out and cancel our orders but my wife was still busy talking to somebody over the phone. So I waited, waited and waited. And then I noticed that the 2 customers on the other booth who arrived 5 mins late than us received their orders already and then the 2 other tables received theirs as well..Then finally, came ours. I didn't complain about the unreasonable delay but the servers noticed that I was not happy. A server approached us and apologized for the delay and few minutes thereafter, they gave us a complimentary dessert.  I hope this won't happen to future customers. Good food but too much delay in the preparation. 20 mins of waiting is acceptable, 30 mins is already considered delayed but 46 mins of waiting is totally unacceptable. It's our first time to dine out here but it's not worth it.   Thanks for the free dessert though!

oCUg1FT2n6PSjaVkuLn7Hg.text: It was our first time here and her first time on the floor. Daisy was awesome. I come from the restaurant industry and I truly believe she is a good asset to the team. She was great and made sure our first time here was amazing. Every worker stopped by our table to check in on us and that's what we appreciated the most. #tipthebillchallenge

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GIOMvvn1At-UmwtTGbp63g.text: Fast fast fast service! The menu didn't accurately describe each item- I didn't realize there were going to be beans in the quesadilla appetizer. But the tacos were amazing and we LOVED all the salsa options! Sat at the bar and had seriously delicious margaritas. I'll just pay attention to the menu next time! We enjoyed dinner on Monday 1/29/18

4t7LObuMpH-oZ889KeHBgQ.text: Service is good, food not to much Fajitas are tasteless, carne asada has no taste no salt or pepper the flour tortillas were hard as a rock so we ordered corn tortillas and they were even worst and my kid ordered chicken fingers with fries and the fries look at least a day old and tasted like burnt old oil, will definitely never come back here

BNt2FQ5MihjxARqvQSCZlw.text: Tropicana location is always so busy and wait times may be a bit long but the staff is very quick and efficient. Great food and also the prices and Happy Hour menu are wonderful. Also they honor the Military on Monday's. Great place and a must try.

ToKui-MX0NvVvz6f4qmrUw.text: We had a wonderful dinner here tonight! The food is pretty authentic and service was great. We did not have fajitas but will definitely have them next time. Worth the drive from Centennial area!!!

zLQRiwfxRIcJqWHZLypkeQ.text: I've been craving fajitas for a long time. I don't typically see them on menus here at Mexican restaurants. So I was glad to find this place that specializes in them. The grilled steak & chicken were good with the right seasoning. I liked the brief fire show when they brought the fajitas to our table. It was surprisingly a huge fire, but it only lasted about 2 minutes. They provided nice, thin chips with many condiments, such as two super spicy salsas (too much for me), pureed beans, grilled jalapenos & onions. My only complaint was about the tortillas. They steamed them too much that they were stuck together and on the doughy side rather than being more like bread. We went on a Saturday, and the place was really packed. It took about 30 minutes for us to get a seat.

3LO2UMfuG8Jdgn_MpCGCrg.text: The best mexican place ever. Will be back again soon. Thank you so much for the great hospitality and the great food. Everyone was so friendly and gave us a awesome customer service.

OkrSe91Z1GpRjK7hZOyp2w.text: Great food Friendly service Fun atmosphere  I had the pleasure of dining here and i can't wait to go back. I ordered the chicken chimichanga and was not disappointed. Before my dish arrived they brought chips and salsa and bean dip. All three were uniquely tasty. The strawberry margarita was not watered down and equally as delicious.  Parking is a bit limited but it is so worth the visit. They have an outdoor patio, the place was packed but honestly our server and the food runner were attentive the entire time.

Ti4-HpmkZLFjxYQR_b9oMQ.text: The best service ever every time we come. Cesar and the rest of the staff is the best. We got the steak picado and the one item combo and cooked to perfection. This is the most authentic Mexican food you'll find in Las Vegas!

tzJe2pN8DdZ4mfbkMwlOww.text: Great food, great drinks and great hospitality. Juan's Flaming Fajitas is one of the best places for authentic Mexican food in the summerlin area

4b2LR5Rms12SK3ZpZknwJA.text: Juan's is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have ever been to and their service was amazing! I would highly recommend going here!

jAfLg1ZMifGpLcIpFDzaNw.text: One of my favorite restaurants in town! Fresh food. Super friendly service, every staff member smiles and asks if you need anything when they walk by. Always exceeds my expectations. Their pozole soup is better than my own! Homemade corn and flour tortillas.

4ltP2FXGL5QmM9RUYaGxkQ.text: Came here on a Wednesday: $4.99 margaritas! :) my friends couldn't be any happier.   I ordered beef fajitas that came with a cup of fideo soup, flour or corn tortillas, and a plate with rice, beans and guacamole. The fideo soup was flavorful. My fajitas were seasoned and cooked well. The rice, beans and guac were unremarkable. Corn tortillas were served warm.  We all enjoyed our churros filled with dulce de leche for dessert.  Try out Juan's Flaming Fajitas for an awesome experience!

aeGDA4Bn3lUHBNWjcEaMfg.text: You can't go wrong with this West Vegas local restaurant. Always packed. You can smell the food two blocks away. The only problem is  this restaurants in the same parking lot with in and out burger. That makes parking measurable. So don't expect to rush in eat and leave. It's going take you 10 minutes to find a parking spot. But it's worth the wait. There's usually always a waiting list. Not very long but weekends tend to get busy as heck. Service is always good and so is the food.

9CEM_xq9nkmcFSE36XwxzQ.text: we live about 30 min away but they make it worth it every time! love the food fajitas are to die for!! the drinks are even better! you have to try the mango one frozen! Everyone there is personable, especially the ladies in the front.

N_xU4ekHOTINMiJYKdYYGQ.text: Amazing, I'm obsessed. The staff is always super nice and on top of refills. They have vegetarian options for about everything! I always get the shrimp fajitas and my boyfriend gets the chicken and steak combo and we both are more than happy each and every time. I do not know what they do with their proteins, and I don't care all I know is it's nothing short of amazing.

r39yAba-3RfEkN5bgOGAzA.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It is great for my kids and the food is yummy. Service is always great and very friendly. The prices are great and it is always an enjoyable experience!! I would definitely try the Anejo margarita.

fc9oDyteL_yu7gPbjprsGQ.text: Good food good drinks enjoyed my time there had a great server his name is Estevan Will visit on my next trip to Las Vegas

XkrqfyYuL7n1bAmRKQW6vA.text: First time reviewing a restaurant, and we picked an unbelievable place to start. Food was top notch and the service was excellent. The guacamole was really good along with the fajitas. We will defiantly come back here again.  Seems to be really busy at times but well worth the wait.

ClcKBcJtM1ZmWXXebD_STA.text: Best Mexican food I've had in a long time! I'm a native to Las Vegas and have tried many different places from here to Arizona, California, and New Mexico and this place is awesome! I came here with 3 other people and we all had positive things to say about our meals. The green chile and cheese tamale is amazing!! The rice is moist and not hard and crunchy like some places. Our service was great. No complaints from this bunch! Definitely recommend and we will definitely be back.

5aDHVE3pe49Y2e20p6BMKg.text: Juans' flaming fajitas and cantina was as good as advertised. The service was excellent everyone that worked there was super polite and made sure we felt right at home. Most important of all the food was hot and fresh. I had the steak Picado and I must say it was very tasty the steak was cooked just as I asked and was very juicy not dry at all! My wife had the chicken floutas and she loved it. My grandma had the cheese enchilada and tamale combo plate and everything was fresh as can be. we noticed a lot of people ordered the flaming fajitas. My friend ordered the steak  fajitas for one and he said it ranked up there with some of the best he ever had.I can't stress how fresh the food was we were all very impressed and will definitely be coming back again soon!

3EU9BrBj8QYCh5JyJ1HPnQ.text: My wife and I went to Juan's while in Vegas for a convention in June of 2015. Wow, talk about a great decision. From the moment we walked in the door to the moment we walked out, the experience was phenomenal. Arguably the best food/service we've ever had. The host was nice when we walked in, the waiter and multiple other waiters/bus boys were attentive and nice the whole time we were there and ALL the food we ordered was great! Their chips, salsa, refried beans and grilled onions with peppers and soup (all are complimentary) were excellent. We had some shrimp ceviche to start and shrimp fajitas for dinner. It was all fantastic. Highly recommend this joint. Food was a 10, service was a 10. No cons to even mention.

wNW7tRYNZLnAIFnvcWeLaQ.text: We've been hunting for good Mexican food since we arrived from Texas a year ago - I'm happy to say that we've now found it! Not only was the food delicious, but the service was top notch. Our waiter, Omar, took great care of us, and at the end of the meal the manager checked on us as well. Even though it's a 20 minute drive we'll definitely be back again.

bAAoxn4QDF2e7iZSK02Tnw.text: Wow Juan knocked it out of the park I ordered a dozen Tamales for Christmas eve dinner 1/2 chicken and 1/2 beef with both sauces the BEST. Like Juan says don't nuke them steam them what difference. GREAT JOB JUAN!!!!!!!!

fUGPHZ9AyNtxFOXk0-Uj3A.text: Excellent food, service and prices! We had a huge group and all the food was hot and delicious. They took us without a reservation and quickly accommodated us. They are very kind and professional. We had a really nice time. The bathroom is also clean which is always important to me.

VPExZiqsSqZLWVVAyvwA8w.text: Good food and drinks.  Happy hour from 3-7pm.  Salsa, bean dip and onions/peppers with chips for free.  I will definitely be back.

tS-MMVYd8NT-0MhiHJ0IPw.text: Really strong flavorful margaritas and delicious fajitas that are set on fire before served. We received great service and the entire restaurant has a clean appearance.

_V7disgvMyIQUJd_H-i4Pg.text: Flaming Fajitas is fun place and also a nice casual place for large groups , plus very good authentic food and very affordable.  love the fajitas...

rria_aoLTE7AIE70jHM9wQ.text: I love this place! The food is by far the best Mexican food out here. The only thing I dislike is when they are packed and we have to sit in the bar. It's loud and crowded and the servers on that side don't really know what's going on. The best server is Juan. We have had him the most and he's great! The New Mexico enchalidias are to die for! Go early because if you get there around 6 there is a wait.

GJI0sIK2ri_xyvG7V2YO0Q.text: This might be the shortest review I've ever written. The fajitas are the same exact fajitas you can order at almost any Mexican restaurant. Except they're flaming. Literally on fire. Which is awesome. Not the worst, not anything to die over. Just good.

fhiXTwzUFJA57jJ1TgRtoQ.text: My first visit was a burrito which was bland and painfully average. The service is amazing, the chips and bean dip are great and the price is good. Have been back several times with better success. The flash fried jalapenos they give with the chips are amazing. The guacamole tacos are also great and more filling then you would think.

sZnajmK-yI1-z_7jKBgkyw.text: This place was amazing!! I came here for Happy Hour and had the Shrimp Coctel and Blended Margaritas. The best Mexican food that I've had in Vegas! I will definitely be back to try their Fajitas (a couple next to me had them and they looked amazing as well)!!

eKptC3SQ9jaL5eMnDpNwjA.text: I love me some fajitas so since it's in the name of this place it should be good. Note that I said "should be" good. I want to first point out that the service here was great. Our waiter came back to see if we needed anything and even brought more then 1 bean dip and salsa for the table without us asking. Most of the time you get a tiny cup to share with a group of people but these were decent sized salsa and bean dips and requesting more was no charge. I didn't care for the salsa and it was thin. The bean dip was good and liked by our table. A cup of Fideo soup was included with the meal and it was really good. For dinner I had a 2 item combo. Chili Relleno, Cheese Enchilada and of course rice and beans. The beans were good because it was probably the same bean dip we were eating previously. The rice was dry and nasty. My plate was swimming in red sauce and some of it was soggy. The relleno wasn't great but I did enjoy the enchilada, soggy and all. This plate could have had less sauce so you could get more flavor from what was under it. My wife and a friend had fajitas and I ended up eating a couple. The meat was tough and chewy and the vegetables weren't even cooked. My wife is also in love with avocados and was not pleased with their guacamole at all. Maybe we came on an off night because this appears to be a popular place and the restaurant had plenty of customers in it. I just can't say I ate anything that I would come back for.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chips
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 item combo with chili relleno and cheese enchilada

H9WJn1UB7lK3TDwaVm5R4w.text: Server was great! Margaritas were tasty. Loved the grilled onion and jalapenos that came with the chips and salsa.

w4CETm-z3O3pvsYPPFRJag.text: Recently moved from San Diego to Vegas and was afraid I wouldn't be able to find good Mexican food...Juan's Flaming Fajitas is as authentic as it is delicious. From the fresh chips and 3 types of salsa on the table as we were seated to the perfectly crispy churros brought with the check, every detail was on point. Dinner started with a cup of soup for everyone at the table. It was a noodle soup in a chicken tomato broth, simple but delicious. I ordered the New Mexico enchiladas. They were packed with well seasoned chicken and covered with a rich red sauce (extra spicy as I had asked for) and topped with plenty of melty cheese. The others at the table (also Southern Californians) ordered different dishes which they all loved as well. Service was great despite the restaurant being packed (8:30pm on Saturday night) and our waiter Omar was friendly and provided great recommendations. Happy to have found my new home for Mexican food in Vegas!

bpxqLiInlrkMU-DqZhpyDQ.text: Wow!  Coming from Arizona you have the belief you can't get good Mexican food anywhere else.  Don't be fooled by that thinking.  The food here is fantastic!  Starting with the chips, salsa, and bean dip to the unbelievable fajitas.  You're most certainly will not be disappointed with a trip to Juan's!9010 W Flamingo Rd, Las Vegas

UCqOTCW88x7xNGDU1pwVbg.text: My husband and I made our first trip from the far Northwest side of town to Juan's Flaming Fajitas last week. There are a few Mexican restaurants in our neck of the woods, and the ones we have tried have not impressed us. I could not have been more pleased with the service or the food at Juan's! I had the chicken fajitas and my husband had cheese enchiladas. I'm allergic to green peppers, so I asked that they be left off my dish. The waiter was very accommodating and said that was easy to do. When my fajitas arrived, they had green peppers. The food was delivered by someone other than our waiter. I'm so used to this happening, I proceeded to remove the green peppers and started my meal. My waiter came over almost immediately and asked how things were. I said other than the green peppers, everything seems great. He offered his apologies, and left the table. Within a minute, he returned with fajitas minus green peppers, saying apparently the young man who delivered the food had not noticed and picked up the wrong order. I offered to give him back the fajitas with the peppers and he declined. He said I deserved to have the order I requested and left me with both plates. Well, I had already started the ones with the removed peppers so I proceeded to eat that dish and he very kindly packed up the second dish for what was an exceptional dinner later that night. My husband did not love his enchiladas but my husband rarely loves his enchiladas, yet he continues to try them in every new restaurant. We had one restaurant in town that has closed after 40 years in business and that was his spot. I'm not really sure what he's looking for, but he is super finicky so they may be fine for everyone else. Overall, I give this restaurant five stars for food, service, and prices. You can't forget prices! They are extremely reasonable here and I'm sure we will be back soon... I just won't let my husband order cheese enchiladas

Gz3yw1GqDj-Lq1Hvl9X0Bg.text: Like most Mexican restaurants, the service is fast and friendly and really gracious. The food is delicious, in large part I think because they use very high quality ingredients, especially the beef, which we got in the fajitas--literally the best in Vegas. Here's the thing: people know how good this place is so even before dinner time you might have to wait for a table. But it's worth it. A manager (Taylor) stopped by the table just to make sure everything was good, which it most certainly was.

_YZp1_mG7DgstB-nl59Rog.text: The wife and I have been coming here since the day this place opened. They start off with chips and salsa AND bean dip AND grilled onions and peppers. They added a second type of salsa just recently to the mix which is awesome called Salsa Casera. The soup comes standard with almost all meals. I get the Carne Los Altos every single time. The pork is incredible and the sauce it's cooked in is sweet and jalapeno spicy. The corn tortillas actually smell like corn when you open up the holder and are super fresh and thick. Greatest Mexican restaurant I've been to.  We also get the blended margarita. They have many other options but we think this is the best blended margarita we've had.

T-XyK1e9ZyKHXeepplhLag.text: If you're looking for a new spot to make yourself a regular at, with incredible food and the service that consistently goes beyond your expectations, look no further - this is the place for you.   My husband and I stumbled upon Juan's when we were going to in-n-out (who they share a parking lot with) and knew we had to try it - we are so glad we did. We were quickly welcomed by the host, who I believe is the owner, seated quickly, and had the best first experience - our server explained the menu, made suggestions, and was just a pleasure to be around. Every single one of our experiences since then have been just as awesome, or better. The service is always spectacular, fast, and everyone working always acts like a team. The last time we came on a weekend, they had a full mariachi band and chorus of singers - the atmosphere here is warm and comfortable, but also lively and fun... It's like they're welcoming you into their home. That's how great this place is.  Now the food - yes, the tacos are amazing. The chips and salsas (they have several- just ask!) are fresh and tasty - but they live by their name. The fajitas are where it's at!!! They have a great deal for fajitas for 2 - we always get chicken, and they are truly the best fajitas we have ever had. It's a huge portion and we always have leftovers. Plus we love when they come out, pour the vodka over the grill, and light the flames - what a presentation :)   We're completely in love with this place and it's hands down our favorite mexican place in Vegas. Highly, highly, highly recommend!

Cplw3vV7qihZxEs8LTVSHQ.text: 5 stars for service, food and value.  Hands down our favorite for Mexican food.  Never had a bad experience. Fajitas are fantastic of course, but everything else we've tried has been excellent as well. Lots of flavor and huge portion sizes. The bean dip and salsa they bring to start are yummy, chips are fresh and warm, service is always top notch!  Kids meals are a wonderful value as well and come with a drink.    Other Mexican restaurants are much closer to us, but Juan's is worth the drive!

f3nD-0Ugm_ozaQi7iyVy4A.text: We found this place on Yelp and give it a 4 1/2. The service is wonderful, our server Omar was great. Great Marggies and on happy hour until 7pm. Roxanne had her carnitas and I had steak tapaquiena which was excellent. Homemade tortillas, 3 different salsas and a jalapeno plate. I highly recommend this restaurant

yNv2_sPUAHWR9fXIgilh5g.text: I rate this place 4.5 Stars.    A fun, lively atmosphere, solid food, and good service make this one of the better Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas.  The food is delicious, seasoned and well prepared.   I ordered the staple dish which is the fajitas, the flames was cool but I was more interested in how it tastes.  The pork fajitas tasted excellent!!  Succulent with a kick because I added jalapenos to it.  The portion is enough for two people to eat and for $17 that's a bargain. My friend got the chicharrones, I sampled a small amount and it was amazingly flavorful.  This place also great for happy hour, $5 margaritas and $3.50 for domestic beers.   The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to make the experience fun.  I'll definitely be coming back here.

z7KyRM3JU4LQ0BfX6EHSsQ.text: I was in Vegas a couple of weeks ago and I went to Juan's with a huge group. First, the chips and salsa are endless and excellent. Vegetarians, be sure to ask for the vegetarian friendly black bean dip! I am told by my meat eating friends that it is not as good as theirs, but oh well!  Juan's was located on the way to the Red Rocks so it was a perfect stop for us. The atmosphere was casual, and everyone was very friendly.   I ordered an enchilada, and it came with a huge portion of rice and beans. The portions in general are HUGE. Oh, and did I mention they bring out a little bowl of tomato soup before your meal? It was a nice touch, even though it was 110 degrees outside!

RWBPBRZ9egWBAY2XocKUrA.text: I recently moved to the west side of town, and I went exploring for Mexican food one afternoon. My google search brought me here, and it was just as good as I'd hoped.   For starters, Juan's replaces the mundane chips and salsa from every other restaurant with a medium salsa roja, salsa verde, and bean dip. Both salsas had an appetizing kick, but the verde was my personal favorite.   As I wandered in around 12:30, I found their lunch specials for $9.99 chicken fajitas. Served with the typical accoutrement of guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo, the fajitas were incredible! And as the name implies, they are indeed "flaming" when they finish it off at your table flambe style!   Overall, this place now tops my list of Mexican eateries in the area, and located within just a few minutes of the 215, I will DEFINITELY be back again soon!

Xvhygzm6UoEYBg_tuDh1Pw.text: Steak fajitas for two were terrific! Lots left over. Their complimentary chips and salsa spread is great too, includes refried been dip and grilled onion and jalapenos. Next time I'll probably try a top shelf margarita - their 12 oz house margarita is a great deal too though.

9vxEzVWuXjZa4MCFuofyFQ.text: Excellent food and service!  I got the Chile Verde and it was great! Another thing that I love about this place is that they serve abundant chips with 3 different types of salsa.  I was introduced to this restaurant by my sister.  My wife and I will probably eat here every time that we come to Las Vegas. Five stars for this exceptional restaurant.

4sOeiklO6CEZLEqJhncJlw.text: The food is amazing and service as we'll be back I'll be back to this place when I'm in Vegas- Hernan the server is on point with everything and knows the menu very well. And yes the margaritas are to die for 5 stars all the way!

wAD6w42NRA4eEwTNEo1vAA.text: My favorite Mexican Restaurant, not only is service prompt, friendly service with great food. Our go-to spot, we love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aDuI5zq_RAewRnjaNvv_sg.text: Great restaurant very busy. I had the Chicken taco and Chili Relleno. Very good, I'll go back

f4smr84Dn0nHpzCHB7PMPA.text: The food was fantastic, the margaritas were superb, and the Wait Staff were great!!  First time, but definitely coming back!

Md7T0WhGmj39pq8eJuuRqg.text: I took my friends from out of town here for the first time and we were very pleasantly surprised. The fajitas were amazing. The chicken tacos were awesome. Great service. I highly recommend making a reservation. Yes the place is busy even during the week. Enjoy.

DoUc9SQRbO9H0yu4eUo8Dw.text: Everything here is perfect! My go to restaurant when we go out  Happy hour is fun, we just walk in straight to the bar order almost everything on the menu and a pitcher of margarita!!! Yum!

NqW3YJ33QAowRWyjT7c8Ig.text: Fantastic and authentic Mexican food. They are also plant based friendly. The service is top notch as well. They are all super friendly and super attentive. There's typically a long wait for dinner so be ready to stand in line. It's worth it though.

RYAUBK37dfoBkQRkrdT6jg.text: I went here with my family last night and everything was amazing! I started out with their guava goodness margarita and it was made perfectly. And then my whole family got the fajitas and they all tasted so good! I also appreciated the prompt service. :)

yo4IrzTzuT5bI56NzM5j9A.text: Have come here quite a few times now and have never been disappointed. The fajitas are delicious and no matter which meat you choose it comes out tender and juicy every time. The chips and salsa are on point and go great with the many different margaritas they have. Most dishes I've had are on point with El Paso restaurants, which if you've ever been to El Paso, you know what I'm talking about.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Colorado and chicken fajitas

fiJq9unBL_0Wyq1UpKtnrQ.text: Maybe it was just a bad first time the chips where awesome and the Fido soup great service fast and food was presentable. However the enchiladas red sauce was more like a mole sauce almost tasted a little to heavy and not what I have come to expect in a enchilada sauce. Overall. 3 Star because service and cleanliness was on point.

fCIGd8ktnrnL5qg3HhDVxw.text: So I would like to start off by saying I have been coming here (quite often) for the last 2 years but have never gotten around to writing a review but it is long overdue!!! I usually go with my boyfriend and we always have a good time and enjoy ourselves, but we have started to request Omar because he is amazing!  I have never felt like "VIP" at a local restaurant but as soon as we sit at his table he treats us like we are family friends.   The feeling is amazing & (along with the delicious food) it keeps us coming back.    We recommend the table side guacamole (extra spicy) or shrimp ceviche for apps.  They also serve sauteed peppers and onions with their complimentary chips and salsa.  For main course the list goes on and on!  You can never go wrong with the fajitas of course, chicken and shrimp combo is our go to.  The Guadalajara special is a MUST! We get this more often than the fajitas.... it's perfect to share after a basket of chips, salsa, & guac!  The parrillada, carne asada a la tampiquena, marisco adobados, and the parrillada de marisco are all delicious choices!! This place has awesome entrees that are "outside of the box" for a normal Mexican restaurant. Do yourself a favor and skip the traditional tacos and quesadilla and get one of these amazing entrees!

G0xl9vZ1bByFB5r2rq6JJA.text: We read the reviews and went for a late lunch. It was busy at 330 but we waited. Super friendly and amazing service. The bean dips and salsa were so good. We never had to wait for anything despite how busy the place was.  The portions were quite generous as well. A great place to eat and reasonably priced.

Lj0zhcJmdTetVSHhTQ_mMw.text: Founded by a Mom on my niece's volleyball team who is a regular there. What a place. Fresh guacamole made at the table, house made tortillas soft, warm and great taste. The meat and veggies flavored perfectly. Great customer service. During peak times do expect a wait! Enjoy!

K9CNSkZUkBGwTte2EOJlPw.text: This restaurant was recommended to me by a couple people before I finally checked it out. I wish I hadn't waited so long. It is amazing. The food is great. The service is very attentive.  The chips and salsa are amazing which makes a big difference when I am picking a Mexican restaurant.  The best part is that you can order the most delicious fajitas without worrying about annoying everyone else in the restaurant when they bring out the sizzling caldron because everyone else is doing it too.

1fYBhLYuZK9h95OT3geQXA.text: My son tried this place one time before and knowing how I like fajitas he suggested we all come here for dinner. The wait was about 30-40 mins, which wasn't bad at all. The chips and salsa was awesome and the place smelled really good.  We all ordered fajitas. My son and his fiance got the Shrimp for 2, I got the steak and her mom got the chicken. The presentation was awesome how they come out and set it on fire right in front of you. Then he placed them on our table and right away my first comment was "wow that's a lot of onions"  It was basically lots of Onions, meat and a little bit of bell peppers. No flavor but onions. I whispered to my son, "can you taste the fajita flavor? Cause I just taste onions" He said he must have been really hungry the first time he came because it's not that good today.   The Margaritas were awesome and so was our server.  I'll probably come back and try something else, just not the fajitas.

KaGaBcMqGukeyUKdKBUhgw.text: My husband and I always try to have date lunch. So we decided to try somewhere new. This is our first time at Juan flaming fajitas and it was AMAZING!!! The fajitas are literally flaming on your table. One thing I love was the option of having grilled veggies instead of rice and beans and romain lettuce wraps instead of tortillas, that's is a very clever idea. Excellent service!!! For sure we are  coming back.

h_IaVNN7_h3IDHmclxHdFA.text: The food is amazing.  The staff was very attentive and very courteous. We will be back for sure.

wAGyR3RhOwl-rtCBpV1_6Q.text: OMG!!!! This is my new spot for my Mexican cuisine! The flaming fajitas are the BOMB DOT COM! So fresh and yummy! Me and my Hubby went last night and The also had $4 house margaritas! Yum!!!! We had a great buzz when we left!! Great price for the quality too. I knew it was there but I just never stopped in and boy I've been missing out!!! No Mas!!!!!!!

QSgsFnLRWJqOaasmG2YU7g.text: Good food, crowded....... high end Margies worth it.....

tUVtWTW197rAE4z84Y-Ncw.text: The food here is delicious and I agree they have the best fajitas in town.   I have mixed feelings about their service because I've had good service and I've had horrible service here so it depends on who you get and how busy they are.   I will say that this place absolutely sucks for big parties because they have no room the waiters and waitresses are very irritable and they will not split checks whatsoever which I thought was ridiculous.   I'll stick to a table for 2

5bulrYqlUAI2az83QCAJfw.text: Excellent food!  Tried this restaurant for the first time this weekend and we loved it!  The steak fajitas we very tasty and our server was energetic and on top of her game.   We will be back!

dIYo89Cw1EjggHNIslgkhA.text: The perfect Mexican Restaurant experience!  It has everything you could ask for:    1.  Excellent chips and salsa ready as soon as you sit down.  Do yourself a favor and put those onions and jalapenos they provide on a chip and dip it in the salsa for a flavor explosion in your mouth!  2.  Super fast and friendly wait staff.  Their "refreshing drink" game is on point.  3.  Decent Margaritas for a reasonable price.  The $5 house margarita is an excellent 12oz cocktail.  4.  Mariachi Guitarist!  Spanish guitar helps with the digestion!  5.  The Food is excellent.  The steak fajita is the best I have ever had with juicy and tender steak.  I also enjoy the pageantry and presentation that comes with ordering these flaming fajitas.  6.  FRIED ICE CREAM.  I have always been a fan of the dangerous idea of dropping scoops of ice cream into boiling oil!   7.  The overall price is very affordable especially if you use the Yelp Discount!

tlWTMRnmswlKbgOQ8OP_Xg.text: 4 stars.   Family friendly place when you have a little one is on my top requirements when we go out to eat now. We actually decided to eat dinner earlier and at 5 there was a bunch of families already there eating and watching football.   Service was really attentive from the start. We decided to order the mixed fajita (chicken and beef). We both got Fideo soup and it was pretty tasty. The flaming fajitas part was entertaining but I think what matters is the food. The chicken and beef were tasty and moist and I even ended up eating onions with it and I don't like onions.  I asked for double rice instead of the rice and beans on the side and they gave it to me like I asked! The tortilla was a thicker type kind of like the type you get at Taco Bell, but other than the tortilla everything was delicious. We actually ended up ordering the churros for dessert too which was good.   Overall, this place is good if you want fajitas. I definitely want to try some of the other items on the menu too.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and beef fajitas for 2.

wJTtVtI6Vtnsef-PRT6Niw.text: Let's say the food was good, however the server was not! The atmosphere is loud, dark and crowded.  But the worst was Service when we finished we asked our server for a check he left ten minutes returned twice to clear the table I asked each time for the bill!?!   Finally he pulled it out of his apron like he was a magician or something what he heck?  If your table wants to pay and leave isn't that a good thing for the restaurant? Likely that I would not return

nQbH28-X9yBxReu_-7g0yw.text: Absolutely love this place. New favorite restaurant for authentic Mexican food. It also comes with really delicious sopa. The service was amazing, too. The facility was clean and quaint; I can definitely see how maddening and crazy this place could get during a meal rush. You definitely have to try this place; you'll love it! I promise.

RIPcV-SmgcDMhVyVXO558g.text: My husband and I decided to go back on our own after we have been there with a large group -and enjoyed it even more! Happy hours margaritas were delicious and the food was fresh full of flavored and yummy! The service was a good as the food! We are highly recommend this place for authentic Mexican food that made practically a front of you! We'll be back soon!

ClJXuO88elv6a23reOR6tA.text: The Mexican food here is delicious and you get a ton of food.  I ordered the carne asada burrito which came with rice, beans, and a cup of chicken soup.  They also serve chips with a bean dip, two types salsa, and grilled onions with peppers.

R-q_z9BuR7-z6PAOjXDUOw.text: They do fajitas the right way!  So far the steak with the melted cheese is my favorite. Great value.  Good for groups. I've been to both locations. I prefer the Henderson one but both have good food.

030yG4KDAsNN12oVrMtEpg.text: We had the fajitas which of course were delicious. The fried ice cream took the prize though. Everyone was great and the music was perfect. Overall a great place to dine either leisurely or on a date.

vRI6TpHSgelN2TNjxHIjIw.text: We always have an amazing experience at Juan's! Their fajitas arw delicious and super filling! I love that almost ever entree comes with fido!!! Great atmosphere!!

uUZjVJXedCyZy-nkTn949g.text: I love Mexican food.  This is the best Fajitas I have ever had.  Perfect in every way.  Salsa, chips, queso home made tortillas.   A definite must. The waiter was friendly and did a great job.

kdPwpVJ3j9qyAhDY7KJC0g.text: Delicious food.  Had the chicken and shrimp fajita for two. Took enough home for another meal.    Had the happy hour margaritas 16oz.  At first I wasn't sure if I tasted alcohol but the second one snuck up on me.  Service was fast, staff was friendly, had to wait about 30-35 minutes for a table but it was packed on a Friday night.    Was worth the wait.
