Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fFAQNEeDo_Klr1avMMKzRQ.text: Love coming here!!!  We've had a few birthday dinners here and they are always amazing. I highly recommend!!

IjEs-EUJZiOq2uSSs8Z7vA.text: Above all..this place I always recommend to my friends and others... They are getting really popular and busy, so I only take out only these days. But I am kind of wondering that they serving so much tortilla chips and I saw that there were so much leftovers... It's always good to serve more than less...however I am curious... I hope they throw away the leftovers..

mmup_TqGNLre9M8u4zRB4A.text: This place is straight out amazing service food environment managers everything from A to Z if you haven't tried your cheating yourself. Dont miss an opportunity to eat here you will never regret it. Valentine the server was amazing.

rQu0EtChBno-gJCDNmP9Zg.text: Had lunch today... excellent service and food. Thanks!!!  I will be back worth the trip and the wait.  Had lunch today at the water street location... wow thanks   Food and service rocked !!!!'

Occf76zKNhjVE8J_LwenLg.text: We love this place.   And the waiter is to die for.  Chris is fabulous!!!   The happy hour is great!!!  The best was the margaritas

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BRfgvHWMF09zvS_xJjf4dQ.text: My wife received strong recommendations for Juan's Flaming Fajita from a colleague.  I was skeptical, as I have yet to find a place that is as close to those in Northern California, come close but there is something missing.  Juan's in my opinion is 90% closer and that is a good thing. The restaurant is located off Tropicana and Fort Apache in the Southwest side of the town that we visited early one afternoon and happened to hit Margarita Wednesday, the ambiance is typical of most Mexican Restaurants, the decor, multiple televisions etc.  We arrived right before the rush and glad we did...by the time we left the place had people waiting. The menu is very extensive and offer many combinations, my wife and I selected the Beef Fajitas for two and were complimented with great Fideo Soup, chips with salsas etc.  The delivery and presentation of the Fajitas was outstanding, Overall the food was delicious, as expected and to my surprise I found out that they have posole all the time.....I am hooked.....since our first visit...we've been there 4 times in 3 weeks...it is now one of our go to places.....plus the service staff was awesome...

qovpC9q9qYFLuSraPJI3-w.text: This is my favorite place to eat.  It can always be packed on the weekend but it's packed for a reason. Such good food, and great service even on a packed night. My drink never gets empty & my needs are always met. Love the staff the environment, everything !

tDABrjzHwFWwb00FmJmGeA.text: first time but it was awesome!!!!  Our server(Yajaira) was awesome. Had great service and great experience!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combo fajitas for 2, shrimp ceviche
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mf6N-ni8iFQrwdi-fCgM_w.text: Visiting from California and with family from Arizona and Florida. We were all very pleased. Food was great and service was excellent. We waited aprox 15 minutes to be seated and noticed that other patrons were all familiar with the staff. Repeat business is a clear sign of happy customers. We will definitely be back next time we are in town

CGDyrzgQ5EFNZ3P3LY5PUQ.text: Excellent food & great service. Parking is a bit of an issue, but it's worth the hassle.

UACcYtLwXXZKmDUY6yhNJQ.text: Jovanni and Adriana were absolutely amazing!!!!! Definitely coming back here with my family and friends!!!!!!

c34GL31DY94i-9YmcsKYbw.text: This is our favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. Food is always wonderful and service friendly. It can get a little loud at times but not that big an issue. Ave tried lots of other places but they rarely measure up to Juan's

br2h1dTx83geUeyP9zfNdw.text: I love this place! We came for lunch today and had the pleasure of been helped by DEMETRIO! He's awesome and really made our lunch much better! He was right on top of our refills  and removing dirty dishes etc! They also have a great happy hour menu and their margaritas are omg!

qZG5spRge-LYfJiY1wb6PA.text: My sister and I had the best dinner experience, thanks to Omar our server. Omar is very friendly and tentative. I arrived 1hr late because of Lyft ride share company, never showed up...end up taking a cab from MGM hotel resorts & casino. Thanks Omar for making our dinner super delicious and enjoyable and fun. I'm visiting from Calgary, Canada

6z5uVn3HLIQJqKKMCQ4V1g.text: Best authentic Mexican food.. Loved it! Quick service, friendly staff, reasonable prices, good food and no ser charges.  I was told about this place and I'm so happy I went in and checked it out. It's so good, I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FdYZZ7XcSuQKqliAoh5RxA.text: This place is awesome! The chips, salsa, and bean dip was amazing. Our dinner was even better.  The waiter, Arturo, lacked in personality, but overall the place and food is amazing!  It is a bit of a wait, about 15-20 mins. The wait is worth it though.

1sStmDYcusUpDsCHgyHgrg.text: We came here for a birthday party and had a very good meal overall!  We had a reservation; FYI they won't seat you until at least half your party is present.  We were seated fairly close to the reservation time.  The place was packed on a Wednesday evening.    We tried their famous margaritas.  I thought the peach margarita was quite good.  It was definitely strong though not too "peachy" in flavor.  I sampled a mango flavor which I think was better.    Unlimited chips and salsa were provided along with a complimentary soup.  The chips and salsa were quite good.  The salsa was fresh and zesty.  The soup was OK; it tasted more like an instant soup powder with water added.    Then we had the chicken and steak fajita combo for two with rice and vegetables.  This was a large though not apparently flaming platter of assorted meats and vegetables.  The meats were tender and flavorful, and this was of course served with tortillas which were excellent and tasted homemade.  A large portion but perfect for two.  We saw some interesting desserts on the menu but decided to wait on these for next time.    Our server might have been overwhelmed by the large party because he was frankly kind of curt and not terribly friendly.    The food would definitely bring us back to try again, though!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach margarita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and beef combo for two

TOWyA4af6IngO92IJD3K4A.text: Quite possibly the best fajitas I have ever eaten? They put on a show and made the fajitas flame, it's Vegas I assume everything here needs a few seconds in the spotlight.   Homemade tortillas, endless homemade salsa and chips. It is affordable, good and friendly service, and probably the best meal I had one this trip to Vegas.

RkEyQDqhSu3GZAsYPSy11A.text: OMG!! I don't even know where to start. When we got here, it was a 20-30 minute wait for first available seating. The parking lot was almost full and we had to park on the opposite side of the parking lot from the restaurant. There were others outside waiting to be seated. The wait time seemed to go by fast. Our waiter was Valentin. He was wonderful. We got the flaming fajitas for two. There must have been enough food for four people. We had chips with salsa, beans, onions and peppers. Them came soup for each of us. At this point, I'm already thinking that this is a lot of food and I'm not sure how much I can eat. Well...to my surprise, here comes the main attraction where he set the fajitas ablaze. It definitely caught our attention. Mind you, this was our first time coming here. We came here because it was suggested as a good place to eat although the suggester has never been here. If you live locally and haven't been here, then shame on you. If you're here traveling or on vacation, then make sure to stop by. The staff are all friendly and will take care of you.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corona Especial
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava frozen margarita

GSMyRE5HXmZwFWUGOWWA7w.text: For a taste of authentic Mexican food, search no further than Juan's Flaming Fajitas.  We started with a side order of guacamole to accompany the complimentary chips upon being seated. The guacamole was fresh and authentic, containing large chunks of avocado. A great start to an anticipated good meal.   Of course going to a Mexican restaurant, you need a beer, and the Do's Equis Lager hit the spot.   We tried a carne asada chimichanga and the Guadalajara Special. Both dishes were huge and tasted great and authentic. We finished with an order of churros, which was a great ending to an enjoyable meal.    Our server, Yajaira, was super nice, friendly and took the time to tell us about the ingredients in some of the dishes we were not familiar with. Great service. Looking forward to our next visit, but be sure to go hungry. The portions are huge.

QMTNMRzFiw2bnwQIYyZ2DA.text: Stopped in for lunch on a Sunday afternoon at 2pm, wait time was only 5min. Its not a very big restaurant(maybe they will expand). There were 4 of us in our party so we got to try a lot of different dishes. The best part was the endless fresh chips and three different types of salsa's; red salsa(hot, but the best), green salsa and a sexy bean dip which we all loved. All the dishes were excellent. I had the New Mexico Chicken Enchiladas, very tasty. I did try one of the beef taquitos, which I was originally going to order, so good! We all enjoyed our food and will definitely go back for seconds!  Check in on Yelp and get $5 off your $50 bill. Love the check in Perks!  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexico enchiladas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamales and Baja fish taco
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno and cheese enchilada

GUEpPoQK9fI5g3JmzHp2UA.text: The show here is the flaming fajitas.  While it adds to the entertainment value, that's just it.  Everything tasted decent enough and the amount was good for 2 people with a little leftover.   We only had that so disclaimer, didnt get to try anything else on the menu.   The beans and rice were nothing to rave about.  The flour tortillas though were definitely freshly made and really soft and fluffy.  If anything that stood  out.  Salsa was decent.  Nothing bad to say, service was friendly.  I'd come back once in a while.

IOsl-fcbACCyDx9P_64pJw.text: 5th time here and Yajaira was our server- as always the service is on point. Everyone working together keeping our glasses full and and our chips high. We had the enchiladas with the red sauce mmmm! This is our regular go to place for authentic Mexican food.   First time here-Can I say fiesta? I saw there was over 1000 reviews had to try it for myself. Be ready for a wait during dinner. Hostesses were friendly with the crowd waiting and kept us up to date on time. When we were seated they brought us chips and 3 dips- the pinto beans we had to get refilled, it was that good! I got a margarita, give that a 3 out 5 for taste. My husband and I did the 2 meat combo fajitas. The shrimp and steak came out flaming- literally! Great 5 second show. Steak was tender but could use some salt. Shrimp was good size. Dinner was delicious definitely want to go back and try other things on the menu. Ambience- fun bar with lots of tvs, there's outdoor by the fire pit and a dining room area. Will definitely come back I had attentive and suservers!   Came back on a Tuesday found out more good menu specials. $10.95 Tuesday specials on the combination and happy hour is till 7:

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KIO7yyZ-A7OMibvTRRhmXQ.text: The wife and I stopped by on a Thursday afternoon between 2-3 p.m. We found this place by looking for Las Vegas restaurants on the internet and this place popped up in the results. This is the best Mexican food in town. Service is always excellent.   The food was very fresh and the Margaritas were good as well. My wife and daughter split the fajitas and I got a combo plate. Fresh chips and salsa, amazing margaritas with so many flavours, fajita was perfect. We had both the steak and the chicken and were equally as good.   I'm picky about my Mexican. This place gets 5 stars being authentic and very good. For the price totally worth it.  Awesome food. Huge portions. Great price. Everything we ate was tasty and homemade. Open one up on the East Coast plz. I will definitely be back every time I come visit Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KRLFlwEYNbqCLcIGEpgJOw.text: We were planning to go to a different mexican restaurant for hubby's b-day until we saw the bad news on Dirty Dining (talk about disappointing, and gross). Enter seeing the busy parking lot, one day, when hubby saw it during Happy Hour. He asked me to check it out on Yelp (great reviews, lots of positive attention, the menu looked appealing). And we had renewed faith into eating out again, just like that. Yes, there is a silver lining!!!   We went here on lunchtime for hubby's b-day (saturday) and the line was almost out the door (I was at the door!). The lobby was standing room only. The line for checking in seemed to go faster than I thought it would. We asked for seating in the dining room. A few minutes later, we went to our table in the middle of the dining room. It was busy (but that was a good sign). Our first sign of noticing the popularity was that the parking lot was crazy full.    Our excitement grew as we saw many other tables ordering what we were going to order: Fajitas for Two, $29.99 (two meats- choice of steak, chicken, pork, or shrimp, onions, peppers, tortillas (3 ea), beans, rice, sour cream, pico de gallo. Comes with fideo soup (small thin noodles in tomato broth soup). We got a kids meal for our little man: shredded beef burrito which came with fries. While we were waiting, we had a basket of chips with bean dip, three salsas (all of them were yummy and flavorful), with grilled onions- nice touch, and jalapeno peppers (sliced lengthwise).   I observed that there were seven TV's throughout the main dining room (that I could see from my vantage point). Two ladies were making fresh tortillas in the corner (I like to see that, because it's fresh). There were more tables and chairs than booth seating. It is dim in the room, but I think that adds to the ooh's and ah's from seeing the flame on the fajitas. The smells and aromas wafting throughout the space, was adding to the whole experience.  When it was our time to get the fajitas, oh man, it was excellent! Hubby noted that the meat was not overly salted (something I appreciate), but it was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The veggies were also done to our preference (cooked, but there was still a crunch). This is a generous sized meal- we had leftovers (three containers to be exact). Our son said that he wanted to come here for his birthday. We really enjoyed our meal here and we were going to enjoy it the following day too (yesterday).     Nice staff, smiling faces, we were thanked for coming in, as we were exiting. It is clean. We were checked on several times throughout our meal. It is busy. But the turnaround was pretty good, as the attention to the table cleanup was prompt.   Since the restaurant is close to our home, I think that we have found our new go-to for mexican food, as the fajitas are quite memorable (our bellies were happy).

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three to-go boxes (large portions)
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The closeup, fajitas for two (I think it&#39;s the best seller) @ $29.99- large portions
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beans, rice, pico, sour cream, guacamole

o0X78gOGNYlAib7kOjGQEg.text: Me and my husband love coming here for their lunch specials. We both don't eat a WHOLE lot, so when we order the 3 item lunch special for $12.99, it is plenty of food for us!  Their al pastor burrito is amazing!  What I love about this place is not only the chips salsa and bean dip, but they also bring the sauteed jalapenos and onions as part of your pre-dinner appetizer   I love making those at home, so it was a nice surprise to have them come with our chips and dip.  I have yet to try their flaming fajitas, but everything that I've had there so far as been very delicious!

uGd4NwDwTHVo1w3plJUqcg.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas.  This place is packed for many reasons.  First of all, the food is excellent.  The flaming fajitas is part show and part gimmick but it's very entertaining.  This is obvious with the name of the restaurant, it's their most popular dish.  The fajitas filling are well seasoned and the portions are very generous.  The chips and salsa comes with the meal and they give you three types.  Two out of the three is quite spicy and has an awesome kick.  The bean based one can be used to calm things down.  Very homemade taste and puts the crappy mass market salsa you get at the store to shame.  The comp soup is excellent also.  For folks who don't like the strong favor of parsley, think that you find the soup intriguing, it's as subtle of a taste of this polarizing spice that I could recall.  This along with the tomato base and rice, was tempted to ask for seconds.  Service is excellent and very friendly with multiple visits for re-fills and see how we are are doing.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More filling
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filling for fajitas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Comp soup

8XNf1uxSzBcR8__1BOo2Ig.text: Great authentic Mexican restaurant. The nachos and beer were wonderful. Mama had a great birthday and she enjoyed the birthday experience. The wait took a while but it's understandable, everyone wants a taste. Definitely would recommend! The outside seating is a plus.

N_Li2enFJXI4zOgrPuR4WA.text: I've been here several times and the food and service is outstanding. The flavors are spot on and meats and other condiments always taste fresh. The complimentary chips are light and crispy and go well with the salsas that are flavorful, but not too spicy. I always order the shrimp ceviche which is a great quality of large shrimp pieces and definitely big enough to share. The fajitas are so tender and delicious; I've tried the chicken and the steak. It's a nice spot to go with friends. The only negatives would be the wait (usually 15-30 minutes) and with all of the fajitas sizzling and the smoke permeating the air, the ventilation could be better. If someone is sensitive to smoke, it could be an issue. I always smell like smoke when I leave and sometimes it does make me cough as well. But the food is great, so I will continue to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Ice Cream
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Fajitas for two
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Beans and Rice with the fajitas

YOCf_gI7536ovpsxW9GJGQ.text: Even though the wait is sometimes long, it is getting better consistently. And the real secret (I'm hesitant to put it here because I may ruin it) is going for lunch. Usually never more than a 5-10 minute wait which is fantastic. A bonus is that it may carry over into happy hour and the lunch prices are a little less as well.  The food is ALWAYS fantastic (so consistent with everything) and the service is always very impressive. Very happy going here any opportunity I get.

ruuiulpMv6sG78RuPytivA.text: The wife and I stopped by on a Thursday afternoon between 2-3 p.m.  We were greeted immediately and taken to our table.  A wait person arrive within seconds to are drink orders and also dropped off chips and salsa. (Bean dip, red salsa, green salsa and piping hot chips, and a hot plate of fried onions and jalapeno)  Within two minutes they came and took our order.  We opted for the Juan's Flaming pork and shrimp fajitas for two.   To start off the chips and salsa were great .  The fajitas arrived and were flamed table side for an awesome spectacle.  The fajitas were also very good with nice chunks of pork and decent sized shrimp.  The entree also came with a side of guacamole, sour cream, and pico de Gallo for each person, hot corn or flour tortillas, and a cup of their soap de video (tomato based soup with broken noodles.  Everything was very good and best of all every single one of the employees were smiling and friendly.  We were checked on many times and also to ask if we liked our food.  Great service.  ($30.00 plus tax & tip)

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EC4Acl9-RKmYQ016mEL8YQ.text: Juan's has worked their way to being the best restaurant in all of LV/Hendo.  Their food & service are consistently on point, which is a double edged sword. I am happy to know that Juan's will continue to thrive, but the wait times have become somewhat lengthy due to their overwhelming popularity.  They have the best chips & salsa.  Everything on their menu is perfection; my personal favorites are the shrimp fajitas or the Guadalaja special.  Additionally, they have become more environmentally friendly by switching from plastic straws to paper and cardboard carryout boxes instead of styrofoam.  This is so cool; great job Juan's!!  If I could suggest just one thing to Juan's, it would be to open a location in Southern Highlands where we have no restaurant choices.  You would totally crush it in the SoHi neighborhood.  There's so much empty land around LV Blvd & Cactus....

Yshl93GOUw2EspX5zaTc8g.text: This was our first time in and Christian took excellent care of us. My husband and I are both on the Keto diet and they offer Romain leaves as a vessel for ur fajita!  Christian also recommended The shrimp cocktail appetizer which was packed with large white shrimp with avocado and a delicious tomato base. Everything we had was delicious and the fired fajitas tableside was just a bonus. Look at those portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and shrimp and chicken and shrimp fajitas

-k-NbC-JQukDgdSQB99LLQ.text: I decided to come to this place for happy hour after some research and it just wowed me. The food and hospitality was amazing. The margaritas were strong and very fairly priced. This comes with free chips and salsa if you are ordering food. The waiter was amazing and friendly. This place would get over 5 stars if I could. I can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weekly specials

YcK0revKbRX6fjWcdeEYfQ.text: First impression walking in is that it must be good becuase it was packed with people had to wait 45min-1hr  thats why the 4 stars ... we were there to celebrate my parents anniversary so we decided to sit and just wait but once we were seated at our table had an amazing server who really took care of us and made sure that we were taking care of the whole night... the food definitely exceeded my expectations and definitely lived up to the hype it was fresh and delicious and very tasty! My parents were very impressed and they even brought out dessert on the house for my parents to celebrate their anniversary!! Highly recommend thia place to anyone if your celebrating something in particular or just for a nice dinner out with friends or your significant other. Thank you Juan's Flaming Fajitas for taking care of us , we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LZszD3wriI-h78-Yc2atyA.text: We went because of the coupon we got in our mail, but were glad we did. We used to go to Buzz BBQ when it was there, and based on the amount of fellow diners joining us, Buzz can't blame their lack of crowd on the location.  Juan's was packed for a random weekday. I got the carne asada chimichanga, the meat was very good, I just didn't realize it was going to be served smothered in sauce,  which ruins my favorite part, the crispy shell. But it was still tasty. My boyfriend had the fork fajitas,  and the meat looked dry, but it was actually very tender, and full of flavor and not dry. He loved his meal! The staff was very attentive and full of energy!

2WWD0VqYnEneIff0_Ana6A.text: Really good Mexican food in a city full of crappie ones. Salsa is fresh and the grilled onions and peppers they bring out are a very nice touch.  Definitely going to become our go to Mexican restaurant.

ZT7EZznyqfk909gTTF4NRw.text: 3rd time here and I will continue to keep coming back. Service & food is great! I would recommend this place. Best Mexican food I've had in the Las Vegas area.

5RdcqC7Szu82yME1Q-VdKw.text: Start with the bad, end with the good.  Ordered a margarita and unfortunately it was very weak and probably the worst one I've ever had. Barely tasted like alcohol at all but hey maybe I've just been getting some good margaritas EVERYWHERE else I go (including some pretty crappy chains).  Chips, salsa, beans, and jalapenos/onions to start. Great! The salsa had a nice spice to it. The jalapenos and onions were a pleasant surprise and tasted wonderful. I don't like beans but for some reason I liked these and ate more of them than anything else.  For mains I ordered a steak/shrimp fajita combo. Worst thing about it, WAY TOO MUCH FOOD! I guess that's not a bad thing but I did feel bad for how much I left. Every piece of it from the meat to sides were very good. The tortillas ended up getting very dried out since they were just brought out wrapped in some paper. This is something that should be figured out since it does take a while to work through the tortillas.  Overall great food, not good margaritas.

qv2VXqCMxX0K-aO833zV0Q.text: Love this place...one of our favorite places to relax.  Italian margaritas are the best!  The flaming fajitas are not only showy but taste great.  Love the fedio soup.  Atmosphere is great and servers are awesome.

yZ0qqVzGha_9mhujERaCRg.text: Excellent food and very attentive service. Give these folks a try. You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back booth near the kitchen...

9Q5uMqnOdP_Me0O7_b1Riw.text: My family and I love Juans. The fajitas are amazing and I love that they have the romaine wrap alternatives for those of us on strict diets. I usually always get something different every time I come and it's always been amazing. The chicken fajitas have been my most common choice lately, but I do really like the chicken tacos and the mole. The service is very friendly and fast. I appreciate that the owners work in the restaurant and ensure that everyone is happy with their experience. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a delicious Mexican meal in the southwest.

ryBWUKfTv8QtkiMv8KS6fg.text: Visiting from California. My niece found this place. What a suprise. Great food drinks and service. Coming back to Vegas in feb. Will definitely be back. Little far from strip but worth the drive.

2VN0nOCFYbinoQpC-yQ3RA.text: My first visit to this restaurant proved to be a huge mistake unfortunately. Extremely busy restaurant so obviously very popular. Chips and salsa and bean dip were all great. However 3 of a party of 6 ate the Shrimp ceviche; all three ended up with food poisoning and not only battled that miserable issue but were also forced to call out from their jobs while they recovered. A health and sanitation check is in order. Be warned!

EZtoy-bnnymnZa0hbutjkA.text: Finally a solid Mexican feast that can fit into my low-carb lifestyle! Skipped the chips and salsa, but ate the grilled onions and peppers that come with it! Those peppers have some heat to them. What a pleasant surprise!  Ok, so I read a few reviews that said the food is not spicy at all.  I lean toward my food extremely spicy. They happily brought out a dish of habanero sauce but gave warning to use very little, since it was extremely HOT!!! I think I was more amused as they watched the "little lady" (ME) douse my food in it and eat ALL of it. Love that they have the option of grilled veggies instead of rice and beans.    I will say the carnitas was a bit dry and not the best I've had, but was fine with a bit of salsa and hot sauce mixed with all the veggies, it was more like a nice Mexican stirfry.    My husband got the "flaming" steak fajita, which is impressive at they brings it out a sizzling cast iron pan with a flame under it to keep it well...sizzling.  My husband enjoyed his feast of  fajitas with surprisingly flavorful rice, beans, pico de gallo, sour cream, guac, and  corn tortilla.  Guess what? We were pleased our food was not drowning in cheese, nor was needed or missed.  However, these servers were nice and attentive and I am sure they would have brought some cheese out if we requested.    I am sure to be back, nice service, decent Mexican food (finally!).  The Cantina looks entertaining as it is big lined with tvs, has a full bar, and even an outdoor area,  but it was empty since it was just shy of noon on a Monday?  Luckily they also have 4 TVs in the dining area too.   The drink specials look decent, affordable, and even tasty.   My one negative, is that I am not a fan of "rustic" aka cheesy Mexican decor and this place was dressed just like that...however, I focused my eyes on a 26th seed beating Serena Williams at Wimbledon.   Awesome that they had it on!

quRglTfh8Gbxt8cBCI4olA.text: Probably the best fajitas I've ever had.  The service is very friendly and  great.  It has a typical cantina feel.  It was very clean in there. The chips are served with two kinds of salsa.  I only had the red, which was great and perfectly spiced.  They also served grilled onions and peppers to go with them, which is a nice touch.   I had the combination steak and chicken fajitas.  They were great and flavorful.  They brought them out sizzling on a cart.  And then they pour something on them and light them on fire. It is a neat presentation.  They serve them with soup (which I opted not to have, because I felt like it would be too much food), your choice of refried or black beans, rice, guacamole, and pico de gallo, as well as choice of corn or flour tortillas (I got the corn).  And the tortillas are made there at the restaurant.  It was awesome.  My only complaints are that the rice and beans were lukewarm.  It was alright though, because I put them into the fajitas anyway.  They brought the tortillas a couple of minutes after my food, which they probably were fresh from the oven, which was nice, but they probably should wait and bring everything at once.  The worst thing is that it is in the same parking lot as a crappy In-N-Out Burger.  I almost got into a wreck twice, with people trying to get to In-N-Out.  But I look forward to going back there again soon.  It's the closest thing to Tex-Mex, as I can find out here in Vegas.

I6C4djeIBGlYn_zZDURdCA.text: This place is awesome. Free chips, salsa, onions and peppers. I had the 3 entree plate. Comes with fideo soup (sooo much flavor). I had the 3 asada tacos ranchero. They were soo good and so big. So much flavor. The rice and beans were also good. The salad they serve with it was super fresh. I ordered a margarita, also super fresh! You can tell they make it fresh and not from mix. The staff is amazing. Very attentive and friendly. They are sincerely happy to have you there because of how new they are. Overall this place is amazing. Finally we have a Mexican restaurant on this side of town that is actually good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cadillac margarita on the porch during a beautiful Vegas afternoon. Bliss :)
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 ranchero asada tacos, rice, beans, salad. Party in my tummy so yummy.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of my ranchero carne asada taco. Yum!

yA2HCMvMnFRA7kENYqyiNQ.text: Saw the other reviews and decided to give it a try. This place was awesome. The fajitas where great and the staff was extremely attentive.

_HA5_Q_BNzZXo35xmTPZvg.text: We were referred here by a friend so we decided to check it out (we live in dtlv btw and drove the distance). My husband got the 2 taco hard shell shredded beef combo and I got the beef fajitas. His tacos were bigger than most Mexican restaurants in the area. They were brilliant with their presentation because the tacos were laying on a flour tortilla to absorb the juice so your taco stays hard and doesn't fall apart when you try to pick it up. My beef fajitas were soooo good too. Oh, we got guacamole as an app and it was delicious as well. Great service, reasonably priced and best tasting Mexican restaurant style food in the LV area that we've had in the 10 years living here.

RGyKIiJfm80D7zSGX4DRlQ.text: Yummy excellent service.. Ordered the carne asada medium rare. It was perfect. And delicious. Their customer service was awesome. They were so friendly and made sure all was good. I definitely recommend this place.

Optqx8CcMWtyHeLfOgtgFw.text: The food was delicious and fresh. The services was outstanding. The prices were reasonable I will definitely  come back.

JANZLTqSKIXzYF1w7qxw1A.text: Had an early dinner here last week with my husband, after looking around on Yelp for a highly rated Mexican place.  As usual, Yelpers were right on the money, this place is FANTASTIC!  Can't recommend it enough - if you're craving Mexican, go to Juan's and you'll have a great meal at a perfect price!  I honestly enjoyed every single thing we ate - the chips (fresh), the salsa (perfect), the soup they automatically serve before your entree, the fajitas, the dips, everything.  I will say it was all slightly on the salty side - but I *love* salt so that's right up my alley.  We ordered the chicken fajitas for 2 and, along with the free chips and salsa, and the tomato-based soup that comes out first, it ended up being 4 meals for the hubs and I.  Well worth the money.  And again, it was all so, so delicious!  The hosts and servers were all super friendly and helpful and everything was brought out quickly.  We honestly don't have a single complaint - except that we didn't go here sooner!  We'll be back very soon to try some of the others options like the quesadillas and enchiladas and I'm already looking forward to it!

wPh8kZizi-9_H0KyvPC8dw.text: Wow is all I can say from start to finish. This was my first time here and I will be going back. There's not too many Mexican places I can rave about, but this place is. And for those who think Lindo Micochan is So Great - first of all, that place is terrible and Both times I went, service was lousy and the food was not only over priced but not even that good. Anyways!  My friend and I walked in on a Friday night with no wait, around 8pm. We were brought to a booth with a friendly hostess and no more than 4 minutes later we were brought chips with bean dip and salsa. Both were good.  Then a few minutes later, we were brought Fideo soup! That was unexpected even though it comes complementary at some places. I have to say, I'm not huge on this soup because nobody ever seems to get it right and I've tried it at a few places. This was by far the best Fideo soup I've ever had and was impressed already.  Our waiter, Amanda, was So Friendly and pleasant along with being helpful with the menu, it was very comforting along with the great soup and chips so far. I got the chimichanga with shredded chicken which came with a generous portion of sour cream and some guacamole and pico. I also got a taco with shredded chicken on the side with rice tortilla, fried. It was whoa! Ask for the house salsa with the taco or whatever you get and I recommend mixing in a little tapatio sauce. You'll be happy you did.  Great portion sizes too! All that and my friend got an enchilada burrito with veggies on the side. I can't believe they serve veggies on the side. That's unheard of, and I'm not talking about a few peppers and onions. No. It was broccoli, zucchini and cauliflower that filled 1 half of the plate and had really nice seasoning on it and it; so good with the salsa too! All that for $28. Go here if your'e craving Mexican food and I don't think you will be displeased :)

Y7VdDkGLeBXEfX-SaRAfvA.text: Was here on Saturday before fathers day around 5pm. They were pretty busy we had a party of 8, we were seated with 5 minutes.  The hosts were so nice to my kids they gave them some doodle pads to play with.  The minute we sat down,  someone was right there to get our drink order. Chips beans and salsa were delivered right after.  Took our food order, food came out so fast.  Food is delicious. Shrimp fajatis are bomb.  Chimagana are Amazing. Soup is the best ever.  Drinks were never empty even the manager was right there getting refills and asking us how everything was. love this place and you guys have a great process down of how to serve customers.  Don't change anything.

_F9FXjGHKNQzo6VsfzoaZQ.text: I Love everything this place has to offer. Great food, great vibe, great service!!!  It's been 5 hours since I left there and I have told about 10 people about this place. I can't wait to go back!

Uit8AzZuhA1DEvx65nQDEw.text: We have been looking for good Mexican food in Vegas for 10 years. We found a great place. The best food we have had in a long time. Sunday football specials cant be beat.  We ordered street tacos, quesadilla,and fundido, with drinks under $30. Flavorful and authentic. Great staff great place. It will be our go to place.

kWcn0WNuWTAWSTFiQK7osA.text: Not only good, but friendly!  As in, as I walked in on a rainy night, 4 people I know came over to say hi.  So that's where you've all been!  Really, really good fajitas.  Really, really good margaritas.  I'm coming back!

jhD0Jv7iiyg018_ItuptOQ.text: Great food! Was on my way to drop my girlfriend at the airport and had my dog with me. They were so accommodating. Even giving my dog some water to drink and set up the patio just for us. 5 stars all the way. Check em out.

Q3AUBOJaLKbh1OwafSSJ_A.text: This place was amazing.  The service was off the chart and they had wonderful food there on top of it never had an empty drink never had any issues at all.  The fajitas great flavor.  This is one of our new favorite places.

rQm0TXzlpYw0AgOJlMu8Eg.text: My family and I have been here about 8 times. Everytime we leave we say how awesome our meal was. I have tried different items on the menu and have never been disappointed. The food and service is always exceptional..I would like to mention a server in particular who is absolutely by far the best server we have ever had and we dine out alot. His name is Hernan. Hernan is always attentive and always has suggestions for us to try from food to tequila. Great place to bring family and friends. Juan who ever you are I believe you hit the jackpot!

Jm1UXYf7ejg6SKo08g5bsA.text: Love this place! All my buddies from vivas work there! The service is amazing and the food is delicious cooked just right and the marinade is sooo good! Two thumbs up!!! Always a great experience:)

UkEeIFJrGr4J9nDPcLNM3A.text: Great food.  And our server Arturo was awesome. And even the busser was quick and had a conversation with is.  Really liked that the owner himself came by to ask how everything was and to thank us for coming in and to chit chat for a minute. Being in the restaurant industry myself I hold high expectations and this place did. Great job guys. Keep up the good work and great tasting food.

c8tO6j_1Qy-ed7lO3E6IqA.text: Great place! Love the sports, music variety, and most of all the bean dip with onions and peppers with the delicious chips and salsa! The food is standard good Mexican what separates this place is price and quality, along with the bean dip and onions and peppers! And oh did I mention the bean dip, onions and peppers!? We'll be coming back!

QflQWzvrhfUd6_db3STg1w.text: What a great place!  Live music on some nights as well.  The flaming fajita for two was delicious and more than enough food for two, we also ordered the chimichanga, enchiladas, carne asada and they were all delicious!  Fried ice cream and churros were great and they even serve authentic sopapiilos, which were excellent!!!  Our friends come here often so we decided to try and this was our third visit! The service is beyond comparison, simply OUTSTANDING!!!! Our waiter was very attentive and the manager (owner?) even took the time to stop by and ask how we were doing.  It was refreshing to have such attentive service and eat authentic, from the heart, food!  I highly recommend them to anyone!!!!!!!!!!

oGOAClSa3PUpsUmsiy37Nw.text: We love this place! Normally we dine in getting a queso fundido, shrimp ceviche salad and fajitas, which we always have a ton of leftovers to bring home, typically lasting us another meal or two. It is always pleasant and the food is constantly delicious. We enjoy the free chips, salsa and bean dip as soon as we sit. However, today we got take out of just the shrimp ceviche salad and the fundido to go everything was just as delicious at home. I did ask for the fundido in a metal tin so I could reheat it in the oven, it was perfect, hot and delicious. The salad is constantly perfect to me and the edible bowl has a great flavor.

0KZcpIqpt7Yr7lBrPzoqjA.text: We enjoyed our dinner here the staff was very nice.  Perfect Margarita !  Soup was tasty!  We had the shrimp and the fish tacos with rice and beans.  We will be going back to try the flaming fajitas.

n-ZNU2h63wtSrv90sHwVBw.text: We tried this place because of the favorable Yelp reviews and were disappointed.  Granted, we did a carry out, we felt the food was best marginal.  On a scale of 1-10, we gave the food a 3-4.  Very plain  across the board.    Service and manager was friendly.  May be better eating in the restaurant.

ldojR6tKJxLd3CJ__QcIMA.text: Fajitas were good, but appetizers and other dishes could use some work.  Flavor and texture was off.

MlosJ_SQVJFyzIo2ylzy1w.text: This place is so good.The Steak Fajitas were soooo good.The service was excellent...We live in Anthem area ...can't wait to go back for happy hour.Everyone that worked there was so nice...They even brought me out a milder salsa...even though there is 2 types served....

eMsEjtbG3vQ7sDVbuZEcVw.text: This place is a hidden gem. Fajitas are wonderful and a good size portion. Atmosphere is cute. The staff are very friendly. Happy Hour is 7 days a week from 3-7. Reasonably priced. This is definitely my new "go to" place.

Qpn_UvctvuxuoonxxJl4iA.text: Fantastic!  Was so good to get away from the crap food on the strip. Service, food, prices were all excellent. Had to go back a second time!!

W-kq4lyn0Q77pwjpqHmGkg.text: Nearly a year from my last review. Since then, we have consistently visited at least once a week. We've now tried several menu items and they have all been D-Lish. I see reviews have piled on as 5 star. That would explain the wait. It's worth it!

s2eXpOyeBC9LEzGgURo-wA.text: Meh... I was not impressed. This was a recommendation from my sister. Maybe it's because this place is called Flaming Fajita and I didn't order fajitas but the food was not great. I ordered Rajas y Crema which is my favorite Mexican dish and I order it wherever I go and see it on the menu. This was not good at all. I question the age of the chicken and pasilla peppers because they tasted super old! And the "cream" was separating. So nasty. Needless to say I don't think we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mJS15YsonDpYKf1KDXXu4Q.text: This is our go to place to watch football. The bean dip and salsa is great and the football menu is cheap and delicious. Don't miss the mexi-fries! Only complaint is that they recently installed video poker machines in the bar. Now there's no bar space to sit and eat.

dmmv9HSLO0CuRvpHqogn4g.text: I don't understand how people can rate so high. Came in greeters were awesome, was seated and then came the wait. Food was alright a bit salty, the hit here is the flaming fajitas which they douse in vegetable oil in order to light. We did really enjoy the chips, salsa, and onion chile slices however we did not receive amazing service like most if the reviews. They took ten minutes to get our waters and soft drinks, and the pina colada my dad ordered was pretty much ice chunks and milk. After receiving our meal we had to flag them down to get refills and extra napkins or what not. Definitely not a high chance of returning.

HQwzifCkZaFYfwIcnRX4Bw.text: Great food and super friendly staff. Manager went out of his way to welcome us and ensure we were seated quickly. This is our new "go to" for great Mexican food!

E-_tZZ-wab1MRoYn0qP7fw.text: My cousin took me here.. Let me tell you, FANTASTIC food! I always get Chilaquilas with 2 eggs and carne asada on the side. Great service, and great food!

Ta5kaY7Kl0uNgxY8IK5UQQ.text: The food was good, but don't order fajita for 2! Just order a single.... It's not worth the extra $10 because it comes out on the same platter. My friend ordered a single version and it looked exactly like a double. You just get an extra plate of rice/beans/soup. Wait staff was mediocre, had to ask for refills a lot on drinks. They water down the ice tea. I watched the guy poor water then add a little tea.

Q2XlqFcuvdbOK2ShDUhRLg.text: Excellent service, above and beyond our expectations. They brought us warm tortillas when we sat, chips and salsa, drinks, dinner. The portion sizes were huge and the food excellent. Would recommend the the skinny margarita!! We will defiantly go back.

1qcOVp3RYxjO6ECgR0nhmA.text: It is really hard to find decent Mexican food in Vegas. I have been twice and had the beef fajitas both times. Really delish. Great sides, chips, bean dip, peppers & onions and salsa. Omar was our server this last time and he was great! Attentive, comes by often even though there was a full house. Even other employees stopped by to check on us. Good value. 2 for $20.

n5MHZHsBXw46F_OZ3QvxdQ.text: This is our favorite place for Mexican in Las Vegas! I highly recommend trying it out! The red salsa isn't bitter like everywhere else we have tried

AatBar3CGBmgT2Y5r_MF2A.text: Last time we went here we got a hair in the food. Unfortunately, this is enough to prevent us from returning based on the thought of it grossing us out so bad. It's too bad too. :/

CXOJ81qTi935nnN1aHkN2A.text: WOW FROM THE START!!! Great house margarita and the chips with the side of onions and pepper slices and bean dip were awesome. The service was smoking fast and it was a busy night. We got the Steak and Shrimp Fajitas for 2....... REALLY nice sized shrimp and grilled great along with the steak..... they came served on a cast iron dutch oven lid with a 2' high flame...........GREAT flavor....... voted #1 by LVRJ people........BEST OF LV. Guess what........ these are the best fajitas I've had in Vegas.... CAN'T WAIT TO GET BACK!

wtmG1Xh85oCakZ1ZieS2tw.text: This place is delicious. My favorite part is the happy hour. The service is ok, but not very attentive. The worst part is the churros. They aren't sweet and very doughy. I'll be back but won't have the churros again

qPvGMc5D3YpFDEisSclcTA.text: We loved everything at JFF. We ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas for two and the serving size easily was enough for 4! Great food. Great service. We will be back! Yum!

jrjj05VboEjY1Bnky-zmew.text: This place is alright, not a big deal, I had better Mexican food...I wouldn't be excited to go back and eat there again..

oJXlM7QlqOhyRBK2Zqh-0A.text: Have been here several times and the food and service is always superb!! They have a great deal on guacamole for happy hour! Yes I said guac!! I love their food but really love their taco plates. They are larger than typical tacos and always overflowing and delicious! Not only does this place have excellent food but the service and prices are just as good. This is by far the BEST Mexican food in all of Las Vegas!!

b95xtFboiZKEkE9HRJFHlw.text: First time customer! Great food and service! Reasonable prices! My family was impressed. We will be back!

O67_gD9tpsccE2kJk8jFig.text: Guarantee you will leave with a full and happy tummy. Not only is the good great, the customer service here is amazing. Can't beat their complementary bean dip and salsa! Food is always fresh and never disappointing. Fajitas are always a good choice and when you order the fresh guac, they'll prepare it at your table! It's like dinner and a show! Will definitely be back whenever I'm in town!

YT3uCZdcRiOMjADgIVfaMw.text: Great food, clean, good service. The jalapenos and onions are awesome! It's nice to have a great locally owned spot.

h3wnRMBc4A_G0Y3ZzdF5nw.text: Everything is excellent about this restaurant. The bean dip is out of this world. Wait staff was awesome. Good thing we live out of town or we would be there every night.

bbeAfvBniJTMHsR-d6CXEA.text: Stopped in for lunch today, having wanted to try this place for quite a while.  Exceptionally friendly staff and service that can only be equaled, because I'm confident it can't be beaten.  As mentioned in other write-ups, you are served complimentary 2 salsas and warm bean dip upon being seated.  Hernan was our server and was terrific.  Wife had the 3 option lunch combination meal.  She thought all 3 items were excellent.  I had a chicken torta (sandwich) which also was very good.  The owner, Juan, stopped by the table and visited with us.  Now we know why all his severs are so hospitable as Juan was very engaging and let us know about the happy hour and other specials.  This place is a special treat and we will most definitely be back and will be bringing friends.  Great job Juan, keep it up!

b1arjmsVtRKtJtapuHN8Kw.text: Ate here for dinner and had the steak and shrimp combo fajitas. Was very very good. Best fajitas I ever had. Only complaint was that the margaritas were very weak. I had 4 margaritas and didn't have a buzz.

QtjnBzGG0YHKEVpehsmYkg.text: It took me a long time to find a Mexican restaurant that I liked in Vegas, but I'm so glad I finally did! Their food is great, portions are perfect, and the service is amazing! I will be coming back for sure.

B35D88KRW4OUNq4sk84AIw.text: This place was delicious. I love that they put out onions and jalapenos with the chips. Huge quantities of food and their tortillas are homemade. The service was excellent. Our server was super friendly. Unfortunately after a day or 2 this review will be taken down because 7 of my 8 past legitimate reviews have been taken down as not recommended. If this does stay up go to flaming fajitas. Its good stuff.

aetomh3FLQkn_vTYy0ZO6Q.text: I ordered the food Togo on a Saturday night. The wait was an hour for dining in. The food was delicious. I got the combination fajitas with shrimp and chicken. The food and condiments were just if you were to eat it there. I recommend this place, just don't be in a hurry.

gBXWwUS_ZXXrbQclQ26EoA.text: I had a sub-par time. Wasn't horrible. Walked in and the music was a bit too loud. It was kind of a "Lets try it" sort of night and most of my group (2adults and 3 kids) were in cranky moods, so I might return to try it again and hope for better.  Finding it wasn't easy, the parking area is kind of poop but we found a good spot, luckily. They were doing some construction or set up in the porch area but that didn't really matter since it was kind of chilly when we visited. Sat quickly and our drinks were brought quickly. Bus boy was polite. Our waiter didn't really come check on us very quickly. Complimentary chips, salsa, and bean dip was pretty good. Soup with meal -- the step kids loved it.   I ordered the taco bowl. It's my go-to since I'm not huge on Mexican food anyway. Food took it's time getting to the table, drinks weren't re-filled very quickly. Different waiter delivered our food but eh, at least it came. My chicken was dry and my bowl was soggy to start. The 1 out of 3 kids enjoyed and devoured their enchiladas and the other two just whined and played with it. Neither one could explain why they didn't like it. So it could just be picky children being picky. My guy ordered the fajitas and the waiter bringing our food forgot to bring the tortillas. It took another 10 minutes to get the tortillas and by that time we were ready to go.   It's not the restaurant's fault everyone was cranky. But the service was lacking, music too loud, and food not done well. I'm willing to try it again since the reviews from all you others are so good and I want to believe my visit was a fluke. =P

9WsZPBhqb-Fux9jQohxhyw.text: Omg! ,, without a doubt absolutely the best Mexican food this side of the Border and  that's saying a lot we grew up in San Diego having dined in Puerto Nuevo, Ensenada, Cabo, ect !We service is absolutely excellent as well as the value. Our server was Vinny give the man a raise! Thank all of you for a wonderful evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omar excelent service and great presentation.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9xJ124B4y28r6vfHjMDG2w.text: One thing I miss from Michigan is the great Mexican food in Detroit.  Juan's  fills that void!  Everything is fantastic and we are never disappointed.

lh36cDKXywboXB-2MUDBTQ.text: First time here it was great the service was great the food very good. We live in Henderson but will be sure to be back. Had fajitas, burrito, guacamole tacos, shrimp tacos. Way to much food

14RAP8aCk5E8gptFGrYVwg.text: 5 STARS!!!  Love this place.  I have to drive to get there but happily make the trip.  The fajitas are the best in town.  The condiments that go along with it are generous (grilled onions, peppers, avocado, pico, sour cream.  You get a choice of either corn or flour tortillas.   They also bring out an interesting cup of soup before the meal.  They also bring out hot bean dip and salsa and chips before the meal which is one of my favorite things about this place.   Juan, the owner is often there and working his butt off.  I wish they would open another location (ie. Summerlin would be awesome!!  (Juan, if you are listening).  What else to say about this place?  Everyone is friendly...service is great!!!! I love everything about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. extra condiments
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas

NWxePjbkEScDTijMOhgZMg.text: We liked this place a lot.  Everything was very tasty, and the service was friendly.  The portions are pretty generous.

tdMcl6svlnTHGWNHQtC0jg.text: The best service I have had in a long time. I went for my 40th birthday and it was the best way to celebrate with my family.

PZPbNtaLKQ0U-NRoNa6XNA.text: Came to celebrate a coworker's Birthday. We had a reservation so they were able to quickly accommodate our medium sized group. At a quick glance, their lunch menu was reasonably priced.  Four people in my party ordered the fajitas which was a sight to see when they came out. They literally lit the skillet on fire and flames were jumping! After a bit the fire went out and we were served.   I had the flautas which I usually enjoy at other Mexican restaurants. I ordered it in a crispy flour tortilla with grilled vegetables instead of beans and rice. I was surprised that my order was really good! Although they had large servings, I took home my leftovers and had them for lunch the next day.   The reason why I can't give them the full 5 stars is, as I don't speak Spanish, some of the waiters spoke really fast English and I could not understand them. Additionally, I felt like attitude was given from one person serving us, who I think may have been a manager. Not cool.   Overall, I would probably eat there again if someone I knew wanted to go. I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican food, but I would definitely like to try other items on their menu.

TqG3J54B5veK1iBW4armNQ.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas to eat good Mexican Food. With a large family of 9 we never have a problem getting in. Pricing is great and everyone loves the food. Give it a shot. You will not be dissappointed. Honestly one of our favorite things is the jalapenos and onions they give you. Amazing. Fajitas amazing. You can't go wrong.

1uiFmMRQsuRXY3uKhxpUiQ.text: Wow.... Fajitas were incredible. Service 1st class. For a Texas Guy I was really pleased.  If you are staying on the strip- its worth the little drive ! Just do it ! Also... Sopapillas ... perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clean place too...

J1LlgYKwh-DCcD-6X3Q8nA.text: The food and service were excellent. Drinks were filled and empty plates were removed.  I had the shrimp and chicken fajitas. Awesome! Wife had the California burrito and my son had the asada torta. Both said their   food was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmm
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fidelity soup was great!

Yb0ZDM9qwki9QhVDQwEz7A.text: 10/10 would recommend. Filled up on free chips/ salsa, taking entree home for later. Very delicious, the flaming fajita platter is a joy to watch.

FsEVenJilXFDNXofTx7vnQ.text: We have been here 3 times. Once it was best fajitas ever- second time it was worse ever..third time it was average. The prices are certainly really great especially if you get the fajitas for two.  Service is friendly and they have plenty of tables so its never going to be that busy in there. Just dont go there expecting the best mexican food you will ever have.

ocq4GXXYeMRc8Ev-ld2hEQ.text: OMG, if authentic Mexican food is what you want, Juan's Flaming Fajitas is the restaurant to go to. The food is soooo delicious, they never disappoint. The cantina is a great place to watch any sporting event also.

dgw4fK7Meoz8WLzxUJIz_Q.text: There are a ton of really high reviews here, and I love mexican food so I was excited to try this place out, but my experience doesn't reflect a similar experience.   The chips were okay, kind of thin and tasted like some cheap supermarket chips. The salsa and beans were alright, not special but not bad at all. The non-custom standard guacamole was really good, but that was about the only thing I had that could be called really good.   My main meal was the flautas combination plate with grilled veggies. The veggies included broccoli which was absolutely ruined. It was grilled fast on high heat, which ended up just burning and charring the florets, and that's a very bad flavor to add to broccoli. The flautas themselves were okay, not special, I just kind of ate them until I was tired of them and didn't take home any leftovers. I feel like that's almost worse than giving me bad food. At least make me have an opinion about it, right? The shell was also cooked a bit too much, so was hard to cut through.  The wife was also unhappy with her meal, I forget what exactly she got but the tortilla it was wrapped in was super soggy on the bottom and not all that pleasant to eat.   The staff, however, was great. They were very attentive and treated us great. I'll definitely give this place a second chance for sure, if for no other reason than to try their custom guacamole option made table-side. Hopefully this was just a bad outing and they will live up to all these other high praise reviews next time.

IzmDDokvzIH8JkpZFP2CNg.text: Loved everything! It exceeded our expectations and it's so refreshing to have finally found a great Mexican restaurant. We will be back. Staff was friendly and professional.

ECQbuYMO3WuBN1Ej7q_VKQ.text: We were waking in and heard a customer leaving say bye to Juan. We walked in said hi to Juan, and my wife told him we found him in trip advisor (5stars). Right away we were treated like old friends. We were able to make a few changes, like poblano instead of bell peppers on the fajitas. Tamale, confirmed wrapped in corn husk and not the dreaded banana leaf. When asked weather they needed sauce, the answer was no, and they did not. The pork tamale was good enough to stand on it own without being smothered in sauce. I got the chili poblano pepper and it was excellent. Chips, hot sauce red, hot sauce green, grilled onions and peppers came when we sat down. Guacamole was chunky and fresh. It is kind of a shame to visit a place so good when you are from out of town because you will come back next time, and not eat at other places. On the bright side, you know you are not going to be disappointed. Real sopapillas - puffy pillows, not the fake flat ones.

fKY7qFHSgvWCgcltMoPEHA.text: Very, very good food! We eat a lot if texmex and this place us fantastic! Hot food, great service and good prices. They salsa has a chipolte flavor that was refreshing and good. The grilled onions and jalapenos were good, super spicy!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get their queso, very tasty!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy and hot food! First time in Vegas and worth the drive off the strip

AoOIb7V_2PZmLYvI7LETwQ.text: I really love this place.  Oddly enough, I've never tried their fajitas!  But, I've had just about everything else.  The Queso Fundido with chorizo, and Chile Rellenos are good stand-bys.  Happy Hours are great. 3-7 PM 4 buck Margaritas, and 8-10 great items for food.

zBUBPBaeeCHEM_bBjDbO8Q.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas hands down . I knew it was good when I pulled and up and it looked like a nightclub instead of a restaurant. People were lined up outside waited to be seated and the wait was about 45 min at the time but that was not stopping anybody . Luckily for my first time I ordered mine to go . Chicken enchiladas and rice and beans you cannot go wrong at all . They also give you this amazing bean dip it is to die for . Definitely gonna be back sometime this week to explore the menu . Yumm yummm yummm !!!

9gopdwtbI6vxvqp61HLitQ.text: One of the best restaurant in las vegas for mexican food! Everyone is so friendly and attentive at our table . They made it a very awesome experience with a flaming fajita dish and some churros and the very end . A+++ .  Omar was a great server . !

Egms8KiyOK_JN-32vtuN-g.text: Great food, great proportions, great ambiance, great price. The only gripe I have is the meat seems to be marinated in lime and cilantro. Our family is not big on cilantro.  The place is busy, so plan accordingly!

_PlOlCaWi20nr0ZSRN6VYg.text: This was our first time visiting this restaurant and I have to say we absolutely loved it The appetizers are wonderful and by the time we got our main meal we were stuffed. Lots of food and the drinks were delicious. Also Happy Hour was a great price. Staff was very kind and friendly. We are from California and have already decided that next time we are in Vegas we will be stopping by Juan's Flaming Fajitas.

lPrq7s19LbWvlcJ9K-j1cQ.text: I have to start with the fact our waiter was in some mood the day we went. Our service was not ideal, our drinks were rarely refilled, and he just, in general, was not nice. However, even though I was seriously underwhelmed by the service I didn't take any stars off for that - everyone has a bad day! We sat down 30 minutes before happy hour ended, and he would not give us happy hour pricing. So I guess my advice would be to finish your meal before happy hour ends!   So, without considering the service, this place is three stars. The food is alright. On the sampler platter, my quesadilla was underwhelming, to say the least. It wasn't toasted on the outside, which is how I prefer them, but even adjusting for that the cheese might as well have been from a can. The chips that came alongside it with refried beans were better, but the taquitos were basically flavorless. Shrimp cocktail is usually the saving grace of any Mexican eatery for me, and this was my least favorite in Vegas. It wasn't bad, I still ate it, but it wasn't good. If it was my first time having a shrimp cocktail in this style, I probably wouldn't have bothered to try it again.   If a friend wanted to try this place, I'd go back, but I wouldn't choose it on my own.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juan&#39;s Sampler
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Cocktail!

KmEYc0nH3z95kULix2dm4Q.text: Great service, great food! The fajitas are the go to with the big flames however everything I tried including the chips and salsa were great!  Thanks , will be back!

vv-aYtiRLs6PH2jo_1ftcg.text: I really enjoyed the excellent food and service at this restaurant. My son had the fajitas and it's fun when they torch it. I had a carne asada burrito, it was delicious. I loved the various dips for the chips.

57xdkcR_rKUy64fKCM0qRg.text: Having dinner at Juan's Flaming Fajitas, it is so delicious. Had the fish tacos & chicken/shrimp fajitas. Also had house margaritas strawberry & guava. Our server was Yaajaira ,she was awesome.

rTqyVWeJ1jNwpH_33nWEDw.text: Reminds me of Tex Mex and being from Texas it is a great find! Happy hour is lively and fun to chill and have a great IPA beer too!

Y7HqDN0aUAUafvnkYa7YxQ.text: I can't get over how cool the actual flaming fajitas are! The food was insanely delicious and the staff were well versed in what the items of the menu were. I normally cannot have milk due to my lactose intolerance, and the waiter who helped us was very sure that the kitchen staff would not have any type of dairy in my dish.

_aY04E-sXNmsc32M7tlcTw.text: I came here for the first time today for lunch and was super impressed! I came alone and was immediately seated on the bar side. The customer service was great and everyone was prompt and attentive which i appreciate. I ordered the steak fajitas- which they set on fire for you in front of your table and they were so good omg. The meat was tender, it was hot, and sizzling for a while. I also got the house margarita frozen. My bill came to under $20 for myself only. I think I found my new favorite Mexican spot

vF8QB1DQu8WNWEJ8Fycqpg.text: Excellent service. The chicken fajitas were rockin. Great margaritas at happy hour! Will definitely be returning!

Oc-aTWNYTBE8kwhyu8Rt_g.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants I have eaten at in a long time! The food was excellent, the portions big and the staff was top notch!  Some restaurants these days have lost their customer service but not this place. My waiter was on top of everything and everyone from the hostess to the manager had friendly smiles and made you feel at home.  Great job Juan's Flaming Fajitas!!

eNHHTp66N4futiAT7qXVyA.text: This place is always packed. They have great food. Great deals for happy hour, great drinks, and a great vibe. The food was great and the prices were reasonable. The employees are hard workers. They are constantly on the go.

8bIz0OI7EL1co8uehQW3vA.text: Shrimp fajitas with Monterey Jack cheese is theeeee best - Highly recommend! Jovanni and Dom gave excellent service. Love this place!

ur0a_ej-ETPzTl4AIN2bDg.text: Great food and great service, I highly recommend this place. We were looking for a place off the strip and found Juan's Flaming Fajitas, it was awesome.    Highly recommended.

7kR69SYG-f-nylmitHgAAg.text: This place was great! The food was delicious and the service was very good. I've been here quite a few times including my Birthday. They really take care of you and your table. I would call ahead and get a reservation as they are packed a lot of the time. I recommend the mango Margarita if you like to drink and of course try the flaming fajitas!

2RnkZx6HCuO8LhrcQfnfLw.text: Amazing food!   Christian was our waiter and was a rock star!  Worth the drive off the beaten path!

8us_9ZF8pRwBVoJwnVPp-g.text: Ordered the mix fajitas and was surprised with so much flavor. Service very good I would recommend this place to friends and family.

JNrP-stm23UB6K8T-fgllA.text: Every time we come back the food and service keeps getting better. Never had a bad experience here, always amazing. Oswaldo was awesome as so is the whole entire staff here. Will always come back. 5 star rating all the way

mTTjtZspTTM1IwTrz0EaUw.text: Bomb.com! Got the appetizers and was full of those alone! The bean dip, onions, salsa and chips I could eat forever. Give the place a try or don't because it was already packed soooo that will make more room for us.

DzUBwdowHrIovLf1d1NYGA.text: Food is great! If you get there early enough you don't have to wait 45 plus minutes for a seat.. what I don't understand is why the patio is closed? My husband and I went out for lunch yesterday hoping to sit outside in this gorgeous 70 degree weather and they have the patio closed for no reason.. makes absolutely no sense.  Open your patio!! The weather is gorgeous people don't want to be stuck inside.  The owner responded to my post about the patio and cleared things up. Very professional! We will be back soon.

ePM8QJ0qH3vJyvkc1vILtg.text: Loved my shrimp fajitas, grilled with green peppers and onions they were very tasty. Delicious chips and salsa and beans. Had a great time with family.

PlNCjrTpluhvzBGIRmtx2g.text: I come here every year when I am in town, the food is excellent the servers are great the bar area is great. But I have never seen 80 people waiting outside to get in. I had a margarita for the first time, really really good, and I always get the cheese enchiladas. Incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 80 people waiting to get in, this place is really good. Televisions all over and lots of happy servers and customers.

rspwK2zdHbaB1vGd55mDaQ.text: My coworkers and I had many meals at Viva Mercado in the past and we were pretty disappointed when it closed. A friend mentioned that many of the former staff of Viva had moved over to Juan's Flaming Fajitas, and suggested we give it a try. I am SO thankful they did!   Everything I loved about Viva can be found at Juan's, from the friendly staff that remembers regulars to the grilled onions and jalapenos served with the complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip...    Every meal I have had at Juan's was been for lunch, they have numerous lunch specials daily, including a $3.75 lunchtime margarita.  We always sit in the bar area and get fantastic service.   Every item I have ordered has been fantastic, I especially enjoy the chicken flautas. And I LOVE that you can get steamed veggies in places of the beans and rice as a side, at no added cost.   Juan's Flaming Fajitas is not close enough for me to frequent for dinner, but for weekday lunches it's one of my favorite spots in town.

PT8YKaBTxb8bvd2eJn8Pfg.text: Flaming fajitas is the place to go. Not only for their food but even more for their service. Our server yajaira was amazing and super helpful and informative!

co8SH8kjqy1OxXYBRwxnNA.text: Love this place ! Great service, supper yummy food ! The fajitas are soooooo yummy ! Loved the enchiladas and beef taquitos are a Must !!! The soup that comes with the meal is also very yummy !

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wqu55CXkEFEEcEQv3FbyBw.text: I can't give this place enough stars. The service is probably the best I've seen in Vegas. And the food is amazing! Love the table side quac.

z3P10BmdXptbtxkZgiqfNQ.text: This was only the second time I have been here. My friend and I went for a relaxing meal on our day off work. We ordered the fajitas and got the Wednesday special $4 margaritas!!! $4 people!!! They were decently loaded with alcohol and made the meal pop. Our food came out quickly. They bring your fajitas out on a cart and set them an fire table side. It is a fun show and makes the meal that much better. These were probably some of the best fajitas I have ever had. I will definitely go back just for them.  The Staff: the staff greeted us upon entering and gave us all the available seating options (patio, bar, dining room) which was nice. They were quick to seat us and the waiter we had was great. He knelt down to our level to talk to us which made it more personable. He was extremely attentive and caring. He always asked us or anticipated what we needed before we even asked. Keep up the great service guy!!!

FH0646sPyZujZcihoXDRCg.text: Best fajitas in town  Great meat quality Awesome flavor Huge portions Good prices especially for lunch Great fun decor

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pQ3_3mdBJfREK7AfJelRZw.text: This place is amazing.  From the service to the food, everything was great.  The service - server was friendly, professional and helpful. It's like she knew us when I asked her if we should get the two person fajita or the single portion! The manager took time to check on every table in the restaurant which was much appreciated.  He followed up with our table at least twice.  What fantastic hospitality!  Our server suggested the single steak fajitas for both of us since we weren't too hungry.  We ordered it protein style with fresh romaine wraps and in addition we ordered shrimp ceviche and the churros and scoop of ice cream.  Gotta have balance!   The fajitas came out blazing hot. The food runner lit it and it bursted into flames... hence Juan's Flaming Fajitas.  The steak was juicy with a lightly charred exterior and it came with caramelized onions and peppers.  The shrimp ceviche was alright.  We honestly had better.  The churros were .com So get that with a scoop of dulce de leche  ice cream if you have space.

zKl3ifCxWklw9DQp90X4eg.text: The food: Chips, and bean dip are good. Salsa is a bit mild, but has a good flavor. Fajitas were bland, but flaming as advertised and somewhat burnt. Rice was stone cold and they forgot the tortillas. Corn tortillas are store bought just like the generic brand at Food4Less back in the day.  The service: We were seated right away. Our server seemed interested, but never checked on us until long after the food arrived. The server delivering the food was in way too much of a hurry to even care to check that the order was even correct. So we waited until finally someone came over to check. Then, they kept interrupting while we were trying to eat just to keep apologizing.  I get it... you're sorry... are you trying to make me leave?  Summary: Food was "meh" at best, service was horrible. I'm hoping this was an "off" day because I really wanted to like the place.

PyxkVTdDSJYG7FtiKLauwA.text: The best Mexican restaurant in town. Food is delicious and sooo tasty. I ordered beef burrito so flavorful mouth watering.....

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IOY8VzpMBNRKTdQUVwz4YA.text: The best since we left Texas 5 years ago!!!  Great customer service, my tea glass was never empty!! Tons of food for a great price!!!  Thank you so much.

uhYthz5XaQ1_HBcIPhrr7A.text: Love this place...great food, margaritas, sangria and salsa.  Service was amazing!  Waits can be long so check before you head there!

LI4M3LDVUVGQJ20YVT7sJw.text: Came here three times already, and all three times have been amazing! First two times were a sit down, and their service have been nice and prompt. Food came out in a timely manner and was super flavorful. The third time was a take out. Waited a long time, but it was understandable considering that the place was PACKED that night. They even packed the complimentary chips and dips and soup into the take out, which is considerate. FYI, the salsa they packed us was so large, it lasted my boyfriend and I for three days. Definitely worth it.

ztKepsc_ANNx3vT4Ap_XDA.text: Fajitas are The best in town! My favorite Mexican place now Juan is the old Manager of Viva customer service is the best!
