3-pOToQqiR0uAW9Z_96JQw.text: Excellent service from start to finish. Seated quickly and our hostess checked on us frequently. I ordered the Steak fajitas which was enough for 2 people at least and my date ordered the Tex Mex Enchiladas with Verde sauce and he thought his food was great too. I cant wait to go back for more fajitas! Next time, I would like to try their dessert seeing how their other food was delicious. Thank you!

eoTWNDpzdckWeKKfibd2wQ.text: We came here on Saturday night with a party of 16.  They were SUPER helpful in seating us quickly and at a nice large table.  We asked off the bat if we could split the bill since everyone had cards and they went above and beyond for us and made everything super easy!  The food was excellent and came out in a very timely manner!  I would highly recommend this place and thank you to all the servers who helped the big rock climbing party on Saturday night!  THANKS!

bq54wrYIX0y4z9ceZzqMwQ.text: Las Vegas locals already know that this is the absolute best Mexican food in town. Service and food are perfect!

Tq7roZkTqxMMg1odleKtBQ.text: I am addicted to this place. So good. I love their chicken Mulitas and their grilled pepper/onion with their bean dip.

WvnwovsA849EC8WiHDzuJA.text: This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant! As a vegetarian I was so excited to see a whole section of veggie substitutes to all the standard dishes! I got the vegetarian Fajitas....so so good. And so many veggies. (Their refrained beans are vegetarian too!) My boyfriend got the steak and loved it as well. The guac was amazing...no need to go for the table side-their house guac is so worth it.  And even with all the amazing food, the best part about this place is the service. Few times have I experienced such excellent service in a restaurant. Everyone was attentive, polite and nice. Even one of the bus boys brought us napkins when he saw the ones in our hands wadded up. I will be back and I will recommend this place to everyone!  Update: after writing this review Juan sent me a message ensuring I knew which sides they give with all meals had a meat base and let me know which I could get vegetarian. Even more respect for this place!

c2NIqiZdVbobwrkqHXgtmQ.text: Happy hour until 7! Great food. Great margaritas and a good atmosphere for families or just friends.

cYeGTgk9o4EdriiEkGkPGg.text: This place simply has excellent food and excellent service. The free chips and salsa always come out very quick and fresh. The quality of the food is really good, and they give you good portion sizes. I always order one of their margaritas, and they definitely hit the spot. I highly recommend the fajitas of course, and they come with fresh tortillas that are made in house. This place is definitely a must try, and surely it will not disappoint.

McLCZhxLsPqDaYnt4C0i8w.text: I'm A Local And A Mexican Food Aficionado, Food Is Ok But Overpriced Based On Their Selection Of Food And Or Margarita's Not Sure If They're Trying To Bring Southern California Mexican Cuisine To Vegas But This Establishment May Have To Do Their Homework On Mexico's Region Of Different Styles Of Mexican Food...Just Saying On The Positive Side They Are A Small Business Owner

LDI8NYmv3IT4PoNqLFbQZA.text: Holy guacamole!  This place is fantastic!  We started with a few margaritas that were phenomenal. The salsa, beans, and roasted jalapenos followed. They were fantastic as well. We decided on the steak and chicken fajitas for two. It was really enough for four. They were the best fajitas I've ever had. JWbX_E65kHyPecLueT684Q.text: My parents and I just came here for the first time and we enjoyed ourselves! We had the fajita plate and a seafood plate that I forgot the name of. The food was delicious and very fresh. I'm from LA and I have yet to find a authentic Mexican spot that serves great food.   Also the service was beyond amazing! From the host to the waiter to the lady that kept asking if we want more ships and bean dip(which was yummy as well). They were all so friendly and so organized. I really enjoyed our time and the dinner we had! Definitely coming back :)

GMtjwsAYGqnMSE0t_1oCUQ.text: Went on a early Friday evening good thing this place was over busy . By the time we left (6:00) it was standing room in and out! 1st impression clean, very courteous staff  It was very noisy in main room kids screaming well you get it . Maybe lunch would be better  Now to the food --- right away they brought us our drinks with chips , salsa,& bean dip . Also a small plate of grilled sweet onions & jalapeno chiles nice ...I had a chile relleno & beef soft flour tortilla taco! I always order the relleno @ new places I go to & if it's good all else can't be to bad . My partner ordered chili Colorado with side of black beans  very good ! he does not like cilantro & I think the red sauce although yummy had to much coriander oh well ! bxMfGJzwu3bLfv0-alxhxg.text: Super popular.  Definitely make reservations. The only thing is they only do that for parties of 10 or more. Food was good but I need to come back another time to be able to comment on it more. Since I wasn't that hungry I only ordered a chille relleno plate which was good but not the greatest. Leticias was better. Next time I'll definitely try the flaming fajitas.

qgDoCGXnaPcDWuoOrf_f6Q.text: Their flaming fajitas are the BEST. Their food is really delicious and i really enjoy their customer service. Price wise, to me its fair. I can never finish my meal, it is such a big portion. Me and family always enjoy coming here.

O39wnfyCroJzIsJXJAtZnQ.text: First of all, parking is a bit of a mess since it shares a lot with in n out.  Sat in the bar area.  Service was attentive but they seemed to keep forgetting things. It was busy but they seemed to be fully staffed so I shouldn't have to ask 2-3 times for something.  Onto the food.  They dropped off chips and 2 kinds of salsa and a bean dip.   Salsa are pretty generic as was the beans.  Ordered a shrimp ceviche that was recommended by waiter but they seemed to forget about it.  Got the fajitas since that's part of the name.  Nice flashy presentation but pretty boring on the follow through.   Lacked flavor.  After asking the runner that we never got our ceviche, it finally showed.  It was okay but again lacked flavor.  Sadly, cucumber was most noticeable part which obviously shouldn't be the stand out ingredient.  All in all, a nice place but more for atmosphere than food.

OgiIk8GOk1v4uzYXxUq-5g.text: This place was delicious!  Along with nachos they also give you a cheesy bean dip, salsa, and hot peppers and onions to start with!  The peppers and onions were certainly a treat for my husband and I.  My Margarita was great.  The Chicken Flaming Fajita and Cheese Quesadilla were both very good.  The Chimichanga was not as crunchy as we're used to (that's part of what we used to like about it) and we got the regular one, which tasted like they just boiled the chicken in water and was VERY bland and gross.  The chicken that came with the Fajita was grilled and delicious.  Our waiter suggested we should have gotten the Grilled Chicken (Pollo Asado) Chimichanga instead and then it would have tasted better - wish they had recommended it back when we asked what Pollo Asado was!  There were so many other authentic looking Mexican dishes on the menu that we can't wait to go back and try something new!  Overall a nice spot with good ambiance - oh, and the busboy walking around singing to himself while he wipes down the tables is a HOOT!

iWjp_yGhysnUaZfU63Cuog.text: Wow hit this place on a Friday. Line was out the door. Grabbed some margi's from the bar and it was well worth the wait. Chips come with beans, salsa, and grilled chilis/onions. So good. Got the Fajitas and was not disappointed. Definitely will eat here again.

axOSWNxEPrLcCJ47ClqEFA.text: Despite the fact my order had to be remade 3 times as they couldn't get it right and my dad almost choked over a bone he had in one of his chicken tacos I can't give them five stars but I also can't give them less than 4 as they do have good food when prepared right. You can tell a lot about a mexican restaurant if they have good chips and salsa as usually the food is good I have found over the years. This restaurant is great and it might just be one of the top three mexican restaurants in Vegas. I love El Dorado but this is just right up there next to it.

va4mPOIHcpY7t5XtYpRKiA.text: We have come back here a few times since my original review and we are still fans. So far I have stuck with the fajitas, which are still consistently good. I still feel like this is the best mexican place I have found in Vegas, but to be fair I haven't tried anything but the fajitas so far. My husband has had the nachos on the happy hour menu before and enjoyed them. They have been busy each time we have gone, but we never have to wait long and everyone there goes out of their way to greet you, ask you how everything is, if you need anything else...etc. Top notch customer service for sure!

3QFQxJcUJk3Vk6K56Bg0ew.text: Awesome food. Had the carne a sada burrito with chips and salsa togo, it was delicious!

6EPPqeJ3PjVtEIeaiJOzqA.text: This place is amazing! This was our 1st time here and our server, Chris, was awesome. We started off with house chips/bean dip/salsa green & red).... we ordered the fajitas for 2 and it was sooo delicious! It was more then enough for the both of us. The service was excellent ! We would highly recommend this restaurant...one of the best (if not the best) Mexican restaurants we've dined in.

nPoGp1yL0gJdkLW6CAc1ew.text: The best Mexican food in LV! Long wait times Friday and Saturday nights. Well worth the wait!

6uRhAw7EJwr3vtmb2ye4Yg.text: Great experience at Juan's!    It was my mid-week birthday dinner and we felt like we wanted to try somewhere new - so I turned to my fellow Yelpers.  Mexican is one of my favorite cuisines (along with everything else it seems) and when I read all of the stellar reviews - I knew I had to try Juan's.  We arrived in time for Happy Hour which let us try two different types of margaritas at a super reasonable price, the house and the Don Julio.  I found the mix a bit lacking in depth of flavor and thought that the house margarita might be watered down - but one sip into my second, and I realized these babies pack a punch! (Also evidenced by the pitcher-sharing table of seniors next to us who were getting into increasingly loud, contentious political conversations in the table next to us. Apparently I'm not the only person that gets sassy on tequila!).  The gratis tortillas chips were fresh and crisp - the salsa and complimentary bean dip tasty!  (Note that their regular bean dip isn't vegetarian - but you can request a veggie version! Love that!) The complimentary plate of grilled peppers and onions was delish as well.  We ordered the shrimp fajitas for two - with two different set-ups - rice & beans, steamed veggies, flour tortillas as well as corn. The best of all worlds and a great way to try a lot of different items on the menu for first-time visitors. When I missed taking a shot of the flaming of the fajitas - our waiter flamed them a second time for me - nice of him!  They don't skimp on the shrimp like some restaurants that serve fajitas in town - here they made up the majority of the meal and were good quality - nice and plump and perfectly cooked. I have to say, the side of veggies was really great - I don't know what they do to it, but it has some really great subtle additional flavorings in there.  I had jokingly mentioned that it was my birthday at some point, and the staff surprised us with churros with chocolate sauce and whipped cream - served up with a hearty version of "Happy Birthday" and a paper tiara with a sombrero on it at the end of our meal.  Awesome touch, you guys!    Overall, had a great time.  The service was great and friendly, the food terrific, the prices super reasonable during happy hour. We'll definitely be back!

sS9I_cziHMPpOF3Cm2wW7w.text: Just enjoyed an excellent dinner with my family. The service was outstanding from beginning to end! The chicken suiza enchiladas and shredded beef burrito with red chili sauce is tasty. And the sopapillas are so yummy. The price is very reasonable for a family of four, with plenty of leftovers to take home. Found our restaurant for authentic Mexican food.

DLikGO_Hut3EumwVNpaKMA.text: Food is absolutely wonderful. The margaritas are very weak on alcohol we had to order 2 shots but it's ok, now we know and we can order something diff next time. The quality of food is great and customer service is awesome too. Thanks for the hard work!

_JRztHkje8en6LF8RImeLg.text: New to town & was looking for a yummy Mexican food place nearby -- so glad we decided on Juan's! Everything was fresh & delicious. I had the pick 2 combo with a fish taco & pollo asada taco & my boyfriend had the seafood enchilada's. They were both cooked perfectly-- nothing overdone or too greasy. We both cleaned our plates.  Service was awesome & friendly. Inside was clean & inviting. We will definitely be back for more.  ++ Happy Hour everyday from 3-7pm!

oqTDco85z3UWBjXJd6Yeow.text: This place is still going strong!  Excellent service, great quality food.  Whenever we cannot agree to a place for lunch, this is always the peacemaker.   Their taco salad is delicious and a go to item for me.  Their free chips and salsa with bean dip are an appreciated bonus!  I always ask for Diet Cherry Coke and I get it with no problems whatsoever.   Clean restaurant. Awesome food.  Entertaining with TVs where ever you look. The staff is top notch!  One major reason we come here. They remember us!  If you STILL haven't tried this place you really are missing out.  Go.  Now!

8EPrUMoT3eO_G-6UR08HgA.text: I've been all over the world and have dined at some pretty incredible places, but I have to say this place has the best customer service I've ever experienced.  The entire wait staff will stop by your table and ask how you're doing.  The waiter noticed our chips were crumbled and he got us another one just because of that without us even asking or noticing. The food is excellent and I will definitely be a regular here.

7RnZBZ-gVKGtqNHUhoXeCA.text: Simply the best tasting, reasonable-priced, and freshly made Mexican food I have had... and our server, Amanda, was very pleasant, attentive and knowledgeable about each item on the menus... they even accommodated a vegetarian diet.. which was a BIG plus for us.. highly recommend it!

XfmOYmv6J9DKT6eqAh3OSg.text: The steak fajitas were pretty good. Not the best not the worst. Must say there carniasada was really tender and delicious. Salsa was superb. so fresh.

yZFXiXWJJsIsKcID2oPIfg.text: This place had great portions of food and prices were excellent. Ordered the Fajitas for 2 and was able to share it with plenty of leftovers. We tried the queso dip which was very tasty. I liked how they bring out chips and 2 different salsas and retried beans. Also and added extra: all the dishes you order come with a fideo soup which was a nice touch! Overall very happy with the food and service, I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mAY4AKhkEkMiOBt9REuJcg.text: Welcome to the magical land of sizzling proteins and delicious drinks!!! The fajitas are really flaming! Oh man, why did I wait soooo long to visit?!?!? Came on a gorgeous Sunday evening, hoping to sit outside and enjoy the weather. The patio already had a large party there and our group was large too, no sweat, we can sit inside.  The restaurant is fairly large with a sort of divided dining are, a patio, and a bar that's separated. I like that it accommodates what ever type of night you're looking to have. Now the food! I absolutely LOVED the shrimp and steak fajitas! I typically don't order steak unless I'm at an actual steakhouse but took a risk and it paid off! The steak was tender, not at all chewy and had wonderful flavor. The shrimp was great as well. Perfectly cooked with flavors of pepper and onions it was cooked with. I really enjoyed watching the server torch the fajitas, a nice touch that adds flare to the dining experience.  The fajitas are paired with rice, beans, guac, sour cream, pico de gallo, and freshly made tortillas - corn or flour. You're able to swap the tortillas for romaine wraps, as well as rice and beans for steamed vegetables. Great option for the health conscious. I personally would not sacrifice the flour tortillas for a few calories, they were delicious! Oh, the fajitas also came with a little bowl of soup! I really did not need it as, the table tortilla chips were pretty good and kept me busy while waiting for the food. Another star of the show for me were the margaritas. ON FIRE! I had the raspberry margarita that got me buzzed, followed by a shot of tequillaaaaaaaaaa, then a pina colada margarita... The Pina Colada Margarita was my fave, perfect combination of sweet and tangy. I look forward to having it again and again :) The service was good, it seemed to take a little while for us to get our order in but we did not mind as we were enjoying each others company. The drinks came right away though. I am not a die hard fan of fajitas but can have them anytime if they are from here. Really!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yas! Pina Colada margarita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry margarita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken taquitos

WcJWVcPNQCzzjtQSsmhc6g.text: They have the best fajitas I've ever had so far. My new food place whenever I come to Vegas. You also get a soup and chips and salsa before your meal. Great food for a great price and alot for your buck can't beat that. You guys need to add locations in southern California

hWF4QdwdgONldVGJdGeUdw.text: This place is so good. The food is authentic the drinks are strong but tasteful. The fajitas are fresh seafood is fresh. And there is a lot of flavor they also serve beans and salsa with your chips  queso fundido has a lot of flavor too!

6W-Jb6ScZ5dBYB9fj-UEMA.text: I came here tonight for my 30th birthday and I can't believe I waited so long to try this place! Everything was amazing! The wait wasn't too long and the place was packed, the food was incredibly delicious, the combo fajitas for 2 was more than enough for 2 people, and my margarita was the best margarita I've ever had! Our servers Arturo and David were so kind and attentive and to top it off they brought out the most incredible churros and sang happy birthday to me. I normally don't eat sweets but those churros were so good! Overall I love this place and I can't wait to come back.

o0Mj9_lhvLKXfcJgJiQgoA.text: Great service Great fajitas Price is reasonable  Lunch menu is perfect for quick lunch

Y7Ft8lm4X3GFS_FfpveNSQ.text: The food was amazing and definitely worth the wait especially since it was cinco de mayo. The service was stellar and everyone was friendly. I definitely recommend this place and if you can ask for Yajaira she was our server and was very nice and helpful with explaining things on the menu. :)

ij0SlGRTNkIQI8FUkAmgiQ.text: Excellent food! Plenty of vegetarian options. And amazing service from Valentin. Thank you!

zYC3H3QiPVhk0RB_Ur_h1w.text: Great Mexican food. Fajitas are delicious but the place is very smoky. Be ready to smell like food

UmZRlk4xzztC3y4MwmtJwA.text: In regards to Lane L.'s review, there are a couple misrepresentations. We were here this night and the man that climbed on the bar was extremely out of line. However the staff stopped serving him once he was obviously intoxicated and then removed him from the bar. It is not the staff nor the bars fault this man was acting a'fool.  Overall, this place is absolutely fantastic. My friend finally convinced me to come here after raving about how great it is for ages, and I finally caved. The margaritas are hella spicy and their food is (literally) fuego. Come here and you will not be disappointed.

2NINg73Bg32RYLgBkhJ0ig.text: My families favorite place for Mexican food. Always busy, but we don't mind as the food is the best. We used to go to Lindo Michoacan's in green valley, but the view is better than their food.  I recommend to every one I can, friends from Alberta, Canada and friends who live here and haven't been. Keep it up!!

j_pCHZSP57zNc_fCJU19sg.text: Fantastic. An absolute fantastic place. Great service to our standards. Awesome fajitas. Especially the signature flaming fajitas. It's a great place. Great vibe. Great food. I will recommend JFFC to anyone.

VkD4D2WfF53e_H0QksgTNw.text: This place is Amazing!!! The food is really good my waitress name yajaira and other staff also checked on us to make sure we was good and our food was good. This was a great place for girls day out with my friend! The prices is good too. Also the Margarita are LIT really good!

BLw08PUc1Kg1pULlGnDAug.text: giving this reataurant 5 stars because of their quality customer service. from receptionist, waiter and manager great service. went to this place as a recommendation from my sis in law. good food, huge servings. great for family or perfect for big groups.

dGeRdF2--0I1iWVkIoag0w.text: Such great Mexican food. Love this place.  I recommend getting the Guadalajara Special.  You will not be disappointed.

0i0PuRRLx0Z5lYoGwCe3sA.text: My husband insisted on going here.. it wasn't bad.. Food was delicious.. Service was on point.. prices were fair..I would go back there!

joaIyts9kGKct7Om9jHZfw.text: This place does a huge business, congratulations to them.  Location (like many others in Las Vegas) sadly is Strip Mall.  So we had to wait about 30 minutes for a table hoping it was worthwhile.  Will I go back?  Probably not, but rest assured though, plenty of others will...It was packed, many large party tables and mostly with rug rat kids screaming.  Just not for me. Positives:  1.  Really cool thing is they have an internet based system so you can see how much longer you have to wait and who is ahead of you.  2.  They had chips and salsa waiting at our table for us as we sat.  The side of peppers was smart and a nice free addition. Negatives: 1.  I thought the Fajita's were fair at best.  Greasy and what I really don't like is leaving a restaurant with my clothes smelling like grease.  They add oil then fire up those bad boys.   Imagine the greasy feeling with nearly every table ordering fajitas.   2.  Stomach ache post meal and let's just say GI tract didn't sit well the next morning.      Ole!

UeFPNMRlR62TprIxK4kN0Q.text: If you're not hungry don't go here!!  They have great happy hour specials on food and drinks. Complimentary chips and salsa are some of the best I've had in town.  Comes with a medium (I thought) salsa, a tomatillo salsa, bean dip, and grilled onions and jalapenos.  My happy hour order of taquitos was great as well!!  Definitely coming back!

d-YK0O6305EDpml963IhFA.text: Met some friends here for happy hour.  The service was good and the menudo was amazing.  It reminded me of menudo from So Cal.  Also, We had beef quesadillas and ceviche (Huge bowl!) from the happy hour menu.  Very good and they service Negra Modelo which is a plus.

e7TGYcVJMbQM_5woRDYP-g.text: I enjoy going here and having their diablo chicken. It is 5 star. I just dont like leaving smelling like a fajita. Hey it's the price you pay for authentic  food

LjJXalsDD12N1EOqklJcWg.text: Great service, lots of fun. Not the most amazing Mexican food I've ever tasted but very good. Their sopa de fideo is great, bean dip is SO good, fajitas are great and they really are flaming. Excellent drink specials too. I give 5 stars because the food is good, service is great, and we always have a lot of fun!

rgfNQ-Jsw55Y9Vxxac-3hQ.text: I walked in this place with expectations and ALL of them were blown away . Didn't expect a gaming bar so major plus. bartender Juan was very accommodating, and friendly . ALL of the staff were on it, food was AMAZING . 10/10 my go to for Mexican food now .

R1cZIxLOiiM9-UQdVcRNjA.text: The cheese here is really amazing! I had the steak fajita - order it rare and it will come out medium rare since it continues to cook on the cast iron. Try to go easy on the chips and salsa - it's addictive and so easy to get full of it before your meal comes out.

XolbUZBJRDfJLWiMxIjREQ.text: Great service with great food!!   I went here for lunch and had the steak and shrimp fajitas. They light the fajitas on fire table side.  Very good food and great service!!!

jISzFicuvz_QBGKOzAPUrg.text: I come here often and food is great however the front entrance girl named "Luna" is a serious problem and needs to learn about hospitality, I have put that she is a problem everywhere. I own businesses also and understand that people need to work however she needs to be behind the scenes. She talks and treats customers terrible. Many customers have left because of her including myself previously

d1qD1bz3UVEOXJaoEypFeA.text: Fast service and great atmosphere!!! It was JUAN in a million and Linda is amazing!!!

D7bvGumvEz6dmi4dLOSPsg.text: Jaun's flaming fajitas,  Is the best mexican restaurant in town.! Jaun the owner and his staff are absolutely wonderful service is great!

sP6oEzyC60PdS98vB3en5w.text: Best Mexican food experience ever. Service is great, food is outstanding. 10/10 would recommend.

fzzwABne0sX0UHt9pn7Fjg.text: Love this place. Can't wait till the Henderson location opens. Loved the chips and salsa. The chicken fajitas were bomb steak was soso

zp9ENUpcIHOpF-XTIo4pCA.text: Just finished a meal here for the first time with my boyfriend and it was awesome!!! He got chicken fajitas and I got a two entree plate. Everything was fresh and tasted great. My michelada could have been a little spicier but still great!!! All of the staff was also extremely friendly and welcoming! Will definitely be back!

QERUYCU-3Ir7I0OpDAHlwA.text: Outstanding!  The fajitas come out and they flame the meat, onions, and peppers.  There is a flame underneath to keep it warm.  Best fajitas I ever had!!!  Staff was very friendly and attentive. I highly recommend trying Juan's flaming fajitas

Pw9KO1gsi1VOAyxXPotcwg.text: Yajaira was awesome and so was the food! It is hard to find great Mexican food in Las Vegas but this place does it right!!!

iXh8u9Xup4lUb9-vTe7Pzw.text: We usually go to Lindo Michoacan when we want Mexican at a sit down restaurant, but I felt like we were just there and talked my husband into trying Juan's. Ok, we're hooked! Service was great. We got the Fajitas for 2 with Steak and Chicken, add cheese...so good, lots of flavor. Loved the fideo soup and chips with the onions and peppers, the salsa and bean dip were good although not my favorite. My only other gripe is smelling of fajita when we left, I smelled like I had worked the grill, my clothes were saturated with the smell and my skin felt greasy. I had noticed the smell and cloud of smoke in the restaurant when we sat down. I'll just be sure not to have anything special planned after we eat here. Prices were on par with other Mexican restaurants and you get more than enough to eat. We will definitely be back and we'll be packing the Febreeze!

ygi5oHJLBM3cCAnoUc_VFw.text: Found this place on Yelp. Staying on the strip and escaped today to go to Red Rocks for some hiking. We figured we'd find some good local food. Decided to try this place out. Excellent. The service was so great both in the Cantina and the restaurant. The food was amazing, probably the best fajitas I've ever had. My husband and I are on weight watchers and we feel great after the meal. They let you choose steamed veggies rather than rice and beans and have an awesome skinny margarita.  Next time we are in Vegas, we will make coming here a priority!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TNbb8GDqJkDobCtmW1K7RA.text: We found this restaurant on yelp and we were blown away... end of story unbelievable.  If you're staying in Vegas is worth getting away from the strip it coming out to the red rocks and then having dinner at Juan's flaming fajitas! We may actually come back to Vegas just to eat here again.  We felt like this was an authentic experience. The flaming fajitas we had were so delicious! The service was excellent.  The environment was perfect right down to the smoke, music and wait enthusiastic staff.

X5PmhoBKz5E33UOMG7KXZQ.text: This place is amazing, especially their flaming fajitas! I also recommend the ceviche.

GPg7D6zsuQqSQe2baLBzeA.text: This place is just okay and overpriced. Mexican food in Vegas is severely lacking to make a huge understatement. I've been here multiple times with family and out of town visitors. Nobody has been impressed. I want to like it, they just put forth minimum effort in every way.

Ay_uHin15zwJknF5Ld7RMQ.text: Very good Mexican food!!!!! And no complaints over here! I willl recommend this place to anyone, second time here!!

FOPkt24opxcz1IEqxo4V-Q.text: We love this place! It's become our regular Mexican good joint! They don't disappoint with portions or flavor! We love the that you get chips and bean dip to start! Great location and big restaurant with plenty of seating! The staff is very kind and attentive.

N89Z02TDE30Qp8cSdfCbXg.text: This is probably my favorite place for Mexican food!  I highly recommend the Horchata it's so refreshing and sweet.  The restaurant is always busy and it's fairly small so you can generally expect to wait for table. They provide you with chips and salsa along with a bean dip (so yummy). I generally get the pozole or menudo along with a chorizo quesadilla absolutely delicious!  Everything is seasoned well And piping hot. The funny thing is I've yet to try their fajitas though they do look and smell amazing.  It you're looking for a fun atmosphere and delicious food you can't go wrong with this place. I'll be back again and again and again!!

vIQbL2tQBws8GpjAxl6W-A.text: Had dinner there tonight. Flaming Fajitas, chicken and beef, flour tortillas and rice & beans. Two beers too. Soup was good. Grilled onions and jalapeno are great with chips and salsa with bean dip. Omar was on his game. Watch the Angles play the Twins. I would go back and you will get a good meal. Can`t wait till they get the homemade tortilla machine cranking out fresh tortillas. Still like Roberto`s hot sauce. Maybe i`ll bring some next time. 9/5/14

tWnHp0vHcE9ir3zStEVSgg.text: Favorite place to go. Great service. Fresh food and oh so yummy. The fajita specials are great....soup chips and dips and the fried onions are bomb

K2rc2nqfd7Il73YDwwxnbw.text: I just want to say I don't really even like Fajitas unless they are with lettuce, tomato and cheese.  Juan's have the best Fajitas I have ever had and I ate them just like they said to.   This place is off the chain good.  The staff and the food are better than most of the 5 star places I have been at.  the chips and re-fried pork beans (on the house by the way) are the Bomb....  You MUST try this place if you are in Vegas.  You won't be disappointed.

0TeqANkDUF9zxIclbVwsHg.text: Ordered takeout: combo fajitas (steak and chicken) and chips and salsa. Meat was seasoned very well and cooked perfectly. Food was delicious. It was ready very quickly even though it was ordered when they were very busy. Very friendly.

1sbkm0uIIihcAKoVJ8sL_A.text: Always a A+ experience, authentic Mexican Cuisine, delightful atmosphere, grade AAAA service. The food is very good.

hVKfZIAzlXGqZsjFLEpqeQ.text: Currently my favorite fajita spot. I love me some fajitas and this place knows exactly how to serve them up. While you're waiting for your food you are given chips, salsa, AND bean dip. Yum! The fajitas come out table-side, as the waiter creates a flame on them, before handing them off to you. Dinner and a mini show! The margaritas are my favorite there as well!

zf6TndFaKuHoIe_PKF4i8w.text: This place is awesome, VALENTINO was the amazing server that we had tonight, he was on point about everything and tended to everyone, he was never late on the service. The food was really good, we will definitely go back here to eat again, highly recommended

JQTeF_Tu-wAgpSmEZ33w2g.text: I liked this place a lot. I had the steak fajitas and they were great. Brought to your table in traditional fajita fan-fare they were tasty, juicy, and the quantity was perfect. My only negatives are that the fajitas had a TON of bell peppers and onions (disproportionately so to the steak) and the refried beans had no flavor whatsoever. Honestly these two things didn't stop me from thoroughly enjoying my meal. I will definitely be back.

T7eLGUwDYMSO1PsCmSqbiw.text: Hands down the BEST Mexican restaurant near Summerlin, or maybe even in Vegas.  I am usually pretty picky with my Mexican places since many places in Vegas seem to have either no flavor or are too greasy.  The service was absolutely fantastic, from the hostess to our server Omar, everyone was very courteous and helpful but not naggy or anything annoying.  It was great.  We were immediately seated and brought chips and salsa and our drink order were taken. We went with the pork and shrimp fajitas, and wow sooooo good. They light them up when it's wheeled out to you, super cool! The veggies, meat, and shrimp had so much flavor.  The tortillas were very fresh and warm.  All the sides: guac, cour cream, pico, beans, and rice were fresh and super tasty! I would definitely recommend this to any Mexican food lover or anyone who needs to be converted.  Definitely my new favorite place!

_u9WlMiRfEmZTUIPK2PMOw.text: You know, for what I see outside versus the food inside, I'm impressed.  Their food is fresh, delicious, and portions can feed 2 people!  I signed up for their VIP texts that provide huge discounts and event info.  You should try this place.  It's flamin' good.

vWWFwMcs1prBOLOZ16C39w.text: Definitely suitable for carnivores. My vegetarian dish did not exceed the expectation.

6QGcQfycEByj5kPn2-J_6w.text: I've eaten here a few times now and it's definitely the best fajitas in Las Vegas. If you live on the southwest side of town and you haven't tried this place you are missing out. Me and my wife always get the fajitas for 2.

DeDZ7JaruKNm5h2H5FifNQ.text: Ordered their signature dish steak fajitas. Presentation was nice unfortunately meat was dry and tasteless and served with steaming hot rubbery microwaved tortillas. If you are more interested in drinking and socializing and less interested in food quality might work for you. Anyone who wants a better food experience look elsewhere.

fXrizA_vfNdy5UQsVkpSOw.text: This place is awesome. Anything I've ever had here is delicious, authentic, and fresh. Juan's super friendly and always checking in to make sure the experience is great.

4KsdCcotRPEmGhiJZEl3Rg.text: We were visiting Las Vegas for the long Labor Day weekend and had a taste for Mexican food and turned to yelp for help and this place turned up first and after reading a few of the reviews decided to give it a try. The reviews didn't lie it's good food and good service! The beef fajitas are good and do not disappoint! Even the chips and salsa were good!  The sopa de Fideo they give with each meal has a lot of flavor.  Give it a try and you will want to go back again!

ztvYRi2oE6VCLaTa0Mx6jg.text: If I had two more hands, I'd give Juans 4 thumbs up!  This is Mexican food on a whole'nether level! My experience lived up to the hype. The food was phenomenal.  There are Mexican restaurants everywhere but nothing compares......I highly recommend the fajitas and quesadilla, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it and I'm stuffed!  Juans has a cool atmosphere, plenty of tv's to watch football and the staff was incredibly friendly!

vacS5TImSpYq9sw2RGcHYw.text: We were heading to In & Out and smelled the fajitas from the parking lot. Walked in on a whim, the fajitas were amazing!!!! Best we have had. They serve on a flaming pot. So good. Homemade tortillas... I could go on and on.

8D6I-mQCnVB8_ZVsguMedw.text: Restaurants cringe when my family when my family walks in the door... " 2 Adults and 5 Kids". It's just something we are used to as a large family. Juan's... was completely different.   Welcomed in and we were seated at our table right away. Adrianna took our drink order and brought chips and salsa to the table before our kids could organize a protest. In fact Adrianna was incredible... drinks were always full and the chips never ran out.   Rolando our server was excellent. He'd visit with the kids and make them laugh.   Rolando and Adrianna made the dinner experience perfect for our large family.  I almost forgot the food. When the kids received their food... they were quiet. That's how you can gauge how good a meal is. My wife and I ordered fajitas for two and they were delicious.   Juan's will be a regular dinner choice for our family.

i1fMZolZkj0H_zknHKraZA.text: So good!  First time here - definitely not the last. We're already planning our next visit. We had the steak fajitas and the chorizo, egg and potato burrito. Service was excellent (thanks Arturo) and very helpful.

b7f_zNztWgSjd7-1nWh5dw.text: Seated within seconds of arriving at 5pm. The second we sat down there was food at table (chips and 6 trays of 3 sauces), the staff treated us well, they were engaged, joking, and happy to see us. The bus boy Manuel was working SO HARD bringing so many sauces and refills. Good food from a Puerto Rican's POV (excellent soup- brings back memories). Off the strip, I'd rather have a trusted food joint and this is IT. Again, incredibly fast service, large portions, overall 5 stars!

x_thHp0-EeFbKpt3foDhlQ.text: Excellent service and such yummy food! We will be back for sure!  Our water cups were always full, super fast service, manager comes around talking to the tables. Food is so good! This is our go to place at least weekly!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Shrimp fajitas for 2!

KYt6hYyxIUjYLude9jpQqQ.text: This place is so good!  The fajitas are perfect, and they fully understand that yes some people put cheese on there.  They also understand kids, so you can get a chicken quesadilla with french fries instead of rice and beans.  Quick, friendly service (almost too quick, every time I go there I almost get in a collision en route to the bathroom going past the kitchen, but I digress).  Today I got the fish tacos (grilled, at the server's suggestion) and oh my god those were tasty.  So now I'm torn between getting what I know is outstanding and searching to see if literally everything on the menu is just as great.  The struggle is real!

to7k3nBUZFiE_sJ95TG5YQ.text: Very impressed. We got a table right away, got a very nice waitress (thank you Amanda), the food was good, & really enjoyed coming here. Definitely would eat here again &/or recommend it to friends & family.       Thanks again Amanda,the 3 of us enjoyed having a personable waitress!!!!

xAhGmziIOhX6cogpJK92NQ.text: First time here last night, and we will always return when we're in the mood for Mexican food, in particular fajitas!  It's really hard to find decent Mexican food in Vegas, and we believe we finally found our Mexican spot.  From the minute we walked in, everyone was so welcoming and friendly. But, the people that stood out the most were our server, Amanda, and her sidekick Erick!  They gave 5 star EXCELLENT service! They were so awesome, always checking on us, giving us refills on beverages, chips, salsa, etc! The food was so yummmmmy and authentic!  The complimentary chips, salsa, grilled onions, jalapenos were to die for, and we couldn't get enough!  Can't wait to return!!!

L3E31_ZW3ph3RhnJpq5TWw.text: Been going to Juans since they opened. Eaten there numerous times and never been dissatisfied. Food is delicious, service amazing , and prices very reasonable. The atmosphere is great and staff incredibly friendly. They even have live music on weekend. Singer has amazing voice but I think he has me figured out. Can't help but think of my grandma when he sings. Tears in my tacos but still yummy.

ng_7yOdmxjhiAQoaSLRFcg.text: I love this place,  the staff is always friendly, the food is delicious! I also love that there are tvs around so you can watch the games (hehe)

ClEF7wOGvWphZk9jDY-cng.text: The first time that my fiance and I went here, it was a suggestion from my boss who said that the food is extremely good. We decided to come back again because not only is the food delicious, but the service is outstanding. The place was packed with not only people waiting inside, but outside as well. That's how good the place is. We were told that it would be approx a 30-35 minute wait and actually got seated within 10 minutes! The chips and dips were delivered almost immediately as was our drinks. After 2 or 3 sips of our drinks, they were continuously refilled the entire time. Our entree's came out rather quickly also. These people are the model of how service should be at any restaurant. We will definitely be back again.

Gj2HHpTO4JtE_AsLnM5GsA.text: We will drive clear across town for Juan's Flaming Fajitas.  We love it!

enz9xBLtCWdqu5AujvyOuA.text: I will drive 20 miles to get here!! Everything from the drinks to the food.. Margaritas are made from scratch!! Happy Hour is extended to 7pm for those of us that have to bare traffic. I LOVE the Chili's and grilled onions as the appetizer!!! Fajitas, well seriously the BEST in town!!!  All of the food is fresh and tasty. The service never fails and rumor has it that they could potentially obtain a second location in Henderson. I vow to be there every Friday!! I can't say enough of this place. I'll be so happy if they get the Henderson location... *praying*

Q4Y5-hiBQItf0ukmnLTm4w.text: Everything was absolutely amazing!!! Service on point the bussers the servers and even the hostess. We never had to wait for a thing and the food was authentic and big portions!! This was our first time here and we will definitely be back :)

yHxUagM7C_kapX6QCh_k9A.text: Im originally from El Paso TX and therefore very picky when it comes to mexican food! I have grew up with Juan at another place he used to work at in town for at least 10 yrs and when I found out he had his own restaurant we now come here on a weekly basis instead of the old place I went to for years. It is the BEST mexican food in Las Vegas and the service is AWESOME!! Ernand is my go to waiter but the others are nice as well!! Love the fajitas the enchiladas the free soup and chips and salsa they serve with every meal and they also have other variety of salsas as well if u like more spice I love the habanero! My whole family goes here from mom dad sisters and husband and kids all love it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas soooo good

Sem_FvwiMIL6KMeXW5UKAA.text: I've been here many many many many times and it's REALLY great food but I warn you, don't sit at the bar. The bartender who's name is "Juan" (not the owner) can't multitask to save his life. I waited 15 minutes and he never even acknowledged me or said hi or anything at all. There were only two people at the bar and I was one of them. He just stood back there making drinks pretty much staring straight down not caring about anything else. I asked to be moved into the restaurant because of terrible service in the bar and then on the restaurant side my order was taken immediately by my waiter as it always is on my visits. Customer service goes a very long way in my book and unfortunately that guy has none. They might want to tell him to step his game up or get rid of him.  UPDATE: I was served again by that same bartender last week and he was on point and very helpful, so maybe the first day he was just having an off day.

MF-nBd9wOVtnTgJpVu-exA.text: Went here on date night with hubby.   It was so good.  I would give it five stars if it were not for these minor reasons: the floor is dangerously slippery, do not wear heels. I had the steak enchiladas,  hubby had steak and shrimp fajitas - his steak was better quality than in my enchiladas.... i am looking forward to returning.

pyesNJ-DouKWGjVW9uxlQQ.text: The food was pretty good. I had the steak fajita lunch special. Would come again.   As mentioned in other reviews the bean dip and salsa is complimentary. Salsa was very good. Bean dip was good but bonito michocan has cheese on theirs so it's a lose here for me.   I like them at for lunch the drink was only 1.50 instead of 2.50 which was a nice surprise.  Overall service was good. Will be back to try the carne asada instead of the fajitas

7RFJQkEenKlthCPGs8vYCQ.text: The service was great! We came for a birthday party good size group and they were fast and very helpful!

VwNeS9ULWBN9EMF9IBH5gw.text: The best Mexican place in Vegas, bar none! Love the variety of salsas and the sopapillas!

XK-OV8qt2xzo_koRBWTekA.text: wow,wow! that was amazing! the food,and a service was excellent!  if i could give them 10 stars!  and i am a very picky eater. i  wish all the employee a wonderful 4th of july celabration they deserved that. our server was melissa. she did awsome job. i hope the keep the master cook! thanks for the great experience!  my friend recommended this place. we were there last night.

u_JyozsT4GrnaoZYuvOPSA.text: Love this place. Great fajitas and margaritas. The service is always good, whether we have a party of two or twenty. Highly recommend.

mrFPA4IYuN5f2bzfDV_dHA.text: 5 stars for food & service! We have been coming here for many years and can't speak highly enough to the quality and freshness of the food and attentive staff. A family favorite where we bring out of town guests often! Way to go Juan.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch fajita special-only &amp;10.95!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican on eke brunch-delicious.

PCKigoCKMBFfUwexVtuK6g.text: This is my favorite mexican food in town. A shout out to Sebastian on great service! I had the street tacos tonight and they didn't disappoint.

3Fl_6sOW6LpJYgYLpERH8A.text: My husband and I are very picky when it comes to Mexican food and we decided to try out this place based on the reviews on Yelp as we just moved to Las Vegas. The service here is great and the food is fantastic! We eat here pretty much once a week. The fajita combo is awesome and I love the grilled onions. The salsa is very fresh and has a nice heat to it. Our toddler loves to eat here too and will eat the soup they bring out until the bowl is dry....which says a lot since he is a very picky eater!! You won't be disappointed.

L0SarmeibKxKvSTn-b5FZg.text: No 10 Star rating??  OMG- this is the best of Vegas!!! No reason to not be satisfied- Juan is almost always there and wants to hear your compliments/gripes. Been eating Mex. every Friday for 18 yrs. all over the world!! This rates top of world rankings as we eat Mex. no matter where we are!!!

OM8zUt_gktGNHA87swZzRQ.text: Juan's Flaming Fajitas is my absolute favorite place to eat.  The food, service and casual atmosphere are AMAZING!   No matter how busy they are, they consistently deliver the same level of attentiveness and food quality making this a great place to dine or bring your friends!

2KfFJYo8Erdz84lmDQw0CA.text: My family and I moved out here from Southern California recently and have been trying to find a good Mexican restaurant. So far nothing has blown us away, until now. Service, food, drinks are all top notch at Juan's. From the salsa, bean dip, and fried onions/jalapenos they bring before the meal to the great enchiladas, Juan's is hands down the best Mexican food in Vegas!

qlmeZb7uQfQVf-nthsZncA.text: My husband and I came here for lunch on New Year's Day. Everything was delicious; from the complimentary bean dip, chips and salsa to my amazingly good ( and $9.99!) steak fajitas to my hubby's 3-item combo plate of carne asada, carnitas tacos and cheese enchilada ($10!). Our guacamole was delicious.  I love this place!

D5MZr42iSNX0onf9ZgqDVw.text: We have been going to Juan's ever since they first opened and I can honestly say that both the food and service has remained excellent every time we've gone.  The atmosphere is clean, casual and open.  The staff are very attentive and friendly.  A lot of the staff are previous employees of Viva Mercado.  Our usual waiter, Hernan, is awesome and has great recommendations.  The grilled fish tacos and steak fajitas are excellent.  The fish tacos are not fishy at all and has a great charred flavor along with a generous portion of fish.  The steak is very tender and seasoned well, unlike some places where the steak is chewy and tough.  Overall this is our favorite place to go for great Mexican food.  Highly recommended. If you have a large party make sure to make a reservation because it gets pretty crowded at dinnertime.

2_3_CChJVy2aXc1V93W9nA.text: This is one of my favorite places for Mexican food in Las Vegas. I love the bean dip and the queso fundido with chorizo is phenomenal. I always order the same thing which is a combo of a beef burrito and chicken taco. The burrito is flavorful and juicy. The chicken in the taco varies a little each time though and can either be juicy or quite dry, but when it is dry I just put salsa on it and it is fine. The staff is always super friendly and quick.   I've seen at least two other restaurants fail in this location, but Juan's seems to know what they are doing because it is usually pretty packed.  I am giving it four stars rather than five because the drinks are very inconsistent. Sometimes the apocalypse drink tastes great and other times it has so much alcohol I can't even drink it.

hMXhrAA5OGw3-Esce_1_Cg.text: This may be the best Mexican restaurant I've ever visited. The food is delicious and the service is amazing. Our waiter, Omar, made great suggestions and took plenty of time helping us pick out entrees since it was our first time there. Will definitely be back soon

Yro6wXw6W8UflbUCv6oaAQ.text: We have been traveling across America and hands down the best Mexican we have had in any state. Sorry Texas. Great Mexican food. Outstanding service from the moment we entered, until the time we left. Will return again some day.

mtPpqcmuG5CQqLNlZ11giw.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere, delicious food and great staff! Come here a lot and always have a great time! Would recommend in a heart beat!

xNmpA1UnQkfFQOd0r6lCog.text: Juan's is bomb! Took what I loved from viva Mercados and made it better! Love sittin at the bar with the bartenders whom my wife and I love! Of course fajitas are killer .... pork and beef add mushrooms and poblanos instead of bells frickin delish!!! My fave tho is the relleno!!!!!! Always have the right game on tv with sound on is such a plus for me! Haven't won anything yet but still have had some great times there! Top notch service from everyone super clean building and the food.... well you just have to go there for yourselves.... Wait don't.... you are just taking up our spaces!!!

bDdo_qK1VJdlkDfurJ3WyA.text: Wow,  first the grilled onions and chili's served with the chips as well as the refried beans made just sitting down awesome.  Then we got with our meal the Sopa soup,  excellent and unexpected at lunch,  but it is what they do.  Now on to the Fajitas,  beef and steak combo for two: they were great.  Beef and chicken was tender and tasty.  A must try. .

MZ97mqDtYFXOxP5-pulbgw.text: Hard to walk into a place called Juan's Flaming Fajitas without ordering the fajitas. They're the tits.

vBC42Io11hRfjzIhAseicQ.text: Wow!  I would give 6 stars to Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina if I could. Thank you Yelp..never would have found them without you!  Best experience in any restaurant EVER no matter the cost, country or nationality!  From the moment we walked in at 3:15 in the afternoon we were treated like long time customers (that tip very good) It was truly amazing.  The hostess girl at the front desk was so sweet and so nice and our server super nice, helpful and FAST... my only caveat is to be careful with the roasted peppers that come with the chips and salsa...Very HOT! Whew! but I recovered fast...  We arrived in time for happy hour and were happy to see red wine for $4.50 a glass and decided to do 4 different happy hour treats from the special menu.  We do this from time to time at different restaurants as we eat our dinner early so we don't go to bed with a full stomach.  When the food came we were shocked at the size of the portions! they were huge and each came with very generous portions of avocado and sour cream.  We had the fajita nachos and fajita quesadillas, shrimp cerviche and something else I don't recall.  Every thing was delicious and full of meat.  The cerviche was delicious, cool, refreshing and with lots of shrimp and avocado in it.  The red wine was tasty and everyone (including both the manager and the hostess) came by to see if everything was OK, at which time we gave them a total thumbs up!  We ended up packing up enough for us to have a light lunch in a day or two.  I can't recommend this place highly enough.  Excellent experience!

pQhgBvi-U0tppF97CTuUHg.text: This is a full five star restaurant. The service is as good as it can be and the food is always on the level. This place really goes out of its way to put that little extra something on the plate. Whoever doesn't like Juan's just simply doesn't know good Mexican food. I have been eating here from the day it opened and I'm not going to stop anytime soon. Thanks to all the staff at Juan's ill be back soon as usual. Highly recommend the breakfast burritos and the chimichangas !!!!

f8gwnPs7Z95YAZ930Amgwg.text: I don't understand how this place got the reviews it did, maybe friends and family. It's just another below average mexican restaurant. Same old beans covered with jack cheese, converted rice cooked with tomato paste and canned salsa. The tamales had little filling and the masa wasn't cooked. Look I'm not gonna criticize everything. If your idea of mexican food is cheap canned product covered with cheese and "red or green" sauce this is the ideal place.

Hx9Ubi_MstlZKaqxJLIaFQ.text: The service is off the charts.  Always friendly, attentive, never pushy.  Food is good, prices are very reasonable (especially compared with Lindo).  I don't know any place where you can get lunch fajitas for less than ten bucks.  Seems word has gotten out as well, it's getting more crowded as we visit more (which is great).  I hope they do really well.

b9MsD3cQXJfFk4_ZUjVJHw.text: First time in here and well worth the drive from the other side of town. I love Mercados when we're there for soccer games and will have to rethink as the chicken enchiladas were fantastic in the red sauce. Service was excellent and even the manager Juan stopped after walking by hearing us say the food smelled so amazing!  I hope they open another one in Henderson otherwise we'll just make the drive!

uqynyac4RUe46mVazSR6Zw.text: My husband and I went here a couple of days ago. The Cadillac Margaritas were marvelous, the salsa, bean dip, grilled onions and chips were awesome and the fajitas were flaming!! Pair that with awesome service...two thumbs up!! We will be back when we are in town for the NFR!!!

EWfmF3talXPOul16Jv48HQ.text: My wife and I have a timeshare just up around the corner and in looking for someplace close we stumbled onto this gem. We went their for lunch and we will definitely be back. The service was courteous, pleasant, and attentive. The food was absolutely wonderful. Their chips, salsa, and bean dip are a great starter.

vKsy5JxPG9IuttVp68bY9Q.text: Ambiance was great.  Service was phenomenal!!  Very attentive with chips and salsa and drinks.  Loved the food.  Might want to make reservations it's a popular place.  They said wait time was 30 but only waited 15.

0rzYt7_6j5BHLDNDRDin-A.text: The food is always really really good. I have become very happy with their fajitas. My office orders for pick up quite often, and every time we order, something gets forgotten. This time it was the tortillas, which kind of ruins the fajita for me. But regardless the food is still great. I would just suggest dining in or triple checking your order if its for pick up.

vrwmCGqcXHlFtpqBbKPNIA.text: Excellent food & great service! Very authentic & delicious Mexican food! Omar the waiter was very good and Patty the bus person was outstanding!

0tMb9prQw7jNRuz0gnYgMA.text: Don't think twice...You have to try this place! We visited this restaurant last night for dinner and was floored by service, food, and overall atmosphere. The quality of food was excellent. The staff and service were wonderful. We will return for sure!

yhGTHBOl7cwpDnUoHovwPA.text: Our new favorite place ever. Had the steak fajitas could not have been more tender and delicious  exceeded all expectations.

zfPjhZ93-ojhaONMGjFpDg.text: I had almost given up on finding a good Mexican restaurant in Vegas until I stumbled upon this amazing place!  First we were given delicious basket of chips, salsa and beans before ordering. We ordered the fajitas and it came with a ridiculous amount of yummy sides. The roasted jalapenos were out of this world and so was the fideo soup that came with the entree.  You have to check this place out! Best Mexican food in Vegas.

PG6jAeOjX20IyFjGwwPk1g.text: Not sure what to think about this place. Not so friendly server, wrong food was brought out and stale 4 day old chips.... The enchilada I ordered was not an enchilada it was tortilla with melted cheese Maybe it will be a better place next time..

zzbIaqVhyoPXTo8RZPC9SA.text: Great service, great tasting food, and nice atmosphere. Wasn't too loud and the servers were very attentive.

yU4uWkBwmqS3pBBsoNULXQ.text: Great margaritas. Fabulous table side guacamole and fajitas and fried ice cream. Wonderful dinner experience.

lstn7KGFbeko2mVAewDxIA.text: The fajitas for two combo is awesome. It's so worth the price because you get sooooo full, plus get to take some home. Best part is that the food tastes authentic.

ZaTF2kWBqhXZiiHLGy8y_g.text: Wow!  We were going to hit "In N Out" while waiting on an oil change ,,,,, we saw this place and ditched the burger idea. Glad we did!  We ordered Taquitos ( i'm not really too hungry, my sweety says)  and I ordered Rancheria Tacos. With a margarita, and a cervesa. Quick and friendly service.  Chips were brought to the table, with salsa, bean dip, and grilled onions with jalapenos! Very tasty salsa and bean dip - and we massacred the onions , jalapenos :-) The taquitos - a massive serving, with guacamole, chopped lettuce and queso. Sour Cream, too. The Rancheria Tacos were huge, too. Same garnish as the taquitos ,,, so friggin'  tasty, awesome!  I don't precisely know what we expected, probably more mex food mediocrity, which is common, but "Flaming Fajitas" really exceeded all expectations for us both. We will be returning. The prices are very fair, the food was definitely a cut above, service was great, and the drinks were ice cold. Recommended. We'll be coming back here for sure!

nBkQZ6VE0BsL0p38QUrKVQ.text: We have had dinner here several times and have had a great meal each time!  The food, service, and atmosphere are all great!  This is way better than anything you'll get on the strip, so if you are looking to venture off-strip, this is a fantastic place to go!  We will be back again the next time we are in Vegas!

Tawr8pGXWs48uAE4GZrPtQ.text: I've been looking for a good place for some Mexican food and this place is it! The service is exceptional! The food is delicious and the salsa, beans and chips they give you is absolute awesomeness! Best part is, the servers are very attentive and never let you feel that anything is lacking. Overall, love this place. Good food, good service and great prices. What more can you ask for?

vGmr5tIjONFHzE_PRgsrvw.text: The food is decent, portions are adequate for the price paid and the happy hour was a good value.

QZyXDJmTGhk-iSb7DIF79A.text: The food was pretty good. What was exciting was their fajitas! Lighting them on fire was an excellent touch. Been there a few times already.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas

8XJjvX_SONgblGwHLYbcbQ.text: Great Mexican food and very affordable. There Fideo soup is the best ever. Service is always very good. Waiters, bus boys, hostesses always friendly. They seem to care about their job and enjoy their work.

SWjfs0ACYDEilxaUllSIHA.text: This is a wonderful local spot to have great food, I do have an advantage since it's in the same complex as my job and I get to have it more often then most.   My husband I get to go and have lunch there all the time and the service is great the food is always consistently good and the salsa is to die for.   I recommend this place for great food....hope they get some authentic singers in there soon, then I'll be there even more!!!!

M19pIy2fNbAFYCIlr325xg.text: This place is awesome!! The food is amazing. I recommend the steak with rajas and the shrimp fajitas. Drinks are nice and strong. Save room for some sopapillas at the end!!! Omar was our excellent server!!!

tgo5cZwU0f9o9M5mV4oEtA.text: Very attentive staff, even during a busy dinner service. Great margaritas. Great happy hour. I will come back again. The digital come flaming. I strongly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Miguel&#39;s Margaritas.

6BvdEZ_XPcb6QB5Q3cyc-A.text: Juan's food is good the restaurant management is not. We know the place is busy so called ahead to see if there was a wait. Told no wait to come on over which we did. Different story when we got there 20 minute wait. The bar has always been first come first serve so I found a seat in the bar the girl at the desk chased me down and rudely said that we had to be on the list for the bar. We left and will never go back.

Cd_llt_mpbypCyTbSutycg.text: My family and I always come to this restaurant for holidays and for birthdays! You won't find any food closer to authentic than this place! The portion sizes are generous, the staff is polite and welcoming, and it has an amazing aura! I HIGHLY recommend their delicious ground beef tacos, those ALWAYS fill me up! But be sure to call ahead of time to check the wait time, as they can get quite crowded on certain days! It sucks that we moved further away from this place, what used to be down the street is now a 15 min drive on the freeway, but it is worth it for the delicious food! And finally, don't miss dessert! Get a churro, you won't regret it!

1rH9lhAUZw2NbLUE75pa6w.text: Food was pretty good, but don't expect a good service here. Everyone was very nice except for servers! What the heck!!!

eSJWKKEpY5cXIN-AFvXAWg.text: Favorite restaurant! Only issue I came across was that I had the $5 off coupon from here and our server had said she will apply it to our check and said I needed to hit "use it now" so she could redeem it. When we got our check, she never took it off but it was too late because she had already ran our card. It's not a huge deal but a discount is a discount which is always cool. Other than that, food was fantastic! Sopapillas are a must!!!

YpEP7sJzCSw-vxjJC8mjXw.text: Pretty good... smelled actual food cooking when i walked in. Several people were near me immediately in a chill way. There to help me get what i wanted to go... my first time after giving up on what i like in mexican food... roasted peppers... bean dip with some nice spices to set it apart from pasty a-- beans.  Portions were enough for me and my and partner but we finished everything  and will be back.  Worth whatever it was.  Reasonable for sure on price.  My place for local fajitas or maybe something else next time.  Great food

vYzBHdBkIah8nTe2-sCx1A.text: What a fantastic hidden gem in downtown Henderson! The festive music greets you when you walk in. Several employees greet you. It was crowded on a Sunday but we were seated immediately. They took our drink order and brought hot, fresh tortilla chips to the table, along with a plate of grilled onions and grilled peppers, and several fantastic dipping sauces and bean dip. Our chips and drinks were refilled before we had to ask.  A delicious soup was brought to each of us before our entrees. The entrees were excellent, although after seeing the presentation of the flaming fajitas I was wishing I had ordered them. The service was impeccable. Such a fun atmosphere. Can't wait to go back again

09qyxzo_vo8eDAvqbWmafw.text: This place is awesome!!  30 minutes till closing and there were still accepting Patrons to sit and have dinner!!  Most businesses would've stop taking incoming patrons before their closing time...high five!!  Then, I was WOWed at how fast they took our orders and brought the food to the table!  And, the portions are pretty good for the price too.   You must check this place out guys!!!

80qdIcvBt99389abbhFO6g.text: Awesome Food and excellent service definitely the go to spot for Mexican good but be prepared for a wait as everyone wants to eat here

gkARQMxgpgYCu4bQ00tYjQ.text: Okay so I really liked this place because it's super group/family friendly, and they're very attentive. Service was great, and appetizer replenishing was on point! They really know how to put on a show with their food:) Recommend: sizzling fajitas, the veggie burrito, and the anejo is awesome. That bean dip at the start is also just perfection/addictive.  The only reason I gave 4 stars is because it isn't the most beautiful of places, just average. But it is still excellent Mexican food and service. and I would totally go back Tip: checkout happy hour times and try to always get reservations since they're always so busy

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and shrimp fajitas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and shrimp fajita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajita

FzxUh7xtfZJ4umcEoG7vPQ.text: Food is mostly good and pricing is fair for what you get. The only downside is service is slow and forgetful. We do go occasionally because it's close to the house however don't go out of the way to stop in.

priHjZxRjnwEVrZC8N_Bvw.text: Second time to be back here. It was busy. I was given a 35-40 minute wait time. They took my phone number so they can text me. I can even check my place online. We got called at the 25 minute mark. For the record, I don't like fajitas that much. I like the smell of the sizzling meat on the hot plate, but I don't really eat it. Like I love the smell of coffee, but I don't drink it. But I digress. We ordered a fajita for two with steak and shrimp and nopales (cactus leaf). Hubby, daughter and I split the meal. The steak had a good marinade. And unlike most fajitas I've seen, the meat was thinly sliced. It's not cut into strips. Those get dry easy. The dish came with all the fixings. There were so much food there was a ton of leftovers for my lunch tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream. The ice cream i think was either dulce de leche or cinnamon.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Taquitos. It came with three, cut in half. I already ate one when I took this photo
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, steak and nopales fajita with melted cheese

iWtVczsgnVY4YdPDhljmKQ.text: Not only is the food amazing but noticeably amazing, very attentive staff on each visit I have made to this establishment.  Definitely one of my top 10 choices to dine when visiting Vegas!

ih5l5-eKaUL7hfHJkY87VA.text: Okay. I'm a Vegas local and it took me this long to hear about this place. I was recently recommended and was shocked at the good reviews and how I never heard of this place before! Came here on a Saturday night and boy, it was packed! The wait for 2 was about 20 minutes. We walked out for 10 minutes and came back. We started realizing many groups who got here after us got seated. Roughly about a total of 30 minutes I checked with the hostess and realized our name was called way long ago (when we stepped outside in the first 10 minutes of putting our name down). The hostess quickly apologized and sat us down immediately.   The vibe is so cool, almost like you're in little Mexico! You get complimentary chips & dip, grilled peppers/onions and soup. We ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas for 2 which was way more than enough for 2 people! Everything was so fresh and delicious! Totally worth the hype.   I cannot wait to come back! This place is also great for kids and big groups of families!

seZdTf_867Ce40lktEhMQw.text: Great food at a good price. Came here for lunch based off of yelp reviews and was not disappointment. Staff was very friendly and attentive throughout the whole experience. Chips/salsa/bean dips are provided while waiting for your food. I ordered the steak fajitas off the lunch menu $10.99 and it kept me full throughout the day. I was so full I skipped dinner that night. Food was fresh, delicious, and excellent. Definitely recommend trying this place. I don't know how busy this place gets for dinner or if dinner prices are higher, but I had a great lunch here and will definitely be back.

v1NxqwkwpGaislOJQOTxvg.text: This was our first experience at Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina and we were most impressed. The atmosphere and food was authentic and the service was impeccable. We can't wait to come back! Thank you!

XVcxmKYzX8JCO_NMNykxqg.text: It's been too long since I've had a flaming fajita.   Portions are very generous, prices are fair, and nice atmosphere.   I always get the steak fajitas for two and split it with the wife.   Super tasty.   Don't need to go into much detail but everything is flavorful and they give you chips with bean dip and salsa when you get to the table.  Plus they re-fill them no questions asked.    With the meal they give you a generous helping of beans, rice, guac, sour cream and cheese.   They light your fajitas up when they get to your table.   The 5 foot flame that come from it gives you a quality wake up before it's time to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guac, sour cream and pico.   But you already knew that.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice and beans with the fajitas for 2!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajitas for two.  Damn it&#39;s good.  And a solid amount of food.  Now I&#39;m hungry.

Qm9j-aeoEhMEazCpDk09Hw.text: Juans Flaming Fajitas was just ok for me.  Typical long wait on a Saturday for a known good restaurant. 45 mins- 1hr.  Hostesses were friendly.  Our waiter Omar was EXCELLENT!! He took care of our table with exceptional sevice. He was on top of everything. He checked on us regularly to see if we needed anything else , asking how are meal was and we never had to worry about our drinks being refilled. Service with a smile, professional, and extremely efficient. 5 stars for Omar.  The live music by the gentleman playing guitar was awesome!! We really enjoyed that. :)  Restaurant a bit too smokey for me. Yes, it's because of ALL of the flaming fajitas. Hence the name "Juans Flaming Fajitas" I know.  I smelled like mexican food the whole way home. If I come back, I will request the outdoor seating if it's available. ;)  Unfortunately, the food was too salty for my liking. The soup and my steamed veggies were packed with sodium I'm certain. I was unable to finish either. :(   Fajitas sadly the same. Too much salt. MY goodness! My suggestion- I would have liked the option to salt my food myself, if at all.   Ambiance was ok,  service was fantastic, dinner was clearly a miss, dessert  (fried ice cream)  was a hit though. That's how I arrived at my solid 3 star rating.  Alot of great things about this restaurant on Yelp. Based on service I would recommend. Definitely give it a try. You can decide. When you do, maybe leave a review. :)

TwfqqMRzIXQcZDVyzEtZlQ.text: Las Vegas, NV.  Can I tell you. I'm from Los Angeles county. Yes,  I do know what good Mexican food tastes like. This restaurant exceeded all expectations.  The food here I found to be authentic . This place was clean, it also had a great traditional feel to it. I ordered a chicken plate. Oh, it had great flavor. It was a  subtle  flavor. So good !Can I also tell you, fresh  tortillas are made here. Wow , I can't wait to return.
