T7QzkNXX6y1UH99fybrKdQ.text: LOOOOOOOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this restaurant!! Best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas! The food is so delicious and the portions are nice and big. Enough to share or take to go if you don't eat a lot. They have really good happy hour also. The service is perfect and your glass is never empty.. everyone works together to make sure the customers are taken care of. We had Jovanni as our waiter and he was really nice. He gave us tons of suggestions of food to try and had a great personality!!  Many friends of mine go here too and they love it. You won't be disappointed!!

HuGayZdZq4QLkiWexKvI3A.text: Not sure what all the fuss is about. Mediocre at best. Food was bland. Beans need salt. Rice is tasteless. Beef needs seasoning. Chili rellenos taste baked, not deep fried and are soft and bland. The best part of the meal is the chips and salsa, served with two salsas and (bland) retried beans and a plate of fried peppers and onions. Americanized Mexican food....

qSgzKxb8FbB89hsJ94KWQA.text: I never had a bad meal here. From the awesome complimentary chips and dip to the tasty tacos, burritos, and fajitas you can't go wrong with any selection. I also found the spicy margarita that I have been searching for after tasting it in Texas. Finally, the customer service is amazing. Oswald and another manager I believe (don't remember his name but he was Mexican with a little southern thing going on, from Oklahoma he said  both were professionals and friendly, I just found my favorite neighborhood restaurant

N9ROmavA7pRlJN4yTE-WOg.text: By far the best Mexican food we have had in Las Vegas. The fideo soup was loaded with flavor and so we're the salsas. We ordered the lunch combinations so we could try a variety and we were not disappointed by any of them. The service was impeccable, we will definitely be back soon.

EYkqdi3Y1UST-eH_tC3Ifg.text: Pro's- Service was good.  A couple of the salsa's were good.  Prices not too bad. The soup with the noodle sticks was very good.  Con's All of the food  besides the soup was bland.  All of the proteins were dry and overcooked. Chicken, Pork, Carne Asada all overcooked and bland.  Everything on the fajita serving platter had a burnt taste after about 5 minutes.  Evident that many of the items were not made in house.   If your by the airport try El Fresco's Cocina Mexicana. The best Mexican food I have ever tried.

gZJndU0JDuCtYYCH2jWM9A.text: FIRST TIMER!!  First impression, kind of quiet, but maybe we got here right before the rush? No complaints here! This was also a Monday night.   Very low key restaurant ambience.  Great food, actually it was so much food we could have only ordered one entree!   The chips and dip were amazing!! I could eat these every day!  We also ordered the chicken taquitos appetizer, these were okay.   Then we ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas for two! Lots and lots of food!! Actually too much!   This is definitely a place I will return to!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and shrimp fajitas for TWO!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and shrimp fajitas

jpgVJMLW0enwJVHIQtezoQ.text: This place never disappoints! Love getting their tacos and enchiladas. During the times I ordered take out, they packed some complimentary chips and salsa and even some tomato soup.

t4PURjUbf4s0k78b6ErTcg.text: This was my first visit, We wanted Mexican food so started looking around for someplace we have not tried before. Most of what we found where counter style places but this one stood out, so we decided to give it a try.     Its off on the west side so people from the strip over have to travel a bit but let me tell you ts worth it. They share a parking lot with some other businesses that are not open at night so plenty of parking. Oh did I mentioned its next to an In and Out?      The restaurant has to seating areas the bar and the main dinning. The bar looks a little dark compared to the main dinning but looked inviting also. We sat in the main area, let me tell you its a bit of show with flames shooting up from almost every direction.. They ignite the fajitas table side with a nice shot of tequila.  I myself have not tried them but they look fantastic  and smell wonderful.      The menu has lots of options and will cover just about any ones taste.  They start you off with chips beans and 2 salsas, one green ( which I preferred ) and one red (this on was a bit bitter to me ). But both tasty.       The staff is very efficient we did not have to ask for a thing. they kept us filled on chips and drinks and food was done in a timely manner and served very hot. The staff continued to check on us to make sure everything was on par. The food was fantastic, good flavor and you can tell not bag and box seasoning. Portion where large we had enough for a second meal at home the next day.     Juan's has become part of my top five in Las Vegas closer to the top of that list. I can say with confidence I will be back many times in the near future.         If you get a chance to be in the area of Juan's I highly recommend you pay them a visit.. you wont be disapointed

Sx9Gbyqh5U-WExUvQ9m18g.text: This was our first time at Juans Flaming Fajitas & Cantina in Las Vegas. We had the Carnitas and the Chicken fajitas. Both were excellent. The carnitas were made in the traditional way. The table side flaming fajitas were tender and well prepared. Our server Christian was very attentive. The prices were very reasonable. They also have $4.00 margaritas on Wednesdays. Overall  a great place for lunch or dinner.

RuCvpVOsvFaeHAar5SoHWA.text: When I want to see something get lit on fire, that I can put in my mouth, I come here. The fajitas are so worth the place being named after.   Great food, on point service, and all around fun spot to hang out at. If you don't believe me, come try finding a spot at the bar. People love it so much they don't mind the little wait.   Speaking of the bar and the post of homeboy jumping on top of it like he's at a restaurant's pay place. Juan's has very responsible bartenders and as soon as he started getting loud, they let him know, cut him off,  and gave him a chance to stick around. The man didn't know his limits or how to act. For that, he was quickly removed.

yhATyFqz4UVQjB3M5Fgwfg.text: Last night was the first time to visit the restaurant.  Party of 8, wait time for a table wasn't bad, about 20 minutes or so.  The problem came after we were seated.  The service was slow at best, and it took about an hour before our food arrived.  They did keep the chips full so it didn't seem horrible.   Today, we can't seem to get rid of the flaming fajita smell!  It's all over our sweatshirts and jackets and has even defeated a good spray with febreeze!  I thought maybe it was just me, but my son, who lives in his own home, says he has smelled like Mexican food all day.  I think I'll stick with Mi Casa Grill Cantina at Silverton Casino.

Th4T8I4xtpkzitcsGH46wg.text: Amazing food! Great speedy service! Always had drink refilled. EVEN REFILLED BEAN DIP! Chips were crispy and warm. Soup had too many veggies , could use some more noodles . Great atmosphere: was greeted and waited upon as soon as I got out of car. Horchata could use more sweetness, but still good. Chips came with free fajitas! Owner greeted us as well! My girlfriend like their salsa. HAd a burrito with green sauce ! OMG too good!  My girl had a mojo de ajo which was even better ! Fresh guacamole , delicious fried ice cream with plenty of whipped cream ! Even the rice and beans were delicious! Everything was hot and fresh. People were nice , staff was even nicer. Got attended by Arturo. Ask for him! He is a great server. Calm and well mannered , and always brings you refills. Never leaves you dry , which is my favorite part about him. Love this place , love the food. Taste authentic , and that's what I was looking for.   Will definitely be back !

V4YERV4YuiWBuVgfc3S4XA.text: My husband and I have been here twice, once just the two of us and we sat at the bar, and once with our family. Both times the food was great! I would definitely recommend the fajitas! We have tried the chicken, steak, and shrimp, and they were all delicious. I love their chips and salsa and a margarita that costs less than $5! We have found our new favorite Mexican restaurant!

nkkdAqjezpB9L_RgtgN6gw.text: Food/Service AMAZING!!! The portions were huge and they even have a great Happy Hour too! We came in with 4min remaining and snagged a Steak Quesadilla for $3 and change! They bring warm chips, warm refried beans, salsa & roasted jalapeno and onions as you arrive.  A tomato based broth soup comes with your entree... So so good!!  Needless to say we will return!! We also had enough left over for dinner the next day.

n5NAyuoKdQ5yzxaPEDsxNQ.text: Unfortunately the experience wasn't what we expected... misquoted a wait time of 1 hour.  Waited with a six year old our grandmother and disabled nephew in a wheelchair.   The problem was the quoted wait time which became two hours.  We kept being reassured they were attempting to seat us.  It became an issue due to our 16 year old wheelchair bound nephew.   I asked politely a few times about the wait.  A female manager approached us and actually used the words they were ADA compliance.  Really!!!   I have never felt so discriminated against before.  We've eaten there many times and it's never been a concern.  Tell you what I'll never step foot in there again.  And to add insult a cheese Queso was supposed to make up for the discrepancy in the extra hour quoted time.   If I was approached after 40 minutes stating it would be longer than expected we would have made other meal choice!! There wasn't an apology after our meal or even 10 percent off the bill.    As the aunt of a child that was hit by a car and to not have the courtesy of an acknowledgement I now understand the unintentional discrimination.

lUZ60H1jtzicLHvyquQphQ.text: Delicious! The food here was wonderful, best enchiladas that I've had in a long time! Our waitress, Araceli and busser Ruben were very friendly, quick and attentive.

A818iZFK7mHQq-fXUKu31A.text: This place is just ok. 3 times we ordered for pick up and all three times food was incorrect.  I been to better places

Es7HU3qga1Onv3rSFNp7rw.text: This place is wonderful, I can't wait to go back, everything was great and fresh, it lived up to my friends bragging about it.

SkB3jQXj2q8vOp3S0dVnyg.text: Awesome service. Great Mexican Ambience. However, food is not my favorite. I would be back because service was really great, they do have amazing people that works there.

lCIL2_XYDNi0-VPwBCq6Kg.text: We love the flavors and the service here. So much better than Lindo Michoacan and Macayo restaurants.

0caMj8tx9n1q1K9MuEiPmw.text: Went back yesterday before we leave Vegas Had the chile relleno Wow, maybe the best item for us on the menu See everyone when we come back to Vegas  Keep those fajitas flaming!,, Good job, thanks

CbMTJxFUVYIQGAvIqXjBzw.text: The tableside guacamole is the bomb! The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was lively. This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant. You must try the Parrillada De Mariscos.  I might have been in a review funk when I wrote my first review of this place. I thought it was strange that it had so many great reviews when I just couldn't seem to see past mediocrity.  I am glad I gave the place another try. My previous experience is leaps and bounds different from today's experience.  As soon as we stepped into the restaurant, the owner greeted us. Our server Amanda was very knowledgeable about the food. She made our guacamole at the table to our liking (e.g., jalapenos, onions, cilantro, salt, pepper, tomatoes). She also waited for us to try the guacamole to ensure we were happy, which is part of my definition of exceptional service. The chips were fresh, light, and crispy. Together this was a great beginning to our meal.   Amanda then made some recommendations for entrees.  I love when servers take the time to make recommendations or ask if there are questions about the menu. All too often I get servers that approach the table and ask, "Are you ready to order?" or "Have we decided what were going to have?" as though they are in a rush and we are just a number. I definitely believe that good service involves finding out what your customers want - and then making recommendations that you personally know will make their experience a lasting one.   The Parrillada De Mariscos for two was her recommendation since we both felt like seafood with a Mexican flare. This is a sizzling fajita style fish platter with scallops, white fish, shrimp, onions, and whole roasted jalapenos.  I wasn't courageous enough to bite into a whole jalapeno, but the flavor seeped into the seafood adding just that right amount of temperature and flavor to the combination of seafood. Plus, some color on top of all that sizzling yummy seafood whiteness was definitely well needed.   The tortillas were offered in either flour or corn. We were able to watch the tortillas being made fresh in the corner of the restaurant. The restaurant also has flowers throughout in beautiful vases.   Dessert was heavenly fried ice cream. I have had Mexican fried ice cream before at other Mexican restaurants, but this was scrumptious. The corn flakes seemed to coat the French vanilla ice cream like a puzzle. Then it was lightly drizzled with chocolate sauce and topped with whipped cream - and yes, a maraschino cherry.  I will come visit again!

IuSLwHDI-nKeyCoqcMcb1Q.text: I heard a lot about this place and was excited to try it. Disappointed- by the experience and food. It was very crowded! The fajitas were not anything special. It was fun to see the flame but other than that nothing to talk about. I will not go back.

7f-PUNgFYbEQdtHtNJD7MQ.text: This food was sooooooooo good!!!! My family and I was here from Atlanta over the Christmas weekend and was craving some authentic Mexican food and didn't want to go to a restaurant on the Vegas Strip... This was the place.....service, food, and drinks was amazing.  I definitely will be back on my next trip to Vegas.

Vrk6zwiTbTYl7ea2kUBX8Q.text: Seriously exceptional food and service! They were so worth the visit! We decided to drive out a little to avoid the crowds on the strip, so glad we did. They had great customer service from the start, super attentive and nice. The food was really delicious. They also had live music. Such a great time. I'm pretty picky when it comes to Mexican food because I'm from SoCal but gotta say, this was very good.

brTnriMOnZy8mOjkajY1Pw.text: Incredible service, although they don't give you enough sour cream for the fajitas. Also, when they ignite the pan of meat and vegetables, they are unaware of their surroundings. If you get too close to the fire, don't be surprised if you go up in flames. The portion size of the fajitas is enough to feed a damn elephant. In summary, the service is fantastic, but before I return, I will need proof of solid improvement.

R0_yYBtXdF5TtYUkq042cQ.text: Great portions ! Food is delicious and very flavorful.    Environment is cozy to me with lots of tv's giving it that sports mexican bar theme going.  Family friendly, and they have plenty of boothes(for parents).  The team is very attentive and on point.  Didn't have to ask for one refill and I drink a lot !! (Water)

gYuBRQQrDfGyTSryr89mhw.text: I've been here a few times and I absolutely love this place! Great Mexican food, customer service is great as well. This restaurant is clean!! Which is something I always pay attention to. The menu has more than enough to choose from, but I can't help but to order the fajitas!! They are a 10 in my book.

IyVncRt47Cg8t2yhVCy6vA.text: Always my go to place in Vegas!  Amazing food & amazing service!  The best Mexican food with great atmosphere!  The staff is always excellent!    Fajitas are a definite must!  The portions are pretty large so consider sharing an order and trying another dish on the menu...you will not be disappointed!    It's only a 15 minute drive from the strip but totally worth it!

cVNBe6OT_uTcYDBtKVsZMw.text: Here on vacation and looking for a place besides casino food. Found this place through yelp and saw all the positive reviews. This place was awesome! Great customer service, good food and reasonable prices. The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere was nice. I would recommend this location for Good Mexican food!

3fPzRTBaSIE_wahzSU9exA.text: The food was really great! Today.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  They have really good prices on lunch specials if you come in before 3 pm and the portions are good. Good place to bring the family. The salsa is extremely good. And good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chimichanga with cheddar cheese and fries! Delicious! Family had the steak and shrimp fajitas. The salsa is amazing.

steOo5DvMAXmxhN35byl6Q.text: This is 3.5 stars, but I decided just due to customer service the smiles etc that I am going to give them 4 stars.   The dips are great, the Fajitas are great, I have had nothing bad here.

aC94g2y6Fkmp0J7yBnwzBg.text: By far the best pozole I've ever had! This place rocks and they have great drink specials!

qtcLuOstnUTkT1pPxQaeXA.text: This customer service here is EXCELLENT. Being a hospitality student at UNLV, the service might be the best I've received in years. The food is awesome. We ordered steak fajitas, enchiladas, and queso dip. Steak fajitas was my favorite. Our server Sebastian was quick, attentive, and very friendly. Angel was also quick too! Always making sure our drinks/beers were filled as well as the chips & salsa. Nothing but great service and food over here! First time and will be returning. Hopefully every week!!!

AV6_Vcj0cMEXyrnhIxxntw.text: Memorable and best value Mexican food in Las Vegas.  My husband and I ordered steak and shrimp fajitas dinner for 2 people.  The flame is a nice touch.  Portion is big.  Service is good.

bqzxWvOku5nsCFy3VCblXw.text: Juan's is always fantastic.  They have lots of tasty dishes to choose from- even if you're vegetarian!

7jovbGcq_8o0N_BDhDry4w.text: Food is always consistently good. Love the chicken and bean burritos-ask to add the queso sauce on top. Mmmm. They have a great Happy Hour menu  3-7, oh you can't go wrong with the margaritas!!! Great bang for your buck! Service is superb.

jZXI_2ddJCCsls3RDQAooA.text: I'm not as big a Mexican food fan as I used to be, but going to eat at Juan's Flaming Fajita's has given something new to look forward to!  The chips and salsa are delicious starters before the meal.  Attentive service and not very long waits.  I really enjoyed their breakfast items!  I absolutely LOVE chorizo and their chorizo and egg dish is out of this world delicious!  The fact that they marinate and grill their steak right near your table when you order a steak dish is amazing!  Very well done!

pdndpVCtXz83xC5f7750VA.text: I've eaten here twice, and both times I've had the chicken fajitas. I loved them. The homemade salsa and chips are fantastic and difficult to stop shoving down your throat. Their guacamole is freshly made and quality. I'd have a chair with my name on it if I lived closer.

Y7GoBZHNiJuRi1Vz6IiAyg.text: This place is excellent. I never knew about this hole in the wall until family came into town. The service was phenomenal and the food was delicious.  The free chips and bean dip were made in house and you can clearly tell. We opted for the beef fajitas that they cooked at tableside.  I didn't expect it to have so much flavor and to be so juicy. It reminded me of backyard barbecues my sister had in L.A.  The tortillas and even the rice were so savory and hot.  I liked how attentive the staff was even though it was a full house and they still were able to tend to our party of 12.  This place knows how to really keep customers happy. We plan on going here with the local fams as well.

xW3lEgatYnJ9mMa9a0hYyw.text: Incredible service and food! If you didn't already know by the name "Jaun's flaming fajitas" the fajita table side sizzling and on fire. I was skeptical at first and thought they might be bitter and taste burnt but no that were cooked perfectly and tasted even better then that looked. Server  Arturo did an amazing job accommodating me and my guest and never let are drinks go empty. A must try family friendly Mexican restaurant.

FDOQqwJYhsIuvUs8cHlmXw.text: We really enjoy coming here. Our waitress (yes we come here often enough to have a favorite waitress), is always super sweet and provides personal and attentive service. Love the onions and jalapenos they provide with the chips and dip before your meal comes out. Be sure to get the guac and you've got the perfect appetizer.   I always order the carnitas (I'm boring) but everything my husband has tried has been really good. Portions are generous and the atmosphere is lively but still good for families too.   Only removing a star for the take-out situation. Trying to order over the phone is usually a disaster with either getting disconnected or not being able to hear to properly take our order. Once you arrive to pick it up though, they are always very nice & quick to get your order out the door.

owU_k9sLnmBrtG-Ej48J3A.text: I had high hopes for this restaurant based on the reviews and a personal recommendation.  We had beef and chicken entrees and both were overcooked.  The service was excellent and the staff were super friendly.

MDmfAi07sGCl6qn9imCWOg.text: My wife and I have been coming to Juan's ever since it opened a little over a year ago. We have always had great food and are so happy to have another really good Mexican restaurant close to home. We've taken many of our guests here as well and they have all enjoyed the food and the excellent service. Juan and his staff have always provided prompt, friendly service and work as a team. We usually go for lunch and most times opt for the "flaming fajitas" as they are our favorites.

AMpboq7fGE6UZz_6dUn4pA.text: Since I moved to Vegas, almost 3 years ago, I've been on the search of really good Mexican Restaurant. I've found a couple of good ones, including taco shops, but I still was searching for one like back home, San Diego,  CA. Today a co-worker texted me asking if I had plans for dinner.  When I didn't she suggested we get together and try out Juan's.  It had been highly recommended by a neighbor of her whose boyfriend is a chef.  So she figured, must be good! And it was really good.   I had the carne asada taco plate and the meat was cooked perfectly.   Just like back home at my one of my favorite restaurants.  While the tortillas were not made on site, they tasted close to it. The beans and rice were just like I like them. My friend had the fajitas and said they were also really good. Before you order, they bring the chips out with both salsa and beans.  I had never seen beans brought before with the chips, but it worked out really good. The service was perfect from the staff. No question, I will be back again and again!

GxliNXxxmgqg0baegg2C5A.text: My family and I regularly eat at Juan's Flaming Fajitas.  The food is great, my kids love to see the fire when they light up the fajitas!  We took my brother there last week and he wanted a shrimp burrito. It was not part of their menu, but they made him one anyway and he said it was GREAT!  They are very accommodating here and always friendly.

GiBQBV0xbs0Hcfe197vfUg.text: Best Mexican in food in Las Vegas.  Chile Colorado and tamales are awesome.

Bj5mscrKSrU6t5jw-5bc-g.text: We love this place! I'm so happy my fiance' and I found our favorite Mexican restaurant. After moving out here to Vegas, we have realized how many mediocre restaurants there are and we haven't been "wowed" with any place but this one. The service is fantastic and the staff is so friendly. The complimentary fideo soup is always good. We usually order the beef fajitas which are never disappointing! This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in Vegas!

4aCDnGPtjnUOEv4PPJiy4Q.text: This is must try restaurant I guarantee once you try it you will go back. Since the restaurant opened I have been there at least 6 times. This this is my new favorite Mexican restaurant and once you try it it will be your too. You have to try the Fajitas and the Margaritas are amazing. The service at Juan's Flaming Fajitas is second to none! I highly recommend them give them a try.

xWkjPggC__i6-gfctuaT5Q.text: Pretty good fajita place especially if you are in the mood for mexican food. Great deal on fajitas for two and they are delicious, the one thing I wish they would not have done is mixed our fajitas. My hubby and I ordered fajitas for two me shrimp and he pork and they brought the meat all mixed together well the only problem here is that I do not eat pork, beef or chicken. I'm not a total lunatic about it so I didn't complain but if someone was and they had ordered just veggie fajitas or if there was an allergy this would be a problem. I used to eat beef and chicken but hate pork and always have so um yea will just make sure to tell them not to next time and I just picked through it this time. Great guac, fresh ingredients and good service would take friends there.

Gjlkm5yLV_K1dS5TCzc-SQ.text: Great guacamole made table-side.  The soups are wonderful, so far i have tried the fideo and posole, both were outstanding.  I also had the special Margaritas and they were perfect.  We enjoyed the flaming fajitas and ended the evening with fried ice cream.  I can't say enough good about our new favorite.

Zl628cAkljmTDSF9RJ3CUA.text: We love this place food is great drinks are good service outstanding priced very reasonable we will return.

ntzrLGd9z1uG2ao0Q6BszQ.text: One of the best service experiences we have had.   The staff members were so friendly, courteous and attentive.   SO much food and everything we tried was very tasty and a great value.   It is now added to our favorite places to dine.

H3Bmyl9QaIwdljVkIapx9w.text: chips and salsa was amazing...I had the chicken fajitas, rice, and beans....it tasted fantastic and the portions were big!!!

Ar6_XW40--m7yV3bqpRfhg.text: Service was good.  Food was good.  We ordered the sampler for an appetizer.  It was plentiful; nachos, quesadilla, and 2 flautas.  Chips came with salsa and a bean dip.  Beans were good, but lukewarm.  We ordered, New Mexico platter, chicken enchilada, fajita salad, and flautas.   Fideo soup was brought to each of us.  It was mildly spicy, but tasty.   Server apparently misheard or scribbled, and fajitas were brought instead of flautas.  No apology was given and our diner felt pressured to keep the fajitas, which she graciously did.  Food was good, but not mind blowing.  We were still charged for the fajitas, which were more expensive than the flautas, even though it was their error.  Again, no attempt was made to rectify their mistake.  For this reason, and the fact that I found a long strand of hair in the salsa, I am giving Juan's 3 stars instead of 4.  I will go back, but I will have the waiter repeat our order next time.

WPGZEhDpJXY-M45aT0XOnw.text: awesom fajitas and service is outstanding staff is very freindly one of my new top favorite mexican eateries.

bKQnjiNuAQm1vcwtGXwp_g.text: I have eaten Mexican food extensively throughout the entire SW USA for many years.   Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina have the best Fajitas that I have ever eaten anywhere, bar none!   They bring the Fajitas to the table and then throw on a large shot of clear liquor which instantly burst into flames.   We get the Steak Fajitas and the meat is deliciously flavored, soft - not dry and hard as so often they are else where, and mouth watering!   Of course you get the Nachos served immediately with both a hot dip and a hot bean dip.   With the Fajitas for 2 you get a very tasty cup of soup and then a large platter with rice and beans which are delicious.   The decor is simple with an outside eating area offered as well.   The service is fantastic, attentive and always give you the feeling they really want you to enjoy your meal with them.   On our second visit, though not our waiter, the waiter who had served us the last time checked on us several times to insure we were enjoying ourselves.   He actually remembered us from our first visit.   You can tell the staff enjoys working together and insuring that each customer enjoys their visit with them.   It has become our number one place to take visitors to eat and they are always impressed with the quality, amount and taste of their food!

kvDmYfiLTCd7WEVJb0pUiA.text: We had been on the lookout for a place that served fajitas brought to your table still sizzling and thought we better give this place a try.  We are very pleased we did and found our new go to place for fajitas.  We ordered beef fajitas for two.  Chips, salsa were include, along with grilled peppers and onions.  The peppers and onions were a great treat and a nice touch that I had not had in other Mexican restaurants.  Fajitas were served tableside and flaming.  Nice Touch!  We were next in fajita heaven, could not have asked for better beef fajitas, nicely cooked, great flavor, tender beef.  Everything was very good; the soup that came with the meal, beans, rice, guacamole, and salsa.  The portion is big and had extra for take home for another meal.   The service was outstanding.  If you love sizzling fajitas, you need to pay this place a visit, as this was my first of many visits to come!   Thanks Yelpers for helping me find a new place that is great!

FEFEkMTdXwTNAZ0gGTJkRA.text: OMG!! you cannot find a single thing wrong with this place!! The service was phenomenal!! Quality great and the portion size?? HUUUGGGE! I  can't wait to go back..

6pGtlqaA_ACFuvzEXQsHsQ.text: Love the flame, but not the smell afterwards! The fajita's are flaming and entertaining, but leave your clothes at your front door before you go home. The gracious staff and delicious food are always a constant here. Be sure to try their queso and parrillada de mariscos!

gZfb1zCyLi24CIPs7kkivA.text: Left a review that they forgot the tortillas for our office takeout order and the management took care of it and offered a 15% off for the next visit when my boss orders for the next time.  The food is always prime though. The chicken fajitas is always so delicious. Hits the spot every time.

8Ww8GHkqcTP6TJF1oa4NJQ.text: Everyone treats u very nice .. Food is delicious.. Tortilla are . Well worth the price..

_rei3E3Xi7jE5pd495GDfw.text: Juan's has quickly become our favorite Mexican place!   I've been about 8 times now and it's always pleasant and yummy. Unfortunately, the word is out...it's busy! It's family friendly which means there's kids everywhere! So many, in fact, that they ran out of highchairs on our last visit. The good news is it's the perfect place for antsy noisy kids because they are at every table and no one would notice.   The happy hour specials are great! The ceviche is generous and tasty. The quesadilla is huge and packed with meat and cheese. The house margarita is meh but the fresh ones and skinny ones are very good! The sangria was ok; the flavor was too muddled.   Our last visit with yummy food, leftovers to take home, 3 full bellies and 3 cocktails was only $48. Can't beat that! There is a singing guitar mariachi that serenades your table and is great with the kiddos too. Fun!

9Y8GAvHHArsQtX60Jn9y9w.text: Love this place!!! Omar our waiter really went out off his way to make my friends Juanito birthday boy a Wonderfull time !!! Grasias a todos por tan burn servisio!!!

TnMMgtIclFfE02C9R6DpiA.text: First I would like to give you a short history on my relationship with Mexican food so that you can fully understand how genuine my review is.  I was born and raised for 17 years in Los Angeles, where I was treated with fantastic Mexican food on every corner.  I moved to Las Vegas and worked in construction for 10 years, surrounded by Mexicans and their wondrous food.  I learned to appreciate everything about authentic Mexican food as well as learn their language.  The problem, there was no good authentic Mexican food in Las Vegas.  I have tried almost every restaurant Las Vegas has to offer, and I can tell you now, after visiting Juan's almost 10 times, there is no question that Juan's is the best.  You are always greeted at the door with a smile.  If there is no wait, you are quickly seated and if you don't like the table, the host/hostess is more then willing to switch you to the table of your choice.  The bussers  are always quick to respond to your table with chips, salsa, bean dip, and a plate of sauteed jalapenos and onions.  The salsa is the closest to Los Angeles style restaurant salsa I have found in Vegas.  My wife caught me eating it with a spoon yesterday.  Yes, it is that good.  The bean dip is the best I have ever had.  I can't explain to you what that really means, just know that Mexican food is my absolute favorite and I love my bean dip.  My wife loves to take the onions, dump them in her bean dip and eat them with a chip.  The flavor is pretty mind blowing.  I prefer to take a jalapeno, and put it on every chip dipped in beans.  If you like spicy or jalapenos, give it a try.  Beware because they staff will continue to replace the bean dip and salsa and attempting not to stuff yourself on these delicacies is a difficult task.  Juan has 8 beers on tap.  8!  For a Mexican restaurant this is quite unique.  I have sampled the Dos Equis, Negro Modelo, Victoria, and my wife's Budlight.  The draft is always fresh and the prices are amazing.  Their happy hour runs from 3-7 every day throughout the entire restaurant.  A 22 oz fresh draft for $4.50 is hard to beat.  Every Mexican brew is served with a lime.  I am usually almost full by the time the entrees come around but I try to find a way to fit them in.  I have enjoyed every item on their vegetarian menu, their flaming fajitas, their carne asada, and all their entree's have been excellent.  Their flaming fajitas have a great presentation and the portion size is rather large.  There is one restaurant in Las Vegas that beats Juan's just in the Fajita category and that restaurant is called Leticia's.  The reason is because Leticia adds mushrooms and zucchini into her fajitas.  I had to find a solution for this because my wife is a Fajita snob and I didn't want to go to a restaurant that lacks in all other categories because their fajitas were "better" (according to my wife of course).  The solution was simple.  "Could we add mushrooms and zucchini to our fajitas?"  we asked.  "Of course" was the reply.  And so, our love affair with Juan's has continued and my wife gets the fajitas her way, every time, and they are excellent.  This restaurant is the best Mexican food that Las Vegas has to offer and I would put it up against any place in L.A, anytime.  To all my friends that haven't had a chance to partake in Juan's, make time, you are missing out on life.  P.S.  If the staff makes any slight mistake, which most restaurants would shrug off, you will be treated with free churros and whip cream.  Pray for a mistake because they rarely make one.

wfUUBOwHcQflJShEzkNo7A.text: This restaurant is all that we read it was! The fajitas were excellent with enough to take home for at least one more meal. Omar was a very, very good waiter. We never waited for anything, and he was very polite. Absolutely will return!

FD8lo4VmCEDjg525p4qEiA.text: We had steak and shrimp fajitas for two.  The shrimp was large and flavorful, the steak was tender and tasty.  Their were grilled onions and red and green bell peppers mixed in with the fajitas.  The server brought the fajitas to the table in this large cast iron pot and set them on fire at our table!    The servers were very attentive and by checking in at Yelp, we got a 15% discount off of our bill!  Our sever gave us a free flan just because I mentioned it was my first time there!  All in all, we had an enjoyable evening and we will definitely go back again!

E1ZU8SBB3DlMQNVxCfdw-Q.text: Was here for the second time while in town from Phoenix. Sat in the bar again and had Sebastian wait on us again. First of all the service from Sebastian is some of the best I have ever had both times I was here. The chips, beans, salsas and grilled veggies are great. We got fajitas both times and they are great. Chicken is flavorful and the peppers and onions are too. Sebastian's helper kept our waters full, brought us more chips and kept used dishes clear. I will continue to go back when in town and maybe try something different on the menu one of these times.

GgjGLJVwrzDhWTjcoi7Pww.text: My best friends took me to lunch here for my birthday, I was great food and the server what wonderful and very attentive, I will be taking my husband here very soon.

aB5o-oyrPmsStSdZLv78dQ.text: Hernan our server was A+ ....I didn't particularly care for the vegetarian burrito as it had enchilada sauce and was a little moist for me . When Hernan noticed I wasn't eating it he quickly got the Mgr on duty Amanda who was Very understanding and had me a custom burrito out in 5min which was Bomb but the way . Awesome Service!

2aPPLxWT_LwOK9dVvTlMOg.text: I love this place! Good portions, reasonable prices, nice atmosphere, and the food is delicious!

PaWIsbgivWB53TpIjFgB3A.text: Had a wonderful dinner.   Always a great and consistent  meal.   The staff is excellent.   Hosted a birthday dinner and the food was delicious , the  atmosphere was fun and Christian our waiter made sure that the night was extra special. Great place.   Recommend it.

hZ6FPb-RngyZIsAXVXBTSA.text: Love this place even more now!! I had birthday reservations last Saturday for a group of 15. When I showed up, they couldn't find the reservation because someone had put my name down for the following Saturday. The managers worked swiftly to accommodate my party and got us right in at my appointment time. They were very accommodating and apologized for the mix up. They have outstanding service here over and over again and that's why I keep coming back. Thanks to the managers who went above and beyond to accommodate my party. I had a wonderful birthday and they brought out churros and sang to me as well! The food here is amazing and their margaritas are delicious! I love the mango and guava margaritas. Ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas for two and it never disappoints! Our server was very kind and took multiple photos for our group too. Thank you to everyone at Juan's who made my birthday very special!

hHiNksf0hsEh09H6EfyEaw.text: It was decent Mexican food, ordered the enchiladas and were very good.  Place and ambiance was great and clean.

u20RRaiTMjttY23E-CwvdA.text: Before I ate here I didn't like Mexican food but this restaurant has completely changed my mind. This is the best Mexican food I have ever eaten in my life. This place will turn anyone on to mexican food for sure. It is delicious and you get so much food for a very very low price.   I loved the steak fajita and the california burrito was also really yummy and unique. The churro dessert was very good as well. They also provide you with so many complimentary appetizers like fresh tortilla chips with multiple dips and they will give refills on chips or dips. We refilled our refried bean dip about 3 times because it was so delicious. They also provide a complimentary soup which was reminiscent of noodle soup with chicken broth. We went home with full bellies and lots of leftovers.   The service here was amazing. We came in 7pm on a monday and it was packed with a 25 minute wait. Somehow we were seated in only 5 minutes and our servers came by very frequently always refilling our drinks and dip and chips.   I would definitely recommend this place & I would love to come back again.

4J7gxPYLKvKr178e2bS-sQ.text: Oh my goodness, this place is delicious! The prices aren't too bad, especially considering the portions. The flaming fajitas for one ($16) are definitely big enough for two and the one for two ($30) is easily big enough for 3. We had steak and chicken both were flavorful. They serve it and set it on fire at the table. Today we had three of us and each had three fajitas off the one for two. Delicious! I only wish it wasn't so far away. But definitely worth the drive! Staff and service was fast and friendly.

M8it4PMuRtbs3faxYODPOg.text: Easily my favorite Mexican food in town! Even when they're busy, the wait is never too long. My only complaint is that I wish it was closer to me.

Vt3Bof8Uw3MX5JyyeoAm4w.text: One of our favorites! I'm not big on Mexican food but my wife loves it. You can definitely bet on great food, service and and overall good time. There's variety with the chips they bring out (Sauteed onions and peppers beans and salsa) and their meat is always properly cooked and seasoned. I usually get the carne asada plate because of the preparation of the steak and they also have a steamed veggies option as a side which I always get. When we don't eat at home this is one of our spots. I highly recommend it.

J4WnotnchHxQkILhH1OTLw.text: Great food every time. They have the friendliest staff and it is kid friendly. Best chips and salsa. I like the carne asada burrito

YVsVuaSpWrinwDyN3rl5kQ.text: Excellent food!! The service was phenomenal!!! Drinks were never empty dishes cleared quickly very friendly staff. Great service!!!!

q-CKBRHlqvA6_c6ULE2vXQ.text: My brother suggested we try this place since he and his family recently had discovered it. So glad he remembered to take us here while we were in town.   Great authentic Mexican food, large portions and fast, friendly service. We ordered way too much food and left with two bags of Togo but that means more for later.   Whatever you do, resist the temptation to fill up on chips and dip.   Signature flaming fajitas: well seasoned, cooked to perfection  Menudo: flavorful and well seasoned, no gaminess to the offal  Pozole: melt in your mouth pork, one of the best pozoles I've tasted

EbqXj5Wjyt313BcG3Osw8g.text: Juans is the best Mexican restaurant In las Vegas hands down !!!!  Moving here from California I was adamant to find authentic amazing Mexican food & I am so glad I finally did! This review is long overdue as my family & I have been coming here basically every Wednesday for the last 2 years or so lol. They treat you like family & are always welcoming & friendly. Anytime my friends or family come into town they ask us to take them to Juans and could careless about the places on the strip lol. Table side guacamole, carne Asada ranchero tacos & much more are amazing ! I haven't tried anything that I haven't liked here !

EB9bCAMFzkWjFrUq0chdTA.text: So glad we came in tonight for dinner. The place was packed with people waiting outside. The greeter was nice and organized. The smell of foods was everywhere. We knew we were going to have a fantastic meal. We ordered a flaming fajitas for 2, shrimps and steak. The server came out to light the flame before serving...so cool!! We only ate half of the portion and took home the rest. Definitely come back again soon.

VMMt-hYL1fncsIkmTOK4nw.text: So I bookmarked this place because I heard from my friends that this is the go-to place for mexican food. Then.... my work got catered food from here and oh my golly gosh. Hello! The best. You will not be disappointed. Their rice, beans, tortillas, chicken fajitas and beef enchiladas are delicious. The flavor on their beef enchiladas are to dream about. The guacamole and pico de gallo was on point. Their chips are perfectly salted, not too much but enough to get addicted and eat it all. I definitely will try to eat at the restaurant. But if you need catering, this the place to order. They have a friendly delivery staff... and ... they set it up for you!

apUN9K_OIi8UcfCzNX_7oA.text: We really enjoyed this place! Food was yummy, and VERY filling. You get what you pay for and then some.   Service: Chips and salsa were also filled, food was fast, and waitress was nice.   Environment: We went at peak times so it was a little noisy, but did not take away from our dinner in any way! Wonderfully decorated as well.   Food: We both had fajitas. So much food! We almost could have shared. If I was into that food sharing thing. Meat was cooked well, and tasty! Felt like we got more than we paid for which is always a nice feeling.   The chips and salsa also came with a bean dip which was a nice surprise.   Overall, it was excellent and we will go back sometime!

9CWA8OOiHsuj61N0JV7yaQ.text: Got here on a Friday night around 6:30pm. They said the wait was an hour but it was only about 20 minutes so that was great. Food was tasty so if all you care about is eating some good food, maybe order to go.   Here are my issues: Their service sucks!   We ordered their namesake- Flaming Fajitas. This was our first time here and I specifically wanted to see the flames. The person who brought the cart over didn't say anything. He just lit up the food. I had my back turned and was engaged in conversation. I happened to turn around as the flames were lit and had to get the attention of the people at the table to watch the 7 second spectacle. If this was the only issue, it's not a big deal. But it wasn't.   Here's the main issue: The fajitas are served with a plate of rice and beans. I barely ate one fourth of it before the waiter asked to take it away. I would understand if my plate was empty but it wasn't. I informed him I was still eating. About 5 minutes later, he stops by and asks if I want to box up my food. I had another uneaten plate on the table which I was going to eat after I finish my fajitas. However, I felt rushed so I said ok to a box. I guess I'll just eat it at home. He brought the box and I placed it at the corner of the table so I could finish my first plate. He came by another two times to clear out dishes while 5 of us were still actively eating with no empty dishes to clear out. Dishes that my family were still eating from. We basically were being kicked out of the restaurant. We were not even asked if we wanted to order dessert which we were planning on doing. We were in the restaurant at the table for about 35 minutes from start to finish. I don't think that's too long of a time to be kicking people out.

CcD6-4dbCav6mEr3NLkpIw.text: We decided to try this place because my Hubby's boss said it was great. This place is amazing. It is our new favorite Mexican restaurant. We had the fajitas for 2 with steak and shrimp . All I can say is Best Fajitas is Vegas! Get here early the place fills up but the service is outstanding, Never asked for anything. It instantly appears.  Also had the Raspberry Margarita delicious

iFFS0ah5QhywHxvRNrjDHg.text: Well food was awesome, yet service was incredibly terrible... waiters don't ask if your done eating they assume and remove plates even if your still eating..... they need to work on service with a smile and ask questions...food was great.to end on a good note

gwjLED1aa7gci68DINUKhQ.text: Solid mexican food and good margaritas. My wife enjoyed the enchiladas but not my favorite. I'm not a huge chili powder enchiladas fan. I like mine more of the chili gravy. The queso was fantastic and it comes with grilled jalapenos. Keep up the good work.

JluvGEg8U9CBKZmExdkxVA.text: This place is the best. Good food at a reasonable price. I really like the vegetarian menu. It is nice to have a selection to choose from rather than having to ask for a special request. Love the salsa, beans and chips. The soup is excellent.

tS1wSV5YpX7YKtD6E826rg.text: The servings are unbelievable. Great Happy Hour menu. However, you better have a reservation or you will be standing in line.

bgKIgywxWJhKDhOTn31hCA.text: Last day of our vacation from out of state and came across this place online. Saw it had good reviews so we decided to give it a shot. By no means were we disappointed! From the time we walked in the staff was so friendly, we had a large group and were seated right away, tables filled with chips, salsa, bean dip and peppers (all which were fantastic). Our waiter was very attentive and personable. Order guacamole for an appetizer which was so good. Drinks came right out. Food took a little long to come out but there was 11 of us and they continued to offer to refill chips etc. All food came out together and it was unreal. Every persons meal was delicious. Can't say enough about this place! Just wish there was one back home! Without a doubt worth a stop for dinner if you haven't been!

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zLl8wxjb26ZFe54h2K756w.text: Don't know what took me so long to try this place, I go here once a week , the food is amazing I allways get the steak  or chicken  fajaitas for two, I order for pickup and let me tell you the way the pack the food and the portions they give are just AMAZING ,,, I love how they bring the food out and go over it with you,, the lady who anwsers the phone  is allways professional and nice very pleasant,,,, I love this place

DaXnKdeR-fyDMb7j76BM8w.text: Came here for the first time, family has always raved about JFF. They did not disappoint, food was excellent and the service was top notch. Our server Jovanni was the best, always checking in to see how we were doing. Our first of many visits to JFF.

rFuqGoeCnYLml8c4Wc42ig.text: This was so delicious!  The steak and shrimp fajitas were so good!  The shrimp were large and perfectly cooked.  I loved that they served chips and two kinds of salsa along with a bean dip.  Then to top it off you get a delicious cup of very tasty soup.   Love it!  Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas.

0ODiquuN0zoi99JqIMQl4Q.text: I love this place! I've only been living in Vegas for 2 months and have already been here 4 times. Food is fresh (I got fajitas which were amazing & quesadilla that was a little too cheesy), service is outstanding (my servers are always full of energy & so kind!), and the drinks are nice and strong-- especially if you sit at the bar :) I also love that they give you beans and peppers with your complimentary chips and salsa!

nG4-eoXGUk7wtXfiIL3G_w.text: First time coming here. First time at any sit down Mexican restaurant. Wish I had come sooner, muy delicioso. Food is great, drinks are great, service is nothing exceptional but not terrible.   Had a carne asada burrito with green sauce from the one item dinner and two margaritas during happy hour. Everything was really decently priced and margaritas are a steal during happy hour. They give you chips, salsa, beans, grilled onions and jalapenos (and soup with your entree) before your actual meal so before you know it you've eaten your weight in chips and when your actual food comes out you're on the struggle boat trying to finish. All good though. I finished. Came at a cost but had to do it.   Btw, you come out of the restaurant smelling like their flamin' fajitas so make sure you've invited everyone you needed to because people will definitely know you were there and will be bummed if you "forgot" to invite them.

plDnb9KI0BcnglhkMlbATA.text: While visiting Vegas, we met up with family who recommended and treated us for dinner at Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina.  I must say that we were not disappointed by their restaurant selection!  They gave us ample chips and salsa's to munch on beforehand and the service was great!  The place is quite the buzz, so expect to wait quite a while for your table and food once seated.  We had the Baja style Fish tacos and the flavors were a hit!  The portion sizes are crazy, so unless you feel like gorging and rolling out of there, be prepared to take home half your plate.  We were pleased that they allowed us to substitute the kids quesadilla plate, as we wanted no meat and only rice.  A to go box is needed for the kids plates as well!  Make sure you try their yummy churros afterwards, if you still have room in your belly!  They are cooked perfectly, not greasy, and the caramel adds to it's deliciousness!  My only regret was not ordering the flaming shrimp fajitas, as those looked amazing!

YWbCox3ouZO4z3Rq2dOiGA.text: We have been to this place twice. Once was during rush hour on a Friday night. The wait time was like 30 min. The second time was around 1pm on a Saturday not crowded but busy. There was no wait time in the bar area. Both times we went the service and experience was great. I have to tell you that this place is not afraid to give an appetizer or some small token off appreciation for your visit, not ever time you go but it can happen, so that's cool. The queso dip blew my wife away. The food was excellent. I actually liked the camaron cocktail better at this place then some of the marisco restaurants I have tried in north Las Vegas. I haven't had a bad experience here yet and the portions area absolutely enormous.

WlXi7yKPL8kU0sYZnePaxg.text: Excellent service from yajaira great food good happy hour margaritas everything was really good for first timers! Will be returning with family and friends

TMMpVb-0-UM2dmIArJVXGQ.text: Great service! Excellent food! Yajaira was our server, she was friendly and funny! Portions were big. The fresh , made in front of you guacamole was amazing!

n8zkIg4PkUqVk0UqTzkqPw.text: I had higher expectations for this place. The food was alright but the service was horrible. Our waiter was either new or didnt give a crap. We probably wont be back

QoM4xrTJcmA4l9brdg6Fuw.text: We were invited to a birthday dinner and had no idea this place existed! It's a good little find whose claim to fame is their fajitas which was good. Not being huge fans of peppers and onions, you can't really make sense of our choice. The drinks were okay, not the best but good for the prices offered. The service was not the best; our server wasn't very friendly and didn't have a stellar personality to match his profession.   We could take or leave coming back.

ZPguRNQGs1aVr9Z9XzDnxQ.text: Yajairia and Dom were the best servers ever, we loved their food and we will be back very soon!

mGgKbM2Wv5wu-sIZNFKSPQ.text: Love coming here! Best fajitas of any I've ever had. This is the only place I have fajitas now! Today, our server was Yajaira. Wonderful service and smile! We'll be back....

SW7VzSsUJyBsZ1TKiu7vYA.text: 3 item lunch deal is the way to go for price and variety. The menudo was pretty good too. The menudo was pretty authentic and 5 dollars for a medium bowl is a steal. Spent 45 bucks for 5 people which is amazing for food like this. 10/10 volveria a comer

XekYHcKMIf0JWBHGDcHdJg.text: Underwhelming. The entrees (steak fajita salad and veggie enchilada) were bland and mostly, well, whatever a good synonym for bland would be: tasteless, flavorless, dull...beige. It's basically Mexican food for people who like Mexican food but don't like all the flavor and spices and all the other stuff that makes Mexican food worth eating. At least the steak was stringy and the choice of vegetables was odd. (Who puts broccoli in fajitas?)   I will say this in Juan's favor: True to their name, the fajitas were indeed flaming when they got to the table. But once the flames were extinguished so was our enthusiasm for the food.

Eo_7LAnE_r0Kyc8KS35CDg.text: Fast service. Decent food. I wasn't impressed by the chips...what Mexican restaurant doesn't have homemade chips for their salsa?

8STKg0lMc5t6etkWCenFsA.text: Great place! For anyone questioning the quality of food just look at the pictures. I can tell you first hand the taste way out shines the pictures. They bring out salsa, beans and grilled peppers w/ onions with the chips. The shrimp ceviche is to die for while the rice and beans have the perfect balance of authentic Mexican food.  Wash it all down with a red sangria and you will not be disappointed... Really reminds me of Viva Mercados. hint, hint.

YY5CpUPMZWh6mU3Px1bHbQ.text: Whoever said this is not real Mexican food doesn't know what real Mexican is! We have lived in Southwest Vegas since 2006 real Mexican food can be hard to find. Glad this place opened up hope it stays open. Our first visit, definately not our last.

Ih9T7LWDXU-Ix_zGNQmNkw.text: Being an original Texas girl, I grew up on Mexican food. I'll be honest, I've only been there once but will now be a regular! Every single thing from the chips to the deep fried ice cream was great! The service was amazing! It was early in the evening so they weren't too busy but no one stood around!! I loved it and will be back this week!

6G5nYXkr29VNQWzDxQcUxw.text: One of the best fajita joints in town! I come here at least twice a week! I come mainly for lunch but also dinner. The lunch menu is awesome!!! I love their chicken fajitas!!!! Uber yum! Great service that is fast and friendly!!! I love that with chips n salsa they serve bean dip and grilled japs and onions to snack on! Yummy!!!

DL2V82rUEzO1k9SYMcMBKQ.text: Our go to Mexican restaurant. Great appetizers, fajitas, fish tacos! My family loves the Fideo soup and complementary dips and onions and peppers. The staff is nice and attentive.

o6J9IK5Xp-cgZ7ECTvPrzg.text: Best Mexican is Las Vegas!  I finally found a great place for Mexican.  Get the fish tacos!

4Ig-15V14y9zN3FPRY_R_w.text: I was impressed. The atmosphere was fun and the food good. Our server, Omar, was spot on; friendly and attentive. Like many others, really enjoyed the grilled onions and jalapenos that accompanied the chips, salsa, and bean dip. Nibbled off the niece's beef fajita (someone had to get them) plate; really tasty. The shredded chicken in my sister's chimichanga was flavorful. That surprised me as many places that I've tried seemed to have boiled the chicken leaving the diner to season with sauces and such. Liked the fact that a plate came with a grilled vegetable option versus having to have beans and rice. Also liked the fact that a cup of fideo accompanied each entree. I'm a carnitas fan and that was my only let down; I like bigger chunks of pork versus the small diced version. Had no complaints about the taste or tenderness of the meat though. Portion size was great. Definitely deserves a return visit next time I'm up that way.

JCLXYGyuNjsS0YklQWqpIA.text: I had been wanting to try this place every time we ate over at In N Out Burger across the way. We finally got to try it the other night.  Eric and I both had the flaming fajitas.  It was good and the onion and peppers they serve with the chips and salsa were so good.  We also had the churros. Yummy.  Crunchy and sweet.

XIfi9f02le-h6gfTxi4JLg.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas no contest.  Amazing albondigas soup, and the best fish tacos.  I wish they were here when I lived on this side of town .

QWEMJ8nBDfuqsJV6HGTuWg.text: I have been here many times and the service is always excellent. They bring out chips salsa, bean dip and grilled onions to start. I usually eat here for lunch and go with a special. Lately it has been the grilled chicken taco salad. Yum! They are always on top of drink refills. Best of all they are very reasonable priced for the quality of food and service. Don't forget to try the signature dish as well!

BRZyNmwxd3YhyGVQ5mDKMQ.text: My family loves this place! Steak and Shrimp fajitas for two are amazing and the tex mex enchilada is great too. Service is always awesome.

FRg-u-778lvNlcgdF8v9gg.text: We enjoy sharing meals with family and friends at Juan's Flaming Fajitas and Cantina. There is consistently good food and great service!

WUQOUU6HdQeWa1Vow2puZg.text: Found this place on accident. It worked out great, it's far from our house. Well worth the drive. We've only been a few times. Every time the service has been great, food awesome and good price. What else can you ask for?

g4eZoQwyFTOj50wIiiGqGQ.text: My honey introduced me to Juan's 3years ago and we visit just about every week. It is bar none the best Mexican food I have ever had. I am in the restaurant business and the service and food has been terrific all these years we have never had a bad meal or bad service. Without a doubt the best Mexican food in Vegas.

mEmz7X0i0iatfX5BSLhCXw.text: First timer but I'll be back! Awesome shrimp fajitas, great Margaritas (no high fructose nasty sweet and sour), can't wait to come back and try their other stuff. The owner Juan is present and making sure his guests are happy... very personable and it looks like it's paying off, the place was very busy. next time I'll sit in the bar though, too many kids, it's like chucky cheese in the diningroom.

wq13V2Do2Gz0T31AJHf26w.text: Happy hour here is awesome. I love love love the fajitas! I got the fajitas for two which was a great portion size to share. Tasted delicious and was the right price! And the drinks are delicious. The margarita is a must!

HLhdBI5DVZFZKgUu97pO9Q.text: I really enjoyed this place and the great service.  The food overall was very good but the rice and beans were kind of in small portions perhaps due to the size of the plates.  The flour tortillas were extra good as was the butter I put on them.  So, only three stars.  Well I've had carne asada all over the place and this piece of meat was the worst by far.  Granted it was overcooked for medium but beyond that it looked like a large, thin Wendy's burger expect it wasn't as good.  For over $15 I expect a really decent piece of meat and it just wasn't.

YykCPdw_DAY-ecDzDbAoMQ.text: I have never had a bad meal here . Always top notch ! I love this restaurant! However for the first time I sat with my friend on the patio during dinner and we both agree that you guys need to sex up the patio. Music . Lights. More plants .maybe fire at night ? I still love love the restaurant  but as a server on the strip  this is what I suggest.  Will be back !

faI0AanqwWCHzqJOHymn2A.text: One of our favorite restaurants! The service is hit and miss sometimes though but the food and margaritas is always great! I brought in a large party once and one of the women in the front had an attitude with me but other than that, it's always been a good meal.

UC54PQqaftuXSXJfs-5J5A.text: Overrated. Place is fueled by popularity. The food isn't great at all, the way some Yelpers described. Ordered the Steak fajita, looks good, but doesn't taste good. Meat was tough to chew. Flour tortillas were stuck together, beans and rice regular. If your looking for "real" authentic Mexican food. This is not the place. Driving North a little or the Eastside can find you close to good Mexican food. Also, save you some money as Juan's can be a bit pricey. Wake up. Unless you like overpriced food for the feel.

ViS7KhYzIrBZIb6KL5LRVg.text: Very good, was an awesome experience and we didn't want for anything! Omar was sweet and made sure our margaritas were always full! Good was delicious as well, on of the best happy hours!

bwgN-2ALd-kJ1RTaKbFpXw.text: Good service good fajitas. I would describe the fajitas to have a Mexican citrusy flavor that stood out most. I liked that they offer grilled vegetables instead of rice and beans. I have to try again to have a better idea of the True quality of the food. But a solid pick and good choice.

iuyJRx_Xbm6pZTp5Zdspag.text: I come here frequently for their awesome fajitas and chips n salsa. Their food is so good!!! I always end up during at the bar area so if you are into sports they have giant TVs everywhere showing the games. I always see specials for margaritas and they have happy hour and game time specials too.

cwvtnibdcnn1FfKhplJgJA.text: Finally, a tasty Mexican restaurant in town. Went here with the family and ordered the fajitas.   The fajitas were perfectly seasoned, which I have found unusual in Las Vegas.   The tortillas were light and accompanied the food well. The staff was attentive and pleasant.

P5xcoNcR7dmOH0qNZ04SPg.text: The best ever. Best service and food. The drinks are perfect. Would eat every day. All my fiends love it as well. They can handle big groups, with reseveration, as well.

X37Nwre7KrV6W3GORk4Vjg.text: This place was excellent - high quality, authentic, and with lots of 'extras' - bean dip in addition to salsa provided with chips - AND with grilled jalapenos & onions on side as well.  Portions are huge - 2 people can share many entrees and the fajitas for 2 could probably serve 3.  I don't normally leave reviews, but after the absolutely overwhelming mediocrity of the Border Grill at Mandalay Bay last night (all except the price overwhelmed), I had to review Juan's given it was spectacular in its own right, and spectacular x 100 in comparison to the bland, tiny, over-priced fare at Border Grill.  This was the Mexican fix the family was looking for before our vacation ends - I'll be leaving a recommendation with our hotel concierge.

jd-5RMx3z5gswUMCZvS92w.text: Such a great local spot to hit for some authentic Mexican food. Generous portions and quick service, too.

NOwQ9zXJp1dGCAQFdzmdfQ.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas! Fajitas were amazing- homemade tortillas- delish sopapillas- stellar service. 5 stars all the way

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Fajitas!!! SOO GOOD!

c0jRhzH3rQ_JGnsIZZsBMQ.text: Amazing authentic Mexican food. When you see Mexican patrons in a place you know they got the real stuff. The guacamole is to die for. I also like their american options on the kids menu since my little ones don't eat mexican. The place is busy. Even on a Thursday. it will take a lot for me to go to another place after trying this one.

5sejbmzO7xjK4A_zpU6XYg.text: Absolutely loved this place!!! Friendly, helpful staff and overall just a really great atmosphere. My family and I got the steak, pork, and chicken fajitas and they fell nothing short of amazing not to mention they were so generous with portion sizes y

wymY9Z6MSVBHEVXLPLkRUg.text: Tried Juan's the other night and LOVED IT!!! The service was top notch...very friendly and did a great job. We tipped the waiter and bus boy separately because he was also that darn good. The fajitas were decent but what stood out was the other little things. Amazing house margaritas, beyond delicious guacamole, awesome happy hour deals, super tasty salsas. I'm telling you..we will come back here 100 times. My girlfriend had vegetarian fajitas. Not my cup of tea but it was very refreshing to see a whole vegetarian section for her. 5 stars!!! I would give them 10 if I could!!

j8T_sKiFG3oCgsJgz7lMpQ.text: Great great service. Hernan, Arturo, Chapo and the rest of the gang are always happy to serve. You have to try the Menudo(served daily) pollo asado tacos, soap de fideo and pretty much anything else on the menu:) See you soon guys!

nj7iqG9rFNmxUtZTLBslWQ.text: THIS place has shot straight to the number one position in my "best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas" list.  There are a number of reasons as to why I think Juan's is #1 but for the most part: the food is fresh, cooked perfectly, unique, and consistently delicious; the service is probably the best I have experienced at a Mexican restaurant; their alcoholic beverages are nice and stiff (unlike most watered-down drinks at similar restaurants); the decor is actually really nice and comforting with great booths and TVs strategically placed around the whole restaurant; and, last but not least - the waiters and staff are AMAZING.   Chips, salsa and bean dip were brought to our table within seconds of being seated. I really, really enjoyed the flavor and spice level of the salsa - it was unique, tasty, and definitely did not come from a jar.  The bean dip was great too.   I ordered fish tacos my girlfriend ordered the Enchiladas en Tomatillo after our waiter highly recommended she try it.    Before our food came, our waiter brought out some complimentary soup.  I'm pretty sure it was pizole or fideo, but I could be wrong. Either way, it tasted amazing and I actually finished the whole bowl. I never like the soup at Mexican restaurants, but the broth was so flavorful I found myself slurping up the entire bowl.   My fish tacos were pretty good - the fish was crispy and flaky without that soggy-ness that often comes when you do not eat the fish fast enough. I enjoyed them (although they are no Phranks!).  The REAL winner were the enchiladas. Ohmygod I have never tasted enchiladas so delicious, creamy and unique. They had onions and white sauce and cilantro and chicken and cheese and it took everything in me not to finish the rest of my girlfriend's meal when she left the table to use the restroom. I highly recommend this dish.   I will be back ASAP to try the flaming fajitas. The table next to us ordered some and all I could hear during the remainder of our meal were variations of "mmmm, ohmygod, did you try this? damn this is good."    Also, we ordered a couple of Coronaritas, which were made with top shelf tequila,  and they were cheap AND fantastic.   I wish I lived closer because Juan's has a great happy hour and Mexican restaurants never have great food AND great service.  Juan's definitely gives all other Vegas Mexican restaurants in this price range something to be scared of ... because they all need to step up their game.

mP1PsOv6k2mP6_VXKTSReQ.text: Reading the yelp reviews prior to my visit, I was expecting a lot more. While the hostesses were friendly, the waiter I had was not. He was short, despite me being very polite, and that frustrates me when I am patronizing a business.   I ordered the vegetarian fajitas, but was dismayed when I was offered a side of rice. As a precaution, I asked if the rice had any meat in it or if it was cooked in a meat based broth. Indeed, it is cooked in chicken stock. Okay, why, then, was I offered it if I ordered off the vegetarian section of the menu? 15 minutes later, I was brought a complimentary appetizer soup. Again asking the same question, I was told that this, too, had chicken stock in it. Hmm.  My suggestion to Juan: please tell your staff to not offer meat-based items to those guests who order off of the vegetarian section of the menu. Or, offer them, but indicate right then that they are made with meat-based ingredients.   When my entree came out, the pan was barren and a couple veggies that were listed on the menu were not served. And the taste was nothing to get excited over. There are two other Mexican spots in town that have delicious veggie fajitas, and these ones just left me yearning for more.

JZ3RpRqAp5Atht1z82PIQg.text: First time here got great service from the staff they were  attentive.  You get alot of food chips salsa bean dip and the entrees are pretty big.  We came during happy hour which is from 3-7.  We got the shrimp ceviche which was 7.95 during happy hour and its worth it.  Definitely coming back again.  Great waiter in ernoldo and the support staff.

9iuaGeyVnlRj6CsCcUl54w.text: Best service!! It is so good I had 5 Diet Coke refills 2 baskets of chips and 2 bean dip refills. Food is amazing!! Fast and efficient .

-0Wrh_AYF_oML7x4btMBPg.text: This is a great place!  Omar is usually our waiter and he's the BEST!!  Today we sat in the bar area (no kids) and received the same great service.  Food is excellent.

AHFjW3cl8RRAMN0kVwX5-g.text: Went to my fav place while visiting in Vegas and of course Juan's you never fail me! I always take whomever I am with even if we have to leave later lol I am going to JUANS!!!! Please open a location in California!

cdChpI7debBA8ksH0lxloQ.text: Excellent service, delicious fajitas (I had the vegetarian fajitas), and big screens..pretty much perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie fajitas

fuZ47L2omFNr8DxdlrTy3Q.text: Disappointed went to dinner and loved it. Sunday , decided to try brunch. So disappointed watered  down drinks with brunch , so they upsell premium drinks.   The eggs were burned and ruined my brunch selection.  Your only allowed one brunch selection.  Out of all the brunch places in Vegas. This is not one to do.  Over priced and undervalued.  The place was empty for brunch.  That should have been a clue.

CfuvH3NAc7J8eREn6p7dWg.text: This is my all-time favorite Mexican restaurant the food is amazing. Great atmosphere great prices and just an all-around great restaurant experience

ZtR2wynnMmudSm9uSKZbFA.text: Good, but I have had better food for a lot cheaper. Service was okay. Atmosphere was good.

N34Xw9J3Vw6wv9-9wRSipg.text: This place was really really good! You get a ton of food here! The drink prices are really reasonable, and if you go on a Tuesday you can get a 2 item combination plate for $10.95. My boyfriend and I got to the restaurant an hour before they closed and the place was packed, and now I know why. I will definitely be going back!

bqFoMmE4Wb1wamRVM2RBxQ.text: As I sit here full and still inhaling the scent of fajitas I am very thankful to the person who recommended this place!   The chips came out warm accompanied with salsa that had just the right amount of spice and a bean dip that reminded me of my long lost favorite Margaritas Cantina (at the old frontier casino), so of course that alone will bring me back!   We ordered the fajitas for two people for $25 (a steal in my book) and there was more than enough meat and veggies! The meat is so tender and flavorful that I didn't really even need all the fixings. But I was pleasantly surprised at how fresh the guacamole tasted and used my chips to truly enjoy the taste instead. The rice and beans were also quite good.   This place is about 20-25 minutes away from our house but we are already planning who we want to bring!   P. S. Service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef fajitas!

3JVSeeEYYTJog2boWRXtwA.text: This place is THE BOMB!!! So awesome. Chips are thin, crispy and endless. Salsas are great. The bean dip is unique and yummy with hot cheese mixed in. One of the best dishes are there fajitas.... Huge portion, lots of meat and veggies... And best of all... They light them up to flame at your table!  The food is excellent! Only tough part is it's always busy, so hard to get seats unless you come earlier before meal time. Worth the wait, though!! Service is great, too. Good job!!

lLsDpOPaqc5VkFSqZWitbA.text: Greatest restaurant in Vegas. If you are lucky you can bump into Vince Neil or the Owner of nationally acclaimed Food and Beverage Magazine.  Ask for Mimi..

3EB6g7TBNhJxklJEG4qaog.text: The best Mexican restaurant in town. I'm happy they have exploded in business but sad the secret is out because now there is usually a 30-45 minute wait during prime hours BUT it's definitely worth the wait. We have been going to Juan's for years and I've never had bad service. The food is always delicious, always. Everyone is so nice from the time you walk in to the time you leave. It's definitely one of our favorite places in town to go to. Excellent service, great food and decent prices!

BqIzYeaVSQMPe7wDdM95NA.text: 1st time here, we went for happy hour. Service was awesome, food was awesome! I left smiling ear to ear! We ordered fish taco Baja style, taquitos and a margarita all for $25! Yes $25! We couldn't even eat all the food and had tons of leftovers.  I will be back very soon! Looks like a favorite here is the fajitas,  100% will be trying it on the next visit.

Tf6v6z9Y_a7Y_4c5E37kRg.text: We had all the fajitas they offered among our party of four All were exceptional Service was good and place was packed so get there early

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas

B1ICCVcXYSPrIcn_5quyZw.text: The food was amazing and the service was friendly and attentive. I will definitely come back.

_BNdZZ7_JDwsD5zHVnbAgA.text: The food here is a solid 3 stars, but the consistently amazing service is enough to bump it up to 4.  This is NOT an authentic Mexican restaurant, it caters to the middle aged American palate. That being said, they do a great job with that. All of the usual suspects like combo plates with burritos, tacos, tostadas, tamales etc.. But also some dishes with nopales (cactus) and calabaza (pumpkin) to make some feel like maybe they're eating adventurously.  What stands out the most here is that they are all about the freebies, and I think that's really what draws the crowd here. Heaping baskets of chips with endless bean dip and salsa. Fideo soup to start every meal (they even asked me if I wanted more) and they gave me a side of vegetables with my dinner for free. They also have free grilled onions and jalapenos. They ALSO honored some happy hour prices for some patrons at the table next to me even though happy hour was over to which those people exclaimed "now that's service!" No.. It's not.. You're just jerks, and they're just really nice. A server who couldn't honor happy hour prices when it's been over for an hour isn't a bad server.  The fajitas are their claim to fame here, and while they are impressive upon delivery, I found them to be quite bland. The tall flame is a gimmick, but I think it's fun anyway. All of the food is solid.. But the check backs, friendly chatter, anticipation of your needs and presence of the servers without being overbearing is really impressive. Just don't come expecting something that your abuela used to make for you.
