9awiYcdDsr-9sKiTLn40mg.text: Great fajitas at reasonable prices .. Decent guest service!  Recommended for everyone to try sometime.

b0yk1n3ATfUfbflJe2zhMg.text: Had a great time!   Service was awesome.  Mimi was fantastic.  Delicious food and awesome drinks.

SP5uwk1U9uGLzHpjF_FSSg.text: Good food, I always like free chips and salsa and they even one up that by bringing warm free bean dip, my favorite. There was a group of us, and one guy got the chimichanga and he said it was the best he has ever eaten. I got tacos and while they were good, they definitely weren't anything to rave about. Another friend got the fajitas and he said the same thing. Nothing to overly rave about. All in all, a great place with decent prices to eat mexican food. No complaints, but nothing blows us outta the water.

Xm517BW5D5Ix8RTTvSlzbg.text: Incredible service and food!!  Ernaldo was our server.  He did an excellent job.  He was very attentive to our every need. The service was definitely a team effort.  Six different employees came to our table asking about quality of food, keeping out drink filled, and bringing additional napkins.  We ordered the steak and shrimp fajita for two, which was not on the lunch menu.  Ernaldo assured us it was not a problem and he assured us he would get it done.  The best Mexican food we've ever eaten. Definitely worth the 9 mile drive off the Strip.

T91sDa6Wt8LtbXEzZt68cQ.text: Flaming Fajitas is a great traditional Mexican restaurant. They start you off with fresh chips and salsa, as well as refried beans, grilled onions and peppers.   They have a huge selection and lots of weekly deals such as happy hour and lunch specials.  If you're going for lunch I would highly recommend their steak fajitas, it's delicious and a large portion size for the price.   The service there is excellent and they are always busy still making sure each table is taken care of.  Enjoyed the experience and will be back again (:

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side Rice, Black beans, tortillas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Steak Fajita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modelo Especial Michelada

ZYSpuk_I6sYVKRgYlvKg5Q.text: Friendly people, excellent fajitas! Good prices, happy tummy! I've sent so many of my clients here and they are all now regulars! Your welcome Juan!

PjTeW5Yfkf2tMPPmxm5FGw.text: After shuffling through the 279+ reviews I talked my husband into driving over 10 minutes to this place. I am CRAZY for Mexican food, so I was excited.   We walked in and my husband was won over by being placed in front of the 80" LED t.v. with Monday night football showing.   Not only were we presented with warm tortilla chips, but they also gave refried beans and grilled onions and peppers as well.   My husband ordered chicken fajitas and I ordered steak and enchiladas. YUMMY is pretty much how I can sum it up! Best meal we had in Vegas out of a total of 4 days.  The service was second to none! Friendly and attentive staff was the big fat cherry on the top of it all! Go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming chicken fajitas. So darn good!!

kiatOLvi9XHUnHTEvEQBtQ.text: I took my family ice skating around the corner from this place. Family decided this should be the place we filled our belly's with after.  Figured with all the great reviews we would be getting some great food.  One. Let me say that the hostess at the front is a 5 star. And the ambience in the restaurant is a 5 star. But what else I experienced there means they receive a 2 star overall.  Our waiter wasn't the greatest. When we started ordering he kept trying to up-sell everyone to one particular dish. I don't didn't catch on to it until after he left the table and we realized that my teenage daughter ordered something he said she should take instead of what she wanted.  When the dish came, I looked at it like "she ain't going to eat this." One. It was freaking massive. It was fit for 4 people. Not a 115 lb teenager. Two. I had realized that was the same dish he tried to upsell me on and that I said no to. Why the hell was he trying to up-sell us this particular dish? Was it because it was more expensive? Was it something he personally like? I don't know. But I would figure when someone says that they want something specific just let the order be done and let it be over with. There's no need to upsell. Noticing the commotion on our table, another waitress came to the table and asked if everything was okay. I explained the situation to her and she said she would take care of everything. At that moment the other waiter came back to the table and asked if my daughter would like what she originally ordered instead. Interesting Lee, he knew exactly what the dish was and did not even have to ask her he said he would just bring it right away. Now I'm not no food kinda connoisseur but I do love food! But I cannot under any circumstance understand what the big hype is about this place. This is not authentic! And I mean not even close! I mean all I had was tacos. And even that was not good. How do you serve a not good taco? Me and my wife and my youngest daughter ate maybe half our dishes we weren't exactly thrilled with the flavors. My oldest daughter the one who was up sold and then got the dish that she did one scarfed all her food down but I think it was more out of thinking she was satisfying me in some way rather than enjoying the food. The rest of our evening they're followed with a thousand offerings of refills of our drinks even though we constantly said no the offers would not stop. And oh joy, much to my delight a $75 bill 4 Non authentic food. I'm sorry but I was not impressed. This is Las Vegas, there are way too many authentic places to get this food then to come here and pay $75 for something that did not taste good at all. Again, this is just my experience I can't say that that is the experience of everyone and I'm sure to some their food is great... just not to me.

QWpBX1Wp-6W5iivSraSINw.text: My second visit here was fabulous! Thank you to Amanda our serve for being so attentive! We did the large order of table guacamole tonight inside of the table side and it was delicious! I still need to bring my family here!   It's just a fun atmosphere with happy employees! The vibes are radiating! The fajitas are out of this world & the table side fire sizzle is always fun and a bit warm. I haven't tried anything else besides them. They have a for 2 option which is a perfect & generous portion for two. Even the house brewed tea ice was yummy. They had a table next to us with a large party celebrating a birthday. This is definitely a great place to bring a big party too. The prices are very fair and they have a nice happy hour menu too. Oh and the flan not that my diet self had any is finger licking good :( lol

EsTONVc0ctqFB_kHsDaSoQ.text: I had heard of this place for awhile but WOW... great food, great customer service , and great ambiance. The wait was worth it... we came here Sunday evening (6pm) and there was an hour wait. It moves fairly quickly but glad we gave it a shot. They are known for their fajitas, the presentation is phenomenal! It's on fire *literally*. I will definitely be back :).

uMDkmAiiPi14-2ZoYcKCJQ.text: Great place. The service was amazing, the prices were very reasonable and the portions were good enough for anyone to be pleased with. I am a sucker for table side fire shows like they do with the 2 person fajitas as well. Mix in a good happy hour menu and prices and you get me as a customer 4 lyfe vato.

0WlKoDxLJLOyNeflZqBdQQ.text: Food was amazing! The wait was long but it was a Friday night.    The only thing that was negative about out experience was the fact that we had to wait about 20 mins to get a check. Our table was cleared and cleaned right away, but the waitress was so busy with so many other tables. They need more staff for sure.    Again the food was amazing and there was so much. The fajitas for 2 fed us that night plus the next day for lunch.

BvN-oWE2C4h8REH81LPb9w.text: Great food, great service. Really not much more needed to say than that. If I'm in the area, it'll definitely be my go to Mexican restaurant.

wZC-gKw92qn_2YMNYrK0Ow.text: Amazing Mexican food worth driving across town for!  Drinks were on point and the fajitas are a good portion and delicious.

ldj_yk1etDz2vnhS6xrzNQ.text: Good atmosphere, terrific prices, superb customer service, and scrumptious food... this place is a new favorite! The staff was quite attentive and very polite. The food is authentic and their salsas were some of the best we have ever tried. We will definitely be going back again and again and I would without a doubt recommend this restaurant.

UhjA1S37iJ9KrYFKvyBH2g.text: We were so happy this place was as good as it's reviews. Everything was fantastic, super delicious! Our service was top-notch, Oswaldo and his partner(unfortunately we did not catch his name) took excellent care of us. The prices were so incredibly reasonable we were so shocked. A big five stars

woLYB2t3tXGHQFhPxLsLfA.text: Great friendly customer service and quality food The waitress checked on and chatted with us throughout our meal. The food is made from scratch from the flour tortillas to the guacamole!  The food is too quality flavored and cooked just right!

1E8eUPes1KT91JxPV2gIrw.text: Been here like 4 times, and it's been great every time. Can't wait to go back. Food is great. Service is great. 5 stars consistently...Best Mexican food in town, Hands Down!!!

8KHY0M9xNPjXoNIs778EZg.text: Juan's has good traditional style Mexican food. They have a big menu & they're great for Happy Hour. I personally love their flavored frozen margaritas. Peach & mango are my favorites! The service is always consistently great. Everyone I've dealt with is fluent in both English & Spanish. It's a very family friendly place. I've eaten there for a girls night out & I've also went with family & young children. I love seeing the actual flaming fajitas come out because the flames are enormous & fun to watch.   If you enjoy authentic Mexican food, rather than the Americanized Taco Bell version then definitely check this place out!

goT7yemts5Gynu8h4amW1w.text: Food: Delicious. Great chips and salsa. We ordered the queso fundido appetizer and then the fajitas for two with steak and shrimp. We also had a mango and a raspberry margarita. All tasted great and we had leftovers to take home.   Atmosphere: Great decor. Comfortable booth seating. Friendly staff. Our waiter called us amigos which was a nice touch.    Price: we thought prices were a little high. We went during happy hour and when we got our check we noticed none of the discounts were taken off. We had to remind them, which is not enjoyable.   Overall we liked the restaurant and would go back.

XByR6nPpoISnSgX846i4Ug.text: I've heard so much good things about juans and always drive by it and it's always packed! I usually don't crave Mexican but we gave it a shot! As soon as we seated they served FRESH chips and three salsas and a side of peppers and onions. The fajita for one or two is a must! We tried the chicken and the presentation alone was awesome! They flavors were great while sizzling on the pot and smothered with cheese. We both were served sopa fideo, which of course was tasteful. We will definitely be back for more! They also have happy hour on drinks and food daily from 3p-7p. The service was also great, the buzzer and server were on top of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5xyauzWFbLiMfI5LinDvag.text: Alex was fantastic ! The service at this place is unbelievable, the best ever. You also not be disappointed with the food which is excellent. We come here every time we are visiting Las Vegas no matter where we stay

oYZgiwbzbDpL1YGto7QQFA.text: I absolutely love this place!! For this quality and price, it's the best I've discovered in Vegas thus far. Literally everything is delicious here, starting with the chips and salsa! This place is typically packed, and for good reason.

-iFu-FAnnNwAVMralDk5Lg.text: My wife wanted Mexican food so i decided to try Juan's based upon all the 5 star yelp reviews. We had the 3 combo dish (chicken enchiladas, 2 beef tamales), beef taquitos appetizer and chicken quesadilla appetizer.  My wife liked the chicken enchiladas. We enjoyed the chips very much. I thought the tamales were terrible (seem like frozen that was baked in oven after since it was dry and a little burned). Beef taquitos were large burritos like that was deep fried and wasn't crisp as I've had before in other good restaurants. Chicken quesadillas were terrible with the chicken being shredded instead of grilled chunks thus it was wet inside. Service was pretty good considering it was busy for a Tuesday. I'm not sure why there are so many good reviews of this place. Maybe locals haven't tried really good Mexican food to compare but this place definitely isn't 4 nor 5 stars!! Vegas has lots of great restaurants so don't waste your money here i say.

DFYAdE5WzZcHNLbYvLJl3w.text: After moving here from Chicago, I was happy to find a Mexican Restaurant that could come close to the excellent food at Javier's in Arlington Hgts, IL.  Juan's gives you a TON of food so bring your appetite.  You're started with homemade chips & dip, then soup, then your meal.  We always get the Steak Fajitas for 2.  Expect to bring some home.  Lots of steak & veggies seasoned to perfection. Happy hour is 7 days a week but either get there early or expect to wait.  The parking lot is the only negative.  In-N-Out burger is next door & that place is ALWAYS busy.  Hard to find parking during peak hours.  Fast, friendly service. Highly recommend.

S_eleXYCjS0s9N_FIVxSiA.text: I had to check this place out after reading reviews.This is a great spot! We came in early afternoon and were able to take advantage of some of the specials going on ! I chose the mango margarita and shared a shrimp cocktail with my husband before trying the famous flaming fajitas. Good size portions, you can easily share. The small cup of fideo is a nice touch, It reminded me of home.  I loved that the food is not overly salted. In the end, i opted out of dessert but one of the servers convinced me to try a shot of mezcal. Few slices of fresh oranges and I was in heaven !! This is a super friendly atmosphere, even the manager came by to check on our dining. Will have to come back next time I'm on that side of town !!

Ws4dRh3WpF3Rw80_vJws5Q.text: Flaming shrimp and chicken fajitas. This place rocks. Killer drinks. Killer dips. Killer staff.   Most place to hit up.

Jwl-N5icWl6xmnMhfY4Uow.text: This place is delicious! I was surprised by the variety of dips they give you in addition to the traditional chips and salsa. I had the chimichanga and it was amazing!! Service was spectacular and friendly. I wish there was a location in my hometown. Do yourself the favor and go!

VLGQeiqwkJZTccUJC-89wg.text: One of my favorite places to eat I luv the fajitas and the chips and salsa one of my fav places

nR5k8YPqA0KFWYKkIqdFHg.text: Their Bartender Sebas is amazing makes wonderful drinks and is very polite. Also the tortillas are hand made.

t_OCV1GnJFtE9hbRQH3OXA.text: I went to Juan's Fajitas to eat. Wow the service I got was excellent. My waiter Christian went beyond my expectations. He offered me Margaritas, new dishes,  Guacamole etc. He was amazing, and very polite. Wish every waiter was like him. Definitely coming back and the food was amazing . Thanks Chris for being a sweetheart.

MzES7gO_SeU9HDH0ZC7N9g.text: Unfortunately I did not order the fajitas but everyone around us did as did my husband. I got the fajita quesadilla and I was not disappointed but next time I will definatly be getting them! Also ordered a top shelf margarita which was super yummy. As were the veggies that come out with the chips and salsa. My new favorite Mexican restaurant!

jQaYCrmDnHaJoJevOfLBug.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.   The Fajitas are flamed at the table and simply delicious.  The guacamole is also prepared table side.  More onion and cilantro please, lol.  Just the way you like it.  The staff and service are excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P1oivA0YJfDqzEkV0p33dQ.text: This place is awesome. The chips came served with a green salsa, red salsa, beans, and a plate of chili's and peppers. The service was quick and polite. Two of us ordered the steak fajitas. They were delicious. Perfectly prepared. The steak was tender and the peppers and onions were nicely caramelized.

aqaYkHnb88HziviungE01Q.text: The food and service are five star, without question! We have been coming here since they opened. This spot consistently had a hard time keeping a restaurant. Over the years they have become so popular that you're lucky to only wait 30 minutes to be seated. They won't take reservations and it's a bummer because we have come a few times to be told it will be 45 min - 1 hour

TjBPan4yB_A4NEOt0CALJg.text: Excellent.   Food - 5/5 Service - 5/5 Value - 5/5 Decor - 2/5  This is the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to.  The service is flawless, drinks refilled before even reaching halfway. Quick, polite, attentive service.   The food is excellent. All sauces served with tortilla chips are delicious. All food has a bit of spice and peppers and onions are served for when you want strong heat. Flavorful and well seasoned. The beef, tender and moist, well-seasoned. The green sauce was perfect.   Pulled Beef Burrito with green sauce - 5/5  Beef Fajitas - 5/5

6f8qhRfq_VRBBzoy_RFXbw.text: Fabulous experience here! There is a wait, but that's because locals know it's so good! Our table was already set with chips and dips, plates and silver wear when we were seated. Yajarita was our server - attentive, friendly, and informative she took very good care of us. A gentleman (no name badge) frequently refreshed our beverages, cleared empty plates etc. We told Ramon, the manager that we were very impressed and appreciated how professionally we were served, and the food was excellent. We travel a lot for business throughout all 48 contiguous states, and now have a favorite Mexican resturant 2,000 miles from our home! We'll be back - perhaps not frequently, but as often as we are in the Las Vegas area. The veggie fajitas brought the most acclaim, followed by the chicken, steak, and shrimp respectively. The wet burrito rounded out our group of five, and everyone was VERY pleased with their meal. Portions were large enough to require three take home containers for enjoyment later in the day. Solid five for our experience - we suggested to Ramon that they open their next resturant in Michigan!  Hope you enjoy your meal should you select them too.

FcoWIVHgPyQd6dPa0zyKnQ.text: I wish I had gotten the name of our waiter, because he was beyond accommodating! My friends and I headed to Juan's after a couple hours driving and hiking at Red Rock Canyon. We were looking for some delicious food & drinks. Juan's DEFINITELY satisfied.   We made it just in time to order off their lunch menu (ends at 3pm). And then just in time to order from their happy hour drinks (starts at 3pm).  The meal starts off with complimentary chips & two types of salsa, a bean dip, and grilled onions & peppers. It was all SO good--especially the grilled onions and peppers.   My boyfriend and I ordered steak fajitas & a chicken burrito (comes suiza [topped with red or green sauce & cheese]) and added lettuce, tomato, and sour cream. It was all so delicious!   As other reviews state, the margs are definitely strong.   To top off our meal, our waiter also let us use the Yelp deal! Four of us dined for about $46--which was a steal! Of course we tipped well because the service was phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious chip spread!
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top left (clockwise): Enchilada, taco, steak fajitas
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken burrito &amp; fajita toppings

ZCx6d3jYwU1Dnba995tbwA.text: So good! While visiting from out of town my wife and I were craving fajitas. She googled "the best fajitas in Las Vegas" and this place came up #1. It was a distance from the strip but let me tell you, IT IS WELL WORTH THE DRIVE!  First off just the smell of the food walking in was captivating. The decor is festive and bright. We got the chicken fajitas for two. Omar was our server and he was as good to us as the food tasted. A huge plus (unless you don't want to gain 10 lbs.), is they give you so much food!   I recommend anyone looking for really good fajitas, maybe even the best you've ever had, this is the place to come to!

WhIuDUKMIYcV-x9Qh1hd_A.text: Amazing. Amazing. Amazing. Not sure what else there is to say. Great service, Bomb.com food, atmosphere is awesome,

3UzdrrfiAXTve3xZ5B1pLg.text: Definitely not real Mexican food! Yuck I didn't like it at all. The food has no flavor no salt the salsa is not spicy at all. Definitely not authentic Mexican food lol

OrjI0xVtPZbFLkYaG0qGHQ.text: Love Juan's Flaming Fajitas but love it even more now because I leaned today that, instead of rice and beans with the Fajitas, one may choose steamed vegetables!  How cool is that for those of us who are dieting?  May also substitute black beans for the pinto beans.  And they have Skinny Margaritas.  WOW!  A Mexican meal that is healthy.  It just doesn't get any better than that.  Calle was an excellent waitress, backed up by a fabulous busser.  Both were absolutely delightful.

aQ36iv3kiUMyQiWT8t7qXw.text: First impression is everything to customers and this place failed! Echo the greeter looked right past me and my family standing right in front of her as she took the name of a couple just walking into the restaurant. This would normally be my exit from a place that has no regard for there patrons, but I was hopeful that the tone she set for this restaurant would drastically change once we got seated. I've had quite a few friends highly recommend this place and we were willing to look past her negligence. The food is amazing, you get 2 different salsas bean dip sauteed onions and peppers oh your chips right when you come in, food is served fast and everything tasted amazing! I'm a business owner and I take customer very serious next time I visit this place I hope things change with Echos customer service!

7SA3y5VWpjtvxc5PGU5lOg.text: Been here a few times already, always for dinner and there's always a line. Don't be discouraged if you see a huge line though as it tends to move pretty quick. There's been a few times where the hosts told me it'll be a 30 min wait but in actuality it'll be closer to 10 min.   You get complimentary chips and three different dips. I can seriously finish a whole basket of their chips because they're that good! For entrees, I usually get the steak fajitas protein style with romaine leaves (instead of tortilla) and side of steamed veggies (instead of rice and beans). Gotta balance it out after eating gorging on those chips.   Servers are always friendly and there's never been a long wait for the food to arrive. The bus persons are quick with clearing your dishes and making sure you have everything you need.   I haven't had a chance to try their desserts yet but that's next on my list! Will definitely be back.

OTf-R3UnWMDGMAnqz9Fb3Q.text: Ate here awhile back and was not impressed. The restaurant is clean and in a nice area of town, and the salsas were really good, but the entrees were bland. I had the burrito Colorado which looked good, but had zero flavor. My friend had the fajitas and the same thing, no flavor. The service was nearly nonexistent as the servers passed by our table and did not refresh my drink which was empty for a long time. Not coming back.

BPiAOtKFwGVpfd7n8kdbVg.text: Amazing food! Great atmosphere. Dark restaurant, the lighting is really low - at least in bar area.

pciaTBuzmPAY8-4nf7LnvQ.text: Wow .... just wow all around . Wish they took reservations . Food was delicious and waiter was friendly . They care ... everyone in the establishment.

QURg0yoAXw-gICfEhkiikw.text: You know I didn't know Vegas had it in them to have a great Mexican Restaurant but this one is muy bueno! I had the Chile Relleno y Flautas with rice and beans and it was very good. The Horchata was tasty also. I went with family and they seemed nice but not overly. I think that's what made my review a 4 not a full 5 stars. I kind of understand it was the end of the day but I always appreciate the feeling of amazing service.   Food: Great 5/5 Atmosphere: 5/5 Service: 4/5  I would definitely eat here or have it as one of my off-the-strip dining options when I come back to Vegas again.

rz2hBvkBcuWQhhrVhHye5Q.text: Great service and even better food! The fajitas are amazing. The jalapeno margarita is delicious and spicy. Their queso dip and queso fundido are some of the best I've ever had!

knDTld62BHLzrYnSct3kOw.text: I got the chicken enchiladas that were great. The sopapillas were the best sopapillas I've ever had! I would give 5 stars however there were guests that got seated after us and were helped before our party of 3 and waited a while to have our order be taken granted they were busy but the fact people got seated after us and got their orders in before us was a bummer since it was a bday celebration and we already knew what we wanted! But overall best spot for Mexican food in Vegas

yaiNetzZRXinh15z5oxEEA.text: We had not been a while but since macayos closed decided to try it again..so glad we had it was great..mom had a chicken burrito and I had,a combo cheese enchilada and chicken taco plus drinks and we shared a table with new another couple and had a blast. The chicken was absolutely delicious.  It was so good we decided to come back within a few days.  But the return visit was horrible.  We tried to order what we'd had that was so good..the chicken tacos but these were nothing like the last ones..the last ones the chicken was grilled and we'll seasoned, the taco shells soft and tasty.. these were bland shredded sopping wet chicken on rubbery shells. The waiter was nice in exchanging it, so we changed to basic cheese enchilada and a chicken burrito.  The burrito came with the same swampy shredded chicken that was found in the taco, the shell wasn't even cooked.  It was truly gross.  Again the waiter exchanged that for a cheese enchilsda. At this point dinner was ruined and we'd had to wait over an hour to eat.  The waiters were nice and one told us the mgr only charged us for a single combo each, as if that was doing us a favor...but thats all we ended up with, so not sure what the favor was other than to mot charge us for the disgusting food?  Turns out unbeknown to us, the first time a week ago we had a waiter who just gave us the better grilled chicken dishes..but we didn't know it so when we ordered, we did exactly what we had the first time.  What is puzzling is why they even have the shredded dish as it makes the food their look bad, even the waiters said the other was better.  Bottomline..it was a huge hassle, ruined our appetite and evening out.  Not anxious to return anytime soon based on tonight.

V3wags2yjT1imKKE9XI0nQ.text: This place is so good. We had chicken fajitas and the portions were huge. The chicken was so tender and the flavors were perfect. I loved the two kinds of salsa and warm bean dip with the freshly House made chips.  My kids had the tamales and they were good the green salsa was had a little bit too much lemon but it was still very good. Service was great my waiter was nice and efficient and attentive. The only negative is that it's a very loud room so don't plan on conversation

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1RgXkaqMVIuXgId85MHIYQ.text: Always amazing food and great service! Hands down my favorite mexican restaurant in Las Vegas!

qKf8ODMuEEvChsb8SlXvsg.text: Delicious fajitas!! Service is always incredible. The wait is sometimes lengthy, but it is so worth it. I usually get the fajitas to share, and it is plenty of food. They have lunch and drink specials too! My favorite place to grab some fajitas and a margarita.

75WGIZcTDHEw9P_noKxk2w.text: Juan, you had me at Flaming! A great place to take a family as they are quick to get you seated.  Don't be fooled by all the people waiting for their table.  My last two experiences, we were seated before the time they said we would.  As we were taking my grandson who is under two, we wondered if we could pull off a cryless dinner with him.  Again, Juan came through as the food was served quickly as well as on fire!  My grandson was hypnotized by the steak fajita's flames and throughly enjoyed the rice also!  Our food tasted great with an excellent selection of salsas at our fingertips!  Tortillas were freshly made and made great holders for the fajitas. I highly recommend this place for great food, good times and fire to go with it all!

NCk02pU_NgBRdois4OaMmw.text: Always a good experience to have here! The fajitas are amazing, Omar is amazing, and the performance for the flaming fajitas is amazing! Don't skip out on the fajitas, even if it's pricey it's worth it. The steak and shrimp is what I usually get, and that is seasoned well so you get a show and good food at a good price! Omar is a great server; attentive to everyone in his area, and very nice! Definitely give this place a try when you're nearby!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-_fob-JJ8BTzX6P5pJ2sng.text: Upon arriving to Las Vegas for the first time with my family, we were immediately recommended this place by our hotel. I saw the reviews and thought if it has more than 1,000 it must be good. We went on the first day anxious to try and found our wait time to be an hour and a half. It was too much time to wait, so we decided to go another day.  The next day, I called and asked the wait time. They said it would be 30 min, but as soon as we arrived it was 50 min. We decided to wait and it was a great decision. Our food was delicious and very filling (parrillada, al pastor burrito, pozole, and much more) but what made it so great was our waiter, Paco, and his teammate, Angel. They always made sure our glasses were full, chips were filled, and anything else we needed. They made the experience a great one with their laughs and jokes.   I totally recommend this place. If you happen to have Paco and Angel serving you, you will without a doubt have a great time and leave with ur tummy full.

t4ZVGvVZS6qxzzDi29RJ1A.text: Visited Juan's for the first time and agree completely with the 5 star review.  It's a place you must be prepared to wait for a seat due to massive popularity.  But be prepared with an empty stomach. Before we were seated, they already had two types of salsa, bean dip, roasted peppers and onions with chips.  And BOTH salsas were fantastic. They nailed both and for me the salsa is the most important piece as it becomes the indicator for me as to the meal to come.  We had a steak, seafood combo in a red/orange sauce that was fantastic.  And a chicken burrito covered in red sauce was solid as well.  Pollo Asada was very tender and seasoned just perfect.  So big we took half home.  Service overall was outstanding.  We will most definitely be back.

m1I5wEPZjSdhtGCJJZMscw.text: The reviews for this place are so good, yet I found Juan's to be squarely average. Not amazing, not terrible, not good enough to return for. I thought the bean dip and chips were delicious; otherwise, it was all okay. My dining partners ordered the chicken and steak fajitas - their reviews, were 'good' 'fine' and 'nothing to write home about'. Another friend and I each had the baja tacos - those were not good. The batter was so thick that you could barely taste the fish and I couldn't even eat the second one because I found it to be so bad. The margaritas are okay. I will search for better Mexican food when I am next in Vegas.

fZfrviy6sHZ6d5_KJY2jRg.text: I dined and went to heaven.  Sure, it is a little wait for seat at this unassuming place with great pro and college sports memoribilia (I am a graduate from UNLV).  But the steak fajitas were amazing.  I cannot wait to head back to this restaurant.  Great service.  Margaritas were great.  Just an absolute jewel in the valley.

6HmPEvNeBBgdilLAn69NJQ.text: Craving Mexican tonight and with my 3 best girls and we did the old where should we go game... after rattling off the usual spots, we opened trusty yelp and the Flaming Fajita popped up as a hit and so we decided to give it a go as two friends had given rave reviews.  Location was in a strip mall and parking was a little tight but once we got into the restaurant it felt nice and cozy ... it  was split between a full bar section and full dinning with TVs and Mexican decor.  Comfortable seating and when some restaurants are uncomfortable when packed, it was actually nice.  Menu was an excellent selection and a great variety of many options from tacos, enchiladas, burritos and chimichangas to some very ethnic meals.  We were greeted by the best waiter we have had in a long time, Christian was on the ball, had excellent recommendations and was so very friendly, he made us feel like fast friends and regulars.    We ordered our typical order for a new place to make sure we like the menu, starting with a large Guacamole for the table that accompanied beans, salsa and tortilla chips, then for entrees,  Chicken enchiladas suiza style,  California burritos (one with steak the other with chicken),  One taco al pastor  and a kids meal with a cheese quesadilla and fries. All meals came with Fideo soup and rice and beans . Ok, so now that I told you the order, let me tell you how amazing the food was.  Now, if you follow me or have read some of my reviews, you know that I am a wimp when it comes to spicy food and so I have to have my friends who love spice be my testers to make sure I can handle it.. sadly the salsa was a fire maker for me (see wimp) but I could handle the beans (ha ha ha) and the guacamole was delicious and fresh and the hint of lime was perfect. Just make sure you don't eat too many of the chips (you will thank me later as the portions are huge) the fideo soup comes next,  and it was a very light, tomato and noodle broth that was a great pallet lightener from the guacamole and beans (and those that can handle the salsa )  Then the meals came out  The Burritos were huge!!! We have enough left over for breakfast and lunch and the meat was so tender and juicy and full of fresh flavors. The taco al pastor did not disappoint, we all tried each dish and couldn't say which was the best but I did love the chicken enchiladas with the corn tortillas and the creamy sauce, I could only eat half.  We did see many tables order the "Flaming Fajitas" which looked and smelled amazing, (another must try for our next stop). We sadly did not have room for dessert but will be back and start with dessert then.  We were not disappointed at all with anything, the service was excellent from our waiter Christian (who we will ask for again!!) to the service help staff keeping our drinks topped and table cleared of empty plates..and the hostesses were on the ball to make sure we got a great table.  Will be eating here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California steak burrito
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California chicken burrito
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids cheese quesadilla and fries

l_TiFQ3hkobQEZefEhwjUg.text: There are a lot of great places for Mexican food but this one is by far the best. The fajitas are amazing and a must.

rPAXertUr_nS7cnQy-kj1A.text: LOVE Juan's! Food is always amazing and staff is always on top of there game. Every time we go the treat us and the kids so great and make sure we all are comfortable and everything is to our liking! Also, the margaritas are really good as well, especially after a long week!

fwR9h1IiGCPPh3gmK4LqiA.text: There is nothing remarkable about this place when you first walk in, from the decor to the chairs and everything else, however what's remarkable is the fajitas, from the delivery, presentation to the flavor and overall satisfaction, this is a really remarkable place.  Go try the fajitas, any of them, definitely a recommend for me.

ozip4HeSoBXuem2dmojT0w.text: Been going to flaming fajitas since I first came to Vegas and I have to say it's one of my favorite places to go service is usually really good and there food is delicious (surprisingly the fries is some of my favorite fries I've ever ate) so I highly recommend eating here

yH3e6OFlG6kndiRml7odzQ.text: Loved loved loved this restaurant!  Friendly service, margaritas were with us in two minutes.  They bring you bean dip, peppers and onions and salsa with the chips. And the "flaming fajitas"!!!! Oh my!!  Can't wait to return.   This is our 11th check in!  We really enjoy the friendly atmosphere and the great food!

3z_ftGvqhFs5UM5j0EwwPg.text: Juan's came highly recommended by a friend of ours. We hesitated because it was a little off the beaten path. Well it did not disappoint. Super clean restaurant. Staff was extremely friendly. Of course we had to try the fajitas! Amazing!! We forgot that restaurants In Nevada include beans along with their chips and salsa. That was fabulous too. Highly recommend Juan's if you're craving Mexican food while in Vegas!

_ybC4hdufIynxE0uj63ALg.text: Excellent fajitas!!! Recommendation for two people: get the fajitas for ONE. You will still have leftovers! We got a steak and chicken combination and it was delicious. My only complaint is the house margarita tasted like it came straight out of the bottle of premixed Jose Cuervo... I prefer something a little fresher. Other than that, the food and service were great.

dAq-ba2KKEh8CS4EqopboQ.text: I may have found me my go to sit down casual dining Mexican restaurant! Took my wife here for a date night. The food was very good, not quite superior. I like the addition of beans and peppers/onions with the chips/salsa. My tamale and flaunts were both delicious....the meats that went into them both were nicely flavored, and the masa for the tamale was fluffy and not dry at all. The service was quiet yet very attentive and friendly.

XrN6rrawBAWHrhBIHLXPvg.text: Wow, everything is great here! From the chips, salsa and bean dip, the fajitas, to the flan, it's seriously fantastic! Not to mention the service is wonderful too. My new favorite restaurant!

UpXCbwSPLW9HOS4tnEPzWA.text: Awesome fajitas, great portions! Their happy hour is really worth it, excellent specials.  Do not underestimate their fajita quesadilla-delicious!  We would go more often if it wasn't all the way across town from us.

OuUsgNH3wigABDP4aU3tOA.text: 5 stars for guacamole.  It is just yummy! They serve grilled onions and peppers along with chips, salsa, and bean dip.  Reason for 4 stars is the alcoholic drinks aren't all that great.  It gets very busy and very noisy in this place. It has a mixture of booths and tables with armless chairs.

um8QRVZ8wlyi0hMnbP9zuQ.text: Here's how it went down.   Seated down nicely and the waiter took our order in a timely matter.  The chips and salsa arrived, we ordered and the food came shortly after. I got the tamale and burrito combo.  The tamale came with green sauce which was pretty good.  However, the beef burrito with the red sauce was extremely salty.  It was probably the sauce which probably came out of a can that did it.  It was so salty that the next few hours I had a raised heart rate!  I am healthy that wasn't the issue. The service was very good and polite but attendants asked one too many times how we were doing.   Another thing I thought the utensils were too cheap and fit for camping.   You would think they would have better ones.   Since they do lit the fajitas on fire next to your table, the place tends to get smoky as will your clothes.  It would have been a better experience and the rating better if only they wouldn't put a ton of salt on the food!   One's health matters most than anything else doesn't it?

WUsh-de1JLcDy8hX9AOfBw.text: I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican but this place was good.  Free chips, sauteed onions and peppers, and soup!  I ordered a taco salad... I asked for no rice and they offered to replace it with steamed veggies. I was very happy.  They were able to make a dirty martini and it was only $5.50 which is half of what I was expecting it to be (grey goose vodka too)  The service was very good. The workers were definitely hustling... Very quick to refill water, chips, and take away finished plates.   The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is because my boyfriend asked for the steamed veggies too, but was given rice instead, and some of the chairs were cheap and looked like they belong in a cafeteria.

elcfvNNZgbTk3nO64Kng8w.text: Best Mexican I have had in a long time. Fajitas are awesome. The service was extremely good. TVs to watch the bball game was added surprise. Don't eat at the strip in Vegas. Come out here. MUCH BETTER.

cK8rpDUfyfXIejZelWHuIQ.text: service was awesome and the server was funny. fodo was good, not really anything to write home about but it was good. I probably would have given 5 stars if the salsa was actually spicy. we will definitely go again and try more than just fajitas

8jxxgfJiiYXgYE42FwmQjg.text: The best mexican deal in town, super clean, everything is fresh, drinks cold. Chips, bean dip and salsa included. Roasted chiles and jalapenos free. Most entrees come with soup . Best fajitas in town, best pricing. Beats all casinos in town

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VUC51xi-XCeWxa-NtLEmnw.text: We've come back to try this place out again and again, I think we'll just by pass it from now on.. The chips and salsa are so so, the chips themselves are flavorless and fried a bit too long, the salsa is ok.. I had the fajitas , the presentation it self is cool, but the meat is so well done its almost like having jerky, and really there's not that much meat , mostly veggies.. Since they flame as they come out maybe they shouldn't grill them for so long since they recook at the table.. The service was ok, nothing to wow about. The tacos were hmmmmm, just tacos I guess.. With so many Mexican restaurants around this place won't miss us...

DeGSEYcuvXbnip1gazbkFw.text: We were greeted right away. Asked if it was our first time. Taken right to our table. I like the wide openness of the place. Not a million people on top of each other. The server one of two took our drink order. Then brought us chips, salsa and bean dip. They were all delicious. I enjoyed the chips. Fresh and not greasy. They then brought us peppers and onions. My DH liked those also.  I had the fajitas, had to try the famous flaming fajitas. They were good. I like the char on the beef. The sides of rice and beans were seasoned perfectly. The DH had the tamales. He enjoyed them. Said they were quite tasty. The portions are generous. Both plates were enough for two. We had plenty of leftovers and no room for dessert.  The service was spot on. Perhaps too many people asking if we were doing OK. Especially when ones mouth is full. LOL  A really nice pleasant dinner. We will be back.

SEnB-H3R_e5-uUbrbrUTQw.text: The best part of this place is the peppers and onions they give you with the chips and salsa.  I understand that this is the same general staff from Viva Mercados (rip) , that is why Ihave given this place many tries now.  The food is very very bland.  Meat has no seasonings or so it seems.  They put on a go show for the  fajitas, but the fajitas are barely average.    Mole sauce is better then some in town, but it still tastes out of a jar.  Tamales are sub-par, tacos...well who can f-up taco, their tacos were good.  Chili verde was aweful but not great.   I could go on and on.    Like I said I really wanted this place to follow the legacy of Bobby's Viva Mercados, but it really falls short.

Xu54DuLukow6yZ13pVz3mA.text: Finally good Mexican food! The portions are huge so be prepared to leaved STUFFED! They have great happy hour specials too. Staff is always friendly and attentive. I have gone many times and will continue to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming fajitas for two! What a presentation!

3by8b1CkhoExLCmJ7Hzytg.text: Best food, best service, best value of all the Mexican restaurants in Vegas. Oh so good!!

2C-L4Ncp0I0oMcLVPGX8kQ.text: We live around the corner and can't believe how great it is just next door. You know it's good when every table packed w families and couples having fun and flames everywhere! (Amazing fajitas!!) ask for Lupe!!!

0Z6DepyN-MQDRdDu-HIrLQ.text: Found some great tasting food and service at Juan's Flaming Fajitas! Was going to grab some lunch while in Vegas for a short time when our party decided to look for something else away from "The Strip" Went inside, ordered and can't say there was anything wrong or needing improvement! The entire waitstaff and all those who work there are the best! Would make another to Vegas just for this place!

JeGt5rgM1BV-jZkUnSMv3g.text: The reviews are spot on. Food is really good and prices are very fair. Definitely will return. Atmosphere is just okay. Service was a little slow.

awQgVXoVLt0XPSRv0fx64A.text: The best Fajitas in LV. Great service too....can't go wrong with this place. Chips come with not only salsa but with bean dip. Quick tip...the bean dip they serve is NOT vegetarian. They do however serve a vegetarian version of it...just ask. They make their own tortillas...to-order. Generous portions and about a 20 min drive from the strip. Well worth the drive.

i3cyVcn_Zzaj7SCrHWG6zA.text: We finally tried this place and wish we hadn't waited so long! First Mexican restaurant in Vegas we like. Great service, good chips, salsa and bean dip and we loved the fajitas! We ordered the steak and chicken for two. It's definitely a popular place all the tables were full lots of people waiting for a table. Looking forward to the next time...

UwRcgRY454XDsFzmF-JgGg.text: Meal:  Good portion and pretty good lunch combo deal. Love the chips and dips they provided.  The churros were really good.  Service:  The food was really good but the service was ridiculously slow.  We came here for my coworker's birthday so we have a large party of 11.  I understand that with a large party food sometimes take longer to come out.  However, it is not a reason to make the lunch a 3 hour event.  We looked around and saw that they were a bit understaff so we were a bit patient with waiting.  I was the only one in the group that ordered a margarita because a lot of people said they were great here.  But they managed to forget my drink, it was even harder to wave someone down to remind them.  Alas, I never got it. I'm just going to assume that it was never in the system.  With all the waiting and how long the meal was, one of my other coworker just got up and flagged down the waiter to get our check and paid the bill so we didn't have to wait for split checks. I don't even want to imagine how long that would've taken.  Conclusion: I would tell people to try this place but please only do it when you know you do not need to be somewhere after the meal just because you never know when you can leave.

kf_D_jhKQNj5AMv0vc0fFQ.text: This place is great. Finally, fresh Mexican with serious margaritas in the Southwest part of town! The food was delicious. Huge portions.  The margaritas were tasty and STRONG (as they should be!)  One star off for no a la carte options. We had the carne asada burrito, fish tacos and kids beef taco with fries. Entrees come with rice and beans (or fries for kids) and a yummy fideo soup.  Margaritas were a tad pricey but totally worth it.  Guacamole appetizer was super fresh and well priced. Next time we may just share an entree which would make the meal more reasonable.

cy59x7nzLuOD4OWei1r0og.text: I would've given this place 5 stars, but the server wasn't that friendly. I forgot his name. I was so distracted with the company of my friends that I didn't pay attention. My friends were visiting from out of state and were craving Mexican food. I've never been here, but I went onto Yelp and searched "Mexican food" and this place popped up. I'm glad it did because the food was DELICIOUS! I ordered Enchiladas which were fire! My husband ordered a chimichanga. My friends ordered fajitas and a burrito. I wish I remembered all the names of our order but again, I was focusing on the presence of my friends. I just had a lot of excitement to see them again!!:) And the portions were HUGEEEE. So filling, we ended up taking our food home. Except for my husband, he just eats a lot lol. The restaurant is a bit overwhelming. When we arrived, we sat down and were immediately given salsa and tortilla chips. We thought that was awesome, then like 10 mins later complimentary noodle soup was given to us. I think it was some type of authentic Mexican soup, but it was yummy:) I wish I had more but the portion size was small. Out of nowhere came a man singing in Spanish and playing the guitar. We thought that was a bit overwhelming and told him to just move along (otherwise you'd have to tip). Overall, we were all having a great time. :) I am very pleased with the food, but I think our server needs to learn how to deal with customers and provide exceptional customer service. I dont know if it was the fact that we looked a bit young?, but we did order alcohol... Oh well, I am still satisfied with their food and will def be back:)

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blurry, but our food was served on this. Look at that flamin fajita
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My alcoholic beverage, The Hurricane
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsa, bean dip and chips

-Fzdih1RNgAF4MDAROs4qw.text: Riquisima la comida!!! Grilled onions and jalapenos with the chips, salsa and beans... delicious! Then soup... delicious! Husband got the chicken tacos and green chile tomale... Delicious! I had the guacamole tacos... Delicious! Fantastic service and the owner even came by to take our plates and asked how everything was. This is our new go to Mexican restaurant!

iNgeYp0u1J9bQLy0E3zNCQ.text: If you try one appetizer, you have to try the queso fundido con chorizo! I can eat that and skip dinner. But they have amazing fajitas and burritos. These burritos are awesome bc it's a three meal size burrito... but maybe that's bc I fill up on the queso everytime. Great food, super nice staff. Definitely repeated visit type of place!

MkPXq1LnSZ4VwY3ELRqi3w.text: Incredible!!! Probably one of the best sit down Mexican restaurants I have ever been to! Total was $26 for two people ( we both got combination meals).   There was not one part of the meal that was disappointing. We will for sure be back.

Ypbr17jPCJhDMADjykf9XA.text: Visiting from out of town and wanted a nice sit down Mexican meal. This place delivered! Moderately priced as well! Everyone loved their food, hubby loved fish tacos, mom raved about the steak ranchero. Not super crowded or loud either which is nice. Lots of comfy booths or tables & chairs. They bring you fideo soup complimentary and chips and salsa and bean dip! Thank you for a great Sunday lunch!! Will return when we come back to Vegas!

5nR2qYNoZIMXCJ4iriEArA.text: This place is an absolute gem! Juan and the staff are always amazing, the service is top-notch! As for the food, it doesn't get any better. We challenge ourselves to try something new each time and are never disappointed. My wife is Mexican and agrees that this is real, authentic, and fantastic!!! The one must-have each time, the shrimp ceviche...delicious!

oiK1BZUV2ULLLYsemZGYbw.text: Service here is excellent. The chicken and pork combo fajitas for two were delicious and enough to feed three.

RJGKyz9x5b7bJQ-FpijBIQ.text: Hands down the best Mexican food in Vegas! Our service was exceptional. You have to give this place a try. You won't be sorry.

sOU0S-J4D_l0eaqXefTOFA.text: Great food, great servers. We love the grilled onions and peppers the give for free, as well as the bean dip, chips and salsa. Flaming shrimp fajitas are great.

2dzhIWVw2SFHcyhX7yHXZg.text: It is nice to have a GOOD Mexican restaurant in this area.  Every meal I have had has been tasty and very fresh.

13yoYsDs6jhm10xUTtti5A.text: Took my parents and boyfriend here last night and left highly impressed!! Delicious food, great presentation, killer prices, good service. Both couples had beef & chicken fajitas with all the fixings for 2 people for $24.99. Chips, salsa, bean dip and soup come complimentary. Happy hour until 7. We had tons of leftovers. We all stuck to fajitas so I can't comment on the other food. Although, my mom's margarita was so-so and the chips could've been better warm. Very casual atmosphere. Will definitely be back!

npyUM1JfOknRL19tSG70Lg.text: Skeptical I decided to give Juan's a try. I was presently surprised! The service was flat out above and beyond your average restaurant of this type. The food was delicious, at least the enchilada dinner I had. I here the  fajitas are off the hook also. "Next trip" never had a dry glass or empty chip bowl. The manager or owner not sure which came to the table at one point to ask how everything was I kinda felt like a celebrity! Ha. This is how all restaurants should do buisness.

sT7ZeSPkMDDS9bGggfAK7w.text: Amazing food, service and ambiance. Ernoldo and Chopo were excellent in their table side manner and customer service was exemplary!!  We will definitely be regulars!! We had the Guadalarja Special and it was delicious!!!

KQXwzdRfFSluru1KX8-2SQ.text: Visited here while in Vegas with our son & his family.  It was great and the flaming fajitas were fun!  We enjoyed the food and the service was amazing.  It is always a little challenging to dine with a 2.5 year old and a 9 month old but this restaurant handled everything in stride.

bkn3Y15nkmr5SYALQUrMnw.text: Some friends of mind suggested Juans.  I loved the decor, the chips and salsa were good, the grilled onions and jalapenos were just like  dad makes at home. The flaming fajita are just that, the table side server was excellent, and the staff prompt and courteous.  It's a bit of a ways off the strip, and more of a locals join, but well worth the visit.  We had a bit of a wait, but it was a Friday night and there was 4 of us, but really the food and server were worth the wait.

-NCreX5q6BvTqxCNpKjnhg.text: Excellent service and food. Came from out of town for the races. Hate eating on the strip. Always looking for local restaurants. Fajitas were great as well as the salsa and bean dip. Margaritas also were good. We will be back again.

Qhx-FFJnxbqC7oHhY8pdNQ.text: My husband and I have been here several times, we've sat at the bar, we enjoyed the delicious chips and salsa, my husband loves the margaritas he said there the best! the staff is very friendly we usually go on Fridays its always busy, so far I've tried the fish tacos chicken enchiladas my son has had the shredded beef burrito,  my husband tried the ceviche and a shrimp chesse foundo all delicious we were all happy with food and flavor. they also have a nice patio if you like to sit outsideI would recommend this place try it I don't think you'll be disappointed:-)

G6plYqsB4w51-QJLx67tuQ.text: In town for a convention and looking for something away from the strip. Found this place on Yelp and was not disappointed. Mango margaritas were tasty as were the shrimp tacos. The waiter mistakenly brought me the fish tacos (which were actually quite good as well) and was very apologetic when I pointed this out. He then replaced them as quickly as possible.

AzJAWFnTYEO4utsX1Bl7RQ.text: This place is amazing! Food and service is always fantastic! My husband and I have been coming here for a couple of years regularly and are never disappointed! Fajitas and margaritas here are the best!

8DrdC74Bqa0pMkWk4S8vrA.text: This has got to be my favorite new spot in town. They opened right down the street from my in laws and we are there all the time. As everyone has said, not only is the food great but the service is incredible. There is never an empty cup in that restaurant and they are quick to refill the chips. They light the fajitas on fire for a little flare right before serving them to you. But my favorite part is the grilled onions they bring out with the cips, salsa and bean dip. Yum!

VoLeQk53APM48WAswKgk5Q.text: After trying Juan's, it instantly became one of my favorite restaurants. The chips, salsa and bean dip they bring before your meal are great. they never let our drinks go empty. the fajitas came out with rice, beans, guacamole, and sour cream with your choice of homemade flour or corn tortillas. i love fajitas and this place has got some of the best in town.  highly recommend this fine restaurant to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h6SOTRLMbfE3L8gsl18I2g.text: Yea, so this is my happy place.  Everything is delicious, but get the fajitas.  Sit bar side, the crew on that side is incredible.  You have a handful of people from bartender to bussers who really do pay attention and are incredibly thoughtful. I tell everyone i know to try it out and it quickly becomes their new go-to. Grab a beer, order up a ton of food and enjoy..

Nx3ih8P_sucVgE4PLr8zcw.text: Outdoor patio, separate nice cantina with televisions to watch your favorite game or event, five gaming machines to try your luck, and a separate well appointed restaurant.   Living in south Texas for the last twenty five years this is the closest I have found resembling the delicious flavor or TexMex.   Signature flaming fajitas are a treat to the eyes and the taste buds.    Great weekend brunch offerings.   Salsa chips and bean dip welcome every customer!

OJYFarDul_Niljob2kPE9w.text: Clearly the best place to go for fajitas in Vegas. Worth the drive from the strip. We went two days in a row!

URpor9CIrGzLvDnq2B0BYQ.text: Delicious food. Great price. We order to go, and they give us a giant sac of food including chips, salsa, soup, and bean dip included with our meals. They are friendly and quick. Also, they have several vegetarian options.

9WsBIDE_hFul4yfBfDhHpw.text: Good food and great staff! Nothing bad to say. Eat the salsa with chips and try the chicken fajitas you will thank me later!

KhZhn3QkqjsfLS9fZm7AwA.text: Lupe and Angel were a great serving team, the anejo margarita was expensive but delicious, and the carne asada tacos were tasty. I'll definitely come back!

Ya9uR_BJKswaoPano493Vw.text: Live this place! My man an I come here all the time! Amazing food, great service even when they are busy. And the price is affordable.

oh9wtJGolap8dJMWFM_qpA.text: Delicious food, tasty margaritas, and very friendly people! Juan's has a fun atmosphere and we will definitely be back!

wKv8d5VrHJSVZUDZquKiTQ.text: Seriously some great food. The service was spot on and the price was remarkable. We are looking at going back. This is our new Mexican Restaurant.

zGB5433IZjkOT75ggm7DUQ.text: This place is fantastic. Great tasting food. Excellent service. Staff were very warm and welcoming. Got chips and salsa as well as these delicious grilled peppers and onions as soon as we sat and ordered our food and beers. When our food came.... It was so good.. Will definately be back!!! They have great football specials too!

FJ5TtTwbSuVI7VPp0eMT5A.text: An authentic Mexican restaurant, with amazing top shelf margaritas, homemade salsa and hot sauce, and of course the flaming fajitas. The steak tacos are also cooked perfectly. Our waiter handled our huge group of 14 really well. Everyone was happy and it made for great evening.

YdLNSdSZhuj8zPnXWU91Sw.text: This place was great! My BF and I went on a week night for dinner. The place was packed, but the service was still above and beyond! Cheap drinks at happy hour, the green chile tamale was OUTSTANDING- nice and fluffy, flavorful and well made. The orange salsa was so good, I literally drank some of it when no one was looking. Best salsa I've tasted in years, and I would consider myself a Mexican food officionado. They even had a decent selection of vegetarian options, which can be hard to find at Mexican restaurants, especially in Las Vegas. Highly recommend trying this place, you won't regret it!

ALhGaaqhGGKrlEukfuuYLg.text: Delicious and affordable for the average person. Live mush on Friday nights. Their souls are tasty too.

eErJaw4nzBI2QR7W_UmgFw.text: Hands down the best chicken fajitas ive had in Vegas and Ive had a lot of different restaurant's fajitas. Service is always great, prices are good, and I am really looking forward to the breakfast menu that they are launching soon.

i5lNT66fTuA5CXMaqdEDwg.text: Always a great spot for great and fast service. The food is always consistent and  the menu offers so much to choose from. This is one of the best local spots that offers a delicious happy hour menu as well.

dxG2JpsQeeDXhUZlSEU0xA.text: I love everything about this place.  Greeters were super friendly,  service was excellent, and the food is terrific!  In the last 2 weeks we have been here 4 times!  Jose is our favorite server.  Our family has a lot of allergies and Jose gets it right and is very accommodating...  It is our favorite Mexican food in Vegas now!

_NtrkE3zJKz1igeESz3zww.text: Got there friday at 7 -had to wait about 30 - 40 min. We ordered beef &. Chicken fajita with margarita. Chip and soup were served with grilled vegetables. - nice :)  Our server was very friendly. Food was good - steak was not tender but seasoning was good- not the best fajita i ever have but good enough. Yes i will recommend this place and will come back. It deserve 5 star overall - service and food. Looking for reasonable - not over priced Mexican food? This is the place.

6bnsQBzVkVndEHDC7jwa7w.text: Second time I have been here. The fajitas have such good flavor and the prices are so reasonable. If you like great mexican food and a nice atmosphere, Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is the place you need to go.

SGgFRMSLehdeNNiJp432Tw.text: I'm seven months away from the magical world of breakfast tacos and salsa on every corner (i.e. Austin) and taking my annualish pilgrimage to Las Vegas to party it up with my family when I have a serious craving for some southern style noms. With my favorite Mexican restaurant closed and only mediocre experiences at others in the area, I turned to Yelp to see what was new.   Juan's was sort of on the way to the Orleans Arena, so I talked Mom into stopping there for lunch on the way to the Wranglers game. We parked right out front and headed in. Mom immediately noticed a giant jar of peppermints--a sure sign of a restaurant that cares about its patrons. We were seated promptly in a booth (always my favorite) and delivered chips, salsa and bean dip. YUM. Shortly after, complimentary vegetable soup with a tomato base. TWO YUMS.   As far as options go, there's something for everyone. Several vegetarian dishes were offered. Mom picked the tamale and I ordered the enchiladas, which came with your standard delicious rice and refried beans. It all seemed pretty healthy, my enchiladas stuffed with zucchini, broccoli and bell peppers--unusual fillings, but I liked the mix.   Everything was clean, including the bathrooms, and large screen TVs were scattered throughout the dining area featuring sporting events. The manager (owner?) stopped by our table for a chat and gave us the history of the restaurant and the building (formerly a BBQ place--my father would be crushed.)   Service? Super important to me, and spot on. All in all, an excellent experience. Can't wait to go back!!  Edit: totally forgot about the onion/green pepper relish. SO GOOD. I don't usually like onions, but I ate as many as I could stuff in my mouth. They also appear to have wifi for guests, but I don't know how to get the password.

fZ89g1GRkqFHMsyirFsdbA.text: Simply the best fajitas in town!  Juan makes you feel like his Oklahoma family every time you visit! The food is awesome and the service impeccable!  Their bean dip as well as the onions and peppers before the meal are the perfect complement to your food. Their homemade tortillas are also great. I am so glad Juan and his team have brought their brand of Oklahoma Mexican cooking to Vegas!

T8Pce-kOlUboLeTGbg8NTw.text: We had dinner here a few days ago. We went based on the reviews.  This is a terrific Mexican restaurant. Probably the best fajitas we've ever had. Flaming them at your table is interesting!  Keeping them war over a flame is a great idea. Incredibly fresh food. Great service.   We will definitely eat there again when in Vegas.

haAmZRuqhTLvA6GiTulxIA.text: The chips, salsa, and bean dip that they start you with is amazing. The fajitas are yummy!!! I recommend reservations on the weekend.

xNOeiXmd9cKmnqSmH02jjg.text: New to Las Vegas and looking for neighborhood _Mexican Resturant. We kept passing this Resturant on the way home and stopped for lunch. What a great surprise. The food was great. The fijiatas are the best. You get more than what you pay for. The atmosphere is so friendly, from the busy boy to the waiter to the manager. We felt so at home. The margaritas are excellent. Loved this place and the people and will definitely be going back.

zjWuGw63zbRsLIwL1qIujQ.text: Absolutely amazing food and atmosphere! I am always pleased when I come here. I would say this is on my top list for favorite restaurants! Super yummy and I will continue to spread the word to my friends and family.

w0V1TRVVhDPy9n0oUmei6Q.text: WOW! Amazing food and amazing service from Amanda. It was our first time here and we will be back for sure. Thank you Team for delivering a great experience.

FSpEmzLkquYZLhnnJ-Y9yw.text: Delicious food at good prices is enough to bring me back.  Add to this the good service we received and the outdoor seating and we were VERY happy.  The shrimp ceviche was great and enchiladas were stuffed with flavorful beef. The chips and salsa included 2 salsas, bean dip , and grilled onions & jalapenos.  All were great and fresh.   If you like mexican food you should go.  you will be pleased.

mUod5MYC50__3MfasB-1CQ.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants I have been to. The fresh chips and salsa are fantastic and come with a delicious bean dip and grilled onions and jalapenos. Very good. The entries we had were just as good. Service was top notch. Highly recommend this place.

mnyKFKOl9VGKl63NbQMNcQ.text: I really liked this place.  The hostess was nice and so was our waiter.  The service was good and they were on top of refilling our chips, salsa and bean dip.  At the end of the meal, the owner came to talk to us and ask us how our food was.  This place is new and there's not much decoration, but there's enough.  I love love love that they have a vegetarian section in their menu.  The menu has 6 different vegetarian plates.  I ordered the vegetarian fajitas with no sour cream or cheese and it came out flaming and on fire.  It was a pretty cool presentation of it.  The servings are big and I was full after eating 2 fajitas. My bf ordered the vegetarian enchiladas and he said it tasted good.  We both had leftovers to take home for tomorrow.  I also our love our bill and how it $20 for the both us!!  It's hard to eat out at restaurants nowadays for two people and pay $20 for the meal.  This place also has happy hour from 3pm-7pm.  If I can remember correctly, the happy hour menu has nachos, fajitas, and something else for like $5.  They also have alcohol for happy hour too.  I think this place will give Frank and Fina's and Lindo a run for their money.     I will definitely come back and try more stuff on their menus.  I'm gonna try hard not to stuff my face with chips, salsa and bean dip so that I have room to order dessert!! :)

VpxAmFAos1R1WlE8kB8EfA.text: Great service and excellent food.  We tried the menudo, carnitas tacos and a pollo asado chimichanga.  $4 margarita Wed made it all the better!

PNQZPvcrxRUJ9nVW_6IDUw.text: Went here with my husband for lunch. We got the fajitas for 2 since fajitas is in the name. We started out with some tableside guacamole, I like garlic and roasted jalapeno in mine so it was just okay. We probably won't get it again, also, because they give you SO MUCH stinking food for the fajitas. When the server arrived with our chicken and steak fajitas they light it on fire with I'm guessing is tequila? Correct me if I am wrong. We OHHHH'd and AHHH'd!! With your meal comes soup which was DELICIOUS (the hubby paid a bit more to get the pozole soup, just lacked some salt) and each person gets their own sides of beans, rice, sour cream, pico, and guac. You also get a choice of 6 flour or corn tortillas. There was so much food I didn't touch my beans or rice, you could easily share this with 3 or 4 people. The chicken was BANGIN' the steak not so much, I found it dry and tough. Next time we want to try to shrimp!!   OH before I almost forgot. The chips and salsa are pretty good, not the best I've had but the best I have found in Las Vegas!! The service was mehh which is why I knocked a star off but I am more then willing to give it another shot.

0SHhCwolr5QOz1vJIzh_Ig.text: Delicious, great atmosphere, friendly staff, decent prices and entertaining food service...it must be Juan's!! This place is amazing!! So hard to find decent Mexican food here in the valley and I found the hole in the wall that has it all!! Must have...flaming fajitas, hmmm wonder what gave it away!? For a casual, uplifting meal any day of the week, this is the place!! :)

Y4SQWzTYl3zNH0T2a62B0A.text: Great place! You must try their flaming fajitas. Service was fast and friendly but expect to wait to be seated. They get pretty busy.

ss3ZpdUbDHg-jcP0TG4P4w.text: Excellent.  Been here twice now and both times have been similar.  The service has been great and friendly each time.  The food is very good and tasty.  We have gotten the ceviche, which has been fresh and good both times, as well as the tableside guacamole.  They make it however you want and both times it has been good, although the second time they put too much lime juice.  However, they immediately offered to put more avocados in it to balance out if we wanted.  The fajitas themselves are great.  The flavor is excellent and I have enjoyed them more than your standard fajitas at any other Mexican place or applebee's type joint (although that is not saying much).  Prices are good...ceviche, guac and an order of fajitas for 1 to share...plenty of food for 2 people, was about $40 before tip.

AGuvza0Vr6Msee6fta6kdw.text: This place is awesome!!!! Valentino and Hernen were spot on with everything. The BEST customer service we have ever had. Blown away from the time we sat down to the time we left. The fajita display was awesome!! Meat was super tender you could taste the marinade. The burrito was the perfect size. We loved the fact that we got salsa (2 types) and bean dip. The staff though, can't say enough on how impressed we were with them.

NoXIjBmO-L0Hbt9_O8rwMw.text: This place is awesome. Service is excellent and by far the best fajitas in town

-Wk4_eom5bvio4mB7c1MAA.text: Rolando is the best bartender ever! The fajitas are seasoned so well and the fire show at your table makes it even more fun! I hardly ever Yelp about restaurants but this is a place I want to keep around. I absolutely love this place! Service and food are way above par!

Fsu822v21dG_op7HzQ8yVQ.text: The food, service and atmosphere here are top notch.  I've tried many of the Mexican restaurants around town and this is the one I keep coming back to.  The menu prices are reasonable and their happy hour prices are really good.

gNgZSkCH77i5yXbDzrEn4g.text: My friend had been raving about this place to me for weeks! Finally she took me to try it out today and I was not disappointed. She did warn me that it would be busy and there would be a wait, she wasn't kidding! It was packed. The hostess told us it would be a 45 min wait but honestly I don't think we waited more than 20 min. So it really wasn't that bad, despite how many people were waiting outside.   The food and the service was so good I would have waited 2 hours! When they sat us at our table there was already chips and salsa with a small plate of grilled onions and peppers waiting for us! The waitress was super sweet and perfectly attentive. They have generous portions, we shared the steak fajitas for 1 and still had food left over. And their prices are really unbeatable. I can see why this place is always packed. I can't wait to go back!

t3kevnq29zIL9G75yP3Apg.text: One of my favorite places for happy hour! The service is always amazing and the food is always delicious! The fajitas are amazing and they have some great lunch offers but the happy hour can't be beat!

WtCVZJSyFvqXWZz9X92tiA.text: This is an incredible place for family or even date night. Love the atmosphere. Food is awesome. I had the steak fajita. I love the presentation. Steak and veggies came in a sizzling pot. Food is fresh. You have the option to add what you want. Staff is awesome and friendly. Great place.

zCSiynOTc96BHatSuEz2rg.text: Juan's is the beat fajitas in Las Vegas! The happy hour is on point worth the trip off the strip. The prices are really nice and the food taste is awesome! We have a great time and the enjoy the flaming fajitas!   Please make the time for this place!

MyzxR_GrFDSWVWsS7PuVaA.text: Great fajitas and table side entertainment. I got fajitas combo for 2 which could easily feed 3 or even 4. We picked steak and chicken as our proteins and it came with onions and peppers sizzling on a cast iron skillet, flames and all. Free salsa, beans and soup. All delicious. Yum yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sopas- Soup

izoEiuzlgmtBDsmneXmhPQ.text: Immaculate service on a Friday afternoon. The place was swamped, but Mom and I were not disappointed. Arturo and Angel were astoundingly attentive from start to finish. Despite there being hordes of other tables to serve, we were never forgotten.  Hosts and hostesses flew through the aisles to make sure they were on top of it all. They were so on top of it, sometimes they flew by and stared at tables to find something to do.   And of course, stellar food.

fJOxIBhBvtCWZg635BvCyg.text: The thirty minute wait was 100% worth it. Sat down at our table where they already had water, chips, three kinds of salsa and a small plate of grilled onions and jalapenos. Callie was our server and I doubt she is paid enough as she was amazing all the way around. Despite being very full the food came out quickly and was sizzling hot, just as it should be. The steak and shrimp fajitas were fantastic and a bargain price for the amount of food. The margaritas were excellent with more than enough alcohol. Overall great experience!

xUfKLW-Ntlyv-oMPEw588w.text: Everything was amazing. I ate way too much. You of course have to have the flaming fajitas. Huge drinks. Great service. Perfect pricing. But expect to wait. Lines outside the door. And for good reason!

Zprtmx-CN0dXDXOWgMBUFg.text: How can you go to a restaurant and not order fajitas when it's in the name, so we did. They were slightly better than average, but everything is overpriced. Food has attractive presentation. Sat at the bar and had good service.  Nothing about this place was better than average.

rEXNGTE9yvipLY79qrzuGw.text: We decided to make the trek to try a different Mexican place.  We were not disappointed.  This place serves up some delicious fajitas.  The showstopper was the parillada de mariscos l.  This dish had a mix of scallops shrimp and a huge fillet of fish.  Everything was grilled to perfection.  They even give you lettuce and vegetables instead of rice beans and tortillas for special diets.  The patio seating was perfect for an April dinner.   Give them a try
