XrswmRyZypDDac49e3Q8Sg.text: Nothing short of excellent!  Stopped by for Happy Hour but aside from the beer,  I ordered from the regular menu.  A customized combo included a moist and substantial Chicken Tamale with green sauce and a hefty Baja Fish Taco on a soft corn tortilla served with soft, fluffy rice and refried beans. Meals are served with grilled chiles and onions, fresh homemade tortilla chips with assorted salsas. Yes, simple Mexican food, but this was MUCH better then anything in recent memory. Great employees too!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tamale w/green sauce.

FTxee_AcfTlR8KdH_STh-g.text: This place is so fun! I love how interactive everyone is (employees and guest) are!   One , let me start by saying thank you for letting us reserve a large party of crazy ugly Christmas sweater goers ! We reserved for 8pm and we're sat by 7:45 . That was the best , feeling like we mattered !  Most of us were there early enough to enjoy that last bit of happy hour , Jose uno and Jose dos were hilarious . With a full bar , and plenty of our party (of 15) crowding 5 chairs they ensured everyone had drinks and we all got paid out - on different checks may I add and they handled it perfectly !   Once we were seated we instantly had baskets of fresh chips and dips . Arturo was able to grab a few Vegetarian beans for a very picky vegetarian (me) and came back with a quickness with 2 bowls ! Oot !  With the party not having seen each other in a few months , most were lost in conversation but Arturo got drinks down with patience especially with a few of us really feeling those bar drinks . LOL . It took a little time figuring out what we wanted to eat but we were checked on regularly to ensure full glasses and extra rounds were taken care of. (Kudos!)   Once we got the food order in , swear , it was record timing with 15 orders of food coming out ! Everything was hot and steaming and everyone quit talking to eat . That's how good it was , you guys shut up 15 very hungry Christmas-ers !   Many of us couldn't even finish the food we were so full from the bomb @$$ dips and salsa . But trust , it still tasted great the next day !   I got lucky , and got to wear the sombrero for my birthday ! 6-months late ! Hahaha they were such sports and got the entire group of servers that night to come over and sing . It was hilarious ! We had enough churros , topped with whip cream and chocolate and Carmel . Mmmmm so freaking good , but enough to share for the entire table .  It was purrfect to top off my full belly of nachos (clearly I love the chips and dips) and the other belly's full of burritos , wet chimichanga and fajitas !   Also , frozen mango margarita with a spicy rim . GET IT . Those alone will make you keep coming back .   The photos are some before and after cause some people actually finished everything (champions)   I would totally tell people to check either location out , they are SO worth the experience .   Thanks again Arturo for being amazing that night and having fun right along with us .

-VwaUSSy-Vo2kIku_uQQYg.text: Great, friendly service. Tasty food. Nice vibe. Definitely going to be a regular spot, or to invite out of town guests to. My drink, The sangria could've been a bit stronger, but not bad. Will try a different drink next time.

e2BJhqqhxtxjjvzYJPzs0g.text: Not sure what all the hype is about. Overall just OK food based on the wait, the churn, and overcrowding they create by putting more people in tables not really meant for it.

We had the steak and shrimp fajita combo, he got his side with tortillas, rice and beans...I ordered steamed veggies and lettuce wraps!!

_u_ZCpyuCr6fv8GLT-5P7g.text: Good food, service was good once we were sitting down. Drinks were ok, I had a flavor margarita but was weak, tasted more like a juice. The wait was long! Took entire family for an early dinner on a Saturday  and parking lot was packed! Since food was good and I had a lunch meeting coming up on the following Wednesday I called to make reservation for 8, there would not make reservation so I could not run the risk of driving 15 min and have a long wait so I had to find another restaurant for out lunch meeting. Would I try it again ? Sure, but one day when I can  wait .

tGOWAJemmQf4kTIzyFREKQ.text: Great place to eat. Happy hour has the best prices, great food, great service. Every time we come we leave very happy, and we come a lot. On Monday's is Military Monday I think it's 15% off Military.

2MZlUnu1Wjs5owh9b7M0XA.text: The BEST fajitas ever!! My boyfriend and I tried this place out and we are set to go back next week!! And maybe the week after that!! Our server Callie was super sweet and on top of things ! My bf and I got the fajitas for two and it's was more than enough! We had the steak and added shrimp for only a $1.00! Everything was just very good! I also LOVE that they serve fresh whole roasted jalapenos on the side! It made my fajitas come more to life !!! I loved it! This place was jammed pack on a regular Thursday so be prepared to wait 15min. Usually less then that tho but I would wait an hour ITS WAY WORTH IT.

DLddVex8uQ66oVmC7wIEKw.text: Holy Fajitas! This place was good. Wheel me out a huge flaming pot of fajitas and I'm a happy camper. Lived up to the expectation. My wife and I got fajitas for 2 - steak and chicken. Loaded with meat and lots of onions and bell peppers.  For dessert we got the sopapillas - I would skip this dish and maybe try something else. You take fried dough and drench it in warm butter - sounds good in theory but they came out soggy and it was just too much. Yes, I said it - too much butter.  Come get your fajitas on.

bbmZe06gfTrIsEOWWzNvOw.text: Ate here for the first time with my girlfriend and this is our favorite place to come eat if we want Mexican food! The fajitas are to die for and if you're in the mood get it! The fajitas for 2 was perfect for my girl and I and our server Callie was amazing and polite! Defiantly coming back here soon!

PoJ1uIFoT6JNOnEO3HEBfg.text: Fav Mexican spot to go to with my friends. There's always a wait, but it's always worth it. The seafood platter is to die for.

nPd62F5zth_8eVTT7Sc_2Q.text: My coworker was raving about this place, so I had to try it.  Lunch Specials FTW!!! I thought that was pretty neat that they had the options to choose 1, 2, or 3 items to make a combo. Ironically, I'm not a fajita person, so I ordered the Chimichanga & Rancho Style Taco ($10.49)  I wish I enjoyed the Chimichanga more, but it had a bitter/burnt/smokey taste that I'm NOT a fan of. And it was soggy vs. crunchy =(  The taco, rice, and beans were good though.  The service was superb and is what'll bring me back. They were super busy & food took a little longer to come out (during the lunch hour). But, their servers & staff ensured we were okay.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos w/ steamed veggies (great option to have if you don&#39;t want rice &amp; beans)

NKX5XuRoeP3DZbCyTKIBJQ.text: This place is great. They have incredible musicians playing. The music is loud enough to enjoy but soft enough you don't have to yell to have a conversation. The music is wonderful and not mariachi. They have a really awesome deal 3 items for $16. It's definitely plenty. The salsa is great. The flauta and taco are okay. The best thing ever is the Chicken Picado!!! It is the best chicken I think I've ever had. I couldn't stop stealing it from my friend's plate.  Also, they have incredible margaritas. Would definitely go back.

-v0LXvR65lTCrXo9ap8ahA.text: Our waiter Sebas in the bar was amazing! Great food and amazing service every time we come which is weekly

tqw7aNe-8YIwKehLYBwPIQ.text: I like this place, eaten here many times.  For the most part, prompt service and good food.  I dropped one star because one person at our table had the entire order lost.

cajWGTkMArVDiAFqxWTunA.text: From the moment I walked into this festive, vibrant establishment I was met with an onslaught of welcomes and smiles. We were sat almost immediately in a booth as requested. Our drink order was taken and a slew of chips salsas and bean dips were provided to us to munch on as we picked out our orders. I ended up getting a combo plate with enchiladas and a chimi changa the dish tasted authentic and the portions were generous. Our server Valentin was on point and very attentive. My drink was never left empty. All in all this place is amazing. We'll be back for sure!

0D1m6cwd9hv8qeTMmath7w.text: Christian is amazing!  And I love their checkin process...you can see where you are in the queue!    Food is to die for...flaming fajitas!  Happy hour margarita, nachos and flaming fajitas for two!!!  Amazing and enough leftovers for lunch!

RaXmwY2VDWhdcYAhIGtZCw.text: Saw a friends instagram story featuring this restaurant, looked so so good I had to try!! Everything is delicious and the service is great our servers name was Yajaira, she was very attentive and polite. awesome ambiance had a great time!

PdeIm_5IKxx1zByYA_TLEw.text: We came here on a Saturday night at 6pm.  Not the best time  to walk in if you're hungry as we were quoted 45 min to an hour wait time.   However,  because of the wait the parties ahead of us were dropping like flies and we were seated in 15 minutes.   We were given our complimentary chips and salsas immediately and our server got us our drinks right away.   Their selection of drinks with free refills was great.   I loved their horchata and am impressed that the refills are free.   We got shrimp and steak fajitas for two which was so much food for 2 people.   I think 3 or even 4 people could eat from this meal.   The food was very tasty and came out super quick.  I can't wait to come back!   I'm very exited to try their tamarindo and some desserts!   Definitely worth any wait you may encounter!

tP3rp9IweF_rjjVD2XOYDw.text: Absolutely Superb! Excellent customer service, our waiter was very attentive and answered all our questions about the menu items. It was a hard decision on what to order so, we ordered a little of everything and it was all good !

yXx3mJneOsbQRAQloyWqqA.text: Bommmmmmb!!!  The food was tasty, phenomenal & on point and our server Yajaira was A+++ she was on top of everything, very kind & helpful made sure we had everything we needed, awesome personality & also kept us updated with how much time we had for happy hour, she's was the best! Was definitely a pleasure to have her as our server!

bS3HCjI7J83zVa-w3ul3QQ.text: The food was super good !!! We came in with a big party and we got seated within about 20 mins. Food came out excellent! I ordered the shrimp cocktail which was so good! Also they have a happy hour with margaritas also very good. The place is always busy though, that's one downfall for me but great business for them !!

VL76S6udFgy9jrOUYRyQNQ.text: I burn with a fiery passion for Juan and his flaming fajitas.....ok, maybe just the fajitas (If my husband is reading this, I apologize).   This is some of the best Mexican food in Las Vegas. It beats Lindo Michoacan, Benito Michoacan, and even Border Grill in my book. Factor in the price and it's a triple threat.   I'm pretty sure this restaurant truly has some of the best fajitas in the valley. The meat they use is very high quality, their produce is fresh, and everything is spiced to perfection. It also doesn't hurt that you get a show with the meal when you order the fajitas.   Their chips and salsa are awesome, served with salsa, refried beans and grilled peppers and onions. Because the wait staff is on fire (badum ching) they keep them refilled too.   The only thing that keeps this place from being five stars for me is their chile verde. It's good, but not great. The pork has been a little bit fatty at times and the flavor could be a titch more complex. I know its the base for verde, but I like my chile verde to taste like more than just tomatillos. It's still good though.   If you stick with the fajita's your meal won't disappoint you!!!

U2t4YT28CELVJ2z-VG12VA.text: We love this place. Casual and delicious and relaxing atmosphere.  Must go early to beat the crowds. Everything we've had on the menu is great. Big portions so order wisely.

SXarLAjOOazykfIAcfBoZg.text: Great food. We had the steak fajitas and fish tacos. They were both amazing. We also had the churros that were super good. Will def come back.

-kTd3qurqEQXLbzCtHAM2w.text: The neighborhood favorite of Mexican restaurants for me!!! The fajitas have that unique flavor and aroma from the flames they used right in front of you!!! The tamales and tacos are great too!

YiRLngSx6bj_da-ES0uVvg.text: Awesome Mexican Food! Large Quantities.  Excellent Service  Service is impeccable . Wait time was about 30 minutes,  which wasn't bad considering it was Friday night.   We had been looking for a good Mexican Restaurant for years   we now have our "GO TO" place

WPL22obJ7UYyjVMMmq0xjg.text: We love Juans! Juan-a know why!? Ever since we dropped in for happy hour a few weeks ago we have been back at least once and some weeks twice! The food is delicious and consistent, servers are very friendly. We've only sat in the bar and the only  thing disappointing for me is most times we've been there the patio is closed and that's where we always want to sit. I understand on windy days but not others,maybe it's staff issues because the service has been slower on the patio. So four stars due to closed patio. Food and drinks is a five.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy as always!

hbP7MK76qh4p4Jz5gZ6XcQ.text: Tonight was our second visit to JFF. Both times it was extremely busy but the wait wasn't longer than 10 minutes to get a seat. My husband and I aren't huge fans of fajitas so we haven't ordered them...yet. The fajitas roll out of the kitchen every few minutes and smell and look delicious. I ordered the street tacos last time and tonight ordered the sampler appetizer platter, happy hour price was $8.95 and it was giant and delish! We ordered the queso fundido both times and it's simple, cheesy and so tasty. We asked for tortillas with it instead of using the chips and the tortillas are so fresh, I could eat them all day long! The only thing better than the food is the service. I had to give my compliments to the manager and I also wrote it on the check because as busy as it was, the service was excellent both visits. This place is about a 15-20 minute drive from our house but worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juan&#39;s Sample Platter
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shredded Beef Burrito

HS2YRhVFfcjEWLJbOHQd_Q.text: Excellent service and food.When you check this place out sit at the bar for amazing service.The fajitas were so cool and entertaining.I will definitely be repeating very soon

wi4hSk4Wo35JLg-MhmpBvw.text: They don't have enough staff to serve anyone anymore. Service has gone way downhill. Not like it used to be.

k_lVyd1aYO1yafF68A9ILQ.text: We stopped here yesterday for late lunch/early dinner.  Since it was Sunday, they had a brunch menu but neither of us were interested in that.  Immediately after being seated, we were asked about drinks and two iced teas were brought quickly.    After looking at the menu for awhile, my wife opted not to have the fajitas for two but ordered the chicken azado Vallarta style--salsa Espanola with capers, banana peppers, and olives.  I ordered the flaming fajitas.  After all, it's the name of the place and that's why I stopped.  We were brought chips, salsa, bean dip, and a small dish of grilled onions and one half of a grilled jalapeno.  Standard fare except for the grilled onions and jalapeno.    In a short time, our dinners arrived.  Mine was flamed near the table but far enough away for safety.  The fajita pan is a high pan with a circular top.  The chicken, peppers, and onions were nicely grilled and the flavors were very good.  My wife's chicken was good, and it was a very large portion.  I have leftovers for dinner this evening.  It was one whole chicken breast.  Not finishing her meal allows my wife to justify dessert.  I need no justification.  We shared an order of fried ice cream that was very good.  The crust on the outside was tasty and the ice cream was nice to have on one of our 100 degree summer days.  Service was excellent.  Multiple people came to check on iced tea refills, was it OK to remove dishes, anything else, etc.  One of the managers (owners?) came by and chatted and made sure all was well.  He asked if it was our first time at the restaurant.  He explained some of their current promotions.  I normally would have given Juan's a 3 star rating.  However, the service and the appreciation shown for patronizing Juan's figured in my upping the review to 4 stars.  I appreciate when businesses give good service and are glad that you stopped there given all the choices we have in this city.  I am a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Accompaniments for fajitas.
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pollo azado Vallarta style.

UAkPesdoetikYo57rTWJCQ.text: Went by reviews and really thought this place would be amazing but what  a disappointment  to start I order a mango margarita that tasted nothing like mango. It was bitter and sour.  My tacos were made with flour tortillas that tasted sweet. Not so happy about the whole deal.

RK-ZPxoBSlgso4XxnB2ovg.text: Tried steak fajitas and very good , service was ok and what I always look for is ... spicy homemade style salsa ... nope didn't have

di8946S2dAAvfreeVK1q7g.text: Ordered shrimp tacos that were the best I've ever had! Order was To Go- and it came with chips and salsa, beans and rice.  Above and beyond in taste- service and price!  Try the nachos- can't finish them...love this place!

c61THgB4_n0d32IUw2ztiw.text: Fun lively spot. Nice to get off the strip and find good family food. Fajitas are awesome and specialty. Loud inside when busy but organized and attentive. Food not fuel. I will return.

yVp7dazWrYPxyZaKId4UnQ.text: The best shrimp cocktails EVER! I was in Vegas for a weekend and was craving a shrimp cocktail mainly because (hungover) but this place made me feel a live again and although I wasn't feeling to good (the hangover was way to real) he made me smile and feel better suggested a beer to help with the headache and I felt way better when I walked out than when I walked in. I go to Las Vegas at least once every 8weeks. I love this place. I make sure I stop by. Hi from LA!

HW_pdzlDpIiyqJkugL7fvA.text: Juan's Flaming Fajitas is one flamingly tasty good time!  You feel welcomed the second you walk through the door. The outdoor patio is fantastic to hang out in during the cool and warm months. Be careful because the second you sit down food is being delivered.   Before ordering, Juan's gives you a delicious basket of chips, salsas, fried peppers, onions and a killer bowl of Mexican soup. Try not to stuff your face with them because the items on the menu are deeeeeeelightful.   I have been here a few times and ate burritos and tacos, which are amazing, but the last time visited I ordered the flaming fajitas. Can you say NOM? I can!  The meal was lit on fire at our table just before serving which makes the dish really fun. It tasted wonderful too.   Throughout my meal I was happy to see little flaming flashes out of the corner of my eye of others who ordered their fajitas. It's like a flaming party up in there!  Juan's has a fun happy hour too. The drinks are great, the service is great and who doesn't like their food lit on fire? I know I do!  Go here. Bring friends. One fajita order is plenty for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready to POUNCE on some Juan&#39;s Flaming Fajitas!

SdAa_oUZwXo_81PvoMYJIQ.text: Juans Flaming Fajitas is literally fire, pun intended. This place is always busy so you know this place has to be good. I ordered the steak and chicken fajita and my total was $30. Best $30 I ever spent. The customer service around here is A1. They always constantly check on you if you need a refill on your tortillas, chips, or water.

e5lUZbAA_IUliB3GrHrXmQ.text: I kept seeing this place in my Facebook feed, so I finally went to check it out. The food was absolutely delicious. I love the fact that they gave you large quantities! The complimentary salsa, chips and bean dip were perfect. If you are able to make it during happy hour time, the portions are large and at cheaper prices. This is definitely a new favorite spot for my family!

vKnYL-1FomNMJve4ndzY-w.text: Amazing!! Bean dip and salsa were worth going. Food is super. Staff and service are a 5+! Update: Tonight I went again. It has been a month since I had the time to get back. Amanda was our server and she rocked it!! She was on point, funny and friendly. Food was AMAZING!! It is so hard to explain how phenomenal this place is!!  Update: I went again tonight for my birthday late about 9:30pm. It was awesome like always. Sebastian was our server and he was fantastic.  Time and time again a truly amazing experience.  Thank you!! Update: I LOVE this place. Went today and had the best service yet from Alex C. He was awesome!!! Please share with him what an asset he is to your business!! Update: Back again!

_s689MOFxVrDxzu6FmVwPg.text: All the 5-star reviews got us intrigued by this place so, we gave it a shot. The parking lot was full but there were lots of empty tables when we went.  We were given a bowl of chips, salsa and refried beans. They have the usual fare: ceviche, tacos, enchiladas, chimichangas, etcetera. Since they call themselves Flaming Fajitas, we got fajitas (and a few drinks). The service was friendly but not that efficient.   Shrimp and Beef Fajitas: You can get portions for 1 person or 2 people. Honestly, the portion for 2 was big enough for 3. You can get flour/ corn tortilla. You also get rice, guacamole, and salsa. I didn't really taste what was 5-star worthy about the food. To me, it was just ordinary and nothing different from all the fajitas I've had from other places. Ok, so they bring a cart by your table and you can watch your food go up in flames (well, not really) but that's about it. 3/5  Horchata: When I'm at a Mexican restaurant, I have to have horchata. Their version was a cross between Mexican horchata (distinct cinnamon taste and sweet) and Spanish horchata (bland). 2.5/5  Mayan Apocalypse: Amaretto, vodka, Citrus Cruzan, Midori, triple sec, sweet and sour, Southern Comfort and cranberry juice. Tasty but strong. This was the best thing I ordered. 4/5

wf8X211_1EmDkp7DCK3FKA.text: Best Mexican food!! Good prices!! I loved the whole atmosphere! The food came so fast and was amazing

8Db8s4HYHb2fPfljYgDcAg.text: Juan's Flaming Fajitas deserves the long wait, huge crowds, awards, and phenomenal reviews. Between the Happy Hour, yummy chips and dips, pozole, and the margaritas, you're in for a treat. But you of course HAVE to try the fajitas! Admittedly, other items have been lackluster comparatively, but the namesake dish more than makes up for them. Service can be slow because this restaurant is always filled to the brim with patrons. I hope they expand this location, because sometimes an hour is (almost) too long to wait.

yqyGlJ_UPFMarazPOQIzgw.text: One of my and my mans favorite restraints. The food is always amazing and customer service great!!!!

Np_2Dxc_8cFdi8MUX4mFYw.text: Food is great , nice and clean restaurant. Very crowded on holiday and weekend( wait time is more 1 hours). Staffs are nice and caring. Definitely would come back

G6OW8WIEwkCiEf9q8xxOdw.text: Great happy hour and really great for groups! The food is good but it does get pretty crowded. The service has been great most times but kind of weird on one or two occasions. To me there's nothing super unique here but the happy hour pricing is pretty good and it's convenient. Fun casual spot if you're in the area.

NdSUshv7t2MwdqPJtZV3EQ.text: Very good. A rare 5 star here in Vegas. Soon as your seated they stuff you full of chips and 4 different salsas and bean dip with grilled onions & jalapenos and a good soup. Then come the fajitas, this is the way fajitas are supposed to be. Service is attentive but not overbearing.  Margaritas are very good also. Prices are average.

pxBGd5Iga1M-1bAwgmUG-g.text: Delicious food with a great atmosphere (energetic, loud, and colorful), which I love. They have a cute little one man guitarist. Their tortillas are homemade and are awesome and they give you unlimited salsa, beans,and tortilla chips

hO8IbbVIhUOeZTEDAB6H-g.text: Awesome food and great service all around. The chips we're fresh and loved the salsa, bean dip and grilled jalepenos/onion snack. Was full before the food arrived, should have stuck to only one basket of chips. A great value, great quality and quantity. The best Mexican restaurant in Vegas that I've been too.

T_6tk_DkrxIhHtmZiZQuzQ.text: Staff was very friendly and welcoming and the food was so good! Loved the the chicken taquitos on happy hour!

924noEvVQgqa35sElkKwDg.text: Jaun's Flaming fajitas Very, very good food!!!  The service is  very good.   The waiters and waitresses and even management is often checking on you to make sure everything is great,  and believe me it always is!!!

wCSCpwNrg5h7NNKoN0SPCA.text: I attended this place last weekend for lunch and I highly recommend you coming here also. I was impressed with the flaming fajitas. As you eat your food the flame in the pot keeps your food hot the entire meal that was very impressive to me. The meats they used were juicy and tender. The margaritas that were served to me were awesome too, the consistency of the frozen margaritas was just perfect. I love it when the chips come out nice and warm, salsa was on point too. Just go, and you will be grateful you made a right choice. Im adding this place to my re-arrivals, lol. I only recommend the best spots!

z_m1nUuf_daeSzPQrmH5Kw.text: This was our first visit to Juan's but we felt at home because we used to deal with all the same people at a previous restaurant. So glad that we found you! The food is wonderful and the service is excellent! You get chips, salsa, beans and jalapenos and onions to start. They make fresh tortillas on site. Great food and service won't disappoint. You still have life long patrons that will definitely be back!

uGYuOiRXAzm8W4Tq1ZdxIA.text: So great to find a great Mexican restaurant in Vegas. Everything we ordered was fantastic and the staff was so warm and welcoming. This will be our go to for Mexican food from now on.

tjKUQPWMM1m_P9crBo1dRQ.text: When I relocated to Las Vegas three years ago, I flew out here for a weekend prior to my move to apartment hunt. I utilized Yelp to find places to eat during my visit and I discovered Juan's. I can't say enough good things about Juan's. The servers are SO friendly, the happy hour is great and every time I go I can't stray away from the signature fajitas that they are known for. When ordering the fajita's, before they came out, there was chips, salsa, bean dip and flash charred onions and peppers AND a little cup of soup. It's crazy all of that comes "free" with the order of an entree. My bf and I usually split the fajita's, but if you want leftovers - order two orders. This place also gets pretty busy for dinner and only accepts reservations with larger groups, so we try to go during off hours if we don't feel like waiting.

Z73qr95FXH9ePSkZKBVhdQ.text: I am becoming a regular at this place, I still highly recommend the al pastor, excellent customer service from the entire staff, especially Carla. Thank you for a wonderful experience and margaritas made with anejo tequila.

UTuNy6Q8o1H056SgCJl4HQ.text: The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because my take out order was missing items. Fajitas without the tortillas or guac and sour cream just aren't as good. By the time I got home and realized all my sides weren't there I didn't feel like doing the 30 minute round trip back to get them.  On the bright side, this was my second time taking food home and quality and flavor is great. As well as pricing. And the staff is very friendly and accommodating. We're all human and mistakes happen but next time I'll be checking my order before leaving.

ptlXq7Lw2b6afTwuPG4NxQ.text: We just moved to the area and this our new favorite Mexican restaurant! Excellent service and they immediately bring us chips, amazing salsa and bean dip. We are hooked!!

dxOoXBL2QIUzGtTjfyfZeQ.text: This place is deelicious. If you're in Vegas you have to stop by and try it.  Large portions and authentic.

GAfSrVKFpJSUjUy8u0GDMA.text: excellent service & employees, always crowded and jam-packed, crappy watered-down tasteless Margaritas loaded with ice, no flavor , no booze, no sweetness, all food arrived cold and/or luke-warm. extremely popular crowd usually a wait for seats. lots of family and kids screaming. not cheap like most Mexican joints. keep going back for all the activity though not the food or the terrible drinks.

gXvFEbZ6n8Jhc1v8TO269A.text: Had a wonderful lunch here today!  Everything was delicious. Nice that they start u off with chips, 2 salsas, beans and onion and Chilis! We ordered the fajitas for 2 with steak and shrimp and it was Very good and plenty of food for 2 people. Going to be coming here often

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EModLctZTMTo5Ar4lZwMlg.text: Been here 3xs already I love their flaming fajitas!!!!! Friendly staff, prompt service & great food! Chips n salsa is always great here too!!! Sign up for their txt alerts to save $$$

JEKPSyr8k-M_D0ZfXc3l7w.text: I wasn't so much disappointed at this place at surprised at the ordinariness.  The four and five star reviews led me to expect something better. The food was okay, but there is definitely better Mexican food in Las Vegas.   I had the chicken taco and chicken enchilada. They were certainly adequate but not extraordinary. My sister had a ground beef taco and her feeling was the same. I thought the sauce lacked a kick and anything that might make it really stand out.   The decor was pretty much standard and the place was a little loud.   I will say that the service was good. There was a line waiting and I was with old friends catching up. I thought the fact that we had overstayed our welcome was well-handled.   I'd say if you live in the neighborhood and need a quick meal, this is a place to go. If you're looking for great Mexican food Las Vegas has better choices.

OtIUR7yAoLBEOqSna6nGhA.text: It's probably my fault for not ordering fajitas from a place called juan's flaming fajitas, but they had an extensive menu and I wasn't feeling fajitas this day. I got the shrimp ceviche appetizer. Big mistake... it was not good. It lacked flavor, and barely had any bits of shrimp but plenty of cucumber. The waitress brought my boyfriend his beer but told me they needed to change the keg for mine. That is fine but she forgot and I had to remind her twice. My boyfriend and I shared the gringo tacos. I didn't know "gringo" meant flavorless ground beef with lettuce and cheese. Overall not a good experience. I felt very deceived by the overwhelming amount of good reviews on this place. Will not be returning.

Wy2ZB15LVK0Y7xDy2FsulA.text: Wow!!!! This is real delicious Mexican food! Even their margaritas. Try their shrimp ceviche and the Mulitas. Enough food to bring home some. Super nice service.

hh-w0nIeGsjTNPnDrB0--Q.text: This place is always a favorite & I haven't had anything here that I don't like...always fast to get our food and always delicious and the staff there are the friendliest around...the steak fajitas are my absolute favorite!! can't wait to go back!!

Tun1wPd3XzpQTzxBdQxSPQ.text: Good food and firiendly sevice. Fajitas are awesome

AHRtQPCwACOw2f90WSJGMQ.text: Our first time here!  Really enjoyed the great service by our server Lupe!!  Food was delicious!!!  We'll be back!!  *****five stars!!

3hX8T6JT2ZE0w_b8Ek-Flg.text: Great food. Solid chips, salsa, bean dip, drinks. The entrees were good. If you like your flautas super crispy like my partner, just ask, they'll cook 'em a bit longer. Locally owned and operated and some of the best service I have had in a Mexican in Vegas.

HNcHRQROtr7_MJRdo2Gq8Q.text: Excellent spot! Ordered the table side guac and the chicken fajitas. We will definitely return soon!

3J1mmNNaKCorDdiOkXGLwQ.text: Great food and great service.  We went there as a party of five and were really impressed with the service.  The fajitas were excellent and the queso was very good too.  A must recommend.  The Yelp 15% coupon helped with our decision to go.

XUiMiuCqrgcDXS0B-IGOUg.text: I've been here a handful of times. Can be tough to find great Mexican food in the valley. This joint delivers the goods. Five star approval and great service.

5pjU_eElIb-gorZ53hSx-A.text: I love that this place serves warm bean dip with their chips and salsa, it's the perfect combination. Today I tried the chicken tamales with green sauce, hands down one of the best restaurant tamales I have had in quit some time.   The servers are very attentive and friendly. I will be going back to try other things on the menu.

zq4GwrnjDbs2fRVXiBRWxw.text: This place is amazing! Out of this world mexican food, excellent prices and the friendliest staff in town. I had a combination plate with a chile relleno and a fish taco and a carne asada rancho taco and everything was delicious! They served us chips and an amazing salsa plus bean dip plus a plate of grilled onions and jalapenos and a small bowl of guacamole. I just cannot say enough about this place. My new favorite mexican food place in las vegas. Thanks to Mary our server, she was on point the whole time and just fun ti have serve us.

WZPgQVCg5VF5XXkm6akjAw.text: I've been here many times for dinner and it's been good.  However today I took my husband and friend to try the brunch.  I was very disappointed!   My husband ordered the huevos rancheros it was one corn tortilla heated with 2 eggs on top.  Awful!  My friend and I ordered chorizo and egg with potatoes. The chorizo and potatoes were black from being burnt!!  Rather than scramble eggs into chorizo the eggs were just separate.  It was the worst breakfast we've had!   The bloody mary was watered down.  Very disappointed,  will not be back.  The wait for our food was almost 30 minutes.

CwaULkr-q6UJ9OeCYTfg5Q.text: Juan's flaming fajitas is a must when I'm in Las Vegas! Honest to God my absolute favorite Mexican place in this planet! The first time my boyfriend and I went to Las Vegas I checked out their reviews and had to try them out. Ever since then we have made it a point to always stop there anytime we are in Nevada. Their service is excellent, everyone is so friendly and you get greeted at the door! Food is top notch, authentic Mexican! I've had their breakfast and dinner, even their fried ice cream is a must. It sounds funny but even their chips and dip, their soups and bean dip which were all complimentary when we went were amazing. I have nothing bad to say about this place other than I wish it were closer to Boston! Keep up the great work at Juans!

Qieg2uoQFOC_dbxKaQWkRQ.text: My husband and I ate here for lunch. Very friendly staff. Our glasses never got half empty. The food is wonderful. Very fresh.

JKvXhhVzwO5Ep-nnhlzwBw.text: Authentic Mexican food... and this is from someone that was raised on it!! Happy hour Bomb.com!!

vVpc62Hn4JU3WvV8Kv4WdQ.text: Great mexican food, and great service every time. I measure the quality of any mexican joint by the carnitas. Juan's carnitas are very good - crispy on the outside, and moist on the inside. Their verde salsa is an excellent flavor addition to the pork. The hosts and waitstaff are very attentive, great with kids, and the manager stops by often to make sure the dining experience is spot on.

cUlDCcakl9dwcOy0OYfOWg.text: My husband and I shared a 3 burrito combination plate. The steak was excellent, the pork was good and the grilled chicken was very good. Our server was 5 stars. She was very friendly and she was the one to recommend the steak. The table next to use had the flaming fajitas, they looked huge and smelled terrific.

yDC8VogOVEHothIioFLEaA.text: The food was amazing! Get the grilled veggies as a side item rather than the rice and beans. The guacamole is great too!

VieB4EQXO-rU3LRKzDU3Kw.text: Incredible lunch specials. Perfect service. Plenty of options. And a delicious, jumbo sized bowl of fresh guacamole. We will be back here again very soon! I recommend that everyone gives this place a try!

dZarFvss_BhzIBspEm8ERQ.text: Best Mexican place in town! The staff is always super friendly. The margaritas are awesome. My husband and I usually order fajitas for one. It's plenty of food for both of us. The chips, salsa and bean dip are really good too.

xkWvBKcpDHg58JE3HBkkvg.text: Although we don't normally think of "mexican" food when we decide to go out to watch football, we decided to give our favorite mexican restaurant, Juan's, a try since we know they have a lot of TV's and heard they had some food & drink specials...good call for sure! They have carne asada fries now (A-mazing), and although not on the menu, we asked if they could make a "California"-style carne asada burrito for my daughter and not only did they cheerfully oblige, when it came out it was HUGE and so delicious! What a great Sunday combo-great drinks, lots of TV's & fantastic food!!!

YlTzrnBseRw7DkTQALjftQ.text: The food is pretty good but not outstanding. Nice atmosphere. Outdoor seating. I had a great strawberry margarita and their fideo soup is very yummy.

S3WEsaqWfFX3IDvCX5Onkw.text: How did we not know about this place with our umpteen trips to Vegas? What a find! My hubby and I shared some chicken and shrimp fajitas. Yum, yum, yum!!! There is a tortilleria inside the restaurant where they are making fresh corn and flour tortillas! Before they bring your food, you are served with a generous bowl of corn chips, salsa, refried beans and a small dish of sauteed onions and jalapenos.If you mix everything together, what a fantastic combination! Be sure to save some of this fabulous onion and pepper combo for your fajitas. I'm not a huge fan of mariachis, mostly because they're so loud and in your face. There was a solo singer, not a mariachi, with a guitar and a lovely voice. The wait staff was fantastic too. They constantly check on you and are very happy to do so. Our waiter, Omar, was kind enough to tell me about a yelp coupon for checking in. This was great food, the house was packed, the service was excellent and we'll definitely be back!!!

3KEXpBiAbyezC98Q3Eh0Sw.text: Happy hour is the best! Good food, affordable prices and the staff is so friendly. We will be returning with our friends!

kiLgQvPMT5zgchIroT8tBw.text: I've been here twice for dinner and both times my fajitas were delicious! I love the grilled chile's and onions served with your chips, salsa and bean dip which by the way is flavorful and yummy!! I must mention how impressed I am with their service, it's the best! The staff is so friendly and attentive which makes the experience all the better. I definitely recommend this spot for Mexican food. This is now our favorite!!

HzpyXaWGopib-YeXi77ixA.text: This is the best Mexican Restaurant I have been to in 20 years. Everything was outstanding. The Fajitas were nicely done. Our waiter, Terrence, made our lunch fun and he was always very attendant to our needs.

-WjB9tzvoPf669j7SiABDw.text: We were looking for good Mexican food. Tried Juan's based on reviews and we were not let down.  The service was good and the fajitas were really good.  We are from out of town but will go back every time we return to Las Vegas!

O_IYDJFPEzDW_CUPfk_qxw.text: absolutely brilliant.....   great fresh food, strong drinks.... lively atmosphere...  large portions

g8_--Gf9qwCswk-sNn0hDw.text: This is my go-to for Mexican cuisine since Viva Mercados closed.  I love their fajitas~! Wish the parking wasn't so chaotic lol

cTTSYnVmVBy2xm8FRT2b3w.text: Heard about this place from a friend and it was amazing. Of course being that it's called Juan's Flaming Fajitas I had to order the Fajitas. I must say everything I order from the margarita to the flaming fajita was good will be back soon and recommend to others!!

doP8B7IPBukGdn2qbX6UoQ.text: Been here twice and the food has been great both times. Best Fajitas ive tasted hands down!!!

zkKI0kh4myL1NAHkz9tkmA.text: This place is hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. 5/5 service 5/5 food. First off, unlimited chips, salsa and bean dip. And this is a seriously good bean dip- like back in the day bean dip at the Frontier (cheesy and bean-y). Nomz.  Next up, I ALWAYS get the shrimp tacos. Like every. single. time. That's how good they are. The brunch on Saturdays and Sundays is also an amazing deal. A meal, a bloody and the chips and salsa for $13? Deal. See you there guys.

MFdLYs-63HnhlKOpH_6BAg.text: The food here is excellent however the REAL reason why I come here is for their homemade Flan! It's by far the best in town! If you ever eat here make sure to order it for dessert! The best!

aYmwmAomZoaPqlravmz01A.text: Be prepared to wait for dinner - It was worth the 45 min wait.    There is a bar where you can wait and watch sports or play (video poker I think)  On the Thurs night we went the bar and restaurant was packed -- there was a 30 person retirement party set up in the bar area taking up most of the tables and chairs. Service is pleasant and efficient. Food was very good. We will be back!

fR75ZKR5ahE5fvRfi0rPhQ.text: This may not count for much coming from a Virginian, but this was probably the best Mexican food I've ever had. The service was great, the price was right, and everything I tasted was delicious. Plus you get so much for free! Salsas, bean dip, fried onions and peppers and chips right off the bat and then a bowl of soup with dinner. We look forward to incorporating a visit to Juan's into our annual Las Vegas trip from now on!

PFdFdjX_8G4VudzHm3IdTw.text: Ask for Omar! We are regulars and he is an amazing waiter. He is fast, funny and works well with large groups and families with small children. Everything on this menu is excellent. Happy hour is never a disappointment!! The sometimes long wait is SO worth it!

f6gv_Ny_Kyns8nt3cn3k6Q.text: We come here at least once a a month and have since they opened. We love the salsas and the chicken fajitas. I love that we have the option of getting veggies instead of rice and beans. Delicious.

OLI170qeZEV48p4uH-700g.text: Great prices! delicious food! Not sure on customer service felt rushed but that won't stop me! Really good place gone a couple times already and will be back :)

F5F2b1bvpA-HD9LbmjP0FQ.text: This place is amazing customer service no better in Vegas very friendly people and food is outstanding . A must go to here in Vegas

8RAtJ_EXKWMgy7DAOJpt0Q.text: This is our favorite place!  Our kids even request it. We have not tried a thing that we do not love. Our go to favorite is the enchiladas. I also love the steak fajita chimichanga.  The chips, beans and salsa are fantastic. The atmosphere is very friendly and the staff are great. We eat dinner here a minimum of once a month.

WMlshCeba2lnZx39HRQnDg.text: We try to come here a few times a month and we love the food and atmosphere here! Thanks Juan for you great service and friendly place to come!

TjdqfZaD3GNl8FuN2cOIFA.text: Killer.  Great salsa, chips and stuff.  Packed on a Friday 7pm.  30 min wait....but well worth it.  Bar area was busy and looks like a good spot to hang out and watch the game.  Had the....  Beef fajitas - amazing.  Cheese enchiladas - awesome.  Great red sauce.  Tacos el Pastor - close second to Tacos el Gordo.  Different, but amazingly awesome.  And last, but not least, service was great.

pQQK1yjd5hLejY0mT1Lk6w.text: My Queen an I Love Mexican food and eat at all kinds of places all over...this place is our favorite! Such amazing food and service at such great prices.  Thanks!

rpz0OI4pVwso8OOnxJqC4A.text: First time here with my family and was not disappointed. Chips came with 4 different salsas. Fideo was divine and albondigas had a bit of a kick. Only thing I was not a fan of was the fajitas. I know I know!!! They're not kidding when they say flaming as the meat ended up being burnt :( Overall very good food and we will return.

TCrGhzus6jZU7l6EGlbBAA.text: Fantastic. Can't say enough yummy. Get there early. Some of the best mex food ever. Tasty drinks tops.

zUY37l1_g6nxYn2n44451w.text: Pretty good and authentic. I like the different salsas and literally flaming fajitas.

BzJTcxfOm3YztE-0ccPN_w.text: Every time I eat at this restaurant my wive and I end up staying for at least 2 hours.  The Tropicana location has an amazing bar staff, the food and drinks are delicious, and the poker machines pay off.  What more can you want from a cantina?!!!

UHZJZjpYBoDoaX-oE76Geg.text: The best Mexican restaurant in vegas. Good food and great atmosphere. The portions are big so you can share and the service is good.

zX6SGvxbZ0S3Q15gAKZRhg.text: We live in green valley and our friends recommended this place. So we drove across the wide plains of Las Vegas  to come here. We started off with table side guacamole and drinks. I had the strawberry margarita and my husband had the jalapeno margarita. Both very good. The guacamole was made to taste. We had them add everything. My enchilada was good. Lots of cheese. My husband had the steak fajitas. The set up for it is neat. Lots of things to add to the fajitas. And the flame below the pan was cool (or hot lol) The service was amazing. Our chips were full. Drinks were filled. Everyone from hostess, bartender, server were sooooo nice. We will make the trek across town to come again.

7hzhuKT1vBp2HbP3jt4WMw.text: Great shrimp and be fajitas, atmosphere and service!  Will be back!  Yajaira was awesome!!!

PsJaMndwiAek37iZ9NfIIg.text: The best authentic Mexican food in town hands down. Service is always amazing, especially when taking out they make sure you have everything and some.

V1wfY6HmKD-EKpmtneyrzQ.text: Awesome, Yajaira is an absolutely amazing waitress. Food is excellent. It's my once a month family get together hideaway.

Chyr2cWHrTXPvHnmDVe8Bg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place! The food was absolutely delicious and you get a ton of it! Very reasonably priced and the service was outstanding. 10/10

apT4phX2UCqw6SD_lIqmnw.text: There was a 20 minute wait(Saturday lunchtime), but it was worth it ! Great food and lots of it. I had the parrillada and it was very tasty. Our server Yajaira was very attentive and made sure we were taken care of. 5/5, would visit again.

kjF-_39x0h-c-pIi8-hgLA.text: we love juans flaming fajitas , we remember valentin as a busser and im happy that he has gotten to do what he loves. the service , the food , the chip , and so much more has never been disappointing. thank you for keeping his friendly face at Tropicana location tonight he was fantastic on the patio #hustle#keep#up#the#good#work# Valentin

oehiEwZiLNaRDO90z1d3tA.text: Just went there today. Heard it was a good place and it always looked busy. Had no clue what to expected. But it was good. The portion is descent, for starts on the house custom 3 dips & chips plus soup. Don't load up on that because the food portion will be too much for u lol. I am so sleeping after this. I recommend u go on a semi empty belly. Leave room for a full plate plus some. I only put 4 stars because my tacos were doughy crispy & that make it more difficult to chew.

pREL0mFviQx18nUn2AwGzw.text: It was amazing!! Yajaira was great she so attentive and Pau always had our drinks filled!!

uTt8z9PkUkt638lGSDRCaA.text: Enjoyed lunch at Juan's. Attentive waiter who gave us wonderful suggestions. I got the seafood quesadilla that was open faced and delicious. I forget what da hunny got, but he ate it all! We will be back.

pK4Qc2fbiDDnXN7f4p883g.text: So good and great service!!!! Will be back soon to try other dishes. The fajita with melted cheese was the best. Christian our server was Excellent!!!!!

MooDCNcCh80LBOR-Asjkkw.text: BEST MEXICAN FOOD IN TOWN! Delicious food, awesome margaritas and great service! We LOVE coming here!

vXOOyokC1nZlbXvL1x4HFw.text: Pretty decent food, large portions, and always professional customer service. We've been coming here for the last 6 months and I can't find any thing bad to say.

rEyilKJdLfzcFjSpRQqWzg.text: We came here for Father's  Day and enjoyed our dinner and Modelo's! Everything was great and delicious! Yajira was amazing!

Ho66s2DoWWkN3JTsx_WmDA.text: Fajitas were amazing the best I have had in Vegas and the service was excellent Thanks to Omar. Great handmade Tortillas and salsas were excellent as well as the fried onions and Jalapenos!!!

nCgk8F_WCp46w8UjAL11GA.text: My son and I absolutly love Juans. The food is always good and the service is amazing.

TJ914ULuYzwJpy-0oj3TIQ.text: OMG!! Best Mexican food and service I've had in along time. Reminded me of being at a family party where everyone checked to see if your OK. Fresh beans, I typically grade my Mexican food off of the beans. That's first and foremost the best around. Fresh guacamole made to order. The burritos were amazing. Now it is called Flaming Fajitas, so of course I had to try them. I was not disappointed one bit, great taste and they do a little trick and boom, they're on fire!!! So if your ever in Vegas you've got to hit this spot.

5UUg8MNN531co_JUP-LaEQ.text: Been here several times and the fajitas are just flamin' on spot!!! I love their chips and salsa to start and good to start with the cervesa. I've brought friends and co-workers here and they never fail. Employees are great and you can tell they're all hard workers.  This place never fail!!! Just finished late lunch with my mom and brother with my family... Everyone was at awe how good the food was and he amount that was served. I love the way we're always checked and made sure we have everything.... Great employees that's why this place is great. This place have such great employees as great assets.

Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb!

Cyu-wPuoOHRuwMiect06PA.text: Service was excellent. We came in just before the rush and a Knights game was starting soon. Our waitress was amazing, chips, beans, salsa was provided and refilled. We even asked to put the game on and they changed all of their televisions to the game. She let us know it was happy hour which was another sweet surprise. The food is amazing, we got the steak and shrimp fajitas and it was delicious. Homemade flour tortillas, you can see someone making them. The childrens plates were portioned on the heavier side but we just took it home. Everyone had a good time, we had a table of 8 and I felt like we were well taken care of. Even my parents who usually have something to complain about, didn't have nothing but good things to say.

lzmC70hY_-NjgbbCuYxJ8w.text: On a Tuesday evening we had a 20 minute wait, once seated, chips and dips were soon brought to us. A good bean dip and a small plate with hot peppers and onions. Great, thin chips. Service is quick and the entire staff is friendly. Watching the waiters lighting the flaming fajitas is fun. The strawberry sopapilla with ice cream is really good. Best Mexican food I have found in the greater Las Vegas area.

pfvabms53eqytX0jDpRaug.text: First off, YES at the wrong time parking does suck due to the In-N-Out traffic, but nonetheless a small technicality. My wife got into it with someone because they stole our parking spot. This became her topic for dinner conversation.....WOW! Anyway after a couple presidente margaritas all I could do is enjoy some really great food.  Love this place!

E6KwDEQyx6Bk8lH8bc4FQg.text: This is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas.  Yajaira was our server and she was very nice and provided great service.  Flaming Fajitas is definitely a place to try and come back. They also have a great Happy Hour!

o1wpyMjanYE5cj6jEsS1Dw.text: Juan's is awesome. The fajitas are fantastic! Delicious margaritas. Really great lunch specials. The staff is really friendly and someone always comes by the table to make sure that everything is right. My favorite lunch is the chicken asada and their special margarita.

TxAZqm1UpLSFRwPbnYDwBQ.text: My wife and I just ate there not 10 minutes ago. We enjoyed our meal, the food was good, and everything was delivered promptly.  The problem came when I noticed a bug swimming in my beer. Keep in mind, we had already signed our check and were finishing our meal. I discreetly let an employee know and a "manager" came to talk with us. Instead of showing any concern, she argued that it was just a cluster of bubbles. WHAT DO YOU THINK MADE THE BUBBLES? She then wanted to filter the beer through a napkin to "test" what it was. THE LEGS WERE STILL MOVING! All of this was in front of other customers.   In short:  - we paid for our meal - the food was good - INSPECT YOUR FOOD OR DRINK!

kYzCnpS1CMgfF-BhrxVS1Q.text: Probably the best happy hour for Mexican cuisine! You can get a loaded steak quesadilla and a beer (or two ) for under $20! Of course the flaming fajitas are great, but how would they not be! It's in the name!

kMA2JQHL-n1nxeNlRAFzZQ.text: I went here last Friday and took my mother.  It was the first time she had been there.  She said that Juan's is by far, the best Mexican food she's ever had.  Anytime I go here, the service is great, the food is excellent, and it seems like the entire staff checks on you to make sure everything is good.  Even the manager came out and greeted us and asked how everything was.  Of course, the answer was excellent!  It's one place I don't mind waiting for a seat.

RMJ9cye2HYPOJEXaVtWvrw.text: Absolutely excellent in every way!!  The only way they could've made our experience better was by giving us a winning lottery ticket.  The service was excellent, the food was outstanding, the selection was vast and we couldn't be happier. Best food at an unbelievable price!  Absolutely coming here again!!!!!

22vmtjaiTPuQkMs7NhaWDw.text: We were meeting some friends for lunch and we asked them for ideas. They chose Juan's and I am glad they did! Located just west of the 215 on Tropicana they are easy to find. We were immediately greeted and sat in a large booth.   Within seconds our waitress arrived for our drink orders and chips, salsa, bean dip and grilled onions and peppers were delivered. The latter is a nice touch that I have not seen before. I went with the shrimp fajitas (lunch size) which comes with rice and beans and all the typical sides. Our friends ordered the queso fundido which was excellent.   When the fajitas are delivered they set them on fire (hence the name Juan's "flaming" fajitas). The shrimp were cooked well and came with plenty of grilled green and yellow peppers and onions. The service throughout the meal was excellent. We were always offered more chips and salsa and our drinks were filled.  The only downside for me was the guac didn't seem like it was made fresh and the cast iron skillet had a lot of oil in it making it a little greasy. Besides that it was a great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajita sides: tortillas, sour cream, guac, pico, rice &amp; beans
Photo of Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas served with plenty of onions and peppers

kmprn_MVyvwBaHM4Ob9i3A.text: I think my review could've been better if it were earlier in the evening. We got there around 7:30pm. They were packed. We waited for our table for 45 minutes after they told us it was a 20 min wait. Then we waited 20 minutes after seating to order. Maybe they were understaffed? Who knows. I wished there was better ventilation in there because of the flaming fajitas and the flame is...BIG. Food was delicious though. We got the fajitas for 2. I ordered a watermelon margarita and it tasted like dirt. They muddled way too much mint and didn't add enough watermelon. It looked like a mojito but was supposed to be a margarita.

_FD2jgoeSV-S1kBVNZ8D-g.text: Excellent meal! My party and I enjoyed almost every aspect of our dining experience. Everything from the beef in the fajita chimichanga to the presentation that resembled a volcanic eruption to the fantastic service of Oswaldo...Juan's Flaming Fajitas gets five gold stars and two thumbs up!! Can't wait to pick up some more flavor at Juan's!

C1cI5h_pPz2ky7dM_p-i7g.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas!  Everyone was so friendly even Donald Trump would be Welcomed here !  Tried the Chips and three dips, Sizzling Fajitas. Good Value and Great Meal !  I will return here....

jX8q8b0FNZ5reRfkyjMxrg.text: Food is good at the right price, and so are the drinks, happy hr is great. I'm really looking forward for the Henderson location which will be closer to me

pTVf3E0OZ0_d2XL-W6NHJw.text: Born and raised in Las Vegas and this is the best Mexican food I have had in Las Vegas in 32 years. It is across town from me and we drive for it. We are on our way to Juan's now and I'm so excited for the chips, bean dip, and amazing salsa. Its happy hour from 3-7 every day what could be better!

mOADSvmMMEt_C4SpSze3aQ.text: food was great! fajitas in vegas this good are hard to come by. Hernan was very helpful and courteous. keep up the good work guys. live music is very authentic!

mRYCn98bCfwcTtLOrp93jQ.text: It was such delightful experience dining here. Food was delicious, big portion but not too big, and the service and ambience were wonderful for the family. Coming back soon!

hGQ9SlBOyr-9A-eioDzA4g.text: Food is delicious. Wait staff was on point and worked as a team. Get there early if you want a seat because parking is horrendous. The in and out burger in the same parking lot takes up half of the parking real estate.

uMvKrdduYxp48_soqWE0TA.text: This place is authentic and great Mexican food. The best part is the service. You will be well attended and the perfect place for food!

IFs2_dq4qJHkqEtD_7x8RQ.text: We started off with the traditional salsa and chips plus a bean dip.  We ordered the signature flaming fajitas with chicken that also included a cup of tomato soup.  The flame was a nice gimmick but the bottom line was the fajitas and soup were pretty average.  A rating of 2.5 is appropriate.

xZKwPCRmSAk5UvPIzDMGDg.text: Wow!  All I can say is wow!  We had the veggie fajitas and they were beyond delicious!  The service was excellent.  We really wish that we lived by this fabulous restaurant....we would be eating there twice a week!!  Two enthusiastic thumbs up!!

VpDBNa5As3EXtIUxqobr5A.text: I've picked up my order here many times, living near by, it is always finishing being, prepared, packaged hot and fresh with tortilla chips, salsa, bean dip and great soup for cold the Fried Ice Cream great! Plus the friendly and courteous ladies up front by 15-20 minutes. Great atmosphere! Busy bar area with outdoor seating, patio and smiling faces coming from the full dining area. Great Food!, Big portions no complaints and great location!

PDV2jFa1SeSRcicj6WoXpA.text: This place is okay. I'm giving it 4 stars cause the staff was very friendly. We were sat right away and the staff was helpful.  Chips and salsa right away with beans.  We ordered a horchata, which was a huge disappointment, and a margarita which tasted horrible.  I'm guessing they use bottle shelf stuff cause it was horrible and only had 2 sips. We ordered their fajitas and the presentation was great.  They smelled amazing but the food was okay. Nothing to give it almost 5 stars.

ny0Mu34Lm7WFlnlzd5sxuA.text: Still the best value restaurant in the Vegas area. And my only problem is I can't stop eating the same things. Child relleno and or chicken fajitas.  .

a5ZfO0c5SxP3kat0lc8cAQ.text: The staff was so incredible! Very attentive and so helpful! I never had to wait for anything! The food and drinks were delicious! I came for happy hour and left very happy! The steak was so fresh and had great flavor! I will be back a lot more, one of my new favorite Mexican place! They brought out chips, salsa, and the best bean dip I've had in a while with sauteed peppers and onions... Right when I sat down! Can't wait to go back!

Gr7jok__PvEN8sEAmO3IfQ.text: Great service. ..lunches are busy but still within a hour Lunches specials are not available on the weekend. Low employee turn over..that's a good thing. Clean family dining

8A3MYUXf81hZ4NOBn7N9qg.text: Love this place. Consistent as can be, and service is top notch. One might think, "Hmm fajitas - doesn't that usually mean dry chicken and stiff steak?" (at least that's what I thought) but I've been proven wrong time and time again at Juan's. Juan's fajitas are the benchmark of fajitas. It's almost as if the meats/proteins come out slightly rare on purpose, knowing that they will be the perfect temperature in about 30 flaming seconds, or the time in which it takes to assemble your first fajita and nab a first bite.  If you like fajitas, you will LOVE this place. If you don't like fajitas, try Juan's and you will understand why fajitas exist.  (Awesome salsa and bean dip, too.)

nv5QUqdsOoQHe0w0-TnhVQ.text: Good food, plenty of options. I like how they give you chips with different dips and soup with your meal. I would recommend to get the fajitas, other items in the menu are good but the fajitas are better

Yq0Jq-JX5mgump1__q_Jqg.text: Excellent food and service!! Will definitely be back! Even gave my kids a quick Spanish lesson while we were dining! The chips,salsa and guacamole are amazing! Authentic Mexican food to the core!

qIczbwkNLi7eZZYjG0aXTQ.text: The food was good. The fajitas were flaming as advertised. They are warmed with a flame under the hot plate. I have never seen this before. There was plenty of food and we all left full. The place was clean and the staff were friendly.

zGfeSLjanAHyG0mxYASWlg.text: After reading the reviews decided to check the place out! Of course we ordered the flaming fajitas & we were not disappointed dinner was delicious, the service was excellent & the strawberry margarita was one of the best I've had. Highly recommend this restaurant well worth the drive off the strip!

rQFu-Y2rEvt8TfYPgV3EgA.text: If you view my profile, you will see that I don't provide a lot of 5 star reviews. I'm very critical of the service I receive. I'll give a 5 star review if I feel the food/service really warrants it.  Well guess what, today I'm giving a 5 star review. Several co-workers of mine recently came here and raved about the place.  So today, I decided to accompany them again and check out this place for myself.  Before you know it, there was group of 10 heading here for lunch.  When we arrived, we entered into the lobby and there was no host or hostess to greet us. However, 45 seconds later, we were welcomed by a gentleman. I said that we had a group of 10. He told me that the wait will only be a few minutes while they set up.  We didn't wait more than 4 minutes to be seated.  Immediately, a few servers came over and gave us chips/salsa and took our drink orders.  I explained that we would like separate bills and the server advised that we they cannot split 10 of us. I then asked for a compromise (5 on each bill) and he agreed. He even apologized to me when I was leaving for the inconvenience. I explained to him that I understand the policy and thanked him for splitting the bill.  Our orders were promptly taken and we were provided updates on our food by the server. Meanwhile, our server along with his help, refilled our drinks, and constantly kept our chips/salsa bowls full.  When I placed my order, I asked for french fries instead of beans and the server without problem said that he can sub the fries for the rice and beans. I was very happy that he allowed me to make the swap.  The food came very fast and it was delicious. I asked for cheese and ketchup for my fries and the ketchup was given to me 20 seconds later. Talk about efficient. These servers were right on point. I ordered the steak fajita and it was perfect.    When we finished, the server processed our payment quickly and thanked us all for coming.  I will definitely return here as a result for the great food and superb staff. I hope the owner reads this review and feels proud that he has such a great team.  Feel free to send me a private message for more details on my dining experience. Thank you.

GaxRQWnYbWp7R1pal46JlQ.text: Happy how the owner handled the situation and went out of his way to leave a gift card for the past experiences. They have increased staff for dinner and it was a great experience.  Lunch time servers can be lacking and not as eager. Food and margaritas are still top notch we will just stick to dinner.

DYuVmMGjoXLZpkhiFtm7XA.text: We've been looking for a great Mexican restaurant since we moved from California 2 years ago. Little did we know that the best place in Vegas was right down the street from us! My favorite thing to order is the chicken fajitas. They come out and light them on fire! Then the fajitas sit atop a little candle that keeps them warm until you've finished eating. Did I mention that before your meal they give you chips, salsa, beans, AND grilled onions and peppers? And sopa de fideo? My husband is getting tired of Mexican food because I've been coming here so often. Hrs seriously the best. And the servers are always friendly and attentive.

r-K96wki9SGq3J7OqbVQxQ.text: I wanted to check out this place due to the high ratings and some of my friends have mentioned that they like this place a lot. As most Mexican restaurants do, they offer chips and salsa. They also offer bean dip, grilled jalapenos, and grilled onions. I really liked their bean dip and that they offer the grilled jalapenos.  We ordered the carne and carnitas fajitas for two people. It was enough for three people. It was alright but nothing spectacular that I would come back for. The service was great and attentive. The restaurant is huge with a nice patio. I would come back for their chips, bean dip, and grilled jalapenos and try something else.

k786AdckoBKz7mUdw2B4_A.text: Order from here all the time!!! Always get the fajita a quesadilla, chimichangas, case so fun Dedo. All is so good. Service is amazing. They always take care of us. Love this place. Salsa is a bit spicy but super refreshing. always very good portions. Take out is what I always order and they've always been accurate! Fan for life. Go eat here.

05jhu_I6JsJKfCnMJfyLBw.text: Wow! Great big basket of warm chips and salsa and bean dip and peppers right up front. Huge selection on the menu. I had the carne flour tortilla tacos with black beans and rice. Superb, all of it. Reasonable prices and busy, busy, when I was there 6:30 Fri and waited 10 mins for a table. Service was awesome! I wanna go back.
